AN ESTIMATED 25 FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN LINN, BENTON AND LINCOLN COUNTIES IN FY 2021-2024.  ALL FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS WITH 1/3 ALSO PARTICIPATING IN EVIDENCE-BASED ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE FOSTERING APPROPRIATE APPROACHES TO LEARNING, K-12 ACADEMIC TUTORING, SMART TUTORING AND MODELING POSITIVE SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL RELATIONSHIPS FOR LOCAL AT-RISK YOUTH.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS K-12 SUCCESS, SPECIFICALLY FOCUSED ON LOW-INCOME, ENGLISH LANGUAGE LEARNING STUDENTS RESIDING IN THE REGION'S SCHOOL CATCHMENT AREAS FLAGGED IN 2021 MOST AT-RISK. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT THE OCWCOG FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE TUTORED AN ESTIMATED 108 CHILDREN WITH AN ESTIMATED 95 SHOWING IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, ENGAGEMENT OR SCHOOL READINESS. THESE GAINS PROVIDED BY THE FGP VOLUNTEER WILL ENHANCE INTER-GENERATIONAL RELATIONSHIPS, DEVELOP STRONG SENIOR COMMUNITY LEADERS AND PROVIDE BOTH COGNITIVE AND EMOTIONAL BENEFITS TO THE VOLUNTEER. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF 163343 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $19793 FROM LOCAL SUPPORT TO INCLUDE LOCAL MATCH AND IN-KIND FUNDING.

JEWISH FAMILY SERVICE AGENCY (JFSA) IS A COLLABORATIVE NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION DEDICATED TO HEALING THE WORLD ONE LIFE AT A TIME.  IN OPERATION SINCE 1977, OUR AGENCY STRIVES TO MAKE LONG-TERM IMPACTS THROUGH PROJECTS THAT BUILD ON OUR EXISTING CAPACITY.

AN ESTIMATED 105 AMERICORPS SENIORS FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE FOR A TOTAL OF 66 VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS (VSY); AT LEAST 75 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  

FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL PROVIDE TUTORING IN PUBLIC SCHOOLS, USING TEACHER-APPROVED ACTIVITIES THAT HELP THE STUDENT REACH HIS ACADEMIC GOALS; INDIVIDUAL AND SMALL GROUP TUTORING IN A COMMUNITY SETTING SUCH AS PUBLIC LIBRARIES, COMMUNITY CENTERS, AND BOYS AND GIRLS CLUBS.  

EXPANDED SERVICE ACTIVITIES DURING THE TIME OF COVID-19 MAY INCLUDE SUPPORT STUDENTS WITH SPECIAL PROJECTS OR STUDENT PACKET DEVELOPMENT/DISTRIBUTION FOR DISTANCE LEARNING; RECORD VIDEO BOOKS OR LESSONS FOR TEACHERS FOR VIRTUAL LEARNING;  OR SERVE AS A PEN PAL FOR BOTH WRITING SKILLS DEVELOPMENT AND SOCIAL SUPPORT.
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION WITH THE OBJECTIVE OF K-12 SUCCESS.

AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOME IS TO INCREASE PARTICIPANTS' FLUENCY AND READING COMPREHENSION.
THE AMERICORPS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF  $429,681 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $41,865 IN NON-FEDERAL SOURCES.

OUR MISSION STATEMENT: "SENIORS IN SERVICE ENGAGES VIBRANT AND EXPERIENCED VOLUNTEERS TO ENRICH NORTHERN NEVADA COMMUNITIES ONE LIFE AT A TIME."

AN ESTIMATED 87 AMERICORPS SENIORS FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 81 AMERICORPS SENIORS FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE ASSISTING IN CLASSROOMS, ASSISTING IN CLASSROOM/HEAD START, TUTORING-PUBLIC SCHOOL/FAITH BASED SCHOOL/OTHER, AND SCHOOL BASED MENTORING. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, AN ESTIMATED 6,648 CHILDREN WILL BE SERVED IN CNCS SUPPORTED K-12 TUTORING/MENTORING, AND 270 CHILDREN WILL BE ASSISTED WITH SCHOOL READINESS IN THE PRE-K SETTING. THE AMERICORPS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $527,913 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY AN ANTICIPATED AMOUNT OF $60,063 OF NON-FEDERAL FUNDING AND IN-KIND SUPPORT.

THE GRANT RENEWAL PERIOD FOR THE CATHOLIC CHARITIES FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IS 2021-22 AND THE REQUEST FOR FUNDING IS $522,862 TO SUPPORT 82 VSYS.   AGENCY WIDE PRIORITY OUTCOMES WILL BE THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREAS FOR THE PROJECT INCLUDING EDUCATION K-12 SUCCESS: - IMPROVED PERFORMANCE, OTHER- MENTORING (OTHER: NUMBER OF YOUTH SERVED) AND SCHOOL READINESS: ED23A - SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL SUPPORT.   OTHER WILL ADDRESS ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT GAINS AMONG AT RISK YOUTH. THESE OUTCOMES WILL NOT BE REPORTED BUT WILL BE DOCUMENTED.  
SERVICES WILL TARGET PRESCHOOL AND ELEMENTARY SCHOOL AGED CHILDREN WHO ARE LIVING IN POVERTY AND WILL CONTINUE ADDRESSING THE ONGOING COMMUNITY PROBLEM OF LOW READING SCORES IN GRADES K-12 AND UNDER ACHIEVEMENT IN SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT AMONG PRESCHOOLERS.   
SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: SKILL BUILDING AND TUTORING IN READING, COMPREHENSION, AND LANGUAGE SKILLS, MENTORING TO SUPPORT ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, PROBLEM SOLVING, ENHANCING SELF-AWARENESS AND CONFIDENCE AND SOCIAL SKILL DEVELOPMENT.     
AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD, THE PREDICTION IS THE CATHOLIC CHARITIES FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM WILL HAVE SERVED APPROXIMATELY 1,065 CHILDREN AND YOUTH IN THE RESPECTIVE PERFORMANCE AREAS. IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT 65% OF THE CHILDREN SERVED IN GRADES K-12  WILL MAKE PROGRESS TOWARD GRADE LEVEL PROFICIENCY IN READING; MENTORED YOUTH WILL SHOW IMPROVEMENT IN BEHAVIOR, SOCIAL SKILLS AND ATTITUDES TOWARD SCHOOL AND 80% OF PRESCHOOL CHILDREN WILL HAVE MET OR EXCEEDED THEIR TARGET GOALS IN SOCIAL/EMOTIONAL DOMAINS.  IT IS ESTIMATED THAT THE ANNUAL FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $522,862 WILL BE AUGMENTED WITH APPROXIMATELY $17,000 IN NON-FEDERAL CASH AND $89,773 IN-KIND TO SUPPORT THE COST OF MANAGING A SUCCESSFUL PROGRAM WITH PROVEN OUTCOMES.
DURING THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC FOLLOWING THE STAY AT HOME ORDERS FROM GOVERNOR NEWSUM OUR PROGRAM HAS CONTINUED AND MOVE OUR SUPPORT TO A VIRTUAL SETTING. WE WILL CONTINUE TO FOLLOW THE STATE GUIDELINES AND WORK WITH OUR MANAGERS TO SUPPORT THE CHILDREN WHILE THE SCHOOLS ARE CLOSED AND CLASSES THAT HAVE MOVED TO A VIRTUAL PLATFORM.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

FORTY-ONE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE DURING THIS GRANT CYCLE. OUR VOLUNTEERS ARE VERY DEDICATED TO THE PROGRAM AND OUR YOUTH, THEY SERVE 24 TO 40 HOURS PER WEEK AT THE CORRECTIONAL FACILITY.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE DEVELOPING POSITIVE RELATIONSHIPS WITH THE YOUTH, TUTORING THE YOUTH AT SCHOOL, ASSISTING THE YOUTH IN MAKING BETTER DECISIONS REGARDING BEHAVIOR WHEN ANGRY OR APATHETIC, AND OFFERING A PERSPECTIVE INFLUENCED BY THE WISDOM OF YEARS IN TEACHABLE MOMENTS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS SCHOOL-BASED TUTORING AND 1:1 OR GROUP MENTORING WITHIN THEIR HALL.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, WE EXPECT THAT OUR FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE SUSTAINED MENTORING RELATIONSHIPS WITH AT LEAST 400+ YOUTH AND AT LEAST 20 PERCENT (25% OF THE YOUTH ARE ENROLLED IN SCHOOL) OF THESE YOUTH WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN THE AREAS OF MATHEMATICS AND READING BASED UPON RESULTS OF THE TEST OF ADULT BASIC EDUCATION (TABE) ASSESSMENT.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY A MINIMUM OF $151,570 FROM THE CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS AND REHABILITATION (CDCR), DIVISION OF JUVENILE JUSTICE (DJJ) PER GRANT YEAR.

THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) IS AN INTERGENERATIONAL PROGRAM THAT CLOSES THE SOCIAL SUPPORT GAPS IN THE LIVES OF VALUABLE COMMUNITY MEMBERS WHO ARE RETIRED OR OUT OF THE WORKFORCE AND LOW-INCOME, WHILE ALSO PROVIDING DIRECT SUPPORT TO MEET THE EMOTIONAL AND EDUCATIONAL NEEDS OF VULNERABLE YOUTH IN OUR COMMUNITIES. SINCE 1972, PEPPERDINE UNIVERSITY HAS SUCCESSFULLY SPONSORED THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP), PAIRING ELDERLY CITIZENS WITH AT-RISK YOUTH FROM IMPOVERISHED, UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES WITHIN THE GREATER LOS ANGELES (LA) AREA. THROUGH A SYMBIOTIC MODEL, FGP SIMULTANEOUSLY PROVIDES COMPANIONSHIP FOR ELDERLY VOLUNTEERS AND MENTORSHIP TO YOUTH WITH SPECIAL NEEDS AND DIFFICULT CIRCUMSTANCES. FGP PRIMARILY FOCUSES ON EDUCATIONAL IMPROVEMENT, WORKING TO PROMOTE SCHOOL READINESS AND SUCCESS IN YOUTH (K-12). 

FGP PURPOSEFULLY TARGETS POPULATIONS IN HIGHLY IMPOVERISHED NEIGHBORHOODS OF SOUTH CENTRAL LA. WITHIN FGP'S PRIMARY SERVICE AREA, A STARTLING 33% OF FAMILIES LIVE BELOW THE FEDERAL POVERTY LEVEL ($25,750 ANNUALLY FOR A FAMILY OF FOUR IN 2019) -- OVER DOUBLE THE RATE IN CALIFORNIA (11.8%) AND THE U.S. (12.3%). MOREOVER, RECENT POLLING DATA SHOWS THAT APPROXIMATELY 56% OF LA HOUSEHOLDS POLLED ARE FACING FINANCIAL HARDSHIP DUE TO THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC, WITH LATINO AND BLACK HOUSEHOLDS EXPERIENCING THE GREATEST HARDSHIP, 71% AND 52% RESPECTIVELY. UNDER CONDITIONS OF SIGNIFICANT POVERTY, CHILDREN EXPERIENCE ENHANCED RISK OF DEVELOPMENTAL DELAYS, ESPECIALLY IN THE CRITICAL AREAS OF LANGUAGE, LITERACY, AND EMOTIONAL REGULATION. THROUGH ITS INNOVATIVE STRUCTURE, FGP WORKS TO MITIGATE EDUCATIONAL CHALLENGES AND RISKS FOR VULNERABLE YOUTH BY PROVIDING A SOURCE OF MENTORSHIP AND SUPPORT FROM ITS FOSTER GRANDPARENTS. IN ORDER TO CONTINUE ITS IMPORTANT WORK THROUGH THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM, PEPPERDINE IS REQUESTING SUPPORT FROM AMERICORPS.

IN ORDER TO IMPROVE EDUCATIONAL OUTCOMES FOR HIGH-RISK YOUTH, PEPPERDINE'S FGP WILL PAIR 168 SENIOR CITIZENS (FGP GRANDPARENTS) WITH YOUTH FROM THE FOLLOWING TARGETED GROUPS: 1) HEAD START PROGRAMS FOR YOUNG CHILDREN AGES 3-5; 2) SPECIALIZED EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS FOR DISADVANTAGED AND/OR DISABLED YOUTH; 3) K-12 STUDENTS NEEDING ADDITIONAL ASSISTANCE IN LANGUAGE DEVELOPMENT AND LITERACY; AND 4) VULNERABLE YOUTH NEEDING ADULT SUPPORT WHILE PARENTS ARE BEING TREATED FOR SUBSTANCE ABUSE OR MENTAL HEALTH ISSUES. THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL FACILITATE A WIDE ARRAY OF EDUCATIONAL AND DEVELOPMENTAL ACTIVITIES WITH THEIR YOUTH PARTNERS INCLUDING: ASSISTING IN HEAD START AND K-12 CLASSROOMS, READING, TUTORING, MENTORING, SOCIALIZING (PLAYING EDUCATIONAL GAMES, READING, TALKING, WALKING, LISTENING, AND SHARING MEALS), AND SUPPORTING YOUTH WHOSE PARENTS ARE RECEIVING REHABILITATIVE TREATMENT. ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT INCLUDE:  INCREASED SCHOOL READINESS, ENHANCED LANGUAGE AND LITERACY SKILLS, IMPROVED CLASSROOM PARTICIPATION, HEIGHTENED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT, AND GREATER SOCIAL AND BEHAVIORAL SKILLS FOR PARTICIPATING YOUTH.

FRESNO ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES COMMISSION (FRESNO EOC) AMERICORPS SENIORS FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) ESTIMATES 68 FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. ALL 68 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE ASSISTING IN PUBLIC SCHOOL CLASSROOMS, TUTORING IN AFTER SCHOOL PROGRAMS-OTHER, TUTORING AND MENTORING IN DISABLED STUDENTS PROGRAM CLASSROOMS, ASSISTING IN HEAD START CLASSROOMS, EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION CENTERS, EMERGENCY SHELTER PROGRAMS, PRESCHOOLS, AND VALLEY CHILDREN'S HOSPITAL. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, FGP ANTICIPATES 486 AMERICORPS SENIORS FGP SUPPORTED OUTCOMES. AMERICORPS SENIORS FGP FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $386,408 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY AT LEAST $38,640.

THE CITY OF OAKLAND?S HUMAN SERVICES DEPARTMENT (HSD) DEVELOPS AND IMPLEMENT SUPPORTIVE INITIATIVES TO PROMOTE A HEALTHY AND CARING ENVIRONMENT FOR ALL MEMBERS OF THE COMMUNITY- CHILDREN, YOUTH, SENIORS AND ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES AND THEIR FAMILIES.  THE AGING & ADULTS SERVICES DIVISION MANAGES THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IN WHICH VOLUNTEERS, AGE 55 AND ABOVE, ARE AFFORDED THE OPPORTUNITY TO VOLUNTEER AND BE PLACED IN OUTCOME-BASED ASSIGNMENTS.  THE INTER-GENERATIONAL APPROACH OF THE FGP FURTHER ENHANCES THE VISION AND DIRECTION OF THE DEPARTMENT.  BY LINKING SENIORS WITH CHILDREN AND YOUTH IN EDUCATIONAL SETTINGS, THE COMMUNITY BENEFITS IN GENERAL AND THE SPECIAL NEEDS OF LOW-INCOME FAMILIES ARE ADDRESSED (E.G, ACCESS TO ADDITIONAL EDUCATIONAL RESOURCES; INCREASED RESOURCES FOR  FAMILY MEMBERS).
OAKLAND IS A CULTURALLY DIVERSE COMMUNITY. OUTREACH TO MAINTAIN THE CULTURAL INTEGRITY OF THE PROGRAM AND ITS PARTICIPANTS IS KEY FACTOR IN BUILDING THE QUALITY SERVICES.  A MINIMUM OF 6 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE RECRUITED, TRAINED AND MATCHED WITH SCHOOLS AND COMMUNITY-BASED PROGRAMS THROUGHOUT OAKLAND AND SURROUNDING CITIES OF ALAMEDA COUNTY. 
EDUCATION IS THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROGRAM.  THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST CHILDREN/YOUTH IN SERVICE ACTIVITIES FOR THE AGE GROUPS COVERING PRE-K AND K-12.
THE FGP'S FOUR WORK PLANS INCLUDE SERVICE ACTIVITIES IN SCHOOL READINESS: ASSISTING IN CLASSROOMS AND COMMUNITY CENTERS, ROLE MODELING, READING, SHARING GAMES, PROVIDING SAFE ENVIRONMENTS TO LEARN/SPACE FOR CHILDREN/YOUTH TO DEVELOP SOCIALLY-EMOTIONALLY, SUPPORTIVE EXERCISES, LANGUAGE/LETTER RECOGNITION. DATA COLLECTED WILL GUIDE THE EVALUATION PROCESS TO ASSESS THE OUTCOMES OF EACH WORK PLAN TARGETS FOR ALL PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS (E.G, STATION SITE SUPERVISORS, FG VOLUNTEERS AND TEACHER/CENTER OBSERVATION ASSESSMENTS).
AT THE END OF THIS THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD, AN ESTIMATED MINIMUM OF 6 FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS AND SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE ASSISTING WITH SPECIAL CLASSROOM LEARNING PROJECTS ENGAGING YOUTH IN BASIC SKILL DEVELOPMENT, READING, AND CONVERSATION.  IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT 100 UNDUPLICATED AND TARGETED PROGRAM MENTEES AND TUTORED CHILDREN WILL HAVE DEMONSTRATED SOME GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS AND GRADE LEVEL ACHIEVEMENTS INCLUDING IMPROVEMENTS IN READING AND  SOCIAL/ EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT.
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $37,881 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $7,386 GRANTEE MATCH.

SAN FRANCISCO'S FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP), SPONSORED BY THE FELTON INSTITUTE/FAMILY SERVICE AGENCY (FSA), IS COMMITTED TO MEETING THE CRITICAL NEEDS OF OUR COMMUNITY. FGP VOLUNTEERS ARE ACTIVE, VITAL, AND COMMUNITY-MINDED ADULTS AGE 55 AND OVER WHO ARE PLACED IN MEANINGFUL VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES THAT INCREASE THE CAPACITY OF SCHOOL AND COMMUNITY-BASED PROGRAMS FOR CHILDREN. OUR FGP VOLUNTEERS FOSTER TRUSTING AND SUPPORTIVE RELATIONSHIPS WITH THE CHILDREN THEY SERVE, HELPING TO NURTURE THE SOCIAL, COGNITIVE, AND EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT OF EACH CHILD. THE PROGRAM BEGAN IN 1965 AS PART OF THE ORIGINAL PILOTS IN THE COUNTRY AND CONTINUES TO BE AN ESSENTIAL PART OF THE EDUCATION AND SUPPORT OF SAN FRANCISCO CHILDREN, AS WELL AS AN IMPORTANT WAY TO BRING MEANINGFUL AND STIPEND, VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES TO LOW-INCOME SENIORS IN OUR COMMUNITY.

PROGRAM PARTNERS INCLUDE 25 VOLUNTEER STATIONS CONSISTING OF: 19 INFANT AND PRESCHOOL PROGRAMS, 3 ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS, 1 AFTER-SCHOOL PROGRAM (WITH PLANS TO DEVELOP 1 ADDITIONAL AFTER SCHOOL PROGRAMS), AND 1 COUNSELING CENTER. OUR FGP VOLUNTEERS PROVIDE SIGNIFICANT SERVICES AND EDUCATIONAL SUPPORT TO CHILDREN AND THEIR FAMILIES STRUGGLING WITH POVERTY AND OTHER SOCIAL ISSUES. THE MAJORITY OF OUR PRE-SCHOOLS IN OUR PORTFOLIO ARE HEAD START PROGRAMS, AND THUS BY THEIR OWN ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA, SERVE PRIMARILY LOW INCOME, HIGH NEED FAMILIES. THE MAJORITY OF OUR ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS SERVED BY FGP VOLUNTEERS ARE SUPPORTING CHILDREN FROM ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED BACKGROUNDS. THE MAJORITY OF OUR VOLUNTEER SITES OFFER SERVICES IN MULTIPLE LANGUAGES INCLUDING CANTONESE, MANDARIN, SPANISH, TAGALOG, AND RUSSIAN. IN RESPONSE TO REQUESTS FROM VOLUNTEER STATIONS, WE HAVE RECRUITED A MULTI-ETHNIC, MULTILINGUAL VOLUNTEER CORPS WHERE 82% SPEAK LANGUAGES OTHER THAN ENGLISH.  

FSA IS REQUESTING A GRANT OF $298,818 TO RECRUIT, TRAIN, AND PLACE 47 VSY (VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS) WITH A GRANTEE SHARE OF $40,254.00 OR AN AMOUNT OF $339,072. THE SPECIFIC SERVICE ACTIVITIES AND FOCUS ARE INCORPORATED IN FOUR WORK PLANS AND COMPLY WITH THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS) REGULATIONS AND STRATEGIC INITIATIVES.

WE DESIGNED THE WORK PLANS TO SUPPORT CHILDREN AND YOUTH IN IMPROVING AND INCREASING THEIR LITERACY SKILLS, SCHOOL READINESS, AND POSITIVE SOCIALIZATION, IN SCHOOL, COMMUNITY, AND CLINIC-BASED VOLUNTEER SITES. WORK PLAN #1 ENCOMPASSES OUR LARGEST GROUP OF VOLUNTEERS WITH 35 VOLUNTEERS ASSISTING IN GENERAL CLASSROOM ACTIVITIES, INCLUDING READING, ART, AND MUSIC, AND ENCOURAGING POSITIVE BEHAVIOR AND SOCIALIZATION WITH CHILDREN AGE 0 TO 5. WE PROJECT THAT FGP VOLUNTEERS IN THIS PLAN WILL SERVE 140 CHILDREN AT 19 PRESCHOOL SITES.  WORK PLAN #2, 7 VOLUNTEERS PROVIDE SERVICE IN SAN FRANCISCO UNIFIED SCHOOL DISTRICT ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS THROUGH COLLABORATIONS WITH EXPERIENCE CORPS AND READING PARTNERS, AND WE PROJECT THAT 28 CHILDREN AGE 5 TO 11 WILL BE SERVED ANNUALLY. WORK PLAN #3, 4 VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE SERVICE IN SCHOOL-BASED AND COMMUNITY-BASED SETTINGS IN BOTH INDIVIDUAL AND GROUP LITERACY SESSIONS, PROJECTING TO SERVE 16 CHILDREN AGE 5 TO 12. WORK PLAN #4 PROVIDES SUPPORT IN A CLINIC-BASED SETTING AND IS OUR SMALLEST WORK PLAN WITH 1 VOLUNTEER SERVING IN 1 VOLUNTEER SITE, PROVIDING REGULAR SOCIALIZATION AND COMFORT TO CHILDREN OF PARENTS RECEIVING CLINIC SERVICES. WE PROJECT THE VOLUNTEER WILL SERVE 6 CHILDREN IN THIS WORK PLAN.

PORTER-LEATH WILL RECRUIT AND PLACE A MINIMUM OF 115 FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS TO PROVIDE  105 FEDERAL VSYS OF ONE-ON-ONE SUPPORT TO SPECIAL NEEDS CHILDREN THROUGHOUT MEMPHIS, SHELBY AND FAYETTE COUNTIES. ALL 115 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF EDUCATION TO PROMOTE SCHOOL READINESS AND SUCCESS IN KINDERGARTEN THROUGH TWELFTH GRADES.  FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL ENGAGE CHILDREN THROUGH IN-PERSON OR VIRTUAL ACTIVITIES INCLUDING READING, COGNITIVE ACTIVITIES, PRE-LITERACY ACTIVITIES AND ENCOURAGING EDUCATION RELATED ACTIVITIES TO ENRICH THE CHILD'S APPRECIATION FOR ACADEMIC SKILLS AND FOSTER SELF ESTEEM. AT THE END OF THE SCHOOL TERM, THE PROGRAM ANTICIPATES THAT 200 CHILDREN WILL SPEND TIME REGULARLY WITH A FOSTER GRANDPARENT FOCUSING ON EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES, WITH 182 OF THESE CHILDREN SHOWING IMPROVEMENT IN LITERACY SKILLS TO ACHIEVE SCHOOL READINESS OR EDUCATIONAL SUCCESS. THE CNS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $586,667 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $65,185 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

OUR MISSION STATEMENT AT AIKEN/BARNWELL COUNTIES COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY, INC., IS "TO MOBILIZE RESOURCES AND TO PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES, SERVICES, AND ADVOCACY THAT WILL EMPOWER PEOPLE TO REALIZE AND SUSTAIN SELF-SUFFICIENCY AND SELF-DIGNITY".  EACH DAY WE CONTINUE TO OFFER THE BEST SERVICE AND PROGRAMMATIC ACTIVITIES TO THE LOW-INCOME AND OLDER POPULATIONS IN OUR COMMUNITY.   WE STRIVE TO PROVIDE QUALITY SERVICES TO PEOPLE WITH SPECIAL NEEDS BY PRODUCING THE ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL SUPPORT THAT SO MANY ARE MISSING.
     THE MISSION OF THE AMERICORPS SENIORS FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) IS TO DEVELOP AND BUILD BRIDGES BETWEEN TWO GENERATIONS WITH THE PURPOSE OF PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES FOR CHILDREN AND SENIORS TO INTERACT AND LEARN FROM EACH OTHER, AS WELL AS TO ENJOY MEANINGFUL EXPERIENCES AND RELATIONSHIPS.  EDUCATION, FRIENDSHIPS, AND CARING ARE MAIN COMPONENTS OF OUR PROGRAM.  FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL SERVE AS MENTORS, TUTORS, AND CAREGIVERS FOR AT-RISK CHILDREN AND YOUTH WITH SPECIAL NEEDS THROUGH A VARIETY OF COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS INCLUDING PUBLIC SCHOOLS, HEAD START CENTERS, AFTER-SCHOOL PROGRAMS, NON-PROFIT DAY-CARE CENTERS, AND FAITH-BASED STATIONS. THE PROGRAM ALLOWS CHILDREN WITH EXCEPTIONAL OR SPECIAL NEEDS OR CHILDREN WHO SEEM TO BE AT-RISK, TO BE ABLE TO ACHIEVE IMPROVED ACADEMIC, PHYSICAL, MENTAL, EMOTIONAL, AND SOCIAL DEVELOPMENT WHILE ASSISTING THEM TO LEARN AND GROW WITH A POSITIVE SELF-IMAGE.  PUT SIMPLY, THE ONE-ON-ONE ATTENTION IS IMPORTANT IN HELPING SET A CHILD ON THE PATH TOWARDS A SUCCESSFUL FUTURE.  IN RETURN, FOSTER GRANDPARENTS RECEIVE THE JOY OF BEING NEEDED WITHIN THEIR COMMUNITIES AND LIVING A HEALTHIER LIFE.
     THE FGP OF AIKEN, ALLENDALE, BARNWELL, AND EDGEFIELD COUNTIES WILL CAREFULLY AND STRATEGICALLY PLACE AN ESTIMATED 102 AMERICORPS SENIORS FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS, SERVING BETWEEN 15 AND 40 HOURS A WEEK AT THEIR ASSIGNED STATIONS.  OF THIS NUMBER, 101 AMERICORPS FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. THEY WILL PROVIDE INDIVIDUALIZED ATTENTION, UNHURRIED HELP, CONSISTENT SUPPORT AND THE OPPORTUNITY FOR INTER-GENERATIONAL CONNECTION. SOME OF THEIR SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TUTORING AND/OR MENTORING WHILE ASSISTING IN CLASSROOM WITH ACADEMICS, (I.E. READING, WRITING AND MATH), SOCIAL SKILLS, LIBRARY SERVICES, PRE-ELEMENTARY DAY CARE, AND AFTER-SCHOOL PROGRAMS WITH HOMEWORK AND RETENTION ACTIVITIES.  THE AMERICORPS PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THIS THREE-YEAR GRANT, WE ANTICIPATE THAT THE CHILDREN WHO RECEIVED SUPPORT FROM A FOSTER GRANDPARENT IN PRE-ELEMENTARY OR EARLY CHILDHOOD PROGRAMS WILL SHOW A POSITIVE IMPACT IN SCHOOL READINESS.  ANOTHER IMPORTANT GOAL IS THAT A POSITIVE NUMBER OF STUDENTS IN KINDERGARTEN THROUGH 12TH GRADE, WHO RECEIVED ASSISTANCE FROM A FOSTER GRANDPARENT, WILL SHOW IMPROVEMENT AND SUCCEED IN ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE.  WITH THE REQUESTED AMERICCORPS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $549,005, WE PLAN TO ENSURE THAT THE CHILDREN AND YOUTH, ALONG WITH THE SENIOR VOLUNTEERS WHO PARTICIPATE, WILL HAVE THE SUPPORT THEY NEED THROUGH QUALITY PROGRAMMING AND PARTNERSHIPS TO SUCCEED.   WITH OUR DEDICATED COMMUNITY PARTNERS, WHO ARE AS PASSIONATE ABOUT OUR PROGRAM AS WE ARE, WE ANTICIPATE THAT THESE FUNDS WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED WITH AT LEAST A TEN PERCENT NON-FEDERAL RESOURCE MATCH.  THESE RESOURCES WILL HELP ENHANCE AND STRENGTHEN THE PROGRAM WHILE ALLOWING US TO ACHIEVE OUR SET GOALS.  
     RESEARCH INDICATES THAT BUILDING MUTUALLY BENEFICIAL RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN VOLUNTEERS, SCHOOLS AND COMMUNITIES HAVE A POSITIVE IMPACT AND THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IS CONFIDENT IN OUR ROLE OF CONNECTOR OF THESE RELATIONSHIPS. THE PARTNERSHIPS WE HAVE FORMED CREATE A FIRM FOUNDATION FOR OUR FOCUS AREA OF EDUCATION AND ALL ASSOCIATED ASPECTS.  WE KNOW THAT OUR FOSTER GRANDPARENTS CONTRIBUTE TO THEIR COMMUNITIES IN MEANINGFUL AND MEASURABLE WAYS. WE EXPECT THAT THE STUDENTS SERVED BY OUR THREE-YEAR GRANT WILL GROW TO BE PRODUCTIVE, CA

PIEDMONT AGENCY ON AGING IS CURRENTLY PROVIDING MEALS ON WHEELS, TRANSPORTATION, AND CONGREGATE DINING IN THE FOLLOWING THREE COUNTIES.

OUR GOAL IN APPLYING FOR THE THREE-COUNTY GRANT IS TO START SMALL AND EXPAND LATER.  WITH THE AGENCY HAVING STRONG TIES IN ALL THREE COMMUNITIES, IT WAS A NATURAL FIT TO EXPAND SERVICES TO ALL THREE COMMUNITIES IF POSSIBLE.  BY EXPANDING TO 65 VOLUNTEERS WITHIN THESE THREE COUNTIES, IT WOULD ALLOW PIEDMONT AGENCY ON AGING TO DOUBLE THEIR FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM WITHOUT BECOMING OVERWHELMED.  STARTING SMALL AND EXPANDING LATER WOULD ALLOW THE AGENCY TO DO A GOOD JOB BY GROWING THE INDIVIDUAL COUNTIES SLOWLY.  ONCE INITIAL START-UP AS BEGUN AND IS GOING WELL, THE POTENTIAL TO EXPAND VOLUNTEER NUMBERS IN EACH COUNTY BASED ON NEED WOULD BE APPRECIATED IF POSSIBLE.  PIEDMONT AGENCY HAS A STRONG DESIRE TO MOVE AN ALREADY WELL ESTABLISHED AND SUCCESSFUL FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM INTO OUR OTHER THREE SERVING AREAS.  THIS IS AN EXCITING MOVE FOR US IF GIVEN THE OPPORTUNITY.

EASTERSEALS OF NORTH GEORGIA MISSION 
EASTER SEALS NORTH GEORGIA (ESNG), INC.'S MISSION IS TO PROVIDE HIGH-QUALITY SERVICES WITHIN OUR 44 COUNTY TERRITORY, TO STRENGTHEN CHILDREN AND THEIR FAMILIES AT THE MOST CRITICAL TIMES IN A CHILD'S DEVELOPMENT. ESNG PROVIDES EARLY INTERVENTION AND HEAD START/EARLY HEAD START TO 5,000 CHILDREN AND FAMILIES ANNUALLY. ESNG IS REQUESTING $494,796 FROM CNCS TO SERVE 82 VSYS. THE SERVICE AREAS ARE HEAD START AND SCHOOL PREPAREDNESS AND MATERNAL/CHILD HEALTH SERVICES. THE GRANTEE SHARE IS $54,981.00. SOME ACTIVITIES PERFORMED BY FGP'S ARE: READING TO AND WITH CHILDREN, PLAYING, REVIEWING ACTIVITIES IN THE TEACHER'S LESSON PLANS IN THE AREAS OF LITERACY, MATH, SCIENCE, PHYSICAL, COGNITIVE AND SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL SKILL DEVELOPMENT,  ATTENDING THERAPY SESSIONS WITH CHILDREN(IN-HOUSE),  SOOTHING CHILDREN WHO ARE UPSET AND ATTENDING FIELD TRIPS. THERE ARE TWO FOCUS AREAS FOR THE AMERICORPS SENIORS . THE FIRST FOCUS AREA WILL BE WORKING WITH CHILDREN WITH A DISABILITY OR SUSPECTED OF HAVING A DISABILITY.  EARLY DIAGNOSIS AND TREATMENT ARE CRITICAL IN A CHILD'S DEVELOPMENT. ACCORDING TO THE SPECIAL NEEDS CHILD WEBSITE, RESEARCH HAS SHOWN THAT MOST OF A CHILD'S LEARNING AND DEVELOPMENT HAPPENS IN PRESCHOOL YEARS. COMMUNITY ASSESSMENTS SHOW THE VALUE OF EARLY IDENTIFICATION AND TREATMENT FOR CHILDREN AGES BIRTH THROUGH 5 WHO ARE LOW-INCOME AND HAVE OR ARE "AT-RISK" OF DISABILITIES, AS WELL AS IMPROVED LITERACY, READING, AND MATH SKILLS FOR CHILDREN CONSIDERED TO BE "AT-RISK" IN ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS IN ATLANTA.  APPROXIMATELY 12% OF THE STUDENTS ENROLLED IN THE EARLY EDUCATION PROGRAMS SERVED BY THE AMERICORP SENIORS HAVE A DISABILITY, AND 260 OF THESE CHILDREN HAVE SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL CHALLENGES. THE CDC STUDY, MENTAL HEALTH SURVEILLANCE AMONG CHILDREN-US 2005-2011, STATES THAT MENTAL HEALTH IN CHILDHOOD IS CHARACTERIZED BY THE ACHIEVEMENT OF EMOTIONAL MILESTONES, HEALTHY SOCIAL DEVELOPMENT, AND EFFECTIVE COPING SKILLS.  ACCORDING TO THE US DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES, HEALTH RESOURCES AND SERVICES ADMINISTRATION, MOST CHILDREN AND ADOLESCENTS WHO EXPERIENCE MENTAL HEALTH DISORDERS CAN RETURN TO HEALTHY DAILY LIVES IF THEY RECEIVE APPROPRIATE TREATMENT EARLY. THE SECOND FOCUS GROUP IS AMERICORPS SENIORS WHO ARE WORKING IN THE 26 CLASSES INVOLVED IN THE STEM EARLY CHILDHOOD PROGRAMS CLASSROOMS.   EASTER SEALS OF NORTH GEORGIA IS A NATIONAL STEM CERTIFIED ECE INSTITUTION THROUGH COGNIA (FORMERLY ADVANCEED), IS THE THIRD ECE INSTITUTION TO EARN SUCH AN ACCOLADE, THE FIRST IN THE SOUTHEAST. THE AMERICORPS SENIORS  ARE WORKING WITH THE CHILDREN IN THESE CLASSES ON SCIENCE, MATH AND ENGINEERING ACTIVITIES. 
THIS INCLUDES CHILDREN FROM BIRTH TO FIVE YEARS OLD THAT ESNG SERVES, 98% LIVE AT OR BELOW THE POVERTY LINE, 12% HAVE A DIAGNOSED DISABILITY, AND 48.5% ARE ENGLISH LANGUAGE LEARNERS. EASTER SEALS NORTH GEORGIA SERVES THOSE COMMUNITIES THAT ARE LOW-INCOME, AND SINGLE MOTHERS OR GRANDPARENTS HEAD LEAD HOUSEHOLDS. WE WILL USE THE AGE-LONG LEARNING MODEL, DEVELOPMENTALLY APPROPRIATE PRACTICES, AND LEARN LITERACY MODEL TO PREPARE OUR  AMERICORPS SENIORS TO WORK WITH CHILDREN IN THE SERVICE AREAS IDENTIFIED. THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOME IS THAT THE CHILDREN INVOLVED WILL DEMONSTRATE DEVELOPMENTALLY APPROPRIATE SKILLS.

THE ATHENS COMMUNITY COUNCIL ON AGING (ACCA) IS A PRIVATE NON-PROFIT 501(C)3 ORGANIZATION SERVING 12 COUNTIES IN NORTHEAST GEORGIA.  OUR MISSION IS TO PROMOTE A LIFETIME OF WELLNESS THROUGH ENGAGEMENT, ADVOCACY, EDUCATION AND SUPPORT.  ACCA HAS BEEN A LEADING PROVIDER OF AGING SERVICES SINCE 1967 AND HAS SPONSORED THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) SINCE 1997.
AN ESTIMATED 26 FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TUTORING AND MENTORING CHILDREN IN ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS, HEAD START PROGRAMS, DAYCARES, AND COMMUNITY CENTERS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THE PROJECT IS EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 75% OF CHILDREN COMPLETING THE EDUCATION PROGRAM WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $169,236 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $ $24,569 IN NON-FEDERAL FUNDS.

IN LATE MARCH OF 2020, OUR COUNTRY WAS PLUNGED INTO A SERIES OF EVENTS THAT HAVE NOT BEEN EXPERIENCED IN MODERN HISTORY. AS A RESULT OF THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC, OUR COUNTRY HAS EXPERIENCED AN UNPRECEDENTED DECLINE OF THE STOCK MARKET, A TIME OF BUSINESSES CLOSING THEIR DOORS AND UNPARALLELED UNEMPLOYMENT, FOOD PANTRIES OVERRUN WITH FAMILIES WHO IN THE PAST DONATED TO SUCH ORGANIZATIONS NOW NEEDED THE SERVICES OF THEM, EDUCATION SYSTEMS WHICH ARE HAVING TO REDEFINE HOW LEARNING WILL TAKE PLACE IN THE FALL OF 2020, AND IN THE MOST SIMPLEST TERMS A COMPLETE OVERFLOW OF CITIZENS NEEDING SERVICES FROM OUR NATION'S HEALTH CARE SYSTEM. WHILE NO ONE KNOWS WHAT WILL HAPPEN IN THE FUTURE, IT IS CLEAR FROM THE STATISTICS PROVIDED THAT IF THE COMMUNITY DOES NOT BAND TOGETHER TO HELP THOSE IN NEED AND HELP OUR COMMUNITIES
NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS WHO ARE ON THE FRONTLINES OF THE BATTLE, EVEN MORE PEOPLE WILL SUFFER PHYSICALLY, FINANCIALLY AND PSYCHOLOGICALLY. FGP VOLUNTEERS, WHILE IN A DEMOGRAPHIC WHO HAVE BEEN IMPACTED SIGNIFICANTLY, ARE READY, WILLING AND ABLE TO HELP THEIR COMMUNITIES RECOVER FROM THE PANDEMIC. FGP VOLUNTEERS ARE WORKING TO MEET THEIR COMMUNITIES MOST PRESSING NEEDS BY TUTORING IN VIRTUAL CLASSROOMS, ASSISTING SCHOOLS AND TEACHERS AS BEST THEY ARE ABLE.

THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) OF DUVAL COUNTY IN JACKSONVILLE, FLORIDA IS AN ORGANIZATION WHICH OFFERS AN OPPORTUNITY FOR SENIORS 55 AND OVER TO GIVE OF THEIR TIME AND TALENTS IN TUTORING, MENTORING, AND NURTURING SPECIAL AND EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS AND AT-RISK CHILDREN. THE SPONSOR FOR THE FGP OF DUVAL COUNTY IS THE CITY OF JACKSONVILLE, A GOVERNMENT AGENCY. THIS PROGRAM HAS OPERATED FOR 48 YEARS AND IS WITHIN THE SENIOR SERVICES DIVISION OF THE PARKS, RECREATION AND COMMUNITY SERVICES DEPARTMENT WITH THE CITY OF JACKSONVILLE. 

EDUCATION IS THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA IN ADMINISTRATING THE PROGRAM. AN ESTIMATED 70 AMERICORPS SENIORS FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  OF THIS NUMBER, 70 AMERICORPS SENIORS VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE VOLUNTARY PRE-KINDERGARTEN (VPK) CHILDREN (AGES 3 - 4) AND PRE-KINDERGARTEN (PK) CHILDREN (AGES 4 - 5) INCLUDE: 1) ASSIST WITH SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL BEHAVIORAL CONCEPTS AND 2) COMFORT AND COMMUNICATE (VOCABULARY AND SPEECH); FOR KINDERGARTEN THRU 12TH GRADE STUDENTS (AGES 5 - 21) INCLUDE: 1) ASSIST WITH EARLY WRITING AND PRINT CONCEPTS, 2) ASSIST WITH READING CONCEPTS, 3) ASSIST WITH MATH CONCEPTS, AND 4) MODEL PROPER SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL BEHAVIORAL CONCEPTS. 
BY THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD, OUR FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE ASSISTED CHILDREN EXPERIENCING EARLY CHILDHOOD SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL BEHAVIORAL PROBLEMS AND FAILING STUDENTS WITH FAVORABLE OUTCOMES AND IMPACT. OUTCOMES THAT ENABLED THE VPK AND PK AGED CHILDREN TO IMPROVE IN THEIR EARLY CHILDHOOD DEVELOPMENT OF SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL BEHAVIORS AND THE K THRU 12 GRADE STUDENTS TO ADVANCE TO THE NEXT LEVEL ARE BASED UPON THE IMPROVEMENT IN READING AND READING READINESS (INCLUDING PHONICS AND COMPREHENSION), MATH AND MATH READINESS, AND LIFE MANAGEMENT SKILLS. 
  
COVID-19 HAS SHIFTED HOW THE PROGRAM OPERATES AND AFFECTED HOW WE WILL ACHIEVE THE OUTCOMES. THE VOLUNTEERS HAVE NOT BEEN CLEARED TO RETURN TO THE CLASSROOMS FOR THEIR SAFETY AND THE CHILDREN AS WELL AS IN-PERSON TRAININGS.  THE PROGRAM WILL UTILIZE ONLINE RECRUITMENT TOOLS TO GENERATE A POOL OF DIVERSE VOLUNTEERS, REMAIN IN CONTACT WITH THE SCHOOLS TO MAINTAIN INTEREST AND RELATIONSHIP AND CREATE A HEAVY ONLINE PRESENCE. THE VOLUNTEERS WILL RECEIVE THEIR REQUIRED MONTHLY IN-SERVICE TRAININGS THROUGH A VIRTUAL PLATFORM. VIRTUAL AND DRIVE THROUGH RECOGNITIONS, AND APPRECIATIONS WILL CONTINUE TO BE PLANNED REGULARLY TO MAINTAIN A HIGH MORALE AND RETENTION OF VOLUNTEERS. ONCE IT IS SAFE TO GATHER IN GROUPS, VOLUNTEERS WILL RETURN TO THE CLASSROOMS, AND IN-PERSON TRAININGS, RECOGNITIONS, AND APPRECIATIONS. 

THE AMERICORPS SENIORS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $407,031 TO FUND THE FGP OF DUVAL COUNTY AT 63 VSYS WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $134,234 PROVIDED BY THE CITY OF JACKSONVILLE.

THE STATE TEXAS CHILDREN?S REPORT FROM THE CENTER FOR PUBLIC POLICY PRIORITIES IN 2018 INDICATES THAT ONE IN FIVE TEXAS CHILDREN LIVES IN POVERTY, AND BLACK AND HISPANIC CHILDREN ARE DISPROPORTIONATELY LIKELY TO LIVE BELOW THE POVERTY LINE. POVERTY RATES FOR FAMILIES WITH CHILDREN HEADED BY SINGLE-MOTHERS (38 PERCENT) ARE TWICE AS HIGH AS THEY ARE FOR FAMILIES WITH CHILDREN HEADED BY SINGLE-FATHERS (19 PERCENT). CHILDHOOD EDUCATION AND ITS ASSOCIATED OUTCOMES ARE ALSO TIED TO MANY OF THE SAME STRESSORS AS OVERALL HEALTH AND WELL-BEING. THE SCIENTIFIC AMERICAN ARTICLE POVERTY DISTURBS CHILDREN?S BRAIN DEVELOPMENT AND ACADEMIC PERFORMANCES STATED THAT STUDENTS WHO ARE ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED DON?T PERFORM AS WELL IN SCHOOL BOTH LOCALLY AND NATIONALLY. IT IS IMPERATIVE THAT CHILDREN BE GIVEN EVERY OPPORTUNITY AND SUPPORT TO SURPASS THEIR CIRCUMSTANCES. MENTORING PROVIDES THAT PROSPECT FOR SUCCESSFUL OUTCOMES. WE BELIEVE AND HAVE PREVIOUSLY DEMONSTRATED THE MOBIUSMENTOR.ORG STATEMENT THAT SAYS ?MENTORING IS A PROVEN STRATEGY FOR POSITIVE YOUTH DEVELOPMENT. YOUTH ARE MORE LIKELY TO SUCCEED IN LIFE WHEN THEY HAVE THE ADDITIONAL SUPPORT OF A CARING, CONSISTENT ADULT MENTORS.

CENLA AREA AGENCY ON AGING, INC. (CENLA AAA) WAS INCORPORATED IN 1992 AS A 501 (C) (3) ORGANIZATION WHOSE MISSION IS TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR SENIORS AGE 60 AND OLDER BY PROCURING AND PROVIDING SERVICES TO ALLOW THEM TO REMAIN IN THEIR COMMUNITIES FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE OLDER AMERICANS ACT OF 1965 AND THE STATE OF LOUISIANA OFFICE OF ELDERLY AFFAIRS REGULATIONS. OUR GOVERNING BODY IS A 15 MEMBER BOARD OF DIRECTORS, COMPRISED OF NO MORE THAN 5 MEMBERS FROM EACH OF OUR PLANNING AND SERVICE AREA (PSA) DISTRICTS. A 14+ MEMBER ADVISORY COUNCIL ENHANCES OUR ABILITY TO SERVE THE ELDERLY BY FURTHERING OUR MISSION TO DEVELOP AND COORDINATE COMMUNITY-BASED SYSTEMS OF ELDERLY SERVICES IN THE PARISHES WE SERVE.
THE CENLA AAA AGING DISABILITY RESOURCE CENTER AND OMBUDSMAN PROGRAMS SERVE 20 PARISHES IN LOUISIANA'S CENTRAL AND NORTHEAST REGIONS. WE CONTRACT TITLE III SERVICES AND PROVIDE SENIORX, SENIOR HEALTH INSURANCE INFORMATION, AND EVIDENCE-BASED III-D WELLNESS WORKSHOPS IN 15 OF THOSE PARISHES. CENLA AAA SPONSORS AMERICORPS SENIORS SERVING AS FOSTER GRANDPARENTS IN AVOYELLES, CATAHOULA, CONCORDIA, GRANT, RAPIDES AND WINN PARISHES.
CENLA AAA HAS ADMINISTERED THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) IN THE CENTRAL LOUISIANA REGION SINCE JULY 1, 2012. WE HEREBY PROPOSE TO CONTINUE THE FGP SERVICES IN THIS AREA BY ENGAGING AN ESTIMATED 70 FGP VOLUNTEERS TO EQUAL A TOTAL OF 51 VSYS PLACED IN OUTCOME-BASED ASSIGNMENTS WITH 9 VOLUNTEERS PROJECTED FOR ASSIGNMENTS AT THE CENTRAL LA SUPPORTS AND SERVICES CENTER (PREVIOUSLY KNOWN AS THE SPECIAL EDUCATION CENTER) IN RAPIDES PARISH. SOME OF THE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: TUTORING CHILDREN IN SCHOOLS, PROVIDING CHILDREN WITH EMOTIONAL SUPPORT IN DEVELOPING BASIC LEARNING SKILLS, ASSISTING CHILDREN IN K-12 AND HEAD START CLASSROOMS, AND MENTORING AND NURTURING SEVERELY ORTHOPEDICALLY IMPAIRED CHILDREN. WE EXPECT THIS YEAR TO BE ESPECIALLY CHALLENGING DUE TO THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC AND INFRASTRUCTURE ISSUES DUE TO HURRICANES LAURA AND DELTA IN ADDITION TO THE PROLONGED, UNPRECEDENTED WINTER TEMPERATURES.
THE PRIMARY AMERICORPS FOCUS IS PROGRAMS DESIGNED TO REMOVE STRUCTURAL RACIAL INEQUALITIES, ADVANCE RACIAL EQUALITY, AND INCREASE OPPORTUNITIES THAT ACHIEVE SUSTAINABLE CHANGE. THE SPONSORING ORGANIZATION, EAST ARKANSAS AREA AGENCY ON AGING (EAAAA) IS A PRIVATE, NON-PROFIT CORPORATION THAT WAS FOUNDED IN 1978. THE EAAAA IS GOVERNED BY A 13-MEMBER BOARD OF DIRECTORS, IN CONJUNCTION WITH AN ADVISORY COUNCIL. ITS MISSION IS TO PROVIDE LEADERSHIP OF AGING ISSUES ON BEHALF OF OLDER PERSONS IN EAST ARKANSAS, AND TO CARRY OUT A WIDE RANGE OF FUNCTIONS IN PLANNING, COORDINATION, AND SERVICE DELIVERY SUCH THAT OLDER PERSONS ARE ASSISTED IN LEADING INDEPENDENT, MEANINGFUL AND DIGNIFIED LIVES IN THEIR OWN HOMES AND COMMUNITIES AS LONG AS POSSIBLE. 
THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IN NORTH EASTERN ARKANSAS HAS A LONG STANDING TRADITION ROOTED IN STRENGTHENING OUR COMMUNITIES AND FOSTERING CIVIC ENGAGEMENT THROUGH A COMMITMENT TO COMMUNITY SERVICE. ITS MISSION IS TWOFOLD: FIRST, TO PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR OLDER PERSONS TO GIVE BACK TO THEIR COMMUNITIES, WHICH CREATES A SENSE OF USEFULNESS AND IT HAS BEEN PROVEN TO IMPROVE HEALTH AND LONGEVITY.  SECONDLY, THE PROGRAM AIMS TO PROVIDE ONE-ON-ONE ASSISTANCE TO SPECIAL AND EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS CHILDREN HELPING THEM TO IMPROVE IN THEIR NEEDED AREAS OF DEVELOPMENT.

THIS WILL BE MEASURED BY AN IMPACT/OUTCOME FORM THAT WILL BE FILLED OUT BY THE STATIONS AT THE END OF THE SCHOOL YEARS.
THESE VOLUNTEERS SERVE AT NINE VOLUNTEER STATIONS IN SIX ARKANSAS COUNTIES. 112 STUDENTS BENEFIT DIRECTLY EACH ACADEMIC YEAR FROM ONE-ON-ONE INDIVIDUALIZED ATTENTION FROM A FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEER. COUNTLESS OTHERS BENEFIT FROM A SMILE OR AN ENCOURAGING WORD SPOKEN FROM A GRANDPARENT IN THEIR SCHOOL.  THROUGH THE RECENTLY ADMINISTERED NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF FOSTER GRANDPARENT DIRECTOR'S SURVEY, IT WAS DETERMINED THAT 75% OF OUR VOLUNTEERS FEEL THAT THEIR PARTICIPATION IN THE PROGRAM PREVENTS ISOLATION WHILE 100% REPORTED INCREASED SELF-ESTEEM AND IMPROVED SENSE OF WELL-BEING AS WELL AS THE BENEFITS OF INCREASED HEALTH, SOCIALIZATION, PURPOSE AND FULFILLMENT.

THE COMMUNITY PLACE OF GREATER ROCHESTER, INC. (CPGR) DELIVERS HIGH-QUALITY, COST EFFECTIVE PROGRAMS THROUGHOUT THE GREATER ROCHESTER AREA.  CPGR HAS SETTLEMENT HOUSE ROOTS THAT SPAN 100 YEARS AND HOLDS STRONG TO ITS MISSION "TO PROVIDE NEIGHBORHOOD-BASED PROGRAMS, SERVICES, AND RESOURCES WHICH STRENGTHEN THE GREATER ROCHESTER COMMUNITY, ONE PERSON, ONE FAMILY AT A TIME."
  
THE ROCHESTER CITY SCHOOL DISTRICT (RCSD) IS A HIGH-NEED URBAN DISTRICT WHERE, ACCORDING TO THE NYS DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION (2019), 90% OF STUDENTS ARE ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED. THE SAME DATA SHOWS THAT ONLY 18% OF ROCHESTER STUDENTS ARE ACHIEVING ENGLISH/LANGUAGE ARTS PROFICIENCY BY THIRD GRADE. THAT IS LESS THAN HALF OF THE NEW YORK STATE RATE. STUDENTS IN THE DISTRICT ALSO STRUGGLE WITH  SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL NEEDS. IN 2019, 81% OF RCSD STUDENTS REPORTED HAVING ONE OR TWO ADVERSE CHILDHOOD EVENTS (2019 ROCHESTER CITY SCHOOL DISTRICT YOUTH RISK BEHAVIOR SURVEY).

CPGR IS REQUESTING 76 FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS (VSY'S) TO ADDRESS THE EDUCATIONAL AND SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL NEEDS OF CHILDREN AND YOUTH. EIGHTY-THREE (83) VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOMES BASED ASSIGNMENTS (WE'VE PLANNED TO RECRUIT 83 TO ACCOUNT FOR ANY ATTRITION). THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS K-12 SUCCESS. ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE MENTORING AND ENGAGING YOUTH DURING OUT-OF-SCHOOL TIME. VOLUNTEERS WILL WORK WITH DISADVANTAGED YOUTH TO PROVIDE TUTORING, MODELING PROPER SOCIAL SKILLS READING AND TELLING STORIES, POSITIVE ENCOURAGEMENT, AND REDIRECTION (MENTORING SERVICES), AS WELL AS READING AND TELLING STORIES, MENTORING, ENCOURAGEMENT, ARTS AND CRAFTS, DANCE, MUSIC AND SPORTS (OUT-OF-SCHOOL TIME SERVICES). 

AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 85% OF STUDENTS RECEIVING MENTORING SERVICES OR OUT-OF-SCHOOL TIME SERVICES WILL SHOW IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT AND/OR A POSITIVE CHANGE IN SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL SKILLS. IN ADDITION, THE PROJECT WILL TRACK AND REPORT THE NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS SERVED. 

CPGR IS REQUESTING A CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $494,000 AND WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $113,953 NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

HEAD START SERVICES HAVE BEEN IN ROCKLAND COUNTY FOR 50+ YEARS AND HEAD START OF ROCKLAND'S ("HSOR") PROGRAMS HAVE CONSISTENTLY BEEN FOUND IN COMPLIANCE WITH ALL REGULATIONS DURING ONGOING INDEPENDENT AUDITS, FEDERAL, AND STATE REVIEWS. HSOR'S PROGRAMS ARE NAEYC ACCREDITED AND ARE APPROVED AS NEW YORK STATE SPECIAL EDUCATION EVALUATION SITES.
OF THE APPROXIMATELY 60 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS CURRENTLY IN ROCKLAND, AROUND 36% SERVE AT HSOR'S DIRECT-RUN SITES, AND 11% SERVE AT HSOR'S COLLABORATIVE AGENCY. HSOR HAS BENEFITTED FROM THE MEASURABLE IMPACT THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM ("FGP") ACHIEVES IN HELPING CHILDREN DEVELOP SOCIALLY AND EMOTIONALLY. 
HSOR'S STRONG LOCAL PRESENCE IN ROCKLAND COUNTY HAS ALLOWED HSOR TO CLOSELY COLLABORATE WITH THE COMMUNITY ADVISORY COUNCIL AND VOLUNTEER STATIONS TO MAINTAIN A STRONG CONTINUUM OF CARE FOR THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS AND THE CHILDREN AND FAMILIES WE SERVE.
HSOR'S PRIMARY FOCUS AREA IS EDUCATION. HSOR AIMS TO PROVIDE SUPPORT AND FACILITATE ACCESS TO SERVICES AND RESOURCES THAT CONTRIBUTE TO SCHOOL READINESS AND ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT FOR ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED AND EXCEPTIONAL/SPECIAL NEEDS CHILDREN. THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE IN EARLY CHILDHOOD CLASSROOMS AND TUTOR IN PUBLIC SCHOOLS. HSOR'S CURRENT STRATEGIC GOALS ALIGN WITH CNCS'S AGENCY-WIDE PRIORITY MEASURE'S OF SCHOOL READINESS AND K-12 SUCCESS.
HSOR PLANS ON PLACING 100% OF FOSTER GRANDPARENTS IN WORK PLANS THAT RESULT IN AGENCY-WIDE OUTCOMES WITH APPROXIMATELY 43% OF FOSTER GRANDPARENTS SERVING IN THE K-12 SUCCESS AGENCY-WIDE PRIORITY MEASURE AND 57% OF FOSTER GRANDPARENTS SERVING IN THE SCHOOL READINESS AGENCY-WIDE PRIORITY MEASURE. IN THE THIRD YEAR OF THE PROGRAM, APPROXIMATELY 120 CHILDREN WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT OR SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT.
THE ANNUAL CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $358,381 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY A TOTAL OF $40,358; COMPRISED OF STATE AND LOCAL FUNDS AS WELL AS IN-KIND MEALS PROVIDED THROUGH VOLUNTEER STATIONS. 
HSOR'S STRONG LOCAL PRESENCE IN ROCKLAND COUNTY, CLOSE COLLABORATION WITH THE COMMUNITY ADVISORY COUNCIL AND VOLUNTEER STATIONS, 50 YEARS OF EXPERIENCE AND COMMUNITY COLLABORATION, AND HSOR'S AND THE CORPORATION'S ALIGNED GOALS OF SCHOOL READINESS AND K-12 SUCCESS PUT HSOR IN A POSITION TO EFFECTIVELY AND EFFICIENTLY SUPPORT THE FGP IN ROCKLAND COUNTY.

OGLALA LAKOTA COUNTY FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

"THEY ALWAYS SAY KNOWLEDGE IS WONDERFUL, BUT WITHOUT EXPERIENCE, IT HAS NO MEANING OR FEELING TO IT.  SO CHILDREN SEE OUR PRACTICES FROM THE TIME THEY'RE LITTLE.  THEY WATCH, AND OFTEN THEY EXPERIENCE WHAT THEY SEE IN ORDER TO DEVELOP UNDERSTANDING." --ALBERT WHITE HAT, "ZUYA:  LIFE'S JOURNEY" (2102)

     OGLALA LAKOTA COUNTY IN SOUTHWESTERN SOUTH DAKOTA INCLUDES MOST OF THE PINE RIDGE INDIAN RESERVATION.  OUR COUNTY HAS THE THIRD LOWEST LIFE EXPECTANCY OF ANY COUNTY IN THE UNITED STATES.  OUR PER CAPITA INCOME IS USUALLY IN THE BOTTOM TEN COUNTIES IN THE UNITED STATES.  OUR RESERVATION IS LARGE AND IS GEOGRAPHICALLY REMOTE FROM LARGER URBAN AREAS.
     IN TRADITIONAL LAKOTA LIFE, THE IDEAL OF THE IKCE WICASA, THE COMMON MAN, WAS THE FOUNDATION OF LAKOTA LIFE.  PEOPLE WERE EXPECTED TO LIVE IN A HUMBLE, SELF EFFACING AND GENEROUS HEARTED MANNER, LOOKING OUT FOR THE WELFARE OF THE MOST DISADVANTAGED PEOPLE IN THE BAND--ORPHANS AND THE ELDERLY.  BECAUSE OF THIS HIGHLY DEVELOPED KINSHIP SYSTEM, MID NINETEENTH CENTURY LAKOTA PEOPLE WERE FELT BY SOME TO BE THE HEALTHIEST PEOPLE ON EARTH, AND NOT JUST BECAUSE OF HAVING HORSES TO HUNT AMPLE HERDS OF BUFFALO.  AN OGLALA LAKOTA PERSON WAS CONFIDENT THAT DESPITE REVERSES IN HER FORTUNES, SHE WOULD BE TAKEN CARE OF BY LOVING, CONCERNED RELATIVES. 
     THE COVID 19 PANDEMIC HIT PINE RIDGE RESERVATION ESPECIALLY HARD, AS THE OGLALA SIOUX TRIBE AND OUR SCHOOLS AND HEAD STARTS WENT TO EXTRAORDINARY MEASRUES TO PROTECT OUR ELDERS, MANY OF THEM LIVING IN MULITGENERATION HOMES, MANY WITH A DOZEN OR MORE INHABITANTS. OUR SCHOOLS AND HEAD STARTS HAVE BEEN CLOSED TO FACE TO FACE LEARNING, AND ONLY RECENTLY, WITH THE COMMENCING OF A MASS VACCINATION PROGRAM ON THE RESERVATION, HAVE WE BEEN ABLE TO CONTEMPLATE A CAUTIOUS RESUMPTION OF FACE TO FACE LEARNING. A POSITIVE ASPECT OF THE PANDEMIC IS THAT LAKOTA PEOPLE HAVE GRASPED THE POTENTIAL OF DISTANCE SOCIALIZING.  IN LATE FEBRUARY, EXACTLY ONE HUNDRED ADULTS PARTICIPATED IN A ZOOM EXPERINECE WITH TRADITIONAL HEALER RICK TWO DOGS (QUOTED LATER IN OUR NARRAITIVE) WHO TOLD THE ORIGIN OF HIS FAMILY'S NAME.

 AS MOST OF OUR ELDERS HAVE BEEN VACCINATED IN THE PAST TWO MONTSH, WE ARE ALSO ABLE TO CONTEMPLATE A CAUTIOUS RESUPMTION OF OUR FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM. DESPITE LOSING THE PAST YEAR, WE BELIEVE THERE HAS NEVER BEEN A BETTER OPPORTUNITY TO HELP OUR FAMILIES THAN AT THIS TIME OF SUPREME CRISIS FOR THE OGLALA SIOUX TRIBE.  DURING THIS PAST YEAR WE HAVE REHOUGHT OUR PROJECT WHICH WILL CONSIST OF DISTANCE LEARNING, BOTH VIDEOS PRODUCED BY OUR FOSTER GRANDPARENTS AND ON-LINE INTERACTION, IN ORDER TO EFFECT OUR GOALS OF SCHOOL READINESS AND LITERACY.  BY THE END OF THIS THIRD YEAR OF THE PROJECT WE WILL HAVE FIFTEEN FOSTER GRANDPARENTS USING I PADS TO MENTOR AND READ TO SCHOOL CHILDREN AND TO PRODUCE VIDEOS.
     THE SPONSORING NON PROFIT CORPORATION WACANTE KIYAPI (HELPING WITH A GOOD HEART) IS BASED IN OGLALA LAKOTA COUNTY AND HAS A TWENTY ONE YEAR TRACK RECORD OF SUCCESSFUL PROJECTS WHICH PROMOTE HEALTH AND WELLNESS IN OUR LAKOTA COMMUNITIES.  PROJECT DIRECTOR MARK BUTTERBRODT, MD, HAS BEEN A MEMBER OF THE OGLALA SIOUX TRIBE COVID 19 MEDICAL TASK FORCE SINCE ITS INCEPTION IN MARCH OR 2020 AND WILL WORK WITH THE MEDICAL TASK FORCE TO ENSURE THAT OUR RECONFIGURED FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IS CONSISTENT WITH CDC AND TRIBAL HEALTH GUIDELINES.

THE SENIOR ACTION, INC. FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) COVERS 37 VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS (VSYS) AT 1044 HOURS PER YEAR.  AN ESTIMATED 39 AMERICORPS SENIORS FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. DOUGLASS COMMUNITY SERVICES (DCS) IS LOCATED IN NORTHEAST MISSOURI AND SERVES THE COUNTIES OF LEWIS, MACON, MARION, MONROE, PIKE, RALLS, RANDOLPH, AND SHELBY. THE TOTAL GEOGRAPHIC AREA COVERED BY DCS IS 4,520 SQUARE MILES, WITH A TOTAL POPULATION OF 122,974. THE DCS SERVICE AREA IS PRIMARILY RURAL WITH THE LARGEST CITY BEING HANNIBAL, IN MARION/RALLS COUNTY WITH A POPULATION OF 28,858. THIS GRANT WOULD INCLUDE CLARK COUNTY, MO INTO THE DCS SERVICE AREA (POPULATION: 6,860)

THE AVERAGE FAMILY INCOME LEVEL FOR THE SERVICE AREA OF THIS GRANT IS $63,212, ABOUT $17,000 LESS THAN THE STATE AVERAGE. EDUCATION, SOCIAL SERVICES, AND HEALTH CARE EMPLOY THE GREATEST PERCENTAGE OF WORKING PEOPLE WHO ARE 16 YEARS AND OLDER. THESE OCCUPATIONS ARE FOLLOWED CLOSELY BY MANUFACTURING AND RETAIL TRADE INDUSTRIES. ALTHOUGH THE AREA HAS HISTORICALLY BEEN ACCEPTED AS HAVING AN AGRICULTURAL ECONOMIC BASE, SHELBY COUNTY IS NOW THE ONLY COUNTY WITH A SIGNIFICANT PERCENTAGE OF EMPLOYMENT IN AGRICULTURE. 

DOUGLASS COMMUNITY SERVICES IS GOVERNED BY A 15-MEMBER BOARD OF DIRECTORS WITH REPRESENTATION FROM THE FINANCIAL, EDUCATION, HEALTH, AND BUSINESS SECTORS, AS WELL AS REPRESENTATIVES FROM THE FIVE MAJOR DCS PROGRAMS.  THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS MEETS REGULARLY IN HANNIBAL, MO AND REPRESENTS THE GEOGRAPHIC AREA SERVED.  DOUGLASS HAS A NEGOTIATED INDIRECT COST RATE OF 11.7%.

 A PRIVATE, NON-PROFIT, DOUGLASS COMMUNITY SERVICES HAS BEEN PROVIDING SOCIAL SERVICES SINCE 1969.  THE ORGANIZATION SPONSORS HEAD START/EARLY HEAD START, RSVP, A THRIFT STORE, A FOOD PANTRY, COURT APPOINTED SPECIAL ADVOCATES, AND A PRE-EMPLOYMENT PROGRAMS FOR AT-RISK TEENS.  DOUGLASS COMMUNITY SERVICES EMPLOYS APPROXIMATELY 225 PERSONS THROUGHOUT NORTHEAST MISSOURI.

AN ESTIMATED 42 VSY WILL BE COMPLETED BY DOUGLASS COMMUNITY SERVICES? FOSTER GRANDPARENTS.  OF THIS NUMBER, APPROXIMATELY 10 VYS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS WITH HEAD START CENTERS.  THEIR ACTIVITIES INCLUDE WORKING WITH LOW-INCOME CHILDREN WHO ARE BEHIND THEIR CONTEMPORARIES IN READING (LANGUAGE SKILLS) AND MATH (NUMBER RECOGNITION).  OF THE  REMAINING VSY, 20 WILL WORK WITH SCHOOL-AGE YOUTH ON ACADEMIC SUCCESS MEASURERS.  AN ADDITIONAL 3 VSYS ARE COMMITTED TO MENTORING YOUTH IN WORK FORCE DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMS. BI-COUNTY SERVICE, INC. WAS FORMED UNDER THE STATUTES OF THE STATE OF MISSOURI IN 1984 AS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION TO SPONSOR THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROJECT THAT NOW SERVES THE COUNTIES OF JOHNSON, LAFAYETTE, PETTIS, RAY AND SALINE IN WEST CENTRAL MISSOURI. BI-COUNTY SERVICE, INC.  FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROJECT RECOGNIZES THAT THE INTRINSIC BOND BETWEEN SENIOR ADULT VOLUNTEERS AND CHILDREN YIELDS IMPRESSIVE RESULTS IN VOLUNTEER STATIONS FROM PRESCHOOL TO HIGH SCHOOL, AND EVEN INTO COLLEGE THROUGH OUR PARTNERSHIP WITH THE UNIVERSITY OF CENTRAL MISSOURI'S CHILD CARE CENTER. FIFTY-FIVE AMERICORPS SENIORS FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THIRTY-TWO VOLUNTEER STATIONS ACROSS THE FIVE-COUNTY SERVICE AREA. OF THAT NUMBER FORTY-TWO FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE ASSISTING CHILDREN WITH READING PROFICIENCY, WORKING ON LITERACY AND NUMERACY SKILLS FOR HEAD START AND PRE-SCHOOL CHILDREN, HELPING CHILDREN WITH BASIC KNOWLEDGE I.E. SIMPLE SHAPES, COLORS AND SIGHT WORDS, SUPPORTING CHILDREN WITH SELF-HELP SKILLS SUCH AS PROPER TABLE ETIQUETTE, PERSONAL HYGIENE AND TOILETING, AND PERHAPS MOST IMPORTANTLY, BEING A TRUSTED AND CARING ADULT ROLE MODEL.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR THE BI-COUNTY SERVICE, INC. AMERICORPS SENIORS FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IS EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE POSITIVELY IMPACTED THE LIVES OF OVER 400 CHILDREN THROUGH THEIR SERVICE. ADDITIONALLY, THE VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE BENEFITED FROM THE ACTIVITY AND CAMARADERIE RESULTING FROM THEIR VOLUNTEER SERVICE.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $310,179.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $47,392.00 OF LOCALLY GENERATED FUNDS AND IN-KIND MATCH. THE NEED FOR MATURE, NURTURING ADULT VOLUNTEERS TO ASSIST CHILDREN IN REALIZING THEIR ACADEMIC POTENTIAL HAS NEVER BEEN GREATER. STANDARDIZED ACADEMIC TEST SCORES ACROSS THE PROJECT'S SERVICE AREA REVEAL SIGNIFICANT DEFICITS IN SOME DISTRICTS AND ARE PROBLEMATIC AT BEST IN OTHER DISTRICTS.  THE NEED IS CLEAR AND THE LARGER BODY OF DATA PROMPTS OUR PROJECT TO ADDRESS THIS UBIQUITOUS COMMUNITY NEED THROUGH A CONCENTRATION OF VOLUNTEER EFFORTS IN THE AREAS OF ELEMENTARY EDUCATION AND SCHOOL PREPAREDNESS. THE PROJECT'S RESEARCH, AND CONVENTIONAL WISDOM DEMONSTRATES THAT THE CRITICAL TIME TO ADDRESS INTELLECTUAL CHALLENGES IS THE EARLY, FORMATIVE YEARS. CHILDREN PAIRED WITH AN AMERICORPS SENIORS FOSTER GRANDPARENT, ALMOST WITHOUT EXCEPTION, PROMOTE TO THE NEXT GRADE LEVEL, BUILD AND SUPPORT STRONGER INTERPERSONAL RELATIONSHIPS, AND PERFORM BETTER IN THE CLASSROOM. IT IS CLEAR THAT AMERICORPS SENIORS FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS NURTURE THE PROMISE OF FUTURE GENERATIONS.

LINC ST. CHARLES COUNTY NON-PROFIT AGENCY ESTABLISHED 1995 WILL BE THE LEAD AGENCY. LINC APPLIED FOR THE RELINQUISHED PROGRAM THAT EXISTED IN AREA FOR OVER 23 YEARS IN 2018.  AN ESTIMATED 32-40 AMERICORPS SENIOR VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE, AND 32 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN MEASURABLE OUTCOMES.  AMERICORPS SENIORS FEDERAL AMOUNT REQUEST IS $204,876 AND WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $20,488 AT 10 PERCENT OF NON-FEDERAL MATCH THROUGH COMMUNITY AND SPONSOR SUPPORT. PRIMARY FOCUS AREA WILL BE EDUCATION. ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE COVID-19 OPTIONS IN FIRST YEAR AND ANTICIPATE FULL-SERVICE TUTORING AND MENTORING BY 2ND AND 3RD YEAR. OBJECTIVES WILL BE K-12 SUCCESS, AND SCHOOL READINESS. VIRTUAL TUTORING/MENTORING WILL BE AVAILABLE AS VOLUNTEERS HAVE NOW BEEN TRAINED OVERCOME THE CHALLENGES OF THE PANDEMIC. SIX SCHOOL DISTRICTS WILL BE PROVIDED SERVICE THROUGH AMERICORPS VOLUNTEERS. CURRENTLY PARTNERED WITH 17 ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS, AND 6 HEAD START AND DAYCARE'S.  PROJECTS HAVE BEEN DEVELOPED THROUGH THESE PARTNERS TO PROVIDE SERVICE THROUGH COVID-19 PANDEMIC UNTIL SCHOOLS ARE OPEN TO VOLUNTEERS AND THE VACCINE IS DISTRIBUTED THROUGHOUT TO ASSURE SAFETY FOR ALL. VOLUNTEERS ARE EAGER TO GET BACK TO PROVIDING FULL SERVICE TO OUR COMMUNITY CHILDREN AS OUR SCHOOLS ARE LOOKING FORWARD TO HAVING THEM BACK IN THE SCHOOLS AND HEAD STARTS. UNTIL THEN VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE A VARIETY OF SERVICE TO OUR SCHOOLS AND SITES, THAT HAVE BEEN ASSESSED THROUGH THE COMMUNITY NEED FEEDBACK. WORK-PLANS ARE STILL BEING ALIGNED WITH THE AMERICORPS GUIDANCE AND WILL CONTINUE TO WORK WITH OUR STATIONS TO PROVIDE THE CURRENT NEEDS AND COLLABORATE PROJECTS THAT WILL BE BENEFICIAL TO OUR CHILDREN. 
SOME DATA WAS NOT COLLECTED DUE TO PANDEMIC TO REFLECT FINAL NUMBERS IN WORK PLANS. AS OUR AREA IS OPENING UP AND VACCINES BEING DISTRIBUTED THE AREAS IN SOME OF THE WORK-PLANS WILL BE UPDATED TO SHOW ACTUAL RESULTS.

AN ESTIMATED 31 AMERICORPS SENIORS FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 31 AMERICORPS SENIORS VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PROVIDING SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL SUPPORT AND TUTORING.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 10 CHILDREN WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS AND 26 CHILDREN WILL SHOW IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE. THE AMERICORPS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $204,140 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $57,048 ANTICIPATED LEVEL OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

AN ESTIMATED 48 AMERICORPS SENIORS FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER 42 AMERICORPS SENIORS VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE MENTORING AND TUTORING K-12 ELEMENTARY STUDENTS AND PROVIDING SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL SUPPORT FOR PRE-K AND HEAD START CHILDREN. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, OUTCOMES WILL MEASURE THE NUMBER OF STUDENTS WITH IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE AND THE NUMBER OF CHILDREN WHO DEMONSTRATED GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS. THE AMERICORPS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $262,357 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $31,278 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

THE PAOLA ASSOCIATION FOR CHURCH ACTION, INC. (PACA) SPONSORS THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM OF MIAMI, LINN, FRANKLIN AND JOHNSON COUNTIES IN THE STATE OF KANSAS.  IT IS OUR MISSION TO PROVIDE ELIGIBLE, LOW-INCOME, OLDER AMERICANS (55 YEARS AND UP) THE OPPORTUNITY TO VOLUNTEER WITH "AT RISK" CHILDREN/YOUTH AND "SPECIAL NEEDS" CHILDREN/YOUTH.  IT IS THE TARGET OF THIS PROGRAM TO FOCUS PRIMARILY IN THE AREA OF ACADEMICS, I.E., LITERACY AND MATH, WHILE AT THE SAME TIME TAKE THE OPPORTUNITY TO BUILD A MEANINGFUL RELATIONSHIP WITH THOSE WITH WHOM THEY VOLUNTEER.  THE TOOLS THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS USE ARE PRAISE, MOTIVATION AND ENCOURAGEMENT.  THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS USE THIS TO ASSIST CHILDREN AND YOUTH TO STRIVE AND ACHIEVE THE GOALS THEY HAVE AND TO REACH THEIR FULL POTENTIAL AT AN AGE APPROPRIATE LEVEL.
PACA IS REQUESTING $305,716 TO SUPPORT 48 VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS.  WITH THE 48 VSY THE SERVICE CATEGORIES OF INTELLECTUAL DISABILITY (FORMERLY MENTAL RETARDATION), ELEMENTARY EDUCATION, HEAD START SCHOOL PREPAREDNESS, HEALTHY LIFESTYLES AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES WILL BE ADDRESSED.  THE NEED IS GREAT FOR THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS TO WORK WITH THE MENTALLY CHALLENGED TO KEEP THEM FOCUSED ALONG WITH HELPING THEM MAKE STRIDES IN THEIR EVERYDAY LIVES.  THE NEED IS ALSO GREAT FOR THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS TO PREPARE THE CHILDREN BEFORE BEGINNING KINDERGARTEN, CONTINUE WITH THEM THROUGH THEIR ELEMENTARY EDUCATION TO MAKE SURE THEY RECEIVE A HIGH SCHOOL DIPLOMA AND/OR GED.  A NEWLY DEVELOPED CHILD TREATMENT PLAN WILL HELP US IDENTIFY THOSE THAT ARE BEING SERVED AND THE PROGRESS THEY HAVE MADE BY HAVING A FOSTER GRANDPARENT ASSIST WITH THEIR NEEDS.  PROGRAM EVALUATIONS DONE BY SITE STAFF, ADVISORY COUNCIL MEMBERS AND MEMBERS OF PACA ALONG WITH CONTINUED EDUCATION AND RESEARCH WILL HELP US DETERMINE THE CONTINUED NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY AND ANY AREAS THAT WE NEED TO IMPROVE OR CHANGE SO THAT WE CAN CONTINUE TO REACH THE OUTCOMES THAT WE HAVE SET FORTH IN OUR WORK PLANS.  AT THE SAME TIME, ALL OF THE COMMUNITY IS INCLUDED IN THE OUTCOMES OF THE PROGRAM IN THE SUCCESS OF THE CHILDREN AND THE USE OF THE MOST PROLIFIC EXPERIENCE IN OLDER PEOPLE.

IN 2021, AN ESTIMATED 71 FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. THIS NUMBER IS REDUCED FROM LAST YEAR'S 95 DUE TO COVID-19. OF THIS NUMBER, ALL FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. THE REALITIES OF THE PANDEMIC MEAN THEIR ASSIGNMENTS WILL LOOK DIFFERENT THIS GRANT YEAR, AND WE ARE CURRENTLY WORKING WITH SCHOOLS TO CONTINUE DEVELOPING PLANS THAT WILL KEEP STUDENTS AND FGPS SAFE WHILE ALLOWING THE PROGRAM TO CONTINUE SERVING ALL INVOLVED. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES THIS YEAR WILL INCLUDE: SERVING IN DAYCARES, MENTORING, AND OTHER CLASSROOM SUPPORT VIA DISTANCED LEARNING, PEN-PAL LETTER WRITING, AND RECORDING THE VOLUNTEERS READING BOOKS FOR THE STUDENTS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. AT THE END OF GRANT PERIOD, THE NUMBER OF CHILDREN DEMONSTRATING GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS WILL BE INCREASED, AS WILL THE NUMBER OF K-12 STUDENTS WITH IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE. 
CATHOLIC CHARITIES OF NORTHEAST KANSAS (CCNEK), SPONSOR OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM OF WYANDOTTE COUNTY/KCK (FGP), IS A HUMAN SERVICE NON-PROFIT PROVIDING A WIDE RANGE OF PROGRAMS AND SERVICES TO THE 21 COUNTIES OF NORTHEAST KANSAS. CCNEK'S VISION IS TO BE A PLACE WHERE "OUR NEIGHBORS WHO ARE CHALLENGED BY POVERTY OF MIND, BODY AND SPIRIT, FIND THE OPEN DOOR OF CATHOLIC CHARITIES AND ARE MET WITH HELP, HOSPITALITY, AND HOPE," AND THE ORGANIZATIONAL MISSION IS "AS A FAITH-BASED ORGANIZATION, WE ARE INSPIRED BY GOD'S LOVE AND COMPASSION TO PROVIDE UNCONDITIONAL LOVE AND NECESSARY HELP TO PEOPLE OF ALL FAITHS BY STABILIZING AND STRENGTHENING INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES IN NEED ACROSS THE 21 COUNTIES OF NORTHEAST KANSAS."  FGP IS INSTRUMENTAL IN THIS VISION AND MISSION, PROVIDING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AND CASE MANAGEMENT TO OLDER ADULTS IN THE COMMUNITY AND EMPOWERING THEM TO BE VITAL MENTORS TO THOSE MOST IN NEED.
FGP WILL UTILIZE THE VOLUNTEER ASSIGNMENT PLAN (VAP) REPORTING TOOL. THE TOOL ALLOWS THE PROGRAM TO COLLECT DATA NEEDED FOR BIANNUAL REPORTING. THE VAP REPORT FORM IS SENT AT THE BEGINNING OF THE SCHOOL YEAR TO HELP TEACHERS MAP OUT A PLAN WITH THEIR FOSTER GRANDPARENTS FOR THE SCHOOL YEAR/SEMESTERS. WITH THE VAP, THE TEACHER WILL IDENTIFY THE STUDENTS WITH WHOM THE FGP WILL BE WORKING AND THE GOALS TO BE ACCOMPLISHED. THE TEACHER WILL USE THE VAP TO IDENTIFY FOCUS AREAS IN WHICH THE STUDENTS MAY NEED IMPROVEMENT, SUCH AS: VOCABULARY, READING, ABILITY TO RETELL A STORY, ETC. THE FORMS ARE SENT BACK TO THE TEACHERS AT THE END OF THE SEMESTER TO DETERMINE IF THE STUDENTS MET THE STATED GOAL(S).
IN FY2020, THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM OF WYANDOTTE COUNTY, LIKE PROGRAMS ALL AROUND THE COUNTRY, EXPERIENCED CHALLENGES DUE TO COVID-19. AS OUR SEMI-ANNUAL REPORT DEMONSTRATED, OUR OUTCOME NUMBERS WERE SIGNIFICANTLY IMPACTED WHEN WYANDOTTE COUNTY SCHOOLS CLOSED AND FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WERE UNABLE TO FULFILL THEIR DUTIES AS DESCRIBED IN LAST YEAR'S GRANT APPLICATION. WE HAVE WORKED HARD TO SUPPORT OUR FOSTER GRANDPARENTS AND FIND MEANINGFUL AND SAFE WAYS FOR THEM TO CONTRIBUTE TO OUR COMMUNITY, AND WE ARE GRATEFUL FOR THE SUPPORT OF AMERICORPS OVER THE PAST DIFFICULT MONTHS. FOR FY2021, WE HAVE DEVISED COVID-SAFE ROLES FOR MANY OF OUR FOSTER GRANDPARENTS, INCLUDING DISTANCED LEARNING, PEN PAL ACTIVITIES, AND DAY CARE PLACEMENTS.

KANSAS NEUROLOGICAL INSTITUTE (KNI), SPONSOR OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM OF NORTHEAST KANSAS, IS A STATE SUPPORTED RESIDENTIAL AND RESOURCE CENTER SERVING PERSONS WITH INTELLECTUAL AND DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES. KNI OPERATES ON A PERSON-CENTERED PHILOSOPHY. THE MISSION IS TO SUPPORT EACH PERSON TO HAVE A MEANINGFUL LIFE.

KNI IS REQUESTING $450,450 TO SUPPORT 67 VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS, AND THIS INVESTMENT IS TO BE SUPPLEMENTED BY AT LEAST $113,075 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

IN THE TWELVE-COUNTY SERVICE AREA, THE NATIONAL PERFORMANCE MEASURES OF SCHOOL READINESS (ED1A) WILL BE ADDRESSED AT HEAD STARTS AND PRESCHOOLS. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD, 90% OF STUDENTS SERVED BY FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL MEET THE OUTCOME OF ED27C, HAVING INCREASED THEIR SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT TO MOVE ON THE NEXT LEVEL. FOR EXAMPLE, FOR FIVE-YEAR-OLDS, THAT WOULD BE TO ENTER KINDERGARTEN. FOR THOSE IN ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS, THE K-12 SUCCESS OUTPUT OF ED1A WILL DEMONSTRATE THAT 70% OF THE NUMBER OF STUDENTS SERVED BY FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL HAVE AN OUTCOME (ED27C) THAT WILL SHOW IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT OR SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL SKILLS AS REPORTED ON ANNUAL EVALUATIONS BY SCHOOL OFFICIALS.

A WAIVER WAS GRANTED TO ALLOW FOSTER GRANDPARENTS TO CONTINUE TO SERVE PERSONS WITH DEVELOPMENTAL AND INTELLECTUAL DISABILITIES WHO LIVE AT KNI AND HAVE HAD THE BENEFIT OF FOSTER GRANDPARENT RELATIONSHIPS FOR 54 YEARS. PROGRAM OUTPUTS INCLUDE H4A. THIS PROGRAM WILL CONTINUE TO PROMOTE INTEGRATION AND INCLUSION OF PERSONS WITH INTELLECTUAL AND DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES (H15A).

ACTION RESOURCES INTERNATIONAL (ARI) WILL CONTINUE TO SERVE AS THE SPONSORING ORGANIZATION FOR FOSTER GRANDPARENTS OF THE WYOMING ROCKIES WHICH IS CURRENTLY OPERATES IN SEVEN WYOMING COUNTIES COVERING AN AREA OF JUST UNDER 36,OOO SQUARE MILES: ALBANY, CARBON, SWEETWATER, UINTA, LINCOLN, SHERIDAN AND JOHNSON.  FOCUS WILL CONTINUE IN THE AREA OF COMMUNITY STRENGTHENING ACTIVITIES OF K-12 SUCCESS AND SCHOOL READINESS, WITH A SMALL PERCENTAGE OF COMPLEMENTARY ACTIVITIES IN CHILD SAFETY, WELFARE AND HEALTH.  ARI WILL AGAIN PROVIDE INFRASTRUCTURE SUPPORT AND PROGRAM MANAGEMENT OVERSIGHT INCLUDING A COMMUNITY LED ADVISORY COUNCIL; A HOME BASE, OFFICE SPACE AND MATERIALS SUPPORT; AND FISCAL, PERSONNEL AND PROGRAMMATIC RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE PROGRAM.  
ARI INCORPORATED IN 1991 AND WAS GRANTED FEDERAL 501(C)(3) TAX EXEMPT STATUS IN 1995, WITH THE OVERARCHING MISSION TO ERADICATE AND PREVENT CHILD SEXUAL ABUSE.  IN CARRYING OUT THIS MISSION, THE ORGANIZATION SPONSORS AND CONDUCTS PROGRAMS TO HELP ACHIEVE OVERALL HEALTH, SAFETY AND SECURITY IN FAMILIES AND COMMUNITIES THROUGH VARIOUS COOPERATIVE AND COLLABORATIVE EFFORTS THAT ARE ACTION ORIENTED, COMMUNITY BASED AND DRIVEN BY INDIVIDUALS WHOSE EXPERTISE IS PRIMARILY INFORMED BY PERSONAL EXPERIENCE WITH THE PROBLEMS BEING ADDRESSED, BACKED BY AN UNDERSTANDING OF THE SOCIAL CONTEXT IN WHICH THAT EXPERIENCE WAS CREATED.
     AN ESTIMATED 42 AMERICORPS SENIORS FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THESE, 33 WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME-BASED ASSIGNMENTS. THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS OF SOUTH EAST IDAHO SUBMITS THIS PROPOSAL TO THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS) TO PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS OF SOUTH EAST IDAHO PROGRAM.  THE PROGRAM INVOLVES SENIOR CITIZENS AGE 55 AND OLDER VOLUNTEERING IN SCHOOLS AND EDUCATIONAL FACILITIES WORKING WITH DISADVANTAGED CHILDREN TO HELP THEM REACH THEIR FULL POTENTIAL.  OUR MOTTO IS SHARE TODAY SHAPE TOMORROW.

FOSTER GRANDPARENT?S IS AN IMPORTANT PROGRAM IN SOUTH EAST IDAHO COMMUNITIES. ACCORDING TO IDAHO?S 2017 HIGHLIGHTS REPORT, IDAHO FINISHES 48TH AMONG THE 50 STATES AND THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA FOR EDUCATION OVER- ALL AND 49TH IN THE NATION FOR GRADUATION RATES. DIVING INTO THE FINDINGS FOR THE THREE GRADED INDICES, IDAHO EARNS A C IN THE CHANCE-FOR-SUCCESS CATEGORY AND RANKS 38TH. THE AVERAGE STATE EARNS A C-PLUS. IN SCHOOL FINANCE, IDAHO RECEIVES AN F AND RANKS 49TH. FOR THE K-12 ACHIEVEMENT INDEX, LAST UPDATED IN THE 2016 REPORT, IT FINISHES 31ST WITH A GRADE OF D-PLUS. THE AVERAGE STATE EARNS GRADES OF C AND C-MINUS IN SCHOOL FINANCE AND K-12 ACHIEVEMENT, RESPECTIVELY.  THE 2017 KIDS COUNT PROFILE FOUND THAT 64 PERCENT OF FOURTH GRADERS ARE NOT PROFICIENT IN READING, AND 66 PERCENT ARE NOT PROFICIENT IN MATH. POVERTY IS ANOTHER OBSTACLE FOR IDAHO?S CHILDREN ACCORDING TO THE 2017 KIDS COUNT PROFILE, 76,000 CHILDREN LIVE IN POVERTY, AND SIX PERCENT OF THOSE CHILDREN LIVE IN HIGH POVERTY AREAS. 25 PERCENT OF PARENTS LACK SECURE EMPLOYMENT. THE ODDS ARE STACKED AGAINST THESE CHILDREN HOWEVER, EDUCATIONAL FACILITIES WITH A FOSTER GRANDPARENTS SERVING IN THEM CAN HELP CHILDREN OVERCOME THESE OBSTACLES. FOSTER GRANDPARENTS BETTER EQUIP CHILDREN FOR THE FUTURE, AND SHOW AT-RISK YOUTH A BETTER WAY OF LIFE.

?WE HAVE AN OPPORTUNITY AND AN OBLIGATION TO USE EVERY RESOURCE AT OUR DISPOSAL TO FIGHT SOCIETY?S MOST INTRACTABLE AND RELENTLESS CHALLENGES. BY UTILIZING THE TALENTS OF OLDER ADULTS AND INVESTING IN INTERGENERATIONAL SOLUTIONS, WE CAN MAKE OUR WORLD A BETTER PLACE. THE DATA OVERWHELMINGLY SHOWS THAT WHEN WE ENGAGE SENIORS AND YOUNG PEOPLE AROUND A SPECIFIC OUTCOME MEASURE, GOOD THINGS HAPPEN?. (FORBES, 2016) 

A 2016 STUDY BY STANFORD UNIVERSITY HAS SHOWN THAT OLDER PEOPLE ARE UNIQUELY SKILLED IN CREATING CLOSE RELATIONSHIPS, ESPECIALLY WITH CHILDREN. ADDITIONALLY, THE AMERICAN JOURNAL OF ORTHOPSYCHIATRY HAS PROVEN THAT CHILDREN WITH AN OLDER ADULT IN THEIR LIVES ARE LESS LIKELY TO HAVE BEHAVIORAL OR PSYCHIATRIC PROBLEMS. CHILDREN LEARN BETTER FROM OLDER ADULTS.

AARP CREATED THE AARP EXPERIENCE CORPS, WHICH LIKE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS PAIRS YOUTH WITH SENIOR VOLUNTEERS SOUGHT TO CREATE A PROGRAM TO IMPROVE THE READING SKILLS OF CHILDREN FROM IMPOVERISHED NEIGHBORHOODS. STUDENTS WORKING WITH EXPERIENCE CORPS MEMBERS HAVE SHOWN 60% GAINS IN CRITICAL LITERACY SKILLS COMPARED TO THOSE WITHOUT ACCESS TO THESE OLDER VOLUNTEERS, AND THE BOOST IN THEIR READING SKILLS IS EQUIVALENT TO PLACING THEM IN CLASSROOMS WITH 40% FEWER STUDENTS, ACCORDING TO RESEARCHERS FROM WASHINGTON UNIVERSITY IN ST. LOUIS.

VOLUNTEERS OF AMERICA (VOA) IS A NATIONAL, NONPROFIT, FAITH-BASED ORGANIZATION DEDICATED TO SERVING THE BASIC NEEDS OF THE MOST VULNERABLE INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES IN THE COMMUNITY. VOA COLORADO BRANCH HAS SPONSORED THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM SINCE 1974. THE VOA DENVER AREA FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) SERVES SEVEN FRONT RANGE COUNTIES IN COLORADO. AN ESTIMATED 90 DENVER AREA FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS (FGVS) WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 81 FGVS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. ALL VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF EDUCATION. THEIR NATIONAL PERFORMANCE MEASURES FOCUS AREA OBJECTIVES WILL INCLUDE SCHOOL READINESS, K-12 SUCCESS, AND OTHER EDUCATION. IN THE SCHOOL READINESS AREA ACTIVITIES WILL BE DETERMINED BY EACH CHILD'S TEACHER, SUCH AS GAMES, MUSIC AND VARIOUS SOCIAL SKILLS, AND K-12 SUCCESS ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE LISTENING TO CHILDREN READ, HELPING WITH PRONUNCIATION, AND PHONEMIC AWARENESS. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT OUR ANTICIPATED OUTCOME FOR SCHOOL READINESS OF THE 124 CHILDREN SERVED ONE-ON-ON BY 31 VOLUNTEERS, 60% OR 74 OF CHILDREN 3-4 YEARS OLD WILL DEMONSTRATE AGE APPROPRIATE SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL SKILLS TO BE READY AND PREPARED TO ENTER THE NEXT LEVEL OF PRESCHOOL OR KINDERGARTEN. FIFTY FGVS SERVING IN THE K-12 SUCCESS OBJECTIVE WILL PROVIDE 200 STUDENTS ONE-ON-ONE TUTORING TO PROMOTE STUDENTS' IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY BY 80%, OR 160, OF THE STUDENTS TUTORED.  NORTHERN KENTUCKY COMMUNITY ACTION COMMISSION (NKCAC) WILL MATCH FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) VOLUNTEERS WITH CHILDREN AGED 3-5 ENROLLED IN HEAD START (HS) PROGRAMS OPERATED BY NKCAC. INDIANA STATE DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH DECLARED A PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCY IN MARION COUNTY ON MARCH 6, 2020. MARCH 16TH MARKED THE CLOSING OF PUBLIC AND TOWNSHIP SCHOOLS AND VIRTUAL INSTRUCTION WAS IMPLEMENTED. THE ASSUMPTION WAS ALL SCHOOLS, STUDENTS AND PARENTS COULD MAKE THE TRANSITION TO 100% VIRTUAL LEARNING AND TEACHING. STUDENTS HAVE EXPERIENCED SIGNIFICANT LEARNING LOSS IN BOTH ENGLISH, LANGUAGE ARTS, AND MATH ACCORDING TO MCKINSEY AND COMPANY. BLACK, AND LATINO COMMUNITIES ARE SUFFERING MOST FROM THE HEALTH AND ECONOMIC IMPACTS OF THE PANDEMIC. STUDENTS IN THESE GROUPS HAVE BEEN DOUBLY DISADVANTAGED BY DISTANCE LEARNING. 80% OF THE STUDENTS WE SERVE ARE LOW-INCOME STUDENTS WHO MAY NOT HAVE RELIABLE ACCESS TO COMPUTERS OR WI-FI, MAKING IT DIFFICULT TO ACCESS ONLINE INSTRUCTION. OTHERS HAVE LIMITED ADULT SUPPORT OR DO NOT HAVE APPROPRIATE CONDITIONS FOR LEARNING AT HOME, STRUGGLING WITH FOOD OR HOUSING INSECURITY. THE FGP PROGRAM WAS TREMENDOUSLY AFFECTED BY THE CLOSINGS. STUDENTS WILL BE INTENTIONALLY MATCHED WITH GRANDPARENTS WHO HAVE THE SKILLS IN MATH, READING AND LANGUAGE TO BRING STUDENTS TO GRADE LEVEL OR ABOVE. GRANDPARENTS WILL WORK WITH STUDENTS ACHIEVING HOMEWORK GOALS AND PROVIDE THAT IN-PERSON STIMULI THAT IS NEEDED.  
COVID HAS EXPOSED AN EVEN GREATER NEED FOR THE PROGRAM. IT IS ESTIMATED 89% OF STUDENTS HAVE SUFFERED FROM LEARNING LOSS AND THE BURDEN OF RECOVERY IS ON US. OUR PROGRAM CAN PROVIDE MUCH NEEDED ADDITIONAL ASSISTANCE.
SENIORS HERE IN MARION COUNTY, WHICH IS THE LARGEST COUNTY SERVE CHILDREN WITH LEARNING DISABILITIES, VISUALLY IMPAIRED, AND HELP STUDENTS WHO HAVE SPECIAL AND OR EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS. AN INTENSIVE SITE / GRANDPARENT MATCH IS DONE BY THE DIRECTOR OF THE PROGRAM TO ENSURE BEST POSSIBLE OUTCOMES

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IN SOUTH CENTRAL INDIANA WAS ESTABLISHED IN 1976 AT THE
MUSCATATUCK CENTER FOR THE DISABLED. FGP MOVED TO A CLASSROOM TUTORING/MENTORING PROGRAM IN
ABOUT 1975. THE FGP RECENTLY HIRED ITS 4TH DIRECTOR APRIL 17, 2017. THE SERVICE AREA COVERS 2,000 SQ.
MILES OVER 5-COUNTIES. THE PROGRAM SERVES ABOUT HALF THE SCHOOL SITES AND HEAD START CENTERS WITH 60
FG VOLUNTEERS.  FOR 32 YEARS FGP HAS SERVED 5 INDIANA COUNTIES, A 2,000 SQ. MILE AREA INCLUDING BARTHOLOMEW, BROWN, DECATUR, JACKSON AND JENNINGS.  WE WERE CURRENTLY ACTIVE IN 21 SCHOOL SITES AND 4 HEAD START CENTERS. 
UNTIL  3/13/2020 WHEN COVID 19 PANDEMIC CAUSED OUR FOSTER GRANDPARENTS TO LEAVE OUR SCHOOL SITES, WE HAD NO CHOICE BUT TO PLACE OUR VOLUNTEERS IN ASSIGNMENTS OTHER THAN IN CLASSROOMS, AS MANDATED BY SCHOOL DISTRICTS, SCHOOL BOARDS AND THE STATE OF INDIANA CDC.  UP TO MARCH 13TH, TEACHER-PROVIDED   PERFORMANCE SURVEYS CONSISTENTLY RATED THE QUALITY OF FGP OUTCOMES AND VOLUNTEER QUALITY " MOST VALUABLE AND APPRECIATED"  BY TEACHERS, PRINCIPALS AND THE COMMUNITIES WE SERVE.  WHILE SCHOOLS TEACHING WAS CARRIED ON REMOTELY,  IT HAS BEEN WELL DOCUMENTED THAT THERE ARE CRITICAL LEARNING GAPS, SOCIAL STRESSES AND REPORTEDLY LOWER THAN EXPECTED LEARNING ACHIEVEMENTS RELATED TO  REMOTE TEACHING PRACTICES, ISOLATION OF CHILDREN FROM THEIR SCHOOL ROUTINES AND PERSONAL CLASSROOM SUPPORTS AND A LACK OF AVAILABLE ADULTS TO HELP THEM WITH THEIR LEARNING AND KEEP THEM ON TRACK TO ACHIEVE.  IT HAS ALSO BEEN DOCUMENTED THAT DEPRESSION AMONG CHILDREN IS A SIGNIFICANT CONCERN, WITH MENTAL HEALTH  DISPLAYED IN INCREASING RISKY BEHAVIORS, DRUG AND ALCOHOL USE INCREASING AMONG MIDDLE SCHOOL STUDENTS AND AN ALARMING INCREASE IN SUICIDE.  STRESSES AT HOME BECAUSE OF WORSENING POVERTY, JOB LOSSES AND FAMILY DISCORD AND HEALTH ISSUES AFFECT CHILDREN  BECAUSE THEY HAVE NO VOICE OR FEW OUTLETS TO ADDRESS THEIR CONCERNS.  THERE ARE STILL CRITICAL LEARNING GAPS RELATED TO REMOTE LEARNING VERSUS 1:1.   
GRANT FUNDING FOR THE FINAL RENEWAL PERIOD JULY 1, 2020-JUNE 30, 2021 WILL FUEL A RE-BUILDING OF OUR RANKS (NEEDING TO BRING OUR VOLUNTEER GROUP UP TO 74 OR MORE GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS AND
WORKING TO DIVERSIFY SERVICE SITES WHILE EXPANDING THE VISIBILITY OF OUR FOSTER GRANDPARENTS.  BASED ON COMMUNITY NEEDS SURVEYS CONDUCTED RECENTLY IN OUR FIVE-COUNTY AREA (BARTHOLOMEW, BROWN, DECATUR, JACKSON AND JENNINGS COUNTIES) WE WILL STRENGTHEN AND ALIGN FGP PERFORMANCE MEASURES AND ACTIVITIES TO BETTER SUPPORT THE NEEDS OF OUR SENIORS AND STUDENT ACADEMIC SUCCESS GOALS AS ARTICULATED BY OUR RURAL INDIANA COUNTIES. WE RECOGNIZE INCREASING POVERTY AND A SPECIFIC NEED FOR FOCUSED EDUCATION IN ACADEMICS AND THE LIFE SKILLS NEEDED FOR LIFE LONG SUCCESS.  COMMUNITIES SHARED WITH US THEIR CONCERNS ABOUT THE GROWING POVERTY IN THEIR COMMUNITIES AND AN ALARMING GROWTH IN THE NUMBER OF WORKING POOR. THEY EMPHASIZED THAT EFFECTIVE LIFE SKILLS EDUCATION, RECOGNIZING, BUILDING AND MAINTAINING RESILIENCE ALONG WITH EMPHASIS ON STUDENT PROFICIENCY AT OR ABOVE EVERY GRADE LEVEL ARE TWO KEY DETERMINANTS FOR THE ECONOMIC VITALITY OF THEIR COMMUNITIES. EDUCATION PREPARES WORKERS WHO ATTRACT JOBS AND FUND SERVICES WITH A HEALTHY AND SUSTAINABLE TAX BASE. ACROSS THE SERVICE AREA, COMMON CONCERNS AMONG ELDERLY RESIDENTS INCLUDED FINDING MEANINGFUL OPPORTUNITIES TO VOLUNTEER, TO LEARN NEW SKILLS, AND HAVE ACCESS TO PRODUCTIVE ACTIVITIES.  COMMUNITIES RECOGNIZED THE VALUE IN LEVERAGING AND ACKNOWLEDGING THE VALUABLE EXPERIENCE AND TALENTS OF THEIR ELDERLY WHO ARE BEST SERVED BY "AGING WELL AND IN-PLACE" FOR AS LONG AS THEY WANT. COMMUNITY PRIORITIES WILL DRIVE OUR CNCS PERFORMANCE MEASURES THAT ENSURE EVERY CHILD WILL BE PROFICIENT IN MATH, ENGLISH AND LANGUAGE ARTS AT OR ABOVE GRADE LEVEL.  WE WILL AGGRESSIVELY RECRUIT VOLUNTEERS TO EXPAND FROM 60 TO 74 VOLUNTEERS WITH TRAINING AND SKILLS IN TECHNOLOGY THAT WILL FUNCTIONALLY ASSIST STUDENTS WITH INCREASED CAPACITY AND CONFIDE

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
THE WESTERN ILLINOIS FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IS SPONSORED BY TRI-COUNTY OPPORTUNITIES COUNCIL (TCOC) A COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY.  AN ESTIMATED SEVENTY-TWO (72) AMERICORPS SENIORS FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE COUNTIES OF BUREAU, CARROLL, LASALLE, LEE, MARSHALL, OGLE, PUTNAM, STARK, AND WHITESIDE COUNTIES. OF THIS NUMBER APPROXIMATELY 72 AMERICORPS SENIORS VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PROVIDING ONE-ON-ONE MENTORING AND ACADEMIC SUPPORT TO CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL OR EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION: SCHOOL READINESS AND K-12 SUCCESS. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE OUTCOMES PROJECTED WILL SHOW NO LESS THAN 80% IMPROVEMENT IN EACH OF THE AREAS LISTED. TCOC ESTIMATES 720 CHILDREN WILL BE REACHED IN THIS 3-YEAR PERIOD. THE MISSION OF SOUTHWESTERN ILLINOIS COLLEGE (SWIC), THE GRANT APPLICANT, INCLUDES TO "SERVE, CONTRIBUTE, AND ENHANCE THE STRENGTH OF OUR COMMUNITIES" AND SHARES THE VALUE OF "LIFELONG LEARNING: THAT EDUCATION DOES NOT END WHEN A DEGREE IS EARNED AND THAT NOT ALL LEARNERS SEEK A DEGREE...[AND] WILL THEREFORE STRIVE TO CREATE A LEARNING COMMUNITY THAT IS OPEN-ENDED AND COMMITTED TO PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES FOR CONTINUOUS LEARNING." SWIC SEEKS TO CONTINUE SUPPORTING THE COMMUNITY IT SERVES BY APPLYING FOR FISCAL YEAR 2021 RENEWAL (YEAR 1 OF 3) OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) GRANT PROVIDED BY AMERICORPS SENIORS. IF GIVEN THE OPPORTUNITY TO BE AWARDED THIS RENEWAL GRANT, SWIC FGP WILL PLACE THE REQUESTED 46 VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS (VSY) IN SERVICE ACTIVITIES THAT WILL ASSIST CHILDREN WITH IDENTIFIED NEEDS IN ST. CLAIR, MONROE AND RANDOLPH COUNTIES IN SCHOOLS, HEAD STARTS, NOT-FOR-PROFIT DAYCARES, AND COMMUNITY CENTERS TO ASSIST THEM IN MAKING PROGRESS TOWARD THEIR INDIVIDUAL GOALS.  IN ALIGNMENT WITH THE AMERICORPS SENIORS STRATEGIC PLAN, SWIC FGP HAS PRIORITIZED EDUCATION AS THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA. THROUGH A SUPPORTIVE PARTNERSHIP OF 27 AVAILABLE VOLUNTEER STATIONS, FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE LOVING AND EXPERIENCED TUTORS AND MENTORS TO YOUTH WITH IDENTIFIED NEEDS WHO WILL CARRY OUT SERVICE ACTIVITIES SUCH AS TUTORING/MENTORING, SUPPORTING SCHOOL READINESS, AND IMPROVING BOTH SOCIAL EMOTIONAL HEALTH AND ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT FOR CHILDREN IN NEED. OVER THE NEXT 3 YEARS THE TARGET OUTCOME IS TO SUPPORT 138 OR MORE EXCEPTIONAL CHILDREN EACH YEAR FROM BIRTH THROUGH MIDDLE SCHOOL. SWIC IS REQUESTING THE FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $300,069.00 WHICH WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $18,777.00 OF LOCAL FUNDING AND IN-KIND SUPPORT, AS WELL AS $22,720.00 FROM THE STATE OF IL. THIS GRANT APPLICATION WILL SHOW EVIDENCE THAT SUPPORTS WHY SWIC HAS BEEN SO SUCCESSFUL AS A SPONSOR FOR THE SENIOR CORPS PROGRAMS FOR ALMOST 50 YEARS AND WILL CONTINUE TO DO SO IN THE FUTURE.

AN ESTIMATED 90 FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE BETWEEN 15 TO 40 HOURS PER WEEK SERVING AT RISK CHILDREN.  OF THIS NUMBER AT LEAST 86 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE WORKING ONE ON ONE READING, DEVELOPING MATH SKILLS, DEVELOPMENTAL SKILLS, AND OVERALL MENTORING TO ENCOURAGE POSITIVE CLASSROOM AND ACADEMIC SUCCESS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS K-12 SUCCESS AND SCHOOL READINESS.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, OUR ANTICIPATED OUTCOME IS TO MAKE SIGNIFICANT STRIDES IN K-12 EDUCATION AND SCHOOL READINESS BY PLACING A MINIMUM OF 90 PERCENT OF UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS IN THE WORK PLANS WHICH ADDRESS THESE TWO AREAS. EVERY YEAR, OVER 80% OF THE SITES WILL REPORT THAT THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEER MADE A SIGNIFICANT POSITIVE IMPACT IN THE YOUTH THAT THEY SERVED.

THE VOLUNTEERS PLACED IN THE K-12 EDUCATIONAL ACADEMIC SUCCESS WORK PLAN, WILL WORK ONE ON ONE, AND IN SMALL GROUPS TO ASSIST THOSE CHILDREN WHO NEED ADDITIONAL ATTENTION TO MATH AND READING SKILLS.  THE ACTIVITIES THE VOLUNTEERS ARE TOO COMPLETE WILL BE DIRECTED BY THE TEACHERS THROUGH THE ASSIGNMENT PLANS COMPLETED BY THE TEACHER AND SHARED WITH THE VOLUNTEERS.

THE VOLUNTEERS PLACED IN THE SCHOOL READINESS WORK PLAN WILL WORK ONE ON ONE WITH PRE-K STUDENTS ON ACTIVITIES DIRECTED BY TEACHERS THROUGH ASSIGNMENT PLANS SHARED WITH THE VOLUNTEERS.

THE TEACHERS WILL THEN REPORT IN AN END OF THE YEAR SURVEY THE PROGRESS OF THE STUDENTS SERVED BY A FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEER.

DURING MONTHLY TRAINING'S, THE VOLUNTEERS WILL RECEIVE TRAINING TO AIDE THEM IN WORKING WITH THE STUDENTS SUCH AS TUTORING SKILLS, MINDFULNESS AND EDUCATION, CHILD DEVELOPMENT, BULLYING, AND MANY MORE TOPICS.

THE CITY OF CHICAGO, DEPARTMENT OF FAMILY AND SUPPORT SERVICES (DFSS) WORKS WITH COMMUNITY PARTNERS TO CONNECT CHICAGO RESIDENTS AND FAMILIES TO RESOURCES THAT BUILD STABILITY, SUPPORT THEIR WELL-BEING, AND EMPOWER THEM TO THRIVE. THE DFSS SENIOR SERVICES DIVISION (SSD) HAS BEEN A SPONSOR OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) SINCE THE EARLY 1980S. EACH YEAR FGP VOLUNTEERS PROVIDE SERVICES TO MORE THAN 500 CHILDREN, YOUTH AND YOUNG ADULTS ENROLLED IN CHICAGO PUBLIC SCHOOLS (CPS), HEAD START PROGRAMS, CHARTER SCHOOLS, THERAPEUTIC FACILITIES AND AFTER-SCHOOL PROGRAMS. PARTICIPANTS RECEIVING SERVICES ARE IDENTIFIED AS AT-RISK AND REQUIRE ONE-ON-ONE SUPPORT IN THE AREAS OF READING, MATH, LITERACY AND SOCIALIZATION. 

IN FY 2021, DFSS WILL MAINTAIN ITS CURRENT NUMBER OF FEDERAL VOLUNTEERS OF 117 AND NON-FEDERAL VOLUNTEERS AT 31. THE FEDERAL FUNDING REQUESTED FOR FY 2021 IS $652,133. THE TOTAL AMOUNT OF NON-FEDERAL DOLLARS IS $281,582, OF WHICH $245,000 IS FROM LOCAL CITY OF CHICAGO FUNDS AND $36,582 FROM STATE OF ILLINOIS FUNDS. CHICAGO'S FGP PROJECT WILL ADDRESS TWO SERVICE CATEGORIES: 1) SCHOOL READINESS - HEAD START AND EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION AND 2) K-12 SUCCESS. DFSS WILL CONTINUE TO ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF OUR MOST VULNERABLE COMMUNITIES BY TUTORING AND MENTORING CHILDREN ENROLLED AT SCHOOLS IN LOW-INCOME COMMUNITIES BY APPLYING VARYING LEVELS OF SUPPORT FROM PROVISIONAL TO INTENSIVE WHILE TUTORING AND MENTORING CHILDREN IN GRADES K-12. 

ON SEPTEMBER 29, 2020, THE AGENCY NAME, THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE, OFFICIALLY CHANGED TO AMERICORPS.  IN ADDITION, THE SENIOR CORPS BRAND NAME CHANGED TO AMERICORPS SENIORS. VOLUNTEERS WILL BE IDENTIFIED AS AMERICORPS SENIOR VOLUNTEERS IN THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM OF THE CHICAGO DEPARTMENT OF FAMILY & SUPPORT SERVICES WHICH IS FUNDED THROUGH A GRANT FROM AMERICORPS.

THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM WILL UTILIZE AMERICORPS SENIORS PERFORMANCE MEASURES: ED1A: NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS SERVED WHO ARE RECIPIENTS OF AMERICORPS SENIORS-SUPPORTED SERVICES RELATED TO EDUCATION INCLUDING PRESCHOOL AGE CHILDREN AND STUDENTS ENROLLED IN GRADES K-12; ED5A: NUMBER OF STUDENTS WITH IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE; ED23A: NUMBER OF CHILDREN DEMONSTRATING GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS; ED27C: NUMBER OF STUDENTS WITH IMPROVED ACADEMIC  ENGAGEMENT OR SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL SKILLS; IN THE FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES AND ACCESS TO CARE; H4A: NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS SERVED; H15A: NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES RECEIVING SERVICES THAT PROMOTE INTEGRATION AND INCLUSION.
