THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM WILL UTILIZE A STANDARD TEACHER SURVEY TO MEASURE THE PERFORMANCE OF THE PROGRAM. THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES OF THE PROGRAM WILL BE: 80% OF CHILDREN IN EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION PROGRAMS ASSIGNED TO A FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEER WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS; 80% OF CHILDREN IN ELEMENTARY EDUCATION PROGRAMS ASSIGNED TO A FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEER WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE.

THE STATE OF WEST VIRGINIA CREATED THE REGION 8 PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT COUNCIL IN 1972 UNDER THE REGIONAL PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT ACT TO SERVE GRANT, HAMPSHIRE, HARDY, MINERAL, AND PENDLETON COUNTIES.  LATER, THE COUNTIES OF BERKELEY, JEFFERSON AND MORGAN WERE ADDED TO THE REGIONAL COUNCIL.  THE REGIONAL COUNCIL IS RESPONSIBLE FOR PLANNING AND FOSTERING COMMUNITY AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT THROUGHOUT THE DISTRICT.  THE REGIONAL PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT ACT EMPOWERS THE COUNCIL TO RECEIVE AND EXPEND FUNDS; ENGAGE IN COMPREHENSIVE DEVELOPMENT PLANNING; PUBLISH SPECIALIZED STUDIES; PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO LOCAL GOVERNMENTS; PERFORM REGIONAL DEVELOPMENT; AND EXERCISE POWERS JOINTLY OR IN COOPERATION WITH AGENCIES AND POLITICAL SUBDIVISIONS OF THE STATE.  THE REGIONAL COUNCIL RECEIVES FUNDS FROM FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTAL ORGANIZATIONS TO PROVIDE THESE SERVICES.  THE REGION 8 PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT COUNCIL HAS ALSO RECEIVED STATE AND FEDERAL FUNDS TO CREATE LOAN POOLS THAT ASSIST NEW AND EXPANDING BUSINESSES.  THE REGIONAL COUNCIL POSSESSES A TRAINED AND EXPERIENCED STAFF AND HAS COMMITTED LOCAL ELECTED OFFICIALS AND COMMUNITY LEADERS.  IN ADDITION TO ITS PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT SERVICES, THE COUNCIL ALSO PROVIDES A VARIETY OF COMMUNITY SERVICE PROGRAMS. 

IT IS THE MISSION OF THE REGION 8 PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT COUNCIL TO OBTAIN THE MAXIMUM LEVEL OF ECONOMIC AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT IN THE POTOMAC HIGHLANDS OF WEST VIRGINIA THROUGH DEVELOPMENT, PLANNING AND BY ASSISTING LOCAL GOVERNMENTS AND BUSINESSES IMPLEMENT PROJECTS AND PROGRAMS.

THE UNITED STATES VIRGIN ISLANDS (USVI) IS UNIQUELY COMPRISED OF FOUR NON-CONTIGUOUS ISLANDS SEPARATED BY THE CARIBBEAN AND THE ATLANTIC OCEAN.  ST. CROIX, ST. THOMAS, ST. JOHN, AND WATER ISLAND.  THE TOTAL AREA OF THE USVI IS 133 SQUARE MILES. 
THE DEPARTMENT OF HUMAN SERVICES (DHS) IS THE RECOGNIZED STATE UNIT ON AGING (SUA) FOR THE U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS AND IS THE RECIPIENT OF SEVERAL ANNUAL GRANTS. THE VIRGIN ISLANDS DEPARTMENT OF HUMAN SERVICES, BY VIRTUE OF OUR LOCAL STATUTORY REGULATIONS IS MANDATED TO PROVIDE SOCIAL SERVICES TO PERSONS ACROSS THE LIFE CYCLE, AND OVERSIGHT AND DELIVERY OF SEVERAL FEDERAL PROGRAMS. THE VIRGIN ISLANDS DEPARTMENT OF HUMAN SERVICES IS THE SECOND LARGEST DEPARTMENT OF THE GOVERNMENT OF THE VIRGIN ISLANDS, WITH 722 FILLED POSITIONS WHICH INCLUDE GENERAL AND FEDERAL FUNDS, WITH THE TASK OF PROVIDING SERVICES TERRITORIALLY THROUGH 12 DIVISIONS ONE OF WHICH IS THE DIVISION OF SENIOR CITIZENS AFFAIRS WITH OVERSIGHT OF THE SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAMS FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM AND RSVP. 
THE UNITED STATES VIRGIN ISLANDS (USVI) IS REQUESTING CONTINUING FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $254,931 FOR THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM TO SUPPORT 58 VSYS.  THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IS PART OF AMERICORPS SENIORS, ADMINISTERED BY THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE, THE FEDERAL AGENCY THAT SUPPORTS SERVICE AND VOLUNTEERING. THE FGP PROGRAM CONSISTS OF VOLUNTEERS AGED 55 AND OLDER WHO PROVIDE ONE-ON-ONE ASSISTANCE TO MANY CHILDREN IN VARIOUS PUBLIC AND PRIVATE EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS. THESE CHILDREN RANGE FROM VARIOUS AGE GROUPS IN THE COMMUNITY, AT PRE-SCHOOL, HEAD START, ELEMENTARY AND JUNIOR HIGH SCHOOL.  
LIKE THE REST OF THE WORLD THE VIRGIN ISLANDS WAS ADVERSELY AFFECTED BY THE OUTBREAK OF THE COVID-19 OUTBREAK.  ON MARCH 16, 2020, GOVERNOR ALBERT BRYAN CLOSED ALL PUBLIC SCHOOLS AS ADVISED BY THE CENTER FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION (CDC) AND THE VI DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH. CONSEQUENTLY, OUR FOSTER GRANDPARENTS HAD TO LEAVE THE CLASSROOMS AND WERE THEREFORE UNABLE TO ASSIST THE CHILDREN WHO WERE THEN FORCED INTO ONLINE LEARNING. MANY OF OUR PUBLIC AND PRIVATE SCHOOLS, PRE-SCHOOLS AND DAYCARE CENTERS HAVE STRUGGLED SIMPLY TO CONNECT WITH STUDENTS AND FAMILIES TO ENSURE THAT THEIR BASIC TECHNOLOGICAL AND SOCIAL NEEDS ARE MET. IN ALIGNMENT WITH AMERICORPS SENIOR PRIORITIES FOR THIS GRANT CYCLE, OUR FGP PROGRAM WILL INCLUDE AN EDUCATION FOCUS AREA TO HELP OUR COMMUNITY RECOVER FROM THE IMPACT OF THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.  CONSIDERING THIS, THE DEPARTMENT OF HUMAN SERVICES WILL COLLABORATE WITH THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION TO HAVE OUR FGP VOLUNTEERS BE A PART OF THE VIRTUAL LEARNING EXPERIENCE.  WE WILL UTILIZE THE WIDELY USED WHATS-APP APPLICATION TO CONNECT TO STUDENTS BY TELEPHONE AND VIDEO CHAT. THE FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL DEVELOP  STRONGER RELATIONSHIPS WITH FAMILIES BY GREETING THEIR STUDENTS EACH MORNING TO ASSURE THAT THEY ARE UP AND READY TO ATTEND ONLINE CLASSES BY LOGGING IN ON TIME.  THEY WILL ALSO CONNECT WITH THE STUDENTS AT THE END OF THE SCHOOL DAY WITH WORDS OF ENCOURAGEMENT AND ASSISTANCE WITH HOMEWORK ASSIGNMENTS.
THE FGP PROGRAM, WITH THE ASSISTANCE OF OTHER COMMUNITY MEMBERS AND ORGANIZATIONS, AND THE ADVISORY COUNCIL, WILL CONTINUE TO TARGET AFTER SCHOOL PROGRAMS SUCH AS THE BOYS AND GIRLS CLUB. THE BOYS AND GIRLS CLUB WHICH NORMALLY WILL OPEN FOR AFTER SCHOOL ACTIVITIES IS NOW OPERATING DAILY TO ACCOMMODATE CHILDREN WITH THEIR ON-LINE CLASSES WHILE THEIR PARENTS ARE AT WORK.
THE FGP PROGRAM IS ONE OF 12 UNITS UNDER THE DEPARTMENT OF HUMAN SERVICES, DIVISION OF SENIOR CITIZENS AFFAIRS, WHOSE MISSION SEEKS TO ENSURE A COORDINATED AND COMPREHENSIVE SYSTEM OF QUALITY SERVICES, TO PREVENT ISOLATION AMONG SENIORS AND TO ADVOCATE COMMUNITY RESPONSIVENESS OF THOSE SERVICES. THE DEPARTMENTS' MISSION STATEMENT IS TO PROVIDE SOCIAL SERVICES THAT WILL ENHANCE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES WITH DIVERSE NEEDS. YWCA TRI-COUNTY AREA WILL MANAGE A FOSTER GRANDPARENT  PROGRAM IN MONTGOMERY COUNTY, PA., WITH 78 FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS WITH DISADVANTAGED CHILDREN AND YOUTH. THEIR VOLUNTEER ASSIGNMENTS WILL INCLUDE READING TO PRESCHOOL CHILDREN, WORKING ON CURRICULUM-BASED LITERACY PROJECTS WITH PRESCHOOL CHILDREN, MENTORING K-6 CHILDREN, AND TUTORING OUT-OF-SCHOOL YOUTH AGE 17-21. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR PROJECT, 96 CHILDREN WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN LITERACY SKILLS, 138 K-6 YOUTH WILL IMPROVE SCHOOL ATTENDANCE, AND 2 OUT-OF-SCHOOL YOUTH WILL IMPROVE ACADEMICS IN A HIGH SCHOOL EQUIVALENCY PROGRAM. THE YEAR 1 TOTAL BUDGET FOR THE PROGRAM IS  $555,034. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $504,577 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY A $50,457 LOCAL MATCH.

BLAIR COUNTY'S AREA AGING ON AGING, BLAIR SENIOR SERVICES, INC., SERVES OVER 10,000 CONSUMERS 60 YEARS OF AGE AND OLDER AND OTHERS IN NEED ON AN ANNUAL BASIS.  BLAIR SENIOR SERVICES, INC. IS A PRIVATE NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION GOVERNED BY A FIFTEEN-MEMBER BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND CURRENTLY HAS A STAFF OF 130 EMPLOYEES.  WITH 28 DIFFERENT SERVICES PROVIDED BY THE AGENCY, CONSUMERS RECEIVE SERVICES FOR A VARIETY OF NEEDS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS IS EDUCATION: MENTORING.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE AMERICORPS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $883,899 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $88,389.90 OF IN-KIND FUNDS.

THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) WILL PROVIDE HIGH-QUALITY AND IMPACTFUL INTERGENERATIONAL SERVICE OPPORTUNITIES THROUGHOUT BERKS COUNTY.  AS PART OF THIS PROGRAM, SENIOR CITIZENS AND COLLEGE STUDENTS WILL WORK TOGETHER TO HAVE A POSITIVE IMPACT ON K-12 ACADEMIC SUCCESS AND SCHOOL READINESS OUTCOMES FOR HIGH-NEED CHILDREN IN AND AROUND READING, PA, ONE OF THE MOST ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED CITIES IN THE COUNTRY.  AN ESTIMATED 60 FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE PRIMARILY AT ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS, AFTERSCHOOL PROGRAMS, AND HEAD START CENTERS ACROSS BERKS COUNTY, IN ADDITION TO SUPPORTING THE READING YOUTH INITIATIVE THROUGH ALVERNIA UNIVERSITY.  FOR EACH OF THESE STATIONS, STUDENTS WITH SPECIAL OR EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS ARE REFERRED TO THE PROGRAM BY THEIR TEACHERS AND MATCHED WITH A FOSTER GRANDPARENT. 
THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM AT ALVERNIA UNIVERSITY WILL WORK IN ALIGNMENT WITH THE CNCS FOCUS AREA OF EDUCATION THROUGH PROGRAMMING WHICH TARGETS K-12 SUCCESS AND SCHOOL READINESS. FOSTER GRANDPARENT ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE HOMEWORK HELP, INCREASING LITERACY PROFICIENCY, TUTORING AND MENTORING.  FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL PROVIDE VOLUNTEER SERVICE WITH CHILDREN DURING THE DAY IN ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS, HEAD START EARLY EDUCATION CENTERS, AND AFTER-SCHOOL PROGRAMS THROUGHOUT THE CITY OF READING AND BERKS COUNTY. AT THE END OF THE PREVIOUS THREE-YEAR GRANT, MORE THAN 93,000 SERVICE HOURS WERE GENERATED TO AID IN THE IMPROVEMENT OF ACADEMIC SKILLS OF MORE THAN 820 CHILDREN THROUGHOUT BERKS COUNTY. THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $300,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY THE $33,359 GRANTEE SHARE FROM ALVERNIA UNIVERSITY. DUE TO THE IMPACT OF THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC MANY OF THE SCHOOLS IN BERKS COUNTY HAVE GONE FULLY VIRTUAL OR HAVE IMPLEMENTED A HYBRID SYSTEM. UNFORTUNATELY, FOR US THIS HAS CAUSED OUR NUMBER OF SERVICE HOURS TO DECREASE BECAUSE MANY OF OUR VOLUNTEERS DO NOT HAVE THE NECESSARY TECHNOLOGY TO PARTICIPATE IN VIRTUAL LEARNING. IN ORDER TO COMPENSATE FOR THE DECLINE, WE HAVE CREATED A PEN PAL PROGRAM THAT ALLOWS OUR VOLUNTEERS TO INTERACT WITH THE STUDENTS FROM THE SAFETY OF THEIR HOME. WE PLAN ON CONTINUING THIS ALTERNATIVE WAY OF INTERACTION UNTIL THE SCHOOLS REOPEN AND AGAIN ALLOW FOR IN-PERSON VOLUNTEERS TO SERVE IN THE SCHOOLS.

AN ESTIMATED 47 AMERICORPS SENIORS FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER 47 AMERICORPS SENIORS FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVES WILL INCLUDE MENTORING, TUTORING, CLASSROOM SUPPORT, SUMMER LEARNING, CLASSROOM TEACHING AND NUTRITION/FOOD SUPPORT. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 75% OF THE STUDENTS SERVED WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS OR DEMONSTRATE IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE. THE AMERICORPS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $241,524 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $51,929.

THE SALVATION ARMY IS PROUD OF THE ONGOING SUCCESS OF ITS FOSTER GRANDPARENTS PROGRAM (FGP) AND ITS PARTNERSHIP WITH AMERICORPS SENIORS. IN THIS COMING YEAR, THE PROGRAM WILL BUILD ON THIS SUCCESS AND EXPAND FROM 62 TO 68 VOLUNTEERS.  THIS WILL ALLOW THE SALVATION ARMY THE OPPORTUNITY TO PROVIDE MORE LOW-INCOME CHILDREN IN ESSEX AND HUDSON COUNTY WITH THE OPPORTUNITY OF RECEIVING EDUCATIONAL ASSISTANCE, EMOTIONAL AND SOCIAL DEVELOPMENT. 

THE SALVATION ARMY FOSTERS AND SUPPORTS EFFORTS TO PROMOTE RACIAL EQUITY AND DIVERSITY. THE SALVATION ARMY IS ROOTED AND COMMITTED TO RACIAL EQUALITY, DIVERSITY, AND INCLUSION IN RECRUITMENT, CONTRACTING, AND GRANTMAKING PRACTICES, AS WELL AS OUR EVERYDAY OPERATION. WE HAVE BUILT RACIAL EQUALITY PROFICIENCY AMONG BOARD MEMBERS, SENIOR LEADERSHIP, AND STAFF MEMBERS TO ENGAGE MULTICULTURAL COMMUNITIES GENUINELY AND COLLECTIVELY. 

THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, WE ANTICIPATE AN OUTCOME OF 64 VOLUNTEERS BEING PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS THAT WILL IMPROVE CHILDREN'S SCHOOL READINESS. FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL WORK DIRECTLY WITH CHILDREN, EITHER 1-ON-1 OR IN SMALL GROUPS, ENGAGING AND STRUCTURED LEARNING ACTIVITIES (COGNITIVE TABLE GAMES, ART, AND CRAFTS, RECREATIONAL EXERCISE, ETC.,) TO IMPROVE LEARNING OUTCOMES. OF THE PLACED VOLUNTEERS, WE ANTICIPATE SIXTEEN (39) WILL ASSIST FORTY (53) STUDENTS K-12 WITH SPECIAL OR EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS IN ESL. OUTCOMES FROM ALL-VOLUNTEER ENGAGEMENT WILL BE MEASURED BY UTILIZING STANDARDIZED PRE/POST-TEST, ACTIVITY CHECKLIST, ASSIGNMENT PLAN, AND TIMESHEETS. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 53 CHILDREN WILL DEMONSTRATE THE GAIN IN SCHOOL READINESS THROUGH TUTORING, MENTORING, SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL SUPPORT, AND OTHER CLASSROOM SUPPORT. THE AMERICORPS SENIORS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $ 371,008 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $63,339. ACCORDING TO CNCS, THE MATCH AMOUNT IS WAIVED FOR THE FISCAL YEAR 2021.

 GATEWAY COMMUNITY ACTION PARTNERSHIP IS ACTIVELY INVOLVED IN THE LIVES AND WELFARE OF THE COMMUNITIES IN SOUTHERN NEW JERSEY. PARTICIPANTS ARE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS, IN CHILD CARE AND HEAD START, HELPING CHILDREN WITH SCHOOL READINESS. THE JEFFERSON PARK MINISTRIES(JPM), UNION COUNTY FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IS THE LIFELINE FOR MANY SENIORS. RESEARCH SHOWS THAT VOLUNTEERING IS GOOD FOR THE HEALTH AND WELL-BEING OF VOLUNTEERS. BUT FOR OLDER AMERICANS WITH LOW-INCOME AND LOWER LEVELS OF EDUCATION, A GROUP VULNERABLE TO POOR HEALTH OUTCOMES, MANY OBSTACLES CAN MAKE IT CHALLENGING TO VOLUNTEER. AS A RESULT, THESE INDIVIDUALS MAY MISS OUT ON THE HEALTH AND WELL-BEING BENEFITS OF VOLUNTEERING, AND COMMUNITIES MAY MISS OUT ON THE VOLUNTEER SERVICE THESE INDIVIDUALS PROVIDE. FOSTER GRANDPARENTS OFFER YOUNG AND OLD THE CHANCE TO GROW TOGETHER. FGP TAPS INTO THE SKILLS, TALENTS, AND EXPERIENCE OF AMERICANS AGE 55 AND OVER TO MEET A WIDE RANGE OF COMMUNITY CHALLENGES. THE FGP PROGRAM HAS REJUVENATED MANY OF THE SENIORS, CHANGE IN THEIR LIVES AND ATTITUDE TOWARDS THE CHILDREN THEY ARE SERVING ARE NOTICEABLE. 
     LAST YEAR, MORE THAN 3,300 NEW JERSEY SENIORS IN OUR FOSTER GRANDPARENTS PROGRAM MET CRITICAL COMMUNITY NEEDS WHILE CONTRIBUTING TO LONGER, HEALTHIER LIVES. THE MARYLAND DEPARTMENT OF JUVENILE SERVICES IS THE CENTRAL CABINET --LEVEL AGENCY RESPONSIBLE FOR PROVIDING INDIVIDUALIZED CARE AND TREATMENT OF YOUTH OFFENDERS BETWEEN THE AGES OF SEVEN AND TWENTY-ONE. THE DEPARTMENT'S MISSION SEEKS TO ENSURE THE PUBLIC SAFETY AND PROTECTION OF THE COMMUNITY, TO HOLD YOUTH OFFENDERS ACCOUNTABLE TO VICTIMS AND COMMUNITIES, AND TO DEVELOP YOUTH COMPETENCY AND CHARACTER TO ASSIST THEM IN BECOMING RESPONSIBLE AND PRODUCTIVE MEMBERS OF SOCIETY. IN CARRYING OUT ITS MISSION, DJS EMBRACES A BALANCED AND RESTORATIVE JUSTICE PHILOSOPHY INCORPORATING EVIDENCE-BASED BEST PRACTICES. THE PRINCE GEORGE'S COUNTY DEPARTMENT OF FAMILY SERVICES IS THE LEGAL APPLICANT FOR THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP). THE MISSION OF THE DEPARTMENT OF FAMILY SERVICES IS TO ENSURE THE PROVISION OF COMPREHENSIVE AND RESPONSIVE COMMUNITY-BASED SERVICES THAT ENHANCE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES THAT STRENGTHEN THE PRINCE GEORGE'S COUNTY COMMUNITY. THE PRINCE GEORGE'S COUNTY FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM HAS BEEN IN EXISTENCE FOR OVER FIFTY (50) YEARS AND IS HOUSED IN THE DEPARTMENT OF FAMILY SERVICES AGING AND DISABILITIES SERVICES DIVISION WHICH ALSO SERVES AS THE LOCAL AREA AGENCY ON AGING.   THE MISSION OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IS TO CONNECT ADULTS FIFTY-FIVE YEARS (55) AND OVER WITH MEANINGFUL VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES WITH CHILDREN IN CHILD CARE CENTERS, SCHOOLS AND OTHER NON-PROFIT AGENCIES.
THROUGH THIS GRANT, AN ESTIMATED FIFTY-FIVE (55) UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THE PRINCE GEORGE'S COUNTY COMMUNITY THROUGH APPROXIMATELY 16 HOST SITES.  OF THIS NUMBER, 43 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  THE PRINCE GEORGE'S COUNTY FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM'S PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF SERVICE IS SCHOOL READINESS AND EDUCATION. THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS PROVIDE ACTIVITIES SUCH AS SCHOOL AND COMMUNITY-BASED MENTORING, ASSISTING IN CLASSROOMS, COMFORTING CHILDREN, CARING FOR INFANTS AND ASSISTING YOUNG MOTHERS. 
DURING THE COVID 19 PANDEMIC THE NEED FOR ADDITIONAL RESOURCES PROVIDED BY THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS IS PARAMOUNT. THE PROJECT IS WORKING CLOSELY WITH PRINCE GEORGES COUNTY PUBLIC SCHOOL SYSTEM AND THE PRINCE GEORGE'S COUNTY SCHOOL BOARD TO IMPLEMENT NEW GOALS AND OBJECTIVES THAT WILL ASSIST CHILDREN WHO ARE BEHIND ON MEETING NATIONAL ACADEMIC BENCHMARKS.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD 55 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST APPROXIMATELY 425 CHILDREN IMPROVE IN THE ACADEMIC AREAS OF LITERACY AND MATH. THE TOTAL AMOUNT OF THE PROPOSED FY22 BUDGET IS $334,058 OF WHICH $263,308 IS THE REQUESTED CNCS SHARE AND $70,750 IS THE GRANTEE SHARE.   
OUR PRIMARY GOALS ARE TO MAKE A DIFFERENCE IN THE LIFE OF A CHILD WHILE AT THE SAME TIME ENRICHING THE LIFE OF THE VOLUNTEER AS WELL AS PROVIDING MENTORING OPPORTUNITIES FOR AT-RISK YOUTH IN PRINCE GEORGE'S COUNTY. THE PANDEMIC HAS HIGHLIGHTED THAT MANY AT-RISK CHILDREN FACE ADDITIONAL CHALLENGES IN THE VIRTUAL LEARNING ENVIRONMENT.  NOT ONLY WERE THERE TECHNOLOGY CHALLENGES, CHILDREN'S EMOTIONAL HEALTH AND MENTAL WELL-BEING WERE AFFECTED.  THE PRINCE GEORGE'S COUNTY FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM ENDEAVORS TO WORK WITH SCHOOLS AND COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS TO ENSURE THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS ARE SOURCED TO ASSIST THOSE CHILDREN WHO HAVE BEEN IDENTIFIED THROUGH THE PRINCE GEORGE'S COUNTY PUBLIC SCHOOLS AND NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS AS NEEDING ADDITIONAL SUPPORT IN ORDER TO THRIVE.

THE UNITED PLANNING ORGANIZATION (UPO) IS REQUESTING FUNDING TO CONTINUE THE ADMINISTRATION OF THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL COMMUNITY SERVICES (CNCS), SENIOR CORPS, AND FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM FOR THE DC GRANT AWARD FROM JULY 1, 2021 THROUGH JUNE 30, 2024 IN THE AMOUNT OF
$853,027 PER YEAR. THE UPO FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) WILL CONTINUE TO PROVIDE VOLUNTEER SERVICE OPPORTUNITIES FOR ITS CURRENT 175 VOLUNTEERS, AGED 55 AND OLDER, DURING YEAR ONE OF THE THREE-YEAR PERIOD AND THEREAFTER. OF 175 SENIOR VOLUNTEERS, 170 OF THEM WILL BE PLACED IN IMPACT-BASED ASSIGNMENTS AND SUPPORTED WITH OUTCOME WORK/ASSIGNMENT PLANS AND EVALUATIONS. THE UPO FGP PRIMARY FOCUS AREA IS EDUCATION WITH APPROXIMATELY 3% (FIVE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS) SERVING TO FULFILL OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. 
SOME OF THE ACTIVITIES THAT FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL IMPLEMENT INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING:
1.	FGS WILL ASSIST TEACHERS IN IN-CLASS, CARE (CANVAS ACADEMICS AND REAL ENGAGEMENT) CLASSROOMS (OR VIRTUAL) SETTINGS AS ALLOWABLE UNDER CITY-MANDATED, COVID-19 SAFETY PROTOCOLS FOR PRE-K AND KINDERGARTEN STUDENTS.  DCPS HAS PRIORITIZED IN-SCHOOL INSTRUCTION FOR PRE-K AND KINDERGARTEN OVER THE NEXT TWO YEARS.  ADDITIONALLY, FGS WILL PARTICIPATE IN REMOTE (VIRTUAL) LEARNING ASSISTANCE TO HEAD START STUDENTS.  FOSTER GRANDPARENTS UNABLE TO SERVE HEAD START STUDENTS WILL BE REASSIGNED TO ELEMENTARY EDUCATION ASSIGNMENTS. FOSTER GRANDPARENTS (FGS) WILL ASSIST IN HEAD START EDUCATION TO FACILITATE SCHOOL READINESS.
2.	FGS WILL PROVIDE IN-PERSON, CARE CLASSROOM, AND VIRTUAL TUTORING AND MENTORING SERVICES TO STUDENTS ENROLLED IN CNCS SUPPORTED PUBLIC SCHOOLS, PUBLIC CHARTER SCHOOLS, AND POTOMAC JOB CORPS AS COVID-19 SAFETY PROTOCOLS ALLOW TO IMPROVE ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE FOR STUDENTS K-12. SPECIFICALLY FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL SERVE IN C.A.R.E. CLASSROOMS, WHICH ALLOW STUDENTS TO CONTINUE TO ENGAGE IN VIRTUAL LEARNING IN A SUPPORTIVE AND SUPERVISED ENVIRONMENT.  
3.	FGS WILL CONDUCT VIRTUAL READING SESSIONS TO ELEMENTARY STUDENTS THROUGH ITS READING PARTNERS REMOTE PROGRAM, EXPANDING ITS REACH BY INCLUDING 20 ADDITIONAL FOSTER GRANDPARENTS AS READERS.
4.	FGS WILL PARTICIPATE IN COMPUTER LITERACY TRAINING TO LEARN THE RUDIMENTS OF TECHNOLOGY USE IN A VIRTUAL FORMAT TO ENHANCE THEIR DELIVERY OF PROGRAM RELATED LEARNING ACTIVITIES, AMONG OTHERS.

AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD, UPO INTENDS TO ACHIEVE THE FOLLOWING OUTCOMES IN THE FOCUS AREAS OF EDUCATION: 1) ED23A NUMBER OF CHILDREN DEMONSTRATING GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS AND; 2) ED5A NUMBER OF K-12 STUDENTS WITH IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT OF READING, MATH, AND SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL SKILLS.

THE PROJECT DIRECTOR WILL CONTINUE TO WORK WITH UPO OFFICES OF DEVELOPMENT AND RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT TO RAISE IN-KIND FUNDING TO SUPPORT THE FGP. IN FY 2020, DEVELOPMENT EFFORTS RESULTED IN RAISING $12,000 FROM PRIVATE FOUNDATIONS AND INDIVIDUALS. OVER THE NEXT THREE YEARS, UPO INTENDS TO SUPPLEMENT THE GRANT MATCH REQUIREMENTS OF $85,303 PER YEAR BY RAISING $25,000 PER YEAR IN GRANTS AND CASH DONATIONS AND $60,303 OF IN-KIND SUPPORT.

THE TEXAS HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES COMMISSION (HHSC), THROUGH CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS) GRANT FUNDS, ADMINISTERS THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) TO SUPPORT OVER 400 FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THE FGP IS EDUCATION, COVERING SCHOOL READINESS AND K-12 SUCCESS OBJECTIVES. SERVICE ACTIVITIES THAT ALIGN WITH NATIONAL PERFORMANCE MEASURES INCLUDE: TUTORING, MENTORING, SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL SUPPORT, SUMMER LEARNING CLASSROOM, AND OTHER CLASSROOM SUPPORT. HHSC ANTICIPATES THAT BY THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT CYCLE, FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE MENTORED AT LEAST 3,846 CHILDREN AND YOUTH IN EDUCATION OUTCOME AREAS IN PUBLIC SCHOOLS, HEAD START CENTERS, AND CHILD DEVELOPMENT CENTERS. THE FGP PROJECT ENGAGES IN OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES SUCH AS JUVENILE JUSTICE DELINQUENCY, STATE SUPPORTED LIVING CENTERS (SSLCS), AND AFTER-SCHOOL AND SUMMER PROGRAMS. CHILDREN IN THESE POPULATIONS WILL BE SERVED IN OUTPUT AREAS SUCH AS JUVENILE JUSTICE FACILITIES, HOMELESS SHELTERS, LIBRARIES, MUSEUMS, AND AFTER-SCHOOL AND SUMMER PROGRAMS. THE FGP SERVICE AREAS HAVE OFFICES IN ABILENE, AUSTIN, CORPUS CHRISTI, DENTON, LUBBOCK, LUFKIN, MEXIA, AND ROSENBERG AND PROVIDE SERVICES TO SURROUNDING AREAS CONSISTING OF 37 TEXAS COUNTIES. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $2,193,056 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $604,676 IN STATE GENERAL REVENUE AND LEGISLATIVE STATE AWARD.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY:
WE ARE THE SOUTH EAST TEXAS FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM.  OUR SPONSORING AGENCY IS THE SOUTH EAST TEXAS REGIONAL PLANNING COMMISSION (SETRPC).  SETRPC WAS ESTABLISHED IN 1971 FOR SOLVING REGION-WIDE PROBLEMS BY PROMOTING INTERGOVERNMENTAL COOPERATION AND COORDINATION, CONDUCTING COMPREHENSIVE REGIONAL PLANNING, AND PROVIDING A FORUM FOR THE DISCUSSION AND STUDY OF AREA ISSUES.  SETRPC HAS BEEN OUR SPONSORING AGENCY FOR 30 YEARS (1989 --2019).   
WE HAVE RECRUITED AND TRAINED AN ESTIMATED 16 FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS DURING THE 2019 YEAR BUT SEVERAL OF THE TRAINEES DID NOT CONTINUE WITH THE PROGRAM. PRESENTLY WE HAVE 71 VOLUNTEERS SERVING IN HARDIN, JEFFERSON AND ORANGE COUNTIES, KNOWN AS THE GOLDEN TRIANGLE.  
OUR VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PROVIDING MENTORS AND TUTORS TO ENCOURAGE "AT-RISK" CHILDREN WHILE HELPING ENHANCE THEIR SOCIAL, EMOTIONAL, AND COGNITIVE DEVELOPMENT AND ACADEMIC SKILLS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION.  
BECAUSE OF OUR FOSTER GRANDPARENT'S INVOLVEMENT WITH AND DEDICATION TO THEIR ASSIGNED CHILDREN, WE ARE ANTICIPATING THE CHILDREN SERVED WILL SHOW AT LEAST 10% IMPROVEMENT IN THEIR ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENTS.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $446,350 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY LOCAL INVESTMENT OF $146,627 WHICH FAR EXCEEDS THE REQUIRED 10% MATCH. WITH THESE INVESTMENTS, WE WILL BE ABLE TO PROVIDE 81 VOLUNTEER SERVICE HOURS (VSYS) -- (80 FEDERALLY FUNDED AND 1 STATE FUNDED) TO OUR COMMUNITY.

KI BOIS COMMUNITY ACTION FOUNDATION, INC. (KI BOIS CAF) IS A MULTI-PURPOSE COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY. ITS MISSION IS TO REMAIN DEDICATED TO ELIMINATING THE CAUSES OF POVERTY AND BETTERING THE ECONOMIC, MENTAL, PHYSICAL AND SOCIAL WELL-BEING OF ALL PEOPLE, MOST IMPORTANTLY THE DISADVANTAGED, BY UTILIZING EFFECTIVE COORDINATION AND ADMINISTRATION OF AVAILABLE RESOURCES. 

KI BOIS CAF IS REQUESTING $625,602 IN BUDGET SUPPORT FROM THE CORPORATION AND WILL SUPPLEMENT THE FEDERAL BUDGET WITH $69,935. AN ESTIMATED 100 VOLUNTEERS WILL PARTICIPATE IN THE PROGRAM. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA IS EDUCATION, THE NATIONAL PERFORMANCE MEASURES ARE K-12 SUCCESS AND SCHOOL READINESS. THE PROJECT WILL ADDRESS COMMUNITY NEEDS SURROUNDING CHILDREN AND THEIR FAMILIES THAT ARE EXPERIENCING LOW-INCOME AND OTHER DIFFICULTIES. ACCORDING TO THE CHILD TRENDS DATA BANK, CHILDREN WHO ARE IN LOW-INCOME HOMES ARE DISPROPORTIONATELY EXPOSED TO RISK FACTORS THAT MAY IMPAIR BRAIN DEVELOPMENT AND AFFECT SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT. THIS CAN AFFECT THEIR ABILITY TO LEARN AND PROGRESS IN SCHOOL WHICH ULTIMATELY AFFECTS THEIR POTENTIAL TO EARN A LIVING WAGE AND BECOME A PRODUCTIVE MEMBER OF THE COMMUNITY. 

VOLUNTEERS WILL GREATLY INCREASE THE CAPACITY OF PUBLIC SCHOOLS AND HEAD START CENTERS BY PROVIDING ONE-ON-ONE ATTENTION, TUTORING AND MENTORING WHICH WOULD NOT BE AVAILABLE OTHERWISE FOR CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL AND EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS. THESE VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST THE EDUCATIONAL FACILITY IN BETTER PREPARING CHILDREN FOR THE NEXT STEP IN THEIR EDUCATIONAL CAREER. 

THE PROJECT'S ANTICIPATED END OUTCOMES ARE 225 ELEMENTARY SCHOOL CHILDREN WILL SHOW AT LEAST 10% IMPROVEMENT IN THEIR IDENTIFIED PRIORITY AREA SUCH AS MATH OR LITERACY SKILLS, AND 18 HEAD START CHILDREN WILL SHOW AT LEAST 10% PROGRESS IN THEIR IDENTIFIED PRIORITY AREAS SUCH AS LETTER, NUMBER AND COLOR RECOGNITION AND SOCIAL/LANGUAGE SKILLS.

DELTA COMMUNITY ACTION FOUNDATION, INCORPORATED IS A PRIVATE, NON-PROFIT CORPORATION ORGANIZED FOR THE PURPOSE OF PLANNING, COORDINATING, AND EXECUTING PROGRAMS AUTHORIZED BY FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL ENTITIES TO ALLEVIATE AND ATTEMPT TO ERADICATE POVERTY IN SOUTHERN OKLAHOMA. THE MISSION OF DELTA COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY IS TO PROMOTE SELF-SUFFICIENCY AMONG OUR CITIZENS TO SECURE THE OPPORTUNITIES TO WORK, TO LIVE IN DECENCY, AND WITH DIGNITY.  DELTA COMMUNITY ACTION FOUNDATION HAS BEEN A PROUD SPONSOR OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM SINCE THE EARLY 1980'S

AN ESTIMATED 82 FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 82 FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. OUR VOLUNTEERS WILL SEEK TO IMPROVE EDUCATIONAL OUTCOMES FOR DISADVANTAGED/AT-RISK CHILDREN.  DELTA FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL ENGAGE IN A VARIETY OF SERVICE ACTIVITIES TO ENSURE THE SUCCESS OF THESE OUTCOMES.  SOME FGS SERVE IN A MENTOR CAPACITY TO AID DISADVANTAGED CHILDREN. FGS ALSO PROVIDE CARE FOR INFANTS AND TODDLERS IN HEAD START/EARLY HEAD START PROGRAMS. VOLUNTEERS ENSURE POSITIVE SOCIAL GROWTH, EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT, AND SCHOOL READINESS. OTHER FGS WILL PROVIDE ONE-ON-ONE INTERACTION WITH OLDER STUDENTS WHILE UNDER DIRECT SUPERVISION OF CLASSROOM TEACHERS AND WILL HELP STUDENTS DEVELOP READING, MATH, WRITING, SPELLING, AND COMPREHENSION SKILLS AS WELL AS HELP IMPROVE ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT.  

THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOME AT THE END OF THE GRANT PERIOD WILL BE THAT ASSIGNED STUDENTS DEMONSTRATE IMPROVEMENTS IN DEVELOPMENTAL AREAS IN WHICH THEY NEED ASSISTANCE. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $518,991 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY SPONSORSHIPS, LOCAL DONATIONS, AND IN-KIND DONATIONS TOTALING $48,503 THE FIRST YEAR OF THE GRANT AND WILL BE MATCHED BY 10% THE FOLLOWING TWO YEARS.  DELTA COMMUNITY ACTION FOUNDATION, INC. WILL BE FOCUSING ON LOCATING ADDITIONAL FUNDING RESOURCES THROUGHOUT THE YEAR.

THE SPONSORING ORGANIZATION IS COMMUNITY SERVICES CENTER (CSC). COMMUNITY SERVICES CENTER IS A NON-PROFIT MULTI-SERVICE CENTER THAT HAS BEEN PROVIDING SERVICES IN ROOSEVELT COUNTY SINCE 1965, HOSTING THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM SINCE 1981. THE CENTER PROVIDES SERVICES AND EXPANDED OPPORTUNITIES FOR CHILDREN, YOUTH, FAMILIES, AND THE ELDERLY OF PORTALES AND ROOSEVELT COUNTY. THE MISSION OF COMMUNITY SERVICES CENTER (CSC) IS TO PROVIDE ON-GOING OPPORTUNITIES TO EMPOWER ALL OF THE PEOPLE OF ROOSEVELT COUNTY TO COLLABORATE IN REDUCING COMMUNITY PROBLEMS. THIS ENLIGHTENED CONCEPT WILL BECOME THE NORM OF THE COMMUNITY.AN ESTIMATED 8 FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE COMMUNITY OF ROOSEVELT COUNTY. OF THIS NUMBER 8 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE, TUTORING, OUT-OF-SCHOOL TIME, SUMMER LEARNING AND OUT OF CLASSROOM SUPPORT.THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE 3-YEAR GRANT, THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE ADDRESSED THE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY BY MEETING OR EXCEEDING THE OUTCOMES; NUMBER OF CHILDREN DEMONSTRATING GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS AND NUMBER OF STUDENTS WITH IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE.THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $24,407 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $58,984 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY: THE MISSION OF THE CITY OF ALAMOGORDO: THE CITY OF ALAMOGORDO IS A MUNICIPAL CORPORATION THAT EXISTS SOLELY FOR THE PURPOSE OF PROVIDING THE BEST POSSIBLE SERVICES TO OUR CUSTOMERS - THE CITIZENS OF ALAMOGORDO. WE ARE COMMITTED TO PROVIDING THESE SERVICES WITH HONESTY, INTEGRITY, COMPASSION, FAIRNESS AND A COMMITMENT TO EXCELLENCE. PART OF OUR MISSION IS TO PROVIDE VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES FOR PERSONS 55 AND OLDER, WHICH IN TURN HELPS US PROVIDE AN ENVIRONMENT OFFERING SUPPORT, EDUCATION, RECREATION, NUTRITION AND ENTERTAINMENT FOR ELDERLY RESIDENTS IN ALAMOGORDO AND THE SURROUNDING AREAS. OUR GOAL IS TO HELP SENIORS ACHIEVE AND MAINTAIN A VITAL, PRODUCTIVE ROLE IN LIFE EITHER THROUGH VOLUNTEERISM OR AS A CLIENT RECEIVING THESE SERVICES. FUNDING SOURCES: NEW MEXICO AGING & LONG TERM SERVICES ARE OUR ONLY FUNDING SOURCE. WE CURRENTLY DO NOT RECEIVE ANY FEDERAL FUNDING - HOWEVER, WE ARE REQUESTING $67,500 IN NON-FEDERAL FUNDING TO HELP SUPPORT 13 VSY'S. SERVICE CATEGORIES: ELEMENTARY EDUCATION COMMUNITY NEEDS: OTERO COUNTY AND THE CITY OF ALAMOGORDO HAVE A GREAT NEED FOR LITERACY PROGRAMS. OVER 25% OF OUR LOCAL SCHOOL AGE CHILDREN SPEAK MORE THAT ONE LANGUAGE, REPORTING THAT ENGLISH IS NOT THEIR FIRST LANGUAGE AND THEY HAVE LIMITED USE OF ENGLISH AT HOME. RESEARCH-BASED METHODS: STUDENTS IDENTIFIED BY TEACHERS AND ASSISTED BY FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL IMPROVE IN THE AREA OF LITERACY AND MATH. THEIR SOCIAL SKILLS WILL ALSO IMPROVE AS A RESULT OF THEIR INCREASED CONFIDENCE. PRE AND POST TESTS WILL BE USED TO MEASURE GAINS IN LITERACY AND MATH. SOCIAL SKILL DEVELOPMENT WILL ALSO BE MEASURED BY THE TEACHERS AND REPORTING ON BEHAVIOR SKILLS AND INCREASED LITERACY SKILLS AND WILL BE REFLECTED ON REPORT CARDS THROUGHOUT THE YEAR. OUTCOMES: THOSE STUDENTS IDENTIFIED BY TEACHERS WILL HAVE REACHED THE GOAL OF READING AT THE STUDENT'S CURRENT GRADE LEVER OR HIGHER.

CONCILIO CAMPESINO DEL SUDOESTE INC. (CONCILIO CDS INC.) IS A 501(C)3 PRIVATE COMMUNITY-BASED NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATION THAT HAS BEEN IN EXISTENCE SINCE 1972 IN SOUTHERN NM.  ORGANIZATION HAS A SERVICE HISTORY IN ADDRESSING NEEDS IN SENIOR ISSUES, HEALTH ISSUES, SOCIAL JUSTICE, AND SOCIAL SERVICES.  WE SERVE STATE-WIDE IN NM AND ITS SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES.  THE COMMUNITIES BEING SERVED BY ORGANIZATION INCLUDE AREAS THAT ARE FEDERALLY DESIGNATED AS A MEDICALLY UNDERSERVED AREAS.  THE POPULATION THAT WE SERVE INCLUDES, BUT NOT LIMITED: SENIORS, YOUTH, FAMILIES, MIGRANT/SEASONAL FARM WORKERS & THEIR FAMILIES, IMMIGRANTS, AND A LARGE PERCENT OF PEOPLE WHO ARE MONOLINGUAL SPANISH OR BILINGUAL.  ORGANIZATION ADDRESSES HEALTH DISPARITIES, ECONOMIC CRISIS, POVERTY, EDUCATION, HUNGER, AND OTHER AREAS THROUGH COMMUNITY VOLUNTARISM. OUR MISSION: TO ELIMINATE POVERTY THROUGH THE PROVISION OF MULTI-GENERATIONAL CIVIC ENGAGEMENT OPPORTUNITIES AND TO SERVE OUR COMMUNITY WITH PASSION AND COMMITMENT.

AN ESTIMATED 67 FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THE PROGRAM.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE:

1.	ASSIST TEACHERS BY HELPING IMPLEMENTING TEACHER APPROVED ACTIVITIES THAT FOCUS ON CHILDREN ACHIEVING READING, MATH AND SOCIAL BEHAVIOR GOALS AS IDENTIFIED. THESE ACTIVITIES WILL BE PROVIDED FIVE DAYS A WEEK ON A ONE TO ONE STUDENT TO FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM VOLUNTEER RATIO. THESE STUDENTS ARE IDENTIFIED BY THE TEACHER AS NEEDING ASSISTANCE IN ORDER TO ACHIEVE THEIR INDIVIDUALIZED PROGRAM GOALS.

THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS SHALL WORK AT 11 VOLUNTEER SITES THROUGHOUT VALENCIA COUNTY. EACH STUDENTS IDENTIFIED BY THEIR TEACHER OR SUPERVISOR AS NEEDING ASSISTANCE IN READING, LITERACY, MATH, WRITING, COGNITIVE, SOCIAL, EMOTIONAL AND MENTORING SKILLS SHALL RECEIVE ONE TO ONE ASSISTANCE FROM THE FGP VOLUNTEER, OR IN SOME CASES MAY BE GROUPED INTO SMALLER GROUPS IN ORDER TO IMPROVE THEIR SOCIAL AND BEHAVIORAL SKILLS. THE GOAL WITH THIS TYPE OF INTERVENTION IS TO IMPROVE THE STUDENTS SOCIAL SKILLS AND QUALITY OF LIFE IN GENERAL.

THE SPONSOR ORGANIZATION IS THE DEMING LUNA COUNTY COMMISSION ON AGING, INC. (COA).  THE COA IS A NON-PROFIT 501(C)(3) CORPORATION OPERATING AS A SERVICE ORGANIZATION IN LUNA COUNTY, NEW MEXICO SINCE 1976.  THE COA HAS BEEN THE LEADER IN IMPLEMENTING SERVICES AND PROGRAMS IN LUNA COUNTY WITH A STRONG MISSION OF PROMOTING INDEPENDENCE, PRESERVING DIGNITY, AND ENHANCING THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR A DIVERSE POPULATION OF OLDER ADULTS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES IN OUR COUNTY.  OUR ORGANIZATION ADVOCATES AND PROVIDES SUPPORTIVE PERSON-TO-PERSON SERVICES TO OLDER, LOW-INCOME ADULTS WHO HAVE HEALTH AND FUNCTIONAL LIMITATIONS, ENABLING THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE IN A DIGNIFIED MANNER WITHIN OUR COMMUNITY.  THE COA CURRENTLY OFFERS OPPORTUNITIES FOR OLDER ADULTS THROUGH PROGRAMS LIKE THE SENIOR EMPLOYMENT PROGRAM, THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT, SENIOR COMPANION AND RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAMS.

FOR OUR FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) PROJECT, AN ESTIMATED THIRTEEN (13) VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE SERVICE WITHIN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF EDUCATION THROUGH THE DEMING PUBLIC SCHOOL DISTRICT AND HEAD START PROGRAMS LOCATED IN THE COMMUNITY.  FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE DEVELOPMENTAL, SOCIAL AND INTERPERSONAL SKILLS TO IDENTIFIED CHILDREN PRE-K THROUGH SIXTH GRADE THROUGH A NETWORK OF ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS AND HEAD START PROGRAMS. 

AT THE END OF A TWELVE MONTH PERFORMANCE PERIOD, THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES FOR FOUR STATIONS WILL BE CHILDREN WHO HAVE DEVELOPED SKILLS THAT WILL ASSIST WITH THEIR ADVANCEMENT TO THE NEXT GRADE LEVEL.  THESE SKILLS WILL HAVE ASSISTED THEM IN AREAS SUCH AS READING, MATH AND LANGUAGE ARTS AS WELL AS DEVELOPING SOCIAL SKILLS FOR RELATIONSHIP DEVELOPMENT.

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT TO OUR FGP PROJECT IS $5,100 DOLLARS.  THE PROJECT WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED WITH STATE FUNDS OF $61,960.  THE PROGRAM WILL ALSO RECEIVE $7,012 OF IN-KIND FUNDS FROM THE CITY OF DEMING.  THESE AMOUNTS TOTAL $68,972 (NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES).

THE COUNTIES OF EDDY AND LEA, LOCATED IN THE SOUTHEASTERN SECTION OF THE STATE OF NEW MEXICO, ARE KNOWN FOR THEIR NATURAL WONDERS, SUCH AS CARLSBAD CAVERNS AND THE LINCOLN NATIONAL FOREST.  EDDY COUNTY HAS A POPULATION OF 58,460; AND LEA COUNTY HAS A POPULATION OF 70,794. IN 2018, TWENTY-SIX(26) PERCENT OF THE POPULATION IN EDDY COUNTY, AND THIRTY ONE (31) PERCENT IN LEA COUNTY, WERE CHILDREN UNDER THE AGE OF 18. OF THESE, 15% IN EDDY COUNTY AND 14% IN LEA COUNTY LIVED BELOW THE POVERTY LEVEL.  THE POPULATION IS STEADILY INCREASING DUE TO THE EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES SPURRED BY THE BOOMING INDUSTRIES OIL AND GAS. THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM, SPONSORED BY THE SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO COMMUNITY ACTION CORPORATION HAS SERVED THE COMMUNITIES FOR 55 YEARS.  
 THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR THE GRANT RENEWAL APPLICATION IS EDUCATION. THE OBJECTIVES ARE SCHOOL READINESS AND K-12 SUCCESS.  TWENTY FIVE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS (INPUTS) WILL TUTOR 125 CHILDREN IN THREE HEAD START PROGRAMS AND EIGHT K-12 SCHOOLS IN EDDY AND LEA COUNTIES (TARGETS). FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL ASSIST CHILDREN ONE-ON-ONE AND IN SMALL GROUPS, TO IMPROVE/ DEVELOP THEIR LANGUAGE/LITERACY AND SOCIAL SKILLS (SERVICE ACTIVITIES). THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES WILL BE THE NUMBER OF CHILDREN DEMONSTRATING GAINS IN - SCHOOL READINESS IN TERMS OF SOCIAL AND/OR EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT, SCHOOL READINESS IN TERMS OF LITERACY SKILLS, AND THE NUMBER OF CHILDREN WITH IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY AND/OR MATH. 
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $85,986 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $122,447 NM STATE FUNDS.

THE CITY OF SANTA FE, NEW MEXICO, DIVISION OF SENIOR SERVICES MISSION IS TO OFFER PROGRAMS AND SERVICES DESIGNED TO ALLOW OLDER ADULTS TO REMAIN LIVING IN THEIR OWN HOMES AS COMFORTABLY AND AS INDEPENDENTLY AS POSSIBLE, AND TO HOPEFULLY AVOID INSTITUTIONALIZATION. ONE WAY OF ACCOMPLISHING THIS IS THROUGH VOLUNTEERING IN OUR SANTA FE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM WHERE THEY HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO REMAIN ACTIVE AND SOCIALLY ENGAGED. WHEN OLDER ADULTS CONTRIBUTE TO THE WELL-BEING OF YOUTH, IT CULTIVATES A SENSE OF PURPOSE AND EXTENDS BENEFITS BOTH WAYS.  THE 2014 STUDY CONDUCTED BY SCIENCE DAILY STATES THAT ?OLDER ADULTS WHO STAY ACTIVE BY VOLUNTEERING ARE GETTING MORE OUT OF IT THAN JUST AN ALTRUISTIC FEELING ? THEY ARE RECEIVING A HEALTH BOOST TOO, RESEARCHERS REPORT.  VOLUNTEERING IS ASSOCIATED WITH REDUCTION IN SYMPTOMS OF DEPRESSION, BETTER OVERALL HEALTH, FEWER FUNCTIONAL LIMITATIONS, AND GREATER LONGEVITY.
 
THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM, THE FIRST NATIONAL INTERGENERATIONAL PROGRAM, WAS CREATED IN 1963 AS A COMPONENT OF THE WAR ON POVERTY. ITS PRIMARY PURPOSE IS TO PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR LOW-INCOME SENIORS (AGED 60 AND OVER) TO ENGAGE WITH CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL OR EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS WHILE REDUCING ISOLATION AND POVERTY AMONG THE ELDERLY. IN THIS CONTEXT, THE SANTA FE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM PROPOSES SERVING A PROJECTED 23 LOW-INCOME SENIOR VOLUNTEERS; ALL OF WHICH WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THE PROJECT IS EDUCATION WITH PRIMARY OBJECTIVES OF INCREASING SCHOOL READINESS AND K-12 SUCCESS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE ASSISTING THE IDENTIFIED CHILDREN IN CLASSROOMS, COMFORTING THEM AND PROVIDING MENTORING/TUTORING.  AT THE END OF THE ONE YEAR GRANT CYCLE, APPROXIMATELY 84 CHILDREN WILL HAVE EITHER SUCCESSFULLY BEEN PROMOTED TO THE NEXT GRADE LEVEL WITH THEIR PEERS, INCREASE TEST SCORES, AND INCREASE SOCIAL SKILLS AS WELL AS BOOSTING THE CHILD'S MORALE, CONFIDENCE AND SELF-ESTEEM. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $31,902 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $85,639 IN NEW MEXICO STATE FUNDS AND $128,254 IN LOCAL CITY FUNDS.

THE TAOS COUNTY SENIOR PROGRAM IS A LOCAL GOVERNMENT ENTITY WHICH COMPRISES FOUR SENIOR CENTERS IN TAOS COUNTY WITH ACTIVITIES AND SUPPORT SERVICES THAT CATER TO THE SPECIFIC NEEDS OF SENIORS. THESE CENTERS ADDRESS THE HEALTH, SOCIAL, RECREATIONAL, AND LOGISTICAL NEEDS OF THE ELDERLY POPULATION IN FOUR LOCATIONS. OUR SENIOR CENTERS SERVE APPROXIMATELY 400 OLDER ADULTS EACH DAY THROUGH A WIDE VARIETY OF PROGRAMS. OUR MISSION IS TO HELP SENIORS IMPROVE AND MAINTAIN A HEALTHY AND INDEPENDENT LIFESTYLE AND TO MAXIMIZE THEIR QUALITY OF LIFE. ACCORDING TO THE 2010 CENSUS THERE WERE 4559 SENIORS LIVING IN TAOS COUNTY, AND 536 LIVING FULL TIME IN THE EAGLE NEST / ANGEL FIRE AREA. MANY FAMILIES IN THE RURAL AREAS HAVE LIVED IN THE AREA THEIR WHOLE LIVES, AND WISH TO REMAIN IN THE AREA. ACCORDING TO THE 2012 AMERICAN COMMUNITY SURVEY THERE WERE APPROXIMATELY OVER 622 IDENTIFIED AS GRANDPARENTS WERE PRIMARY CAREGIVERS FOR THEIR GRANDCHILDREN. THERE WERE 8,232 MALE AND FEMALES OVER THE AGE OF 60 IN TAOS COUNTY WITH 3,857 BEING MALE AND 4,375 BEING FEMALE. THERE WERE 5,771 DISABLED PERSONS LIVING IN TAOS COUNTY. ALL AREAS ARE CONSIDERED VERY RURAL, WITH A POPULATION DENSITY OF 13 PERSONS PER SQ. MILE.
THE MAJORITY OF THE AREAS WHERE THE SENIORS LIVE ARE ON UNPAVED AND NON-MAINTAINED ROADS, WHICH CAUSES ISSUES IN THE WINTER AND RAINY MONTHS. OUTSIDE OF THE TOWN OF TAOS AREA, EMERGENCY TEAMS ARE ON VOLUNTEER BASIS, WHICH INCREASES THE TIME OF RESPONSE. THERE IS A HOSPITAL IN THE TOWN OF TAOS WHICH IS OVER AN HOUR DRIVE FROM THE FARTHEST MOST PART OF THE COUNTY, AND A MEDICAL CLINIC IN BOTH QUESTA AND CHAMISAL AREA, BUT IS ONLY OPEN MON-FRI REGULAR HOURS.
WE ARE CONSCIOUS OF THE CHANGING DEMOGRAPHICS IN OUR CENTER'S SERVICE AREA AND ARE COMMITTED TO GROWING AND ADAPTING OUR CENTERS TO MEET THE EMERGING NEEDS.

THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IS INTENDED TO ADDRESS THE CATEGORIES IDENTIFIED IN THE ELEMENTARY SCHOOL EDUCATION SYSTEMS. THE CATEGORIES IDENTIFY THE NEED FOR INDIVIDUAL ONE-TO-ONE INTERVENTION TO ASSIST CHILDREN WHO ARE STRUGGLING TO REACH THEIR SCHOOL READINESS AND LITERACY GOALS. STUDENTS HAVE SHOWN IMPROVEMENT IN GOALS SET BY TEACHER THROUGH WORK PLANS TO ACHIEVE SET ACCOMPLISHMENTS TO NEXT GRADE LEVEL OF ACHIEVEMENT PER IDENTIFIED CHILD. TEACHERS PROVIDE PRE/POST TESTS, DI BELS AND THE CTBS BURGANCE SCORES OR TEACHERS SURVEY TO IDENTIFY THE LEVEL OF ACHIEVEMENT PER IDENTIFY CHILD. 

THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IS FUNDED FOR 15 CORPORATION VSY'S AND 16 NON-CORPORATION VSY'S FOR A TOTAL OF 31 VSY'S. SOME OF THE ACTIVITIES THAT THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS ENGAGE IN INCLUDE: PARTICIPATING IN GROUP ACTIVITIES, PLAYING GAMES, AND TELLING STORIES. ASSISTING WITH READING, TEACHING MANNERS AND SOCIAL SKILLS. HELPING CHILD TO FOLLOW DIRECTIONS, ACCOMPLISH WORK AND TO STAY FOCUS ON TASK. CLARIFYING AND INTERPRETING GROUP INSTRUCTIONS INTO INDIVIDUAL INSTRUCTIONS. ASSISTING WITH SELF-HELP SKILLS, COMFORTING AND PRAISING CHILD. 

THE PRIMARY FUNCTION OF OUR FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IS TO ASSIST OUR SCHOOL CHILDREN WITH LITERACY AND SCHOOL READINESS. 

AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOME WILL BE: STUDENTS WILL IMPROVE ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY AND IN SCHOOL READINESS OF SOCIAL AND OR EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT.

THE LEGAL APPLICANT IS THE CITY OF ALBUQUERQUE (THE CITY) DEPARTMENT OF SENIOR AFFAIRS (DSA). DSA OFFERS SENIORS AGE 50 AND BETTER A CONTINUUM OF SERVICES AND PROGRAMS FOR ACTIVE TO FRAIL ADULTS. PROGRAMS PROMOTE BOTH HEALTHY AGING AND INDEPENDENT LIVING THAT MEET THE INDIVIDUAL NEEDS OF SENIORS IN THE ALBUQUERQUE/BERNALILLO COUNTY AREA. DSA OPERATES SENIOR CENTERS, MULTI-GENERATIONAL CENTERS, SPORTS/FITNESS CENTERS, MEAL SITES, HOME SERVICES, CARE COORDINATION, AN INFORMATION & ASSISTANCE HOTLINE, SENIOR TRANSPORTATION, AND A CENTRAL KITCHEN. THE MISSION OF DSA IS TO BE A COMMUNITY LEADER, WHO IN PARTNERSHIP WITH OTHERS, INVOLVES SENIORS AND PEOPLE OF ALL AGES IN CREATING A COMMUNITY THAT ENHANCES EVERYONE'S QUALITY OF LIFE BY PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES TO ACHIEVE THEIR POTENTIAL, SHARE THEIR WISDOM, MAINTAIN THEIR INDEPENDENCE, AND LIVE WITH DIGNITY. 
     
     AN ESTIMATED 59 FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN APPROXIMATELY 50 VOLUNTEER STATIONS INCLUDING ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS, MIDDLE SCHOOLS AND/OR HIGH SCHOOLS, HEAD START PROGRAMS, PRE-ELEMENTARY DAYCARE CENTERS, AND HEALTH AND WELFARE PROGRAMS. TWELVE VOLUNTEER STATIONS ARE YEAR-LONG ASSIGNMENTS. VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES IN ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS WILL INCLUDE TUTORING CHILDREN AND PROVIDING READING SUPPORT. VOLUNTEERS SERVING IN MIDDLE SCHOOLS AND/OR HIGH SCHOOLS WILL MENTOR DISADVANTAGED YOUTH. VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES IN HEAD START PROGRAMS WILL INCLUDE ASSISTING IN CLASSROOMS AND MODELING PROPER SOCIAL SKILLS. VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES IN PRE-ELEMENTARY DAYCARE CENTERS AND HEALTH AND WELFARE PROGRAMS WILL INCLUDE CARING FOR AND COMFORTING INFANTS, TODDLERS, AND HOMELESS CHILDREN. ALTERNATE AND DUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE SEASONAL SERVICE IN ELEMENTARY SUMMER SCHOOL SESSIONS AND IN COMMUNITY CENTER SUMMER RECREATION PROGRAMS. 
     THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THE PROJECT IS EDUCATION WITH OBJECTIVES IN K-12 SUCCESS AND SCHOOL
READINESS. AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT, FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL HAVE SERVED OVER 375 UNDUPLICATED CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL OR EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS AND DISADVANTAGED YOUTH.
     OF THE CHILDREN SERVED IN OUTCOME-BASED WORK PLANS, 85% WILL HAVE IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY OR MATH, WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT, OR WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS IN TERMS OF SOCIAL AND/OR EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT. THE CHILDREN SERVED IN PRE-ELEMENTARY DAYCARE CENTERS, HEALTH AND WELFARE PROGRAMS, AND IN SEASONAL ASSIGNMENTS, WILL BE COMFORTED BY FORGING RELATIONSHIPS WITH FOSTER GRANDPARENTS.
     
     THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT AMOUNT OF $183,591 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $98,802 FROM THE NEW MEXICO AGING AND LONG-TERM SERVICES DEPARTMENT AND $173,409 FROM THE CITY OF ALBUQUERQUE.

HELP NEW MEXICO, INC. (HELPNM) IN RIO ARRIBA, SAN MIGUEL, MORA AND GUADALUPE COUNTIES HAVE BEEN OPERATING AND ASSISTING COMMUNITIES STATEWIDE FOR OVER 54 YEARS TO CREATE SELF-SUFFICIENCY AND PROMOTE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES TO STRENGTHEN FAMILIES THROUGHOUT NEW MEXICO.  ESTABLISHED IN 1965, HELPNM HAS PROVIDED SERVICES TO COUNTLESS LOW-INCOME, MIGRANT/SEASONAL FARMWORKERS, ABUSED AND NEGLECTED CHILDREN, DISABLED INDIVIDUALS, DISADVANTAGED YOUTH, AND SENIOR CITIZENS. HELPNM PROGRAMS INCLUDE ADULT EDUCATION, FINANCIAL LITERACY, ON THE JOB TRAINING, WORK EXPERIENCE, FAMILY OR INDIVIDUAL CASE MANAGEMENT, EARLY CHILDHOOD AND YOUTH DEVELOPMENT, EDUCATION, NUTRITION, AFFORDABLE HOUSING, EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE AND SENIOR PROGRAMS.  HELPNM WOULD LIKE TO CONTINUE TO SERVE OUR SENIOR POPULATION THROUGH THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP).  WE PROPOSE TO RENEW THE PROGRAM FOR CONTINUED OPERATION AND CONTINUE TO SERVE A MINIMUM OF 66 VOLUNTEERS. ALL OF THE PROPOSED FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS IN LOCAL SCHOOLS, AS THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. ACTIVITIES WILL BE BASED ON THE SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL SUPPORT AND TUTORING/MENTORING AS PRESCRIBED IN THE PERFORMANCE MEASURES FOR FGP. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, STUDENTS WILL SHOW IMPROVEMENT GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS, INCREASED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT AND/OR POSITIVE SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL SKILLS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $91,729.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $307,353.00 OF STATE FUNDING.

CITIZENS FOR THE DEVELOPMENTALLY DISABLED, INC. (CDD) PROVIDES DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH CONTRACT SERVICES THROUGH THE FAMILY, INFANT & TODDLER PROGRAM FOR CHILDREN BIRTH -- THREE YEARS OF AGE, A DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES WAIVER PROGRAM FOR HANDICAPPED ADULTS FROM THE AGE OF 21 THROUGH ADULTHOOD, AND SPONSORS THE COLFAX COUNTY FOSTER GRANDPARENT AND SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAMS. CDD IS APPLYING FOR ELEVEN VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS AND $78,015 IN STATE FUNDING TO SUPPORT THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM  AND $5096 FROM CNCS

THE SERVICE CATEGORIES THE PROJECT WILL ADDRESS ARE PRE-ELEMENTARY, ELEMENTARY EDUCATION, TUTORING & CHILD LITERACY (MID-SCHOOL) AND BENEFITS TO VOLUNTEERS.  THE ELEMENTARY EDUCATION WORK PLAN INCLUDES PERFORMANCE MEASURES. THE PROGRAM WILL COLLECT MID-YEAR AND END-YEAR EVALUATION FORMS FROM VOLUNTEER STATION REPRESENTATIVES TO MEASURE PERFORMANCE. ANOTHER MEASUREMENT TOOL USED IS VOLUNTEER SATISFACTION SURVEYS. THE PROJECT'S ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES ARE:

* PRE-ELEMENTARY CHILDREN RECEIVING SERVICES WILL BE ABLE TO ADAPT TO THEIR SCHOOL SCHEDULE AND SEPARATION FROM PARENTS AND/OR BE ABLE TO ENTER KINDERGARTEN.
* INTERMEDIATE OUTCOME IS; EIGHTY PERCENT OF ELEMENTARY STUDENTS WILL IMPROVE THEIR ACADEMIC, ORGANIZATIONAL AND BEHAVIORAL SKILLS BECAUSE OF THE HELP OF A FOSTER GRANDPARENT.  
* END OUTCOME IS; NINETY PERCENT OF ELEMENTARY STUDENTS WILL ADVANCE TO THE NEXT GRADE LEVEL.
* MENTORED STUDENTS (MID-SCHOOL) WILL IMPROVE IN ACADEMIC, ORGANIZATIONAL AND BEHAVIORAL SKILLS BECAUSE OF THE HELP OF A FOSTER GRANDPARENT THEY WILL ADAPT TO THE CHANGE OF MID- SCHOOL SCHEDULES. 
* VOLUNTEERS WILL BENEFIT BY HAVING SOMETHING MEANINGFUL TO DO, SUPPLEMENTAL INCOME FOR LOW-INCOME VOLUNTEERS AND ALL VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE IMPROVED QUALITY OF LIFE. 

THE ELEMENTARY EDUCATION WORK PLAN ADDRESSES COMMUNITY NEEDS AND THE CORPORATION'S STRATEGIC PLAN; EDUCATION, BY IMPROVING EDUCATIONAL AND BEHAVIORAL OUTCOMES OF STUDENTS IN LOW-ACHIEVING PRE-ELEMENTARY, ELEMENTARY AND MIDDLE SCHOOL. 

THE BENEFITS TO VOLUNTEERS WORK PLAN ADDRESS CNCS GOAL 2 (STRENGTHEN NATIONAL SERVICE SO THAT PARTICIPANTS ENGAGED IN CNCS-SUPPORTED PROGRAMS CONSISTENTLY FIND SATISFACTION, MEANING AND OPPORTUNITY.) BY SUPPORTING PARTICIPANTS TO FIND MEANING IN THEIR SERVICE EXPERIENCE AND REMAIN HIGHLY ENGAGED IN THEIR COMMUNITIES.

THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) IS A NATIONAL PROGRAM ESTABLISHED IN 1965 TO PROVIDE OLDER ADULTS WITH A USEFUL WAY TO SERVE THEIR COMMUNITIES IN THEIR RETIREMENT YEARS, GIVING THEM THE SATISFACTION THAT COMES FROM BEING NEEDED AND SERVING OTHERS. CURRY COUNTY HAS BEEN AN ACTIVE PARTICIPANT OF FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM SINCE 1986, POSITIVELY AFFECTING THE LIVES OF MANY SENIOR FOSTER GRANDPARENTS AND POSITIVELY IMPACTING THE ACADEMIC FUTURE AS WELL AS PROVIDING EMOTIONAL SUPPORT OF THE STUDENTS THEY HAVE HELPED. AN ESTIMATED NINE (9) FEDERALLY FUNDED AND THREE (3) NON-FEDERALLY FUNDED  VSY WILL SERVE IN THE CURRY COUNTY FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM. OF THIS NUMBER TWELVE (12) VSY WILL BE PLACED IN WORK PLANS THAT RESULT IN NATIONAL PERFORMANCE MEASURE OUTCOMES IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THE PROJECT WHICH IS EDUCATION WITH OBJECTIVES: K-12 SUCCESS. ACTIVITIES WILL BE CONDUCTED IN PUBLIC SCHOOL CLASSROOMS AND WILL INCLUDE TUTORING STUDENTS WITH SPECIAL NEEDS AND/OR DISADVANTAGED YOUTH IN THE AREAS OF READING, ENGLISH AS A SECOND LANGUAGE, AND MENTORING IN BEHAVIOR AND SOCIAL SKILLS. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT WE ANTICIPATE THAT THE STUDENTS RECEIVING SERVICES WILL HAVE IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY, LANGUAGE SKILLS, BEHAVIOR AND SOCIAL SKILLS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $60,693 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY OVER $30,000 FROM NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

THE KANSAS CITY FOSTER GRANDPARENTS (KCFGP) PROGRAM OF JACKSON, CLAY, AND PLATTE COUNTIES SPONSORED BY RECONCILIATION SERVICES (RS) WILL HAVE AN ESTIMATED 86 VOLUNTEERS SERVING ANNUALLY DURING THIS GRANT PERIOD. OF THIS NUMBER, 99% OF KCFGPS WILL BE SERVING IN OUTCOME-BASED ASSIGNMENTS. OUR PROGRAM SERVICE ACTIVITIES IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF EDUCATION INCLUDE SCHOOL-BASED MENTORING, ASSISTING CHILDREN IN THE CLASSROOM, AND COMFORTING CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL OR EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD, OUR ESTIMATED 90+ KCFGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE NEARLY 267,000 SERVICE HOURS AND PROVIDE PERSON-TO-PERSON SUPPORT TO AROUND 775 YOUTH. THE VALUABLE SERVICES PROVIDED BY KCFGPS ENABLES YOUNG PEOPLE TO IMPROVE SOCIALLY, EMOTIONALLY, AND ACADEMICALLY. IN ADDITION, ACTIVE PARTICIPATION IN THE KCFGP PROGRAM HELPS OUR AGING SENIORS COMBAT SOCIAL ISOLATION AND CONTRIBUTES TO THEIR IMPROVED PHYSICAL AND MENTAL HEALTH. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $480,410, INCLUDING THE MUCH ANTICIPATED STIPEND INCREASE, AND $4,000 INCREASE IS SUPPLEMENTED BY $53,379 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

QUAD AREA COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY, INC. SENIOR CORPS FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM WILL OVERSEE THE PLACEMENT OF 94 FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS SERVING IN THE SEVEN PARISH AREA WHICH INCLUDE: ASCENSION, EAST FELICIANA, LIVINGSTON, TANGIPHOA, ST. HELENA, WASHINGTON AND WEST FELICIANA.  FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL TUTOR CHILDREN UNDER THE AGE OF 21 YEARS, TO STRENGTHEN EDUCATIONAL ACADEMICS AND SOCIAL SKILL THROUGH A NETWORK OF 32 STATIONS WHICH INCLUDE PUBLIC SCHOOLS, HEAD START CENTERS AND HANDICAPPED FACILITY. THE PRIMARY FOCUS WILL BE TO IMPROVE EDUCATIONAL OUTCOMES FOR THE ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED CHILDREN ENROLLED IN THE HEAD START CENTERS WITH EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES TO PREPARE THEM FOR SCHOOL READINESS, TUTOR ELEMENTARY STUDENTS TO IMPROVE THEIR ACADEMIC AND SOCIAL SKILLS FOR EDUCATIONAL SUCCESS IN K-12TH GRADES AND TO IMPROVE HANDICAPPED WITH ABILITIES TO WORK IN OUTSIDE AREAS OF THE COMMUNITY.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $509,938.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $64,025.00 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES WHICH INCLUDE DAILY LUNCHES AND BREAKFAST FOR VOLUNTEERS, ANNUAL PHYSICAL EXAMS, CRIMINAL HISTORY (STATE AND FEDERAL) THROUGH TRUESCREEN AND FIELDPRINT, BACKGROUND CHECKS, VOLUNTEER TRAINING, USE OF FACILITIES FOR TRAINING, AND OPERATING EXPENSES.

BIG BROTHERS BIG SISTERS OF SOUTHWEST LOUISIANA'S FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM WILL HAVE AN ESTIMATED 64 FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WHO WILL SERVE CHILDREN IN 21 STATIONS IN CALCASIEU, ACADIA, VERNON AND JEFF DAVIS PARISHES. THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL WORK AT LEAST 30 MINUTES PER DAY, PER DESIGNATED SUBJECT (READING AND MATH), PER ASSIGNED STUDENT. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS K-12 SUCCESS AND SCHOOL READINESS. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOME IS THAT STUDENTS WILL SCORE AT AVERAGE OR ABOVE AVERAGE ON BENCHMARK TESTING IN MATH AND READING. 

THE FGP PROGRAM WILL FOCUS ON 3 OUTCOME AREAS: 
1. ASSIST STUDENTS IN K-12 IN IMPROVING THEIR READING SKILLS AND MATH SKILLS TO HELP THEM REACH GRADE LEVEL BY GRADE THREE, INCREASING LEAP, ILEAP, AND BENCHMARK SCORES TO BASIC OR ABOVE BASIC. 
2. ASSIST STUDENTS WHO ARE IN GRADES K-12 WHO HAVE LITTLE TO NO ASSISTANCE AT HOME WITH HOMEWORK IN IMPROVING THEIR MATH AND READING SKILLS TO HELP THEM REACH GRADE LEVEL IN THESE SUBJECTS BY GRADE THREE, INCREASING LEAP, ILEAP AND BENCH MARK TEST SCORES TO BASIC OR ABOVE BASIC. 
3. ASSIST HEAD START CHILDREN IN COGNITIVE ABILITIES IN EARLY LITERACY AND MATH SKILLS PRIOR TO ENTERING KINDERGARTEN. 

DATA WILL BE COLLECTED FROM THE STATIONS REPORTED BY TEACHERS AND/OR SUPERVISORS TWICE DURING THE SCHOOL YEAR. 

TEACHERS WILL DOCUMENT CHILD PARTICIPATION IN FGP PROGRAM ACTIVITIES AS SHOWN ON THE CLASSROOM ATTENDANCE LOG/TEACHER SURVEY. DATA COLLECTION WILL BE INCLUDED ON A SPREAD SHEET SEPARATED BY STATION AND FGP PROGRAM WHICH WILL BE UPDATED IN JANUARY AND AGAIN IN MAY WITH INFORMATION COLLECTED FROM BENCHMARK SCORES AND/OR STANDARDIZED TESTS. DATA WILL THEN BE TOTALED AND REPORTED. EXPECTED RESULTS INCLUDE GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS, IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE AND ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT WOULD BE $ 310,813.

THE UNIVERSITY OF LOUISIANA MONROE, COLLEGE OF BUSINESS AND SOCIAL SCIENCES, UNDER THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, MS. RITA MASSEY, WILL OVERSEE THE CADDO/BOSSIER FGP PROGRAM.  NEVA JONES , FGP DIRECTOR (FULL TIME DIRECTOR )WILL ADMINISTER THE FGP PROGRAM FUNDED FOR 57 VSY'S.  FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL TUTOR AND MENTOR CHILDREN TO STRENGTHEN EDUCATIONAL ACADEMICS AND SOCIAL SKILLS THROUGH A NETWORK OF NON-PROFIT VOLUNTEER STATIONS SUCH AS HEAD START CENTERS AND PUBLIC SCHOOLS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THE PROJECT WILL BE K-12 -SUCCESS EDUCATION AND SCHOOL READINESS FOCUS AREAS (ED2, ED5, ED23, ED24).  AT THE END OF THE GRANT PERIOD THE NUMBER OF CHILDREN THAT COMPLETED PARTICIPATION IN CNCS SUPPORTED EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION PROGRAMS WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS IN TERMS OF SOCIAL AND/OR EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT.  THE NUMBER OF STUDENTS IN GRADES K-12 THAT PARTICIPATE IN THE MENTORING OR TUTORING OR OTHER EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMMING, INCLUDING CNCS-SUPPORTED SERVICE-LEARNING WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT.  
THE LA DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION (LDE) FOR 2019 INDICATES 46% OF STUDENTS ENTERING KINDERGARTEN ARE NOT ACADEMICALLY AND DEVELOPMENTALLY READY TO SUCCEED.  STUDENTS WHO BEGIN KINDERGARTEN UNPREPARED ARE LIKELY TO EXPERIENCE DIFFICULTY IN THEIR ACADEMIC ENDEAVORS.  LDE DEVELOPED THE SCHOOL READINESS REPORT TO ENGAGE STAKEHOLDERS TO RECOGNIZE THAT CHILDREN COME TO SCHOOL WITH MANY EXPERIENCES IN MULTIPLE SETTINGS AND RESOURCES FOR SCHOOL READINESS.  SCHOOL READINESS DESCRIBES THE CAPABILITIES OF CHILDREN, THEIR FAMILIES, SCHOOL, AND COMMUNITIES TO BEST PROMOTE STUDENT SUCCESS IN KINDERGARTEN AND BEYOND.  EACH COMPONENT PLAYS AN ESSENTIAL ROLE IN DEVELOPMENT OF SCHOOL READINESS.  A READY CHILD IS PREPARED SOCIALLY, PERSONALLY, PHYSICALLY, AND INTELLECTUALLY WITHIN THE COGNITIVE DOMAINS OF LITERACY, MATH, MOTOR DEVELOPMENT AND SOCIAL/EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENTS.  A STUDY PUBLISHED IN THE JOURNAL OF GERIATRICS AND GERONTOLOGICAL EDUCATION, REPORTS THAT 3-4 YEAR OLDS WHO PARTICIPATE IN A 9-MONTH INTERGENERATIONAL PROGRAM WERE MORE WILLING TO SHARE, HELP AND COOPERATE WITH AN OLDER PERSON THAN THOSE WITHOUT EXPERIENCE WITH THE ELDERLY.
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $369,009.00 IS REQUESTED ANNUALLY, PENDING CONTINUED FUNDING AVAILABILITY.

CATHOLIC CHARITIES OF THE DIOCESE OF BATON ROUGE HAS PROVIDED LIFE-SUSTAINING SOCIAL SERVICES THROUGHOUT A 12 CIVIL-PARISH REGION SINCE 1964. WE PROVIDE A WIDE ARRAY OF COMMUNITY BASED SERVICES TO LOW AND MODERATE INCOME POPULATIONS. THE VAST MAJORITY OF INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES, APPROXIMATELY 95% RECEIVING SERVICES FROM CCDBR FALL BELOW FEDERAL POVERTY GUIDELINES. OUR SERVICES INCLUDE MENTAL HEALTH COUNSELING, HOMELESSNESS PREVENTION PROGRAMS, DOMESTIC AND INTERNATIONAL ADOPTION SERVICES, POST-ADOPTION SERVICES, EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION PROGRAMS, EMPLOYMENT SERVICES, DISASTER RECOVERY CASE MANAGEMENT, THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM, HOUSING FOR HOMELESS PREGNANT WOMEN, IMMIGRATION AND REFUGEE SERVICES, AND TRANSITIONAL HOUSING FOR FAMILIES WITH CHILDREN. CATHOLIC CHARITIES PROGRAMS ARE DESIGNED TO ASSIST THOSE MOST VULNERABLE IN OUR COMMUNITY ACHIEVE A HIGHER LEVEL OF SELF-SUFFICIENCY AND SUCCESS AS FAMILIES, HOUSEHOLDS AND NEIGHBORHOODS. WE SERVE THOSE MOST IN NEED REGARDLESS OF FAITH, DEPLOYING CREATIVE AND EFFECTIVE SERVICES AIMED AT REDUCING THE IMPACT OF POVERTY.. FOR A NUMBER OF YEARS, CATHOLIC CHARITIES OF THE DIOCESE OF BATON ROUGE HAS BEEN THE LEADING REFERRAL AGENCY OF THE BATON ROUGE UNITED WAY'S 211 INFORMATION LINE.
FOSTER GRANDPARENTS PROVIDE A VITAL SERVICE TO COMMUNITIES THEY SERVE. 
THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM RECRUITS NURTURING, CARING AND LOVING SENIOR VOLUNTEERS TO SERVE AS MENTORS FOR AT-RISK YOUTH IN ELEMENTARY EDUCATION AND SCHOOL READINESS. THE SUCCESS OF CHILDREN ARE MEASURED BY OUR INITIAL ASSESSMENT FORM WHICH INCLUDES ASSIGNMENT PLANS, TUTORING LOGS, AND TEACHER SURVEYS. OUR LONG TERM OUTCOMES FOR STUDENTS ARE TO IMPROVE READING SKILLS AND BE PROMOTED TO THE NEXT GRADE LEVEL. MANY FOSTER GRANDPARENTS HAVE WORKED IN SCHOOL SETTINGS PRIOR TO RETIREMENT AND HAVE A DESIRE TO GIVE BACK BY EDUCATING, NURTURING AND ASSISTING CHILDREN TO ACHIEVE ACADEMIC AND BEHAVIORAL GOALS. 
A TOTAL OF 63 FGP FUNDED VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE MORE THAN 212 CHILDREN BETWEEN THE AGES OF 3-12. CHILDREN READING BELOW THEIR GRADE LEVEL WILL RECEIVE ONE HOUR TUTORING SESSIONS, 3 TIMES PER WEEK, FOR A NINE MONTH SCHOOL TERM. SOME OF THE FGP ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE ONE ON ONE AND SMALL GROUP TUTORING, WITH A FOCUS ON READING READINESS SKILLS AND LANGUAGE DEVELOPMENT. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THE PROJECT IS EDUCATION, WITH A HEAVY EMPHASIS ON K-12 SUCCESS AND SCHOOL READINESS. AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT, WE PROJECT THAT 80% OF STUDENTS PARTICIPATING IN THE PROGRAM WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVED SCHOOL READINESS, ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY AND/OR MATH, IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT AND IMPROVED ATTENDANCE.

THE SENIOR RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT AGENCY (SRDA) IS THE SPONSOR OF THE PUEBLO FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP). SRDA HAS SUCCESSFULLY ADMINISTERED THE FGP PROGRAM FOR 
OVER 40 YEARS. THE MISSION OF SRDA IS TO PROVIDE PROGRAMS AND PROJECTS THAT ENHANCE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR THE COMMUNITY OF SOUTHERN COLORADO. SRDA PROVIDES OPPORTUNITIES FOR INTERGENERATIONAL PROGRAMS AND DEVELOPS THE RESOURCES WHICH ENABLES SENIORS TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY.
 AN ESTIMATED 57 FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE SRDA FGP PROGRAM. 57 FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. VOLUNTEER SERVICE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE K-4TH GRADERS DAILY TUTORING IS DONE IN WRITING, READING, SPELLING AND/OR MATH SKILLS. PRE-K CHILDREN SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL FOCUS ON SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL AGE BENCHMARKS FOR SCHOOL READINESS. THE SERVICE AREAS WILL BE BOTH PUEBLO CITY AND COUNTY PUBLIC, CHARTERED AND FAITH-BASED SCHOOLS ALONG WITH HEADSTART PROGRAMS.
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT 780 STUDENTS IN K-4TH GRADES WILL GAIN IMPROVED ACADEMIC GRADE LEVEL PERFORMANCE AND PRE-K CHILDREN WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS.
 THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $292,450 ANNUALLY WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $32,495 ANNUALLY OF LOCAL CASH AND IN-KIND PER YEAR.

THE NAVAJO FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IS SUBMITTING ITS RENEWAL GRANT FOR FY2020, YEAR 1 OF A THREE YEAR GRANT. THE NAVAJO FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) STARTED IN AUGUST 28, 1965 ON THE NAVAJO NATION UNDER THE OFFICE OF NAVAJO NATION ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT. THE NAVAJO DIVISION OF HEALTH TOOK RESPONSIBILITY OF THE FGP IN THE MID-1980 UNDER THE NAVAJO AREA AGENCY ON AGING. THE DIVISION OF AGING AND LONG TERM CARE SUPPORT, FORMERLY THE NAVAJO AREA AGENCY ON AGING ADMINISTERS THE NAVAJO FGP.  THEY PROVIDE SERVICE TO DISADVANTAGE CHILDREN TO ENHANCE THEIR EDUCATIONAL ENDEAVORS. VOLUNTEERS SERVE AS A SOURCE OF ENCOURAGEMENT AND MENTORSHIP THAT MANY CHILDREN LACK IN THEIR HOME SETTING.  FGP VOLUNTEERS MAKE UNSELFISH AND VALUABLE CONTRIBUTIONS TO NAVAJO CHILDREN TEACHING THEM ABOUT THEIR CULTURE, WHICH INCLUDES WRITING AND SPEAKING THE NAVAJO LANGUAGE. DUE TO THE GENERATIONS OF CHILDREN THAT HAVE BEEN POSITIVELY AFFECTED, THE NAVAJO NATION VIEWS THE FGP AS A VITAL PART OF THE NAVAJO EDUCATION SYSTEM.
THE NAVAJO FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM HAVE TWO DISTINCT GOALS: (1) TO ENABLE PERSONS AGED 55 YEARS AND OLDER TO REMAIN PHYSICALLY, MENTALLY ACTIVE AND ENHANCE THEIR SELF-ESTEEM THROUGH CONTINUED PARTICIPATION IN NEEDED COMMUNITY SERVICES; (2) TO ENABLE CHILDREN WITH EITHER EXCEPTIONAL OR SPECIAL NEEDS TO ACHIEVE IMPROVED PHYSICAL, MENTAL, EMOTIONAL, AND SOCIAL DEVELOPMENT THROUGH MENTORING AND TUTORING. 
THE NAVAJO FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM CREATED THREE PERFORMANCE PLANS:
?	TUTORING ? PUBLIC SCHOOL:  FIFTY-THREE (53) VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE PROVIDED 55,332 SERVICE HOURS TO TWO HUNDRED AND TWELVE (212) STUDENTS BY THE END OF JUNE 30, 2021.  
?	COMMUNITY- BASED MENTORING:  TWENTY-ONE (21) VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE PROVIDED 21,924 SERVICE HOURS TO EIGHTY-FOUR (84) STUDENTS BY END OF JUNE 30, 2021.  
?	ASSISTING IN CLASSROOMS ? HEAD START:  TWENTY (20) VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE PROVIDED 20,880 SERVICE HOURS TO EIGHTY (80) STUDENTS BY END OF JUNE 30, 2021.  
THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM WILL ACHIEVE ITS PERFORMANCE PLANS BY COLLABORATING WITH LOCAL COMMUNITIES, ENHANCING EXISTING PARTNERSHIPS, ONGOING VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT, AND CREATING NEW STRATEGY TO RECRUIT AND RETAIN VOLUNTEERS.  FGP WILL HAVE PROVIDED 98,136 VOLUNTEER SERVICE HOURS WITH 94 VOLUNTEERS BY END OF JUNE 30, 2021.

THE CIVIC SERVICE INSTITUTE (CSI) AT NORTHERN ARIZONA UNIVERSITY (NAU) PROPOSES AN ESTIMATED 160 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL SERVE 129 VSYS TO MENTOR AND TUTOR OVER 750 CHILDREN AND YOUTH THROUGH PARTNERSHIPS WITH PRESCHOOLS, HEAD START CLASSROOMS, K-12 PUBLIC AND CHARTER SCHOOLS, AND OTHER NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS SERVING CHILDREN THROUGHOUT ARIZONA.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR PERIOD, AT LEAST 600 OF THE 750 CHILDREN AND YOUTH ASSISTED WILL SHOW IMPROVEMENT IN ACADEMICS OR IMPROVEMENT IN THEIR SOCIAL AND BEHAVIORAL SKILLS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS GRANT IS EDUCATION AND ALL 160 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS TO WORK WITH STUDENTS WHO HAVE SPECIAL NEEDS IN TUTORING, MENTORING, AND SCHOOL READINESS WORK PLANS. SOME OF THE ACTIVITIES IN THOSE WORK PLANS INCLUDE EARLY TEACHING LITERACY SKILLS AND PHONICS, TEACHING SONGS, MODELING APPROPRIATE SOCIAL BEHAVIORS, TUTORING IN MATH AND OTHER SUBJECTS AS ASSIGNED BY THE TEACHER, AND MENTORING TEEN PARENTS. THE CNCS INVESTMENT OF  $840,210 WILL BE MATCHED WITH $84,056 OF FOREGONE INDIRECT, CASH, AND IN-KIND/OTHER COSTS BY SPONSOR, AND $13,781 IN EXCESS SUPPORT.

AN ESTIMATED 57 FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL MENTOR CHILDREN IN PARTNERSHIP WITH NON-PROFIT CHILDCARE CENTERS, AFTER SCHOOL PROGRAMS, FAITH-BASED PRIVATE SCHOOLS AND ONE RICHMOND CITY PUBLIC SCHOOL SERVING CHILDREN WITH EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS. OF THE 57 VOLUNTEERS, 57 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: TUTORING IN AFTERSCHOOL PROGRAMS, MENTORING PRESCHOOLERS, AND PROVIDING CLASSROOM SUPPORT IN CHILD DEVELOPMENT CENTERS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT WE WILL DEMONSTRATE AN INCREASE IN THE NUMBER OF STUDENTS DEMONSTRATING GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS, AN INCREASE IN THE NUMBER OF STUDENTS WITH IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT, OR SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL SKILLS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $273,640 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $31,055 IN NONFEDERAL RESOURCES AND $270 IN EXCESS FUNDS.

THE MISSION OF THE PENINSULA FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (PFGP) IS TO SHARE TODAY, SHAPE TOMORROW, AND LEAVE A POSITIVE FOOTPRINT FOR THE FUTURE OF CHILDREN AND SENIOR CITIZENS THROUGHOUT THE PENINSULA.  FOR OVER 40 YEARS, THE HUNDREDS OF VOLUNTEERS THAT CHOOSE TO SERVE THE CHILDREN OF OUR COMMUNITY HAVE NOT JUST REPEATED THE WORDS OF THEIR MISSION BUT HAVE LIVED THEM AND GIVEN THOSE WORDS LIFE.  THE COMMITMENT OF OUR SENIOR CITIZENS IS NOTHING SHORT OF OUTSTANDING.  ALTHOUGH THE NATIONAL FOCUS OF THIS PROGRAM IS TO CONTRIBUTE TO IMPROVED EDUCATIONAL OUTCOMES...FOR CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL AND/OR EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS, THIS PROGRAM HAS GIVEN OUR SENIOR CITIZEN VOLUNTEERS AN IMPROVED LIFE OUTCOME. AS ONE OF OUR VOLUNTEERS SAID, THE CHILDREN LOVE US TO DEATH, NO, THEY LOVE US TO LIFE.  THEREFORE, THIS PFGP PROVIDES A UNIQUE MULTIGENERATIONAL IMPACT THAT IN FACT IMPROVES THE LIVABILITY OF OUR COMMUNITIES. THE PFGP SERVES HUNDREDS OF CHILDREN WITH 105 VOLUNTEERS IN A FIVE-CITY AREA (WILLIAMSBURG, YORK AND JAMES CITY COUNTIES, NEWPORT NEWS AND HAMPTON). THE PRIMARY FOCUS FOR THE PROGRAM IS TO PROVIDE MENTORING AND ACADEMIC ASSISTANCE TO STUDENTS, SPECIFICALLY THOSE WHOSE LEARNING MAY BE IMPACTED BY POVERTY, TO RAISE ACHIEVEMENT IN READING AND READING COMPREHENSION (LITERACY SKILLS). 
FOR SCHOOL YEAR 2020-2021, STUDENTS IN CHILD DEVELOPMENT CENTERS, HEAD START PROGRAMS, PRE-K, KINDERGARTEN AND TITLE I ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS WILL BE SERVED BY ONE-HUNDRED FIVE (105) SENIOR CITIZEN VOLUNTEERS, COMPLETING A TOTAL OF SEVENTY-FIVE (75) VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS (VSY) OR 78,300 VOLUNTEER HOURS (75 X 1,044 HOURS). THE VALUE OF VOLUNTEER TIME, WHICH IS MADE AVAILABLE BY INDEPENDENT SECTOR AND UPDATED ANNUALLY, IS CURRENTLY AT A RATE OF $25.43 PER HOUR WHEN CONSIDERING THE POTENTIAL COST OF REPLACING A VOLUNTEER WITH PAID STAFF. USING THIS FORMULA TO CONVERT OUR 75 VSYS TO A DOLLAR AMOUNT, THE TOTAL DOLLAR VALUE OF OUR PFGP VOLUNTEERS IS $1,991,169. 
THE PFGP IS REQUESTING $393,888 FROM THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE TO SUPPORT THE PROGRAM.  THE PFGP RECEIVES DIRECT LOCAL FUNDS OF $69,770 FROM THE CITY OF HAMPTON (PENDING APPLICATION APPROVAL) AND $20,000 FROM THE CITY OF NEWPORT NEWS (RECOMMENDED BY CITY BUDGET OFFICE, AWAITING FINAL APPROVAL BY CITY COUNCIL) TOTALING $89,770. THE REQUESTED BUDGET WILL SUPPORT VOLUNTEER STIPENDS, INSURANCE, THE ANNUAL RECOGNITION LUNCHEON, ORIENTATION FOR NEW VOLUNTEERS, MONTHLY IN-SERVICE TRAINING FOR VOLUNTEERS, UNIFORMS, STAFF SALARIES (2 FULL TIME AND 1 PART TIME) AND CRIMINAL BACKGROUND CHECKS FOR ALL PARTICIPANTS AS REQUIRED BY THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE.
 THERE ARE 32 VOLUNTEER STATIONS THROUGHOUT THE 5 LOCALITIES. THREE SITES ARE SUMMER SCHOOL PROGRAMS AND THE REMAINING 29 SITES ARE OPEN THROUGHOUT THE NORMAL SCHOOL YEAR.  FOUR (4) OF THE SITES ARE EARLY CHILDHOOD CENTERS, EIGHT (8) ARE HEAD START AND PRE-K CLASSES AND TWENTY (20) OF THE SITES ARE TITLE 1 ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS (K-12).  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THE PROJECT IS EDUCATION, SPECIFICALLY EARLY LITERACY STRATEGIES AND SOCIAL/EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT FOR YOUNGER CHILDREN IN EARLY CHILDHOOD CENTERS. EACH VOLUNTEER IS ASSIGNED 5 CHILDREN TO TRACK FOR IMPROVEMENT, HOWEVER, A VOLUNTEER USUALLY INTERACTS WITH ALL THE CHILDREN IN EACH CLASSROOM. THE MINIMUM NUMBER OF CHILDREN REPRESENTED IN THE SUBSEQUENT NARRATIVES REFLECTS THESE 5 TEACHER- IDENTIFIED STUDENTS, HOWEVER, WE KNOW THE IMPACT OF PFGP VOLUNTEERS WOULD BE MUCH HIGHER IF EACH CHILD WAS COUNTED. WITH AN AVERAGE OF 26 STUDENTS PER CLASSROOM, A MORE ACCURATE NUMBER OF STUDENTS IMPACTED BY PFGP VOLUNTEERS WOULD BE CLOSER TO 2,730 STUDENTS THROUGHOUT THE FIVE LOCALITIES. HOWEVER, WE WILL TRACK THE PROGRESS OF THE IDENTIFIED 5 CHILDREN PER VOLUNTEER USING PHONOLOGICAL AWARENESS LITERACY SCREENING (PALS) DATA SUBMITTED BY EACH SITE AND THE CREATIVE CURRICULUM AND LEARNING CHECKLIST FOR CHILDREN UNDER 4 YEARS OLD.
