THE COUNCIL ON AGING INC., SERVING ST. CLAIR COUNTY (COA) IS A NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION THAT IS THE SINGLE LARGEST SENIOR-SERVING ORGANIZATION IN THE COMMUNITY.  ITS MISSION STATEMENT IS BASED UPON PROMOTING AND SAFEGUARDING THE INDEPENDENCE AND WELL-BEING OF SENIORS, THROUGH THE COORDINATION OF PROGRAMS AND SERVICES. THE GOAL OF THE NATIONAL SENIOR CORPS IS TO EMPOWER PEOPLE 55 YEARS OF AGE OR OLDER TO CONTRIBUTE TO THEIR COMMUNITIES THROUGH VOLUNTEERING, ENHANCE THE LIVES OF THOSE WHO SERVE AND THOSE WHOM THEY SERVE, AND PROVIDE COMMUNITIES WITH VALUABLE SERVICES (DOMESTIC VOLUNTEER SERVICE ACT, CHAPTER 66, SUBCHAPTER II). THE COA HAS BEEN AN APPROPRIATE MATCH AS THE SPONSOR OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM SINCE 1977.

THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IN ST. CLAIR COUNTY, MI. PROVIDES ACCESS TO SERVICES, RESOURCES, AND STRUCTURED VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES THAT WILL IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR LOW-INCOME SENIORS, ENABLING THEM TO BE ACTIVELY ENGAGED IN THE COMMUNITY. THROUGH THAT ENGAGEMENT, VOLUNTEERS CONTRIBUTE TO THE IMPROVEMENT OF EDUCATIONAL OUTCOMES AND MORE FOR 300 OR MORE AT-RISK CHILDREN AND YOUTH ANNUALLY. FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL SERVE IN SCHOOLS, PRESCHOOLS, AND OTHER NON-PROFIT CHILD-SERVING ORGANIZATIONS TO FOCUS ON SCHOOL READINESS SKILLS FOR ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED YOUNG CHILDREN AND ON EDUCATIONAL AND BEHAVIORAL OUTCOMES OF K-12 YOUTH WITH SPECIAL OR EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS.

METHODIST CHILDREN'S HOME SOCIETY (MCHS), A NON-SECTARIAN PRIVATE 501C (3) NON-PROFIT, IS APPLYING TO SPONSOR THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) IN WAYNE COUNTY AND ST. CLAIR SHORES IN MACOMB COUNTY, MICHIGAN.  OUR AGENCY ACQUIRED COMMUNITY SOCIAL SERVICES OF WAYNE COUNTY (CSSWC), WHICH HAS SPONSORED FGP IN OUR COMMUNITY SINCE 1965 IN ADDITION TO THE RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM AND SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM.  WITH THE ADDITION OF CSSWC SERVICES AND PROGRAMS, THE COMBINED STAFF LOOKS FORWARD TO MCHS?S NEW STRATEGIC PLAN TO OFFER SERVICES FOR THE WHOLE FAMILY, RATHER THAN JUST CHILDREN.  ALTHOUGH MCHS IS CONSIDERED A NEW AGENCY APPLYING FOR THE FGP GRANT, OUR NEWLY COMBINED AGENCY WITH FORMER CSSWC FGP OF WAYNE AND PART OF MACOMB COUNTY STAFF HAVE A COMBINED 54 YEARS? EXPERIENCE IMPLEMENTING THE PROGRAM IN THIS SERVICE AREA.  OUR STAFF HAS THE KNOWLEDGE TO MANAGE THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM, RELATIONSHIPS WITH COMMUNITY PARTNERS TO CONTINUE ITS GROWTH, AND THE SUPPORT OF MCHS TO ACHIEVE ITS GOALS.  FOR THE 2020-23 FGP GRANT, OUR NEWLY COMBINED AGENCY WOULD LIKE TO CONTINUE THE MORE THAN FOUR DECADES OF ADMINISTERING FGP IN WAYNE AND PART OF MACOMB COUNTY AND BUILDING UPON THE RELATIONSHIP WITH CLOSE TO 139 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS AND OVER 45 STATION PARTNERS. ONCE AWARDED THE GRANT, OUR EXPERIENCED FGP STAFF WOULD IMMEDIATELY REACH OUT TO BOTH THE CURRENT STATIONS AND VOLUNTEERS THEY MANAGE TO SIGN A NEW MEMORANDUM OF UNDERSTANDING (MOU) AND VOLUNTEER ENROLLMENT FORM WITH MCHS.
AN ESTIMATED 169 FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AND WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE HELPING THE YOUNGER CHILDREN WITH THEIR BEHAVIOR AND SOCIAL SKILLS AND HELPING THE OLDER CHILDREN WITH THEIR ACADEMICS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS MENTORING AND OUTCOMES WILL BE TRACKED USING A CHILD ASSIGNMENT PLAN.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE K-12 SUCCESS WORK PLAN WILL TRACK THE NUMBER OF VOLUNTEERS PROVIDING SERVICE, THE NUMBER OF YOUTH SERVED AND THE NUMBER OF STUDENTS WITH IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT OR IMPROVED SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL SKILLS.  THE SCHOOL READINESS WORK PLAN WILL TRACK THE NUMBER OF VOLUNTEERS PROVIDING SERVICE, THE NUMBER OF YOUTH SERVED AND THE NUMBER OF CHILDREN DEMONSTRATING GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS.  THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL & COMMUNITY SERVICE?S FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $658,721 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $417,707 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
THE MISSION OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM OF FORT WAYNE, INDIANA IS TO ESTABLISH AND BUILD A STRONG FOUNDATION WITH AT-RISK YOUNG CHILDREN IN OUR INNER-CITY LEARNING COMMUNITIES AND OFFER SUPPORT IN THEIR LANGUAGE, LITERACY AND SCHOOL READINESS. WE ARE SENIORS WHO DESIRE TO INVEST IN THE CHILDREN WHO WILL ONE DAY LEAD OUR COUNTRY AND RECALL THE DAYS WHEN A SPECIAL VOLUNTEER TOOK THE TIME TO HELP WHEN THEY NEEDED IT MOST.  
AN ESTIMATED 60 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM OF FORT WAYNE. OF THIS NUMBER, 56 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN VOLUNTEER STATIONS THAT MEET THE NATIONAL PERFORMANCE MEASURE OUTCOME ASSIGNMENT, SERVING 168 CHILDREN.
AT CHILDCARE CENTERS AND HEAD START PROGRAMS, FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL SUPPORT PRE-SCHOOL CHILDREN IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF THEIR LANGUAGE AND PRE-LITERACY SKILLS BY:

*ENGAGING IN CONVERSATIONS TO HELP DEVELOP EFFECTIVE COMMUNICATION
*READING TOGETHER TO SUPPORT STORY COMPREHENSION, PHONOLOGICAL AWARENESS, AND LETTER   RECOGNITION
*SUPPORTING THE DEVELOPMENT OF EMERGENT WRITING AND THE MEANING OF WRITING
*SUPPORTING ELL STUDENTS (ENGLISH LANGUAGE LEARNERS) WITH ACCURATE ENGLISH GRAMMAR AND PRONUNCIATION
*SUPPORTING THE DEVELOPMENT OF NUMBER, SHAPE AND PATTERN RECOGNITION, AND USING MATH WORDS 

AT SCHOOLS, FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL SUPPORT CHILDREN WITH IMPROVING THEIR READING SKILLS BY:
*SUPPORTING PHONEMIC AWARENESS (SOUND FLUENCY WITH SPOKEN WORDS)
*SUPPORTING PHONIC SKILLS (CONNECTING SOUNDS WITH LETTERS IN ORDER TO READ WORDS)

AT THE TIME OF WRITING THIS GRANT, THE SSP FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IS CURRENTLY ON PAUSE. OUR PROJECT WAS INTERRUPTED IN MARCH OF 2020 DUE TO THE OUTBREAK OF COVID-19 IN OUR COMMUNITY. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TUTORING, MENTORING, OTHER CLASSROOM SUPPORT, OUT-OF-SCHOOL TIME, AND SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL SUPPORT. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $467,440.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $23,811 FROM THE ILLINOIS DEPARTMENT ON AGING.

COMMUNITY ACTION PARTNERSHIP OF CENTRAL ILLINOIS (CAPCIL) IS A NON-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATION. IT IS THE MISSION OF CAPCIL, IN PARTNERSHIP WITH COMMUNITIES IN OUR SERVICE AREA, TO EMPOWER PERSONS WITH LOW INCOME AND THE AGED BY CREATING AND IMPLEMENTING POVERTY-FIGHTING INITIATIVES FOR THOSE IN CRISIS AND THOSE THAT ENDEAVOR A LIFE OF LASTING INDEPENDENCE. WE PURSUE A PROMISE TO CHANGE PEOPLE'S LIVES, EMBODY THE SPIRIT OF HOPE, IMPROVE COMMUNITIES AND MAKE AMERICA A BETTER PLACE TO LIVE. WE CARE ABOUT THE ENTIRE COMMUNITY AND WE ARE DEDICATED TO HELPING PEOPLE HELP THEMSELVES AND EACH OTHER. THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IS JUST ONE OF MANY SERVICES CAPCIL PROVIDES TO HELP ACCOMPLISH OUR PROMISE. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR OUR PROJECT IS EDUCATION. OUR PROJECT IS DESIGNED TO ENGAGE OUR FGP VOLUNTEERS IN SERVICE ACTIVITIES THAT WILL PROMOTE GENUINE IMPROVEMENTS IN THE LIVES OF THE CHILDREN WE WORK WITH, WHICH IN TURN ENRICHES THE LIVES OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS. AN ESTIMATED 57 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN HEAD START, EARLY LEARNING CENTERS, SCHOOLS, AND COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS IN OUR SEVEN-COUNTY SERVICE AREA. WE ARE REQUESTING $344,969.00 FROM CNCS TO PROVIDE SERVICES, WITH $60,063.00 TO BE SUPPLEMENTED THROUGH OTHER RESOURCES. OUR PROJECT WILL ADDRESS CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL OR EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS INCLUDING LITERACY, SOCIAL/EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT, CHILDREN IN FOSTER CARE AND AT-RISK TEENS. SERVICE ACTIVITIES MAY INCLUDE READING AND/OR LISTENING TO CHILDREN READ, HELPING IDENTIFY COLORS/NUMBERS/LETTERS/OBJECTS, HELPING WITH SCHOOLWORK, ASSISTING WITH SELF-CONTROL, SELF-CONCEPT, COOPERATION AND SOCIAL RELATIONSHIPS. THE PROJECT ANTICIPATES POSITIVE OUTCOMES FOR IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE AND ATTENDANCE FOR AS MANY OF 228 CHILDREN AS WELL AS HELPING OUR VOLUNTEERS TO REMAIN INDEPENDENT THROUGH THE TAX-FREE STIPEND, EDUCATIONAL TRAININGS, AND REFERRAL RESOURCES.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

THE LEGAL NAME OF THE SPONSORING ORGANIZATION IS THE KANKAKEE SCHOOL DISTRICT NO. 111 LOCATED IN KANKAKEE IL, WHICH IS THE COUNTY SEAT OF KANKAKEE COUNTY.  THE KANKAKEE SCHOOL DISTRICT #111 MISSION STATEMENT STATES, "THE KANKAKEE SCHOOL DISTRICT IS TOTALLY COMMITTED TO PROVIDING QUALITY EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES DESIGNED TO MEET THE DIVERSE ACADEMIC PHYSICAL AND VOCATIONAL NEEDS OF ALL OF OUR STUDENTS.  WE STRIVE TO ESTABLISH A SUPPORTIVE LEARNING ENVIRONMENT IN WHICH STUDENTS ACQUIRE THE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS NECESSARY FOR A PRODUCTIVE LIFE IN THE 21ST CENTURY.  WE ARE ALSO COMMITTED TO HELPING STUDENTS DEVELOP A HEALTHY SELF-IMAGE AND EXHIBIT POSITIVE SOCIAL BEHAVIORS AS WELL AS LEARN TO APPRECIATE ETHNIC AND CULTURAL DIFFERENCES.  TO ACHIEVE THIS PURPOSE, TEACHERS AND ADMINISTRATORS, THE BOARD OF EDUCATION, PARENTS AND STUDENTS MUST WORK TOGETHER TO BUILD AN EDUCATIONAL PROGRAM WHICH MATCHES COMMUNITY EXPECTATIONS AND AVAILABLE RESOURCES WITH THE RESPONSIBILITY FOR DEVELOPING ENTHUSIASTIC LIFE-LONG LEARNERS CAPABLE OF MEETING AND SOLVING SOCIETY'S PROBLEMS".

THE NUMBER OF VSY'S REQUESTED FOR FY2020 IS 50 (FIFTY).  THE DOLLAR AMOUNT REQUESTED FROM CNCS IS $320,063.  THE RECIPIENT SHARE IS $69,948.00, FOR A TOTAL OF $392,984.00. THE SERVICE CATEGORIES THIS PROJECT WILL ADDRESS ARE IMPROVING ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AND INCREASING READING READINESS AMONG STUDENTS AGED 3-12.  THE VOLUNTEERS ARE PLACED IN AREAS WHERE THERE IS A GREAT NEED FOR IMPROVEMENT IN THE AREAS OF READING READINESS AND LITERACY. THEIR ONE-ON-ONE ASSISTANCE IN THE CLASSROOM WILL PROVIDE A STRONG BASE FOR IMPROVEMENT IN THESE AREAS. 

FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO SERVE AS MENTORS IN OTHER ACADEMIC AND BEHAVIORAL RELATED AREAS INCLUDING MODELING CONFLICT RESOLUTION SKILLS, DEVELOPING A HEALTHY SELF-IMAGE, EXHIBITING APPROPRIATE CLASSROOM BEHAVIORS ETC.  THE GOAL OF THE PROGRAM IS TO HELP STUDENTS IMPROVE SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT, GAIN LITERACY AND MATH SKILLS, IMPROVE STUDENT ATTENDANCE PATTERNS, AND IMPROVE THE ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT OF ALL STUDENTS. THE PROJECT WILL ADDRESS COMMUNITY NEEDS SUCH AS INCREASED TEACHER-PARENT COOPERATION, PROMOTING POSITIVE INTERACTION BETWEEN DIFFERENT ETHNIC GROUPS, ENHANCING COMMUNITY AWARENESS OF VOLUNTARISM AND SHARING KNOWLEDGE AND BENEFITS OF PARTICIPATION IN SENIOR CORPS PROGRAMS.

RESEARCH BASED METHODS USED WILL INCLUDE (BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO) SELF-ASSESSMENT SURVEYS, COMMUNITY PARTNER SURVEYS, STUDENT GRADE REPORTS, TEACHER LOGS, ADVISORY COUNCIL INPUT ETC.

OUR CURRENT GRANT APPLICATION IS BASED ON PAST PRACTICES. DUE TO THE CURRENT COVID 19 PANDEMIC, THERE ARE CLEARLY MANY UNCERTAINTIES ABOUT THE INPUTS AND OUTPUTS FOR THE UPCOMING PROGRAM YEAR. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THE UCAN SUBURBAN COOK COUNTY FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM WILL CONTINUE TO BE ELEMENTARY EDUCATION WITH A FOCUS ON LITERACY AND CONTINUED SUPPORT TO LOCAL HEAD-START PROGRAMS. THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM OF GREATER SIOUXLAND, SPONSORED BY THE ROTARY CLUB OF ROCK VALLEY FOUNDATION, INC. (RVRFGP), REQUESTS $357,500 FUNDING FOR THE EIGHT-COUNTY SERVICE AREA INCLUDING LYON, SIOUX, O'BRIEN, OSCEOLA, MONONA, DICKINSON, PLYMOUTH, AND WOODBURY COUNTIES IN IOWA.  

FEDERAL FUNDS FROM THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL & COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS) PROVIDE DOLLARS FOR PERSONNEL EXPENSES, OPERATING COSTS, AND DIRECT BENEFITS TO LOW-INCOME SENIOR VOLUNTEERS AS DESCRIBED IN PART II-BUDGET DETAIL.  AN AMOUNT IN EXCESS OF 80% OF FEDERAL FUNDING HAS BEEN USED FOR DIRECT VOLUNTEER EXPENSES.  FUNDING ALLOWS AN ESTIMATED 70 FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS TO PROVIDE ALMOST 70,000 HOURS TO ASSIST APPROXIMATELY 1800 CHILDREN IN 35+ NON-PROFIT AGENCIES, INCLUDING SCHOOLS, HEAD STARTS, DAY CARES THROUGHOUT THE RVRFGP SERVICE AREA.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $357,500 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.  

THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR LOW-INCOME FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS TO SERVE CHILDREN IN NEED THROUGH EDUCATION.  FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS FOCUS ON ASSISTING CHILDREN WITH SCHOOL READINESS AND K-12 SUCCESS BY PROVIDING ONE-ON-ONE AND SMALL GROUP ACTIVITIES TO HELP STRUGGLING CHILDREN.  EXAMPLES OF ACTIVITIES INCLUDE READING TO CHILDREN; LISTENING TO CHILDREN READ; CHECKING THEIR READING COMPREHENSION; ASSISTING WITH MATH COMPREHENSION; AND ASSISTING WITH GAMES AND ACTIVITIES TO ENHANCE PRE-READING SKILLS, VOCABULARY, SPEECH DEVELOPMENT, MATHEMATICS AND SOCIAL SKILLS.  FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS ALSO ACT AS POSITIVE ROLE MODELS, PROVIDE SUPPORT AND ENCOURAGEMENT TO THE CHILDREN, AND ADD DIVERSITY BY PROVIDING AN INTER-GENERATIONAL ASPECT TO THE PROGRAMS OFTEN BY SHARING THEIR LIFE EXPERIENCES RELATING TO THE STUDIES. 

AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE CHILDREN/STUDENTS SERVED WILL SHOW INCREASED SCHOOL READINESS IN TERMS OF SOCIAL AND/OR EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT, GAINS IN LITERACY SKILLS FOR SCHOOL READINESS, AND IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY AND/OR MATH.

THE CITY OF FORT DODGE, IOWA, A COUNTY SEAT IN NORTHWEST IOWA APPROXIMATELY 100 MILES FROM THE STATE CAPITOL OF DES MOINES IS APPLYING FOR A FOSTER GRANDPARENT GRANT TO FUND YEAR ONE OF A THREE YEAR GRANT CYCLE TO SUPPORT 32 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS SERVING IN TWO LARGELY RURAL COUNTIES.  THE CITY OF FORT DODGE HAS BEEN THE SPONSOR OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM SINCE 1973 AND SUPPORTS THE FEDERAL GRANT FUNDING OF $209,693 WITH LOCAL CASH IN IN-KIND MATCH OF $79,491.  THE SEVEN COMMUNITY SCHOOL DISTRICTS OR HEAD START CENTERS IN THE SERVICE AREA HAVE STUDENTS FROM ALL SOCIO-ECONOMIC BACKGROUNDS, WITH NEARLY 50% QUALIFYING FOR FREE OR REDUCED SCHOOL LUNCHES.  AT THE TIME OF THIS APPLICATION, THE PROGRAM OPERATIONS TO THE PUBLIC ARE SUSPENDED DUE TO THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC; HOWEVER, COMMUNITY LEADERS RECOGNIZE THAT WHEN STUDENTS DO RETURN TO SCHOOL THE NEED FOR CARING COMMUNITY TUTORS, MENTORS AND ROLE MODELS WILL BE MORE IMPORTANT THAN EVER.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY: THIS NARRATIVE DESCRIBES AMERICAN HOME FINDING ASSOCIATION (AHFA), THE CURRENT SPONSOR FOR THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IN WAPELLO COUNTY, IOWA. AHFA IS A LICENSED, PRIVATE, NOT-FOR-PROFIT SOCIAL SERVICE AGENCY THAT BEGAN AS AN ADOPTION AGENCY IN 1899. ALTHOUGH ADOPTION REMAINS ONE OF THE SERVICES, AHFA HAS EXPANDED TO INCLUDE: BIRTH PARENT SERVICES, MATERNAL CHILD HEALTH & WIC, CHILD CARE CENTER, CHILD WELFARE EMERGENCY SERVICES, AFTERCARE PROGRAM, ACHIEVING MAXIMUM POTENTIAL (AMP), TEEN HEALTH CENTER, AND THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM. THE MISSION OF AHFA IS TO PROVIDE QUALITY SERVICES THAT NURTURE AND IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR CHILDREN AND FAMILIES. WE BELIEVE: *EACH PERSON IS AN INDIVIDUAL WITH A UNIQUE SET OF EXPERIENCES. *EACH PERSON HAS DIGNITY AND WORTH. *EACH PERSON HAS A RIGHT TO ACCESS THE POWER STRUCTURE. *EACH PERSON IS FREE TO MAKE HIS/HER OWN DECISIONS. *EACH PERSON HAS POTENTIAL. *EACH PERSON HAS A NEED TO BE WANTED AND APPRECIATED. *EACH PERSON IS TO BE RESPECTED, AND *WE CAN ALL LEARN FROM ONE ANOTHER BY WORKING TOGETHER. THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM ALIGNS WELL WITH AHFA'S MISSION, AS THE PROGRAM SERVES LIMITED INCOME SENIORS, AT RISK CHILDREN, THE AREA SCHOOLS, AND THE COMMUNITY AS A WHOLE. APPROXIMATELY 33 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL TUTOR CHILDREN IN 13 VOLUNTEER SITES. THESE SITES INCLUDE CHILDCARE CENTERS, FAITH-BASED AGENCIES, ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS, A RESIDENTIAL FACILITY SCHOOL, A WIC CLINIC, AND HEAD START CLASSROOMS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS READING READINESS AND KINDERGARTEN THROUGH 12TH GRADE SUCCESS. THE ANTICIPATED PROJECT OUTCOMES INCLUDE: IMPROVEMENT OF STUDENT READING AND PRE-READING SKILLS, IMPROVEMENT OF GRADUATION RATES, INCREASED QUALITY OF LIFE (PHYSICAL AND MENTAL) IN THE LIMITED INCOME SENIORS WHO PARTICIPATE, AND OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE VOLUNTEERS TO REMAIN FINANCIALLY INDEPENDENT. AN ADDED BONUS TO THE SENIORS INCLUDES BENEFITING FROM A CIRCLE OF PEERS WHO HAVE SIMILAR INTERESTS AND LIFESTYLES, AND PREVENTING ISOLATION IN THEIR GOLDEN YEARS. BY ATTENDING MONTHLY IN-SERVICES, SENIORS WILL ALSO INCREASE THEIR AWARENESS OF LOCAL SERVICES THAT BENEFIT THE AGED, AND EXPAND THEIR KNOWLEDGE OF CHILDHOOD DEVELOPMENT AND CURRENT TEACHING CURRICULUMS.

THE NORTHWEST VERMONT FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP; FORMERLY CALLED TRI-COUNTY FGP) HAS BEEN SERVING CHITTENDEN, FRANKLIN, AND GRAND ISLE COUNTIES OF NORTHWESTERN VERMONT FOR OVER 40 YEARS. SPONSORED BY UNITED WAY OF NORTHWEST VERMONT (UWNWVT), FGP IS PART OF UWNWVT'S COMMUNITY IMPACT & VOLUNTEER MOBILIZATION DEPARTMENT WHICH ALSO INCLUDES RSVP OF NORTHWEST VERMONT AND VOLUNTEER CONNECTION. UWNWVT STRIVES TO UNITE OUR COMMUNITY IN ORDER TO SOLVE COMPLEX PROBLEMS AND CREATE A STRONGER NORTHWEST VERMONT. 

UWNWVT ACCOMPLISHES THIS MISSION THROUGH STRATEGIC INVESTMENT OF FINANCIAL RESOURCES AS WELL AS VOLUNTEER INVESTMENTS THROUGH UWNWVT SENIOR CORPS PROGRAMS RSVP AND FGP, AND THEIR BROADER MOBILIZATION OF VOLUNTEERS THROUGH COMMUNITY-WIDE RECRUITMENT AND REFERRAL EFFORTS. THIS VOLUNTEER MOBILIZATION EFFORT AIMS TO ACHIEVE UWNWVT'S GOAL OF ENSURING, AMONG OTHER PRIORITIES, THAT CHILDREN, YOUTH AND YOUNG ADULTS ACHIEVE THEIR FULL POTENTIAL.
 
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF NORTHWESTERN VERMONT FGP IS EDUCATION: SCHOOL READINESS AND K-12 SUCCESS. AT THE END OF THE GRANT PERIOD, AT LEAST 29 FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL BE SERVING CHILDREN IN PRE-SCHOOL, ELEMENTARY AND MIDDLE SCHOOL CLASSROOMS; 100% OF THESE VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: ONE-TO-ONE NURTURING, AGE APPROPRIATE INSTRUCTION AND DEVELOPMENTAL PLAY FOR YOUNG CHILDREN; TUTORING AND LEARNING SUPPORT FOR STUDENTS WHO ARE IDENTIFIED BY SUPERVISING TEACHERS AS NEEDING ADDITIONAL SUPPORT TO ACHIEVE LITERACY AND/OR MATH GOALS; AND ONE-TO-ONE OR SMALL GROUP ACTIVITIES PROVIDING TUTORING, MENTORING, ROLE MODELING, NURTURING AND SUPPORT. AT THE END OF EACH YEAR, THESE EFFORTS ENSURE THAT A.) YOUNG CHILDREN SERVED BY FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL HAVE ACHIEVED ESSENTIAL SOCIO-EMOTIONAL AND DEVELOPMENTAL SKILLS THAT WILL PREPARE THEM FOR SUCCESS WHEN THEY ENTER SCHOOL, AND B.) K-12 STUDENTS WILL HAVE IMPROVED AND ACHIEVED INDIVIDUALIZED GOALS IN LITERACY AND/OR MATH. 

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $168,471 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $85,534 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES. OUR PROGRAM WILL PRODUCE 26 VSYS ANNUALLY.

GREEN MOUNTAIN FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM WILL DEPLOY ALL OF OUR 57 VSY'S IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF EDUCATION. ALL VOLUNTEERS WILL BE IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  THE PRE-K VOLUNTEERS WILL ADDRESS THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF SCHOOL READINESS CENTERING THEIR ACTIVITIES ON THE SERVICE FOCUS OF SOCIAL/EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT. THEIR SERVICE WILL ADDRESS A CHILD'S DEVELOPMENT IN ONE OR MORE OF THE FOLLOWING AREAS: SELF-CONCEPT, SELF-CONTROL, SELF-HELP, COOPERATION, SOCIAL RELATIONSHIPS AND APPROACHES TO LEARNING. VOLUNTEER GRANDPARENTS WILL TUTOR/MENTOR CHILDREN TO ACHIEVE GAINS IN BEHAVIORS SUCH AS ATTENDING TO TASKS, LISTENING, FOLLOWING DIRECTIONS, COOPERATIVE PLAY, SHARING, DRESSING, APPROPRIATE MANNERS, PERSONAL HYGIENE, CLEANING UP THEIR SPACE, ZIPPING COATS, TYING SHOES, FINE MOTOR SKILLS SUCH AS CUTTING, PASTING AND COLORING. 15 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE 45 CHILDREN AT 8 SITES WITH AN OUTCOME TARGET OF ACHIEVING GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS, SOCIAL/EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT WITH AT LEAST 50% OR 23 OF THE STUDENTS. THE ACTIVITIES FOR THE ELEMENTARY GROUP WILL CENTER AROUND THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT WHICH CENTERS AROUND STUDENT ATTITUDES AND BEHAVIORS AS THEY RELATE TO THEIR DAY TO DAY INVOLVEMENT IN THEIR CLASSROOMS AND REFLECTED IN TASKS SUCH AS HOMEWORK COMPLETION, CLASS PARTICIPATION, INTEREST IN CLASSROOM ACTIVITIES AND CLASSROOM CONDUCT.  VOLUNTEER GRANDPARENTS WILL TUTOR/MENTOR CHILDREN TO ACHIEVE GAINS IN AREAS SUCH AS STAYING ON TASK, LISTENING, FOLLOWING DIRECTIONS, ESTABLISHING AND HONORING CLASSROOM ROUTINE, SHARING, COOPERATION WITH PEERS, RESPECT, TIME MANAGEMENT, HOMEWORK/ASSIGNMENT/PROJECT COMPLETION AND POSITIVE WORK AND LEARNING HABITS. 42 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE 126 CHILDREN AT 19 SITES WITH AN OUTCOME TARGET OF ACHIEVING GAINS IN ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT WITH AT LEAST 50% OR 63 OF THE STUDENTS. AT THE END OF EACH GRANT YEAR A MINIMUM OF 57 OUTCOME VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AN ESTIMATED 169 STUDENTS AT 27 VOLUNTEER STATIONS WITH 50% OF THE STUDENTS OR A TOTAL OF 84 STUDENTS DEMONSTRATING GAINS IN THE FOCUS AREAS DEFINED ABOVE. THE CNCS INVESTMENT OF $365,012 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $42,273 IN NON- FEDERAL RESOURCES.

EAST BAY COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM (EBCAP) WILL PROVIDE HIGH-QUALITY VOLUNTEER EXPERIENCES FOR LOW-INCOME SENIORS WHO WORK WITH HEAD START, PRE K AND ELEMENTARY SCHOOL-AGE CHILDREN, FOCUSING ON INCREASED SCHOOL ENGAGEMENT, IMPROVED ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, AND GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS AN INCREASED SOCIAL/EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT. 

AN ESTIMATED 38 FOSTER GRANDPARENT (FG) VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE SCHOOLS AND HEAD START SITES WITHIN THE EAST BAY OF RHODE ISLAND. ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TUTORING IN PUBLIC SCHOOLS AND OTHER NON-PROFITS AND ASSISTING CHILDREN AND TEACHERS IN HEAD START AND PRE K CLASSROOMS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA NOTED IN THIS PROPOSAL IS EDUCATION. WE EXPECT TO SERVE BY THE END OF A NEW THREE-YEAR GRANT DURATION 2100 (700/YEAR) STUDENTS IN HEAD START AND PRE-K-12 WHO PARTICIPATE IN THE CNCS SUPPORTED MENTORING OR TUTORING PROGRAM.  THOSE STUDENTS (2100) WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT AND SPECIFICALLY 321 (107/YEAR) CHILDREN FROM EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION PROGRAMS WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS BY INCREASED SOCIAL/EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $206,405 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY AND $12,943 OF IN-KIND SERVICES.

THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS PROGRAM HAS BEEN ESTABLISHED SINCE 1975 AND OUR OFFICE HAS BEEN THE SPONSORED SINCE OCTOBER 1, 2008. UNDER THIS GRANT WE PROPOSED CONTINUE THE USE OF OLDER VOLUNTEER INDIVIDUALS TO RENDER SERVICES TO CHILDREN AND YOUNGSTERS WITH SPECIAL NEEDS IN THE PONCE SERVICE AREA AND DESIGNED SERVICE ACTIVITIES TO BE CARRIED OUT THROUGHOUT THE YEAR IN ORDER TO ACHIEVE THE OBJECTIVES PROPOSED. OPPEA IS VERY INTERESTED IN CONTINUING WITH THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM AND TO RENDER AN EXCELLENT SERVICES AS NOWADAYS.
AN ESTIMATED 96 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER ABOUT SEVENTY-SIX (76) FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: TUTORING-PUBLIC SCHOOLS, TUTORING-FAITH-BASED SCHOOLS; AFTER SCHOOL PROGRAM; SCHOOL- BASED MENTORING AND COMMUNITY- BASED MENTORING; ASSISTING IN CLASSROOM AND COMFORTING CHILDREN. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE YEAR GRANT, THE PROGRAM ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES: TUTORING SERVICES AND COACH READING APPROXIMATELY 252 SCHOLARS AT ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS AND AT AFTER SCHOOL PROGRAM; EDUCATION AND MENTORING TO 15 CHILDREN AT MIDDLE SCHOOLS, 100 YOUNG PEOPLE INCARCERATED AT THE PONCE SOCIAL TREATMENT CENTER (CENTRO DE TRATAMIENTO SOCIAL DE PONCE) AND 50 PRE- SCHOLARS; OTHER CLASSROOM SUPPORT SERVICES TO 87 CHILDREN IN THE CEREBRAL PALSY CENTER IN PONCE, ALEXANDRA ACADEMY AND RAMON MARIN SPECIAL EDUCATION SCHOOLS; OFFERS SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL SUPPORT TO APPROXIMATELY 1,270 FAMILIES WITH CHILDREN AT THE SAN LUCAS PEDIATRIC HOSPITAL.
WE ARE REQUESTING THE AMOUNT OF $363,582 (87.1%) TO CONTINUE PROVIDING THIS VALUABLE SERVICE TO THE COMMUNITY. IT WILL BE SUPPLEMENT BY $53,976 (12.9%)-GRANTEE SHARE BY SPONSORING 79 VSYS.

THE CORPORACION REGIONAL DE GUAYAMA DE SERVICIOS A LA COMUNIDAD, INC., (CORPORACION REGIONAL) IS A NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION SINCE 1992 THAT PROVIDES SERVICES IN THE FOLLOWING MUNICIPALITIES OF PUERTO RICO: ARROYO, CAYEY, GUAYAMA, PATILLAS, SALINAS SANTA ISABEL, PR. THE LAST 28 YEARS IT EFFECTIVELY IMPLEMENTED AND PROVIDED CONTINUATION OF THE PROJECT.  THE MISSION OF THIS ENTITY IS TO ASSIST IN THE INTEGRAL WELL-BEING OF ELDERLY PERSONS, YOUTH AND CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL OR EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS IN THE GUAYAMA REGION.  AN ESTIMATED 97 FOSTER GRAND PARENTS WILL SERVE IN 18 SCHOOLS OF THE GUAYAMA REGION: HEAD START, HIGH AND ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS,  IMPACTING AT LEAST 776 STUDENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TUTORING, READING AND ACADEMIC LEARNING ASSISTANCE.  AT THE END OF  THREE YEAR GRANT THE EXPECTED OUTCOME IS STUDENTS WITH IMPROVED ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT.  THE TOTAL OF THE GRANT IS $365,988.00 SUPPLEMENTED BY 67,945.00.

THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS PROGRAM PROVIDES THE OPPORTUNITY FOR 176 VOLUNTEERS AGE 55 AND OLDER TO OFFER DIRECT SERVICES TO CHILDREN AND YOUTH. OF THE ONE HUNDRED AND SEVENTY-SIX (176) VOLUNTEERS, ONE HUNDRED AND FORTY-THREE (143) VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN TWENTY (20) PUBLIC SCHOOLS TO OFFER ACADEMIC AID AND EMOTIONAL SUPPORT TO AT LEAST THREE HUNDRED AND FORTY-SIX (346) STUDENTS ANNUALLY.
THE WORK PLAN FOR THE PLACEMENT OF ONE HUNDRED FORTY-THREE (143) VOLUNTEERS WILL BE BASED ON THE PERFORMANCE MEASUREMENT. SOME OF THE ACTIVITIES THAT THE VOLUNTEERS WILL CARRY OUT WITH THE STUDENTS ARE: TUTORING, MENTORING IN THE CLASSROOM, INDIVIDUALIZED HELP IN THE MOST DIFFICULT ACADEMIC AREAS, EMOTIONAL SUPPORT THAT OFFERS SECURITY TO THE CHILD AND YOUNG STUDENT, SOCIAL SUPPORT FOR THE CREATION OF POSITIVE ATTITUDES AND HEALTHY HABITS AND THE NECESSARY MOTIVATION TO HELP THE CHILD AND YOUNG STUDENT OVERCOME DIFFICULTIES IN THE EDUCATIONAL PROCESS.
THE FOCUS AREA IS EDUCATION AND THE K-12 SUCCESS IN EDUCATION SERVICE OBJECTIVE PROVIDED BY THE C.N.C.S. IN THE PROPOSAL'S WORK PLAN, THE ASSIGNMENT OF ONE HUNDRED FORTY-THREE (143) VOLUNTEERS IS PROJECTED TO BENEFIT A TOTAL OF ONE THOUSANDS THIRTY EIGHT (1,038) STUDENTS AT THE END OF THE THREE (3) YEARS GRANT. THE ACTIVITIES ARE AIMED AT STRENGTHENING ACADEMIC SKILLS ACCORDING TO THE GUIDELINES OF THE TEACHERS WHO WILL EVALUATE THE STUDENT'S SUCCESS AS A RESULT OF THE ASSIGNMENT OF THE SERVICE OFFERED BY THE VOLUNTEERS. 
AT THE END OF THE  YEAR GRANT, THE C.N.C.S. FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $754,753. WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $ 83,861. OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES. THE ORGANIZATION HAS ELECTED TO USE THE DE MINIMS RATE OF 10% OF MTDC THAT AMOUNTS IS $13,795. AT THE END OF THE THREE (3) YEARS OF THE PROPOSAL, IT IS EXPECTED THAT THE ONE HUNDRED AND SEVENTY-SIX (176) VOLUNTEERS WILL MANAGE TO SERVE APPROXIMATELY A TOTAL OF ONE THOUSAND EIGHT HUNDRED AND THIRTY-SIX (1, 836) CHILDREN AND YOUTH.
THE ONE HUNDRED AND SEVENTY-SIX (176) VOLUNTEERS ARE PLACEMENT THROUGH A NETWORK OF SERVICE STATIONS MADE UP OF: (20) SCHOOLS, (22) HEAD START CENTERS, ONE (1) TEMPORARY SHELTER HOME FOR CHILDREN VICTIMS OF NEGLECT & ABUSE AND IN ONE (1)  PEDIATRIC WARD OF A HOSPITAL. ALL THE VOLUNTEERS FULFILL ALL THE SELECTION REQUIREMENTS THAT THE CNCS DEMANDS AND RECEIVE TRAINING IN THE SERVICE AREA PRIOR TO THEIR LOCATION.
THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS PROGRAM HAS BEEN SPONSORED SINCE 1966 BY ESPERANZA PARA LA VEJEZ, INC, A NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION WHOSE MISSION IS TO PROMOTE AND ESTABLISH SERVICES AIMED AT IMPROVING THE QUALITY OF LIFE OF LOW-INCOME OLDER ADULTS AT THE ISLAND LEVEL. THE PROPOSAL OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS PROGRAM IS ALIGNED WITH THE MISSION OF THE ORGANIZATION.
THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS PROGRAM WITH ITS INTERGENERATIONAL APPROACH INTEGRATES 176 OLDER ADULTS AS VALUABLE RESOURCES TO SERVE THE NEEDS OF CHILDREN AND YOUTH IN THEIR COMMUNITIES. OLDER ADULTS REPRESENT THE FASTEST GROWING SEGMENT OF THE POPULATION. THEY ARE ACTIVE, HEALTHY PEOPLE, WITH WORK EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATION. THE PROGRAM OFFERS THEM AN ALTERNATIVE TO STAY INTEGRATED AND CONTRIBUTING IN THEIR COMMUNITIES.

AN ESTIMATED OF 83 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS (FGP) VOLUNTEERS WILL PARTICIPATE AS PART OF THE PROGRAM. OF THIS NUMBER 71 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE ASSISTING IN CLASSROOM AT HEAD STARTS, TUTORING STUDENTS AT PUBLIC SCHOOLS, MENTORING IN SPECIALIZED PUBLIC SCHOOLS, COMFORTING CHILDREN IN HOSPITALS AND CARING FOR INFANTS IN HOSPITAL AND FOSTER CARE INSTITUTIONS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA IS EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, AT LEAST 57% OF THE CHILDREN HAVE DEMONSTRATED IMPROVEMENT  IN SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT, 450 STUDENTS HAVE IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY, AND 27 STUDENTS HAVE IMPROVED ACADEMICS THANKS TO THE BENEFIT OF CNCS MENTORING / TUTORING PROGRAMS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $ 424,836 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $ 160,952 OF LOCAL FUNDS.

WESLEY FAMILY SERVICES FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) [SOUTHWESTERN PA INTERGENERATIONAL PARTNERSHIP]
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
WESLEY FAMILY SERVICES (WFS) HAS A WELL-ESTABLISHED ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY AND A LEGACY TO DELIVER HIGH PERFORMING QUALITY PROGRAMMING TO DIVERSE POPULATIONS ACROSS SOUTHWESTERN PA TO ENSURE THE SUCCESSFUL IMPLEMENTATION OF THE PROPOSED FGP PROJECT.  AS THE SPONSOR AGENCY, WE PROPOSES TO IMPLEMENT THE FGP PROJECT TO MEET THE EDUCATIONAL, TUTORING, MENTORING AND SOCIAL EMOTIONAL NEEDS OF K-12 SCHOOL AGE CHILDREN AND YOUTH IN CHILD CARE AND DEVELOPMENT CENTERS, ESPECIALLY OF THOSE IDENTIFIED AT RISK AND/OR WITH EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS, ACROSS THE FGP SPECIFIED GEOGRAPHICAL AREA.  THE FGP VOLUNTEERS CAN PROVIDE AN OPTIMAL RESPONSE TO THE MANY CONCERNING TRENDS AND NEEDS WITHIN THE IDENTIFIED COMMUNITIES. IN ADDITION, OLDER ADULTS' INVOLVEMENT, WHILE HELPING STRENGTHENING THE PROTECTIVE FACTORS OF CHILDREN AND YOUTH IN THESE COMMUNITIES, IT ALSO CONTRIBUTES TO SUPPORT THEIR OWN SOCIAL, COGNITIVE, AND EMOTIONAL WELL-BEING.  THE FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE COMPRISE OF ELIGIBLE ADULTS 55 YEARS OF AGE AND OLDER AND SERVE BETWEEN 15 AND 20 HOURS PER WEEK TO FULFILL MEASURABLE ASSIGNMENT PLANS IN IDENTIFIED CORE-PARTNERS FACILITIES (I.E., STATIONS)  WITHIN THE TARGETED FGP AREA.  WFS PROPOSES TO RECRUIT TO FULFILL 129VSY  AND TO DEVELOP AND SUSTAIN AN ADEQUATE CORE-PARTNERSHIP NETWORK OF VOLUNTEER STATIONS ACROSS THE FGP GEOGRAPHICAL AREA. IN TOTAL, WFS IS REQUESTING $825,168 IN FEDERAL FUNDS AND CONTRIBUTING $92,592 OF NON-FEDERAL SUPPORT FOR THIS PURPOSE, FOR EACH BUDGETED YEAR OR 12 MONTH PERIOD. THESE FGP OUTPUTS WILL BE INVESTED AND AIM AT AUGMENTING OUR CORE-PARTNERS' CAPACITY TO IMPROVE THE SCHOOL READINESS AND K-12 SUCCESS, BY FOCUSING FGP VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES (E.G., TUTORING, REINFORCING SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL SKILLS, ASSISTING WITH HOMEWORK, DEVELOPING POSITIVE AND SUPPORTIVE RELATIONSHIPS, ETC.) ON IMPROVING THE EDUCATIONAL AND BEHAVIORAL OUTCOMES OF DISADVANTAGED CHILDREN AND YOUTH AND THEREBY EXPAND THEIR CHANCES AND PROSPECTS OF SUCCESS IN POST-SECONDARY EDUCATION SETTINGS.  OUTCOMES WILL BE REPORTED AND MEASURED ON ALL CHILDREN WHO RECEIVE A MINIMUM OF 30 HOURS OF 1:1 ACTIVITIES WITH AN ASSIGNED GFP VOLUNTEER.

THE UNION-SNYDER AGENCY ON AGING, INC. IS REQUESTING FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $530,164 FOR THE 2020-2021 GRANT YEAR. NON FEDERAL FUNDING WILL BE AT A LEVEL OF NO LESS THAN $70,307. THE REQUEST IS FOR 83 VSYS. EIGHTY-THREE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME-BASED ASSIGNMENTS. 
THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM OF CENTRAL PENNSYLVANIA WILL SERVE SITES IN THE FOLLOWING SIX COUNTIES: COLUMBIA, JUNIATA, MIFFLIN, NORTHUMBERLAND, SNYDER, AND UNION. THIRTY-EIGHT  VOLUNTEER STATIONS WILL BE SERVED. CHILDREN FROM INFANCY THROUGH 21 YEARS OF AGE WITH DOCUMENTED AND SPECIFIC SPECIAL NEEDS WILL BE SERVED. 
THE COMMUNITY NEEDS THAT WILL BE ADDRESSED ARE PRIMARILY IN THE AREAS OF EDUCATION AND MENTORING AT ALL AGE LEVELS. PRIMARY FOCUS WILL BE ON MATH AND READING SKILLS AND DEFICIENCIES IN REGARDS TO K-12 SUCCESS. EACH YEAR THE PENNSYLVANIA SYSTEM OF SCHOOL ASSESSMENT SCORES WILL BE REVIEWED IN ORDER TO SEE THE AREAS OF DEFICIENCY THAT NEED TO BE ADDRESSED IN THE PUBLIC SCHOOLS. PRE-K COUNTS AND HEAD START CURRICULUM AND GOALS WILL BE ACQUIRED FROM THEIR SITES IN ORDER TO MEET THE NEEDS OF THE CHILDREN. ACTIVITIES DONE BY THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL INCLUDE EDUCATIONAL TUTORING IN ALL AREAS (WITH A FOCUS ON MATH AND READING), DEMONSTRATING AND PROMOTING PROPER SOCIAL SKILLS, ASSISTING WITH SELF-HELP, FINE, AND GROSS MOTOR SKILLS.
THE PROGRAM WILL SERVE A MINIMUM OF THREE PRE-K COUNTS CLASSROOMS. TEN PRESCHOOLS AND CHILD CARE CENTERS WILL BENEFIT FROM THE PARTICIPATION OF FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS. 
THERE ARE ELEVEN SCHOOL DISTRICTS WITHIN THESE SIX COUNTIES. HEAD START PROGRAMS THAT WILL BE ASSISTED ARE LOCATED IN JUNIATA, MIFFLIN, NORTHUMBERLAND, SNYDER, AND UNION COUNTIES. 
AT THE END OF THE 12-MONTH PERFORMANCE PERIOD, IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT 75% OF THE CHILDREN SERVED WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVEMENT IN ONE OR MORE OF THE DESIGNATED PERFORMANCE MEASURES.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

IN FY21, THE CITY OF PHILADELPHIA?S FOSTER GRANDPARENTS PROGRAM WILL HAVE 81 VOLUNTEERS PLACED IN OUTCOME-BASED ASSIGNMENTS ENGAGING IN 81 VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS. PHILADELPHIA?S PROGRAM IS ONE OF THE LARGEST AND LONGEST RUNNING SENIOR CORPS PROGRAMS IN THE STATE.

THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION (PRE-K TO GRADE 4). THE PROGRAM ENGAGES LOW-INCOME SENIOR VOLUNTEERS WHO DEDICATE 15 TO 40 HOURS PER WEEK IN PRE-K AND EARLY ELEMENTARY CLASSROOMS AND OUT-OF-SCHOOL-TIME (OST) SITES ACROSS THE CITY, WORKING WITH STUDENTS ONE-ON-ONE OR IN SMALL GROUPS. VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES INCLUDE MENTORING, TUTORING, AND GENERAL SUPPORT IN SCHOOL PREPAREDNESS. 

THE SENIOR VOLUNTEERS STAY ACTIVE BY SERVING YOUTH IN THEIR COMMUNITIES, AND THE PROGRAM CREATES LONG LASTING INTERGENERATIONAL RELATIONSHIPS THAT PROVIDE CLASSROOM STABILITY AND INDIVIDUALIZED STUDENT SUPPORT.

RESEARCH INDICATES THAT SUSTAINED MENTORING RELATIONSHIPS YIELD A VARIETY OF BENEFITS FOR THE YOUTH INVOLVED.  THE STUDENTS SERVED BY FOSTER GRANDPARENTS, AT THE END OF THE PROJECT PERIOD, WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVED SCHOOL PREPAREDNESS AND ACADEMIC AND SOCIAL GAINS.

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $519,921 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $57,345 NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES. THE CITY OF PHILADELPHIA WILL CONTINUE TO FUNCTION AS THE LEGAL APPLICANT AND SPONSOR ORGANIZATION FOR THE PHILADELPHIA CHAPTER OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS PROGRAM. 

THESE EFFORTS ALIGN WITH THE MAYOR?S POLICY OBJECTIVE OF PROVIDING QUALITY PUBLIC EDUCATION FOR ALL, AND KEY INITIATIVES INCLUDING COMMUNITY SCHOOLS, A PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN THE CITY OF PHILADELPHIA, THE SCHOOL DISTRICT OF PHILADELPHIA, AND SCHOOL COMMUNITIES TO REMOVE BARRIERS TO LEARNING AND SUPPORT THE SUCCESS OF EACH STUDENT, AND PHLPREK WHICH FUNDS FREE, QUALITY PRE-K FOR THOUSANDS OF FAMILIES. (HTTPS://WWW.PHILA.GOV/MEDIA/20200106104156/CITY-OF-PHILADELPHIA-MAYOR-SECOND-TERM-REPORT.PDF)

THE BROOME COUNTY OFFICE FOR AGING (OFA) IS APPLYING FOR CONTINUED SPONSORSHIP OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) FOR THE PERIOD JULY 1, 2020 THROUGH JUNE 30, 2023.  OFA HAS SUCCESSFULLY IMPLEMENTED FGP SINCE 1972, BRINGING PURPOSE AND JOY TO COUNTLESS OLDER ADULTS WHILE HELPING THOUSANDS OF CHILDREN ACADEMICALLY, SOCIALLY AND EMOTIONALLY.
THE BEGINNING OF THIS GRANT PERIOD OCCURS DURING AN UNPRECEDENTED CRISIS, THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.  THE LONG-TERM IMPACTS ARE NOT YET FULLY UNDERSTOOD.  FOR THIS APPLICATION, IT WAS ASSUMED THERE WILL BE NO SIGNIFICANT IMPACTS TO THE BUDGET, NUMBER OF VOLUNTEERS NOR THE OUTCOME PROJECTIONS.
THE NEED FOR FGP IN BROOME COUNTY HAS NEVER BEEN GREATER.  THERE ARE NEARLY 50,000 RESIDENTS WHO ARE 60 YEARS OR OLDER.  NEARLY 5,000 RESIDENTS OVER AGE 65 HAVE AN ANNUAL HOUSEHOLD INCOME OF LESS THAN $20,000 (AMERICAN COMMUNITY SURVEY, 2018).  THERE ARE ABOUT 25,000 SCHOOL-AGE CHILDREN (KINDERGARTEN THROUGH TWELFTH GRADE); 3,600 OF THOSE HAVE A DISABILITY AND OVER 13,000 ARE ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED (NYS DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION, 2018). THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS CAN HELP THESE CHILDREN LEARN THROUGH NURTURING AND GIVING THEM POSITIVE REINFORCEMENT.
BROOME COUNTY IS EXPECTED TO HAVE 48 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS SERVING IN FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM.  95% OF THE VOLUNTEERS ARE EXPECTED TO BE IN OUTCOME-BASED ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE READING WITH CHILDREN, SOUNDING OUT WORDS AND LETTERS, WRITING LETTERS AND NUMBERS, ASKING QUESTIONS TO PROMOTE CRITICAL THINKING, AND DEMONSTRATING PROBLEM SOLVING SKILLS.  THE PRIMARY WORK PLANS FOR THIS PROJECT ARE FOR KINDERGARTEN THROUGH TWELFTH GRADE (K-12) EDUCATION AND EARLY EDUCATION.  IN THE PREVIOUS SCHOOL YEAR, ENDING JUNE 2019, TEACHERS REPORTED THAT 101 SCHOOL-AGE CHILDREN WHO WERE ASSIGNED TO FOSTER GRANDPARENTS IMPROVED THEIR ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE.  IN ADDITION, 35 YOUNG CHILDREN IN SCHOOL READINESS PROGRAMS, SUCH AS HEAD START PROGRAMS, SHOWED GAINS IN SOCIAL AND ACADEMIC SKILLS.  A PORTION OF THIS PROJECT, ABOUT 5% OF THE UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS, WILL SERVE BY CARING FOR INFANTS IN DAYCARE CENTERS.  
FOR GRANT YEAR 2020-2021, BROOME COUNTY OFA REQUESTS A CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $280,332.  THE GRANT WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $42,577 (13.2%) FROM THE STATE, COUNTY AND IN-KIND SUPPORT.

AN ESTIMATED 229 FOSTER GRANDPARENT (FGP) VOLUNTEERS (229 VSYS) WILL SERVE IN HEAD START CENTERS, DAY CARE, AND PUBLIC SCHOOLS IN THE HUDSON VALLEY (NY) COUNTIES OF WESTCHESTER, PUTNAM, DUTCHESS, ULSTER, ORANGE, AND SULLIVAN. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PROVIDING TUTORING AND MENTORING IN READING AS WELL AS MATH, ASSISTING TEACHERS IN THE CLASSROOM, AND COMFORTING AND CARING FOR CHILDREN WHO ARE ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED AND / OR HAVE SPECIAL OR EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS THE CNCS FOCUS AREA OF EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 169 (75%) OF 226 K-12 AND FAITH BASED SITE STUDENTS WORKING WITH THE APPROXIMATELY 113 FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL IMPROVE READING, PROBLEM SOLVING, AND COMMUNICATION SKILLS. 120 (75%) OF 160 CHILDREN IN UNIVERSAL PRE-K AND HEAD START SITES WORKING WITH THE APPROXIMATELY 80 FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS IN TERMS OF SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT, LITERACY, AND MATH SKILLS. ANOTHER 36 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN PRE-ELEMENTARY/DAYCARE SETTINGS AND COURT-BASED CHILD CARE WHERE THEY WILL COMFORT CHILDREN AND CARE FOR APPROXIMATELY 190 INFANTS/TODDLERS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $1,163,031 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $28,313 IN STATE AND LOCAL FUNDS FROM THE NEW YORK STATE OFFICE FOR AGING AND WESTCHESTER COUNTY, AS WELL AS $119,347 IN IN-KIND DONATIONS.

SECTION A.  EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
GATEWAY COMMUNITY ACTION PARTNERSHIP IS ACTIVELY INVOLVED IN THE LIVES AND WELFARE OF THE COMMUNITIES IN SOUTHERN NEW JERSEY.  IN ATLANTIC COUNTY, GATEWAY PROVIDES SERVICES TO CHILDREN AND FAMILIES IN ITS EARLY HEAD START AND HEAD START PROGRAMS AS WELL AS THE WOMEN, INFANTS, AND CHILDREN'S (WIC) NUTRITION PROGRAM.  GATEWAY HAS BEEN ACTIVELY SUPPORTING THE WORK OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM THROUGHOUT ITS HEAD START CENTERS IN SOUTHERN NEW JERSEY, INCLUDING CELEBRATING THEIR WORK AT THE ANNUAL HEAD START VOLUNTEER LUNCHEON. GATEWAY RECOGNIZES THE IMPORTANT ROLE THAT SENIOR ADULTS CAN PLAY IN THE LIVES OF YOUNG CHILDREN. GATEWAY IS COMMITTED TO ENSURING THAT CHILDREN BENEFIT FROM THE LOVE AND ATTENTION OF A FOSTER GRANDPARENT, AND THAT FOSTER GRANDPARENTS BENEFIT FROM THE OPPORTUNITY TO SHARE THEIR TIME AND TALENTS WITH THE CHILDREN.  
GATEWAY COMMUNITY ACTION PARTNERSHIP WILL WORK WITH AN ESTIMATED 91 FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS TO SERVE IN THE COMMUNITY. ALL THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS, IN CHILD CARE AND HEAD START, HELPING CHILDREN WITH SCHOOL READINESS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE SUPPORTING SCHOOL READINESS IN THE CLASSROOM: HEAD START, CHILD CARE, AND SCHOOL DISTRICT PRESCHOOL PROGRAMS. OTHER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE COMFORTING CHILDREN IN THE CLASSROOM AND ASSISTING WITH CARING FOR INFANTS IN THE EARLY HEAD START CLASSROOMS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION, SPECIFICALLY EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, IT IS EXPECTED THAT CHILDREN WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS, SOCIAL AND/OR EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT, LITERACY SKILLS, AND NUMERACY.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $583,224 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $60,759.

THE FRIENDS PROGRAM, INC. IS A NON-PROFIT HUMAN SERVICES AGENCY OPERATING SINCE 1975 WITH FOUR PROGRAMS: A YOUTH MENTORING PROGRAM, EMERGENCY HOUSING FOR FAMILIES, FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM AND RSVP - RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM.  
92 OR MORE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE EACH YEAR.  THESE VOLUNTEERS WILL SUPPORT CHILDREN'S DEVELOPMENT IN A VARIETY OF WAYS. SOME FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL PROVIDE ONE-TO-ONE AND SMALL GROUP TUTORING TO IMPROVE STUDENT ENGAGEMENT, ATTENDANCE, AND ATTITUDES TOWARD EDUCATION. SUPPORTED STUDENTS WILL SEE IMPROVED OUTCOMES IN LITERACY AS WELL AS MATHEMATICS AS A RESULT OF THEIR INCREASED ENGAGEMENT. SOME FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL PROVIDE SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL SUPPORT TO IMPROVE STUDENTS' UNDERSTANDING OF TASK ORGANIZATION AND TO INCREASE TASK COMPLETION. FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL PROVIDE HELP TO STUDENTS WITH ASSIGNMENT PLANNING, PROBLEM-SOLVING, AND PROVIDE BEHAVIORAL REINFORCEMENT AT THE DIRECTION OF THE TEACHER. THOSE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS ASSIGNED TO CHILD CARE AND HEAD START PROGRAMS WILL SUPPORT PRE-LITERACY ACTIVITIES AND EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT THROUGH READING ALOUD, SUPPORTING TASK COMPLETION, ENCOURAGING COOPERATION, AND PROVIDING ONE-TO-ONE ATTENTION. FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WHO SUPPORT PRESCHOOL STUDENTS WILL INCREASE THEIR APTITUDE FOR SCHOOL READINESS AND BETTER PREPARE THEM FOR ACADEMIC SUCCESS IN A K-12 SETTING. ALL FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL SERVE AS POSITIVE ROLE MODELS AND PROMOTE EACH CHILD'S DEVELOPMENT. 
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA IS EDUCATION.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 1,020 DISADVANTAGED CHILDREN AND YOUTH WILL SHOW EVIDENCE OF INCREASED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT AS EVALUATED BY THEIR TEACHERS. THESE STUDENTS WILL DEMONSTRATE EFFECTS SUCH AS IMPROVED ATTENDANCE, IMPROVED ATTITUDES TOWARDS EDUCATION, IMPROVED BEHAVIOR, POSITIVE CHANGE IN STUDENT SKILLS AND IMPROVED ORGANIZATION AND TASK COMPLETION. THESE IMPROVEMENTS WILL SUPPORT STRONGER RESULTS IN LITERACY AND MATHEMATICS.  95 YOUNG CHILDREN (UNDER 6) WHO ARE AT-RISK OR IN POVERTY WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS.  THESE MOST VULNERABLE CHILDREN WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVED SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT, AGE-APPROPRIATE ACADEMIC ADVANCEMENT AND COGNITIVE AND MOTOR DEVELOPMENT. THE GAINS FOR MANY WILL BE ACCOMPANIED BY STRONGER PRE-MATH AND PRE-LITERACY SKILLS. IN ADDITION, A TOTAL OF MORE THAN 1,300 CHILDREN AND YOUTH WILL BE POSITIVELY IMPACTED BY THE SERVICE AND SUPPORT OF A FOSTER GRANDPARENT IN THEIR CLASSROOM. 
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $517,577 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED WITH $128,580 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES REPRESENTING THE SUPPORT OF THE NEW HAMPSHIRE COMMUNITIES.

THE APPLICANT, PENQUIS C.A.P., INC. (PENQUIS), IS A NONPROFIT COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY WHOSE MISSION IS TO ASSIST INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES IN PREVENTING, REDUCING OR ELIMINATING POVERTY IN THEIR LIVES, AND, THROUGH PARTNERSHIPS, TO ENGAGE THE COMMUNITY IN ADDRESSING ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL NEEDS. PENQUIS HAS ADMINISTERED THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) SINCE 1992 AND SERVES 14 OF MAINE'S 16 COUNTIES (ALL BUT YORK AND CUMBERLAND). AN ESTIMATED 65 FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE, SUPPORTING SCHOOL READINESS AND K-12 SUCCESS BY ASSISTING IN CLASSROOMS AND CHILD CARE CENTERS. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 85% OF PRE-K STUDENTS WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS, IN TERMS OF SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT, AND 90% OF K-12 STUDENTS WILL IMPROVE ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $390,297 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED IN FY21 BY $43,440.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
THE OPPORTUNITY ALLIANCE'S (TOA) PROGRAMS SUPPORT CHILDREN, YOUTH, ADULTS, AND SENIORS; INDIVIDUALS, FAMILIES, AND COMMUNITIES THROUGHOUT MAINE.  ITS' FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) CREATES OPPORTUNITIES FOR MEN AND WOMEN AGE 55+ WITH INCOME BELOW POVERTY AND INTERESTED IN VOLUNTEERING IN ACTIVITIES ADDRESSING CRITICAL COMMUNITY NEEDS. 
A COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM FOUNDED IN 1965 DURING THE WAR ON POVERTY, TOA'S FGP HAS SINCE 1974 MADE MANAGED VOLUNTEER PLACEMENTS IN SOUTHERN MAINE SUPPORTING SCHOOL READINESS IN CHILD DEVELOPMENT CENTERS AND HEAD START CLASSROOMS AND  ACADEMIC SUCCESS WITH K-12 STUDENTS. 
SINCE ITS INCEPTION TOA'S FGP HAS BEEN KNOWN FOR ITS CREATIVE AND COLLABORATIVE PROGRAMMING.  PROGRAM STAFF ARE PROFESSIONAL VOLUNTEER MANAGERS WHO ALONG WITH A STRONG AND VIBRANT ADVISORY COUNCIL, CONTINUALLY ASSESS PROGRAMMING AND VOLUNTEER PARTICIPATION TO ENSURE THAT STATED GOALS AND OBJECTIVES ARE MET THROUGH PLACEMENT OF FOSTER GRANDPARENTS IN OVER 45 LOCATIONS THROUGHOUT YORK, CUMBERLAND AND WITH AN AGREEMENT FROM PENQUIS COMMUNITY ACTION, PARTS OF OXFORD COUNTY.  
TOA'S FGP SUCCESS IS EVIDENT IN ABILITY TO PLACE 100+ VOLUNTEERS ANNUALLY IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS IN THE FOCUS AREA EDUCATION AND ITS OBJECTIVES SCHOOL READINESS AND K-12 SUCCESS. WITH THIS APPLICATION TOA HAS A COMMITMENT OF $165,000 IN MATCHING NON-FEDERAL FUNDING IN ADDITION TO THE $569,714. IN FEDERAL FUNDING TO ENSURE A SUCCESSFUL PROGRAM.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
SHORE UP! INC. (SELF-HELP ON RURAL ECONOMICS & URBAN PROBLEMS) IS A PRIVATE, NON-PROFIT COMMUNITY ACTION PARTNERSHIP ON MARYLAND'S EASTERN SHORE THAT HAS BEEN IN EXISTENCE SINCE 1965.  SHORE UP! IS DEDICATED TO BUILDING COMMUNITIES, CHANGING LIVES, AND EMPOWERING INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES TO MAINTAIN LONG-TERM INDEPENDENCE AND ACHIEVE ECONOMIC SECURITY THROUGH A COMPREHENSIVE SYSTEM OF SERVICES AND RESOURCES. 
   SHORE UP! WOULD LIKE TO SUBMIT A GRANT APPLICATION FOR FY 2020 FGP GRANT RENEWAL QUARTER 4 (YEAR 1 OF A MULTI-YEAR GRANT). THE PRIMARY PROGRAM FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS "EDUCATION". THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM WILL ENGAGE ADULTS 55 AND OLDER TO PROVIDE CARING, NURTURING, AND EXPERIENCED MENTORS TO CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL AND/OR EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS, AND/OR TO THOSE CHILDREN WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM PERSONALIZED INSTRUCTION BASED ON THEIR INDIVIDUAL STRENGTHS AND NEEDS.  SENIOR CORPS FOSTER GRANDPARENT (FG) VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN OUTCOME-BASED ASSIGNMENTS TO PROVIDE SERVICES THAT CONTRIBUTE TO IMPROVED EDUCATIONAL OUTCOMES FOR ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL AND/OR EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS. ACTIVITIES MAY INCLUDE PROVIDING SUPPORT THAT CONTRIBUTES TO SCHOOL READINESS, PROVIDING SUPPORT THAT ENHANCES ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, AND PROVIDING SUPPORT THAT IMPROVES ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT. AMONG OTHER ACTIVITIES, FG VOLUNTEERS WILL REVIEW SCHOOLWORK, READ BOOKS, COMFORT CHILDREN, REINFORCE VALUES, WORK IN SMALL GROUPS, AND CARE FOR INFANTS AND CHILDREN WITH DISABILITIES, AND ASSIST WITH ENGLISH LEARNERS IN THEIR ASSIGNED CLASSROOMS. 
    AT THE END OF THIS THREE-YEAR GRANT, FG VOLUNTEERS WILL SUPPORT MORE THAN 1,500 CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL AND/OR EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS AND CHILDREN WHO REQUIRE PERSONALIZED INSTRUCTION BASED ON THEIR INDIVIDUAL STRENGTHS AND NEEDS. FG VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN OUTCOME-BASED ASSIGNMENTS AT ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS, HEAD START AND EARLY HEAD START CENTERS TO PROVIDE SERVICES THAT CONTRIBUTED TO ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL AND/OR EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS DEMONSTRATING IMPROVED EDUCATIONAL OUTCOMES.. ACTIVITIES WILL HAVE INCLUDED PROVIDING SUPPORTS THAT CONTRIBUTED TO SCHOOL READINESS, PROVIDING SUPPORTS THAT IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, AND PROVIDING SUPPORTS THAT ENHANCED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT. AMONG THE OTHER ACTIVITIES, FG VOLUNTEERS REVIEWED SCHOOLWORK, READ BOOKS, COMFORTED CHILDREN, REINFORCED VALUES, WORKED IN SMALL GROUPS, CARED FOR INFANTS AND CHILDREN WITH DISABILITIES, AND ASSISTED WITH ENGLISH LEARNERS IN THEIR ASSIGNED CLASSROOMS. 
   THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $324,014 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY IN-KIND DONATIONS AND CONTRIBUTIONS IN THE AMOUNT OF $35,357.

FIFTY-ONE FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE UNDER THE GRANT YEAR 2020-2023.  THIRTY-ONE VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED AT THIRTEEN VOLUNTEER STATIONS FOR A MINIMUM OF FIFTEEN HOURS PER WEEK DURING THE SCHOOL YEAR & ASSIGNED TO FOUR AT RISK STUDENTS EACH, WHO HAS BEEN IDENTIFIED BY THEIR TEACHER.  THESE VOLUNTEERS WILL CONDUCT DAILY TEACHER APPROVED ACTIVITIES THAT FOCUS ON HELPING KINDERGARTEN THROUGH GRADE TWELVE STUDENTS REACH THEIR INDIVIDUALIZED, TEACHER-IDENTIFIED ACADEMIC GOALS. SIXTEEN VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN SIX PRESCHOOL LOCATIONS & TWO HEAD STARTS AND WILL VOLUNTEER A MINIMUM OF FIFTEEN HOURS PER WEEK OVER TWELVE MONTHS. THESE VOLUNTEERS WILL EACH BE ASSIGNED FOUR AT RISK STUDENTS. THEIR GOAL WILL BE TO IMPROVE PRE-LITERACY SKILLS WORKING TOWARDS SCHOOL READINESS. FOUR VOLUNTEERS WILL BE ASSIGNED TO TWO AFTER SCHOOL PROGRAMS AND TWO SPECIAL NEED PROGRAM VOLUNTEER STATIONS FOR A MINIMUM OF FIFTEEN HOURS PER WEEK OVER TWELVE MONTHS WITH AT RISK STUDENTS FOCUSING ON ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT OR SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL SKILLS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION FOR PRESCHOOL THROUGH TO GRADE TWELVE.  AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM UNDER THE NATIONAL PERFORMANCE MEASURES EDUCATION SCHOOL READINESS FOR PRESCHOOLERS AND IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE FOR KINDERGARTEN TO GRADE TWELVE, VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE A) EXPOSED THE STUDENTS TO LITERACY ACTIVITIES B) ENCOURAGED THE YOUTH TO REMAIN IN SCHOOL TO GRADUATE & C) HELPED STUDENTS ACHIEVE IMPROVEMENT IN SCHOOL READINESS, READING AND MATH SKILLS, BEHAVIOR AND ATTITUDE. THESE GOALS WILL GIVE THE STUDENTS A LITERACY FOUNDATION TO GRADUATE TO THE NEXT GRADE LEVEL EACH YEAR. COASTLINE ELDERLY SERVICES, INC. OF NEW BEDFORD, MA IS THE SPONSORING AGENCY APPLYING FOR THE GRANT RENEWAL (YEAR 1 OF 3) OF THE SENIOR CORPS GRANT FOR THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $328,419 FOR FIFTY-ONE VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $34,230 NON-FEDERAL FUNDING. VOLUNTEERS WILL BE ASSIGNED TO TWENTY-FIVE STATIONS IN THE DARTMOUTH, FAIRHAVEN, NEW BEDFORD, WAREHAM, AND PLYMOUTH TOWNS.

AN ESTIMATED 51 FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS ALL 51 WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TUTORING IN PUBLIC SCHOOL, ASSISTING IN HEAD START CLASSROOMS AND ASSISTING IN EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION CLASSROOMS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. IN THIS APPLICATION, ACTION FOR BOSTON COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT (ABCD) IS SEEKING RENEWAL OF ITS FOSTER GRANDPARENTS PROGRAM (FGP) SERVING BOSTON, CAMBRIDGE, EVERETT, MALDEN, MEDFORD, MELROSE, QUINCY, SOMERVILLE AND STONEHAM, MA. THE MISSION OF ABCD IS TO EMPOWER LOW INCOME PEOPLE BY PROVIDING THEM WITH THE TOOLS TO OVERCOME POVERTY, LIVE WITH DIGNITY, AND ACHIEVE THEIR FULL POTENTIAL. THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS PROGRAM HAS BEEN AN INTEGRAL PART OF THAT MISSION SINCE 1965.

ABCD INTENDS TO PLACE 150 LOW-INCOME VOLUNTEERS, AGES 55 AND OLDER, IN EDUCATION BASED ASSIGNMENTS WITH CHILDCARE CENTERS, HEAD START CLASSROOMS, AND PUBLIC/PRIVATE SCHOOLS IN BOSTON, CAMBRIDGE, EVERETT, MALDEN, MEDFORD, MELROSE, QUINCY, SOMERVILLE, AND STONEHAM, WHERE THEY WILL PROVIDE ONE-ON-ONE AND SMALL GROUP SERVICES TO CHILDREN. SERVICE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE ASSISTING IN HEAD START AND PRESCHOOL CLASSROOMS, SPECIFICALLY IN THE AREA OF SCHOOL READINESS (SOCIAL- EMOTIONAL AND LITERACY); PROVIDING TUTORING IN K-12 PRIVATE, PAROCHIAL, AND PUBLIC SCHOOLS TO SUPPORT LITERACY OUTCOMES, AND PROVIDING MENTORING IN A SCHOOL-BASED PROGRAM. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION, ADDRESSING BOTH SCHOOL READINESS AND SUCCEEDING IN KINDERGARTEN THROUGH 12TH GRADE OBJECTIVES. 

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $876,711 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY A MATCH OF $143,910 IN NON-FEDERAL FUNDS, AND WILL ADDITIONALLY LEVERAGE MANY OTHER RESOURCES AT ABCD, SUCH AS A FULLY OPERATIONAL FGP INFRASTRUCTURE, AND SOLID FISCAL MANAGEMENT, PROGRAM DESIGN, AND PROGRAM EVALUATION EXPERTISE. 

ALL VOLUNTEER INFORMATION AND SERVICES ARE TRACKED AND MONITORED USING ABCD'S INTERNAL DATA MANAGEMENT AND PAYROLL SYSTEMS. THIS SYSTEM ENSURES THAT PROGRAM OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES ARE COLLECTED, MEASURED, AND MANAGED IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE MEASURES OUTLINED IN THE PERFORMANCE MEASUREMENT SECTION OF THIS PROPOSAL, AND IN COMPLIANCE WITH ALL FGP FEDERAL REGULATIONS. EVERY FALL, ABCD HAS ITS FGP PARTNERS COMPLETE ASSIGNMENT PLANS INDICATING THE FREQUENCY AND DURATION OF SERVICES TO BE PROVIDED TO ASSIGNED CHILDREN, AND THE SPECIFIC NEEDS TO BE ADDRESSED BY THE FGP WORKING WITH ASSIGNED CHILDREN. THE PARTNER ALSO DOCUMENTS CHILDREN'S SPECIAL NEEDS AS DETERMINED BY THE NECESSARY PROFESSIONAL. AT THE END OF THE SCHOOL YEAR, ABCD HAS PARTNERS COMPLETE AND SHARE INFORMATION IN A CONFIDENTIAL AND TIMELY MANNER USING OUTCOME MEASUREMENT TOOLS REFERENCED IN THE PERFORMANCE MEASURE SECTION OF THIS PROPOSAL. DATA IS COLLECTED AND ENTERED EACH YEAR INTO ABCD'S DATABASE TO REPORT OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES. FOSTER GRANDPARENTS ALSO COMPLETE A SELF-EVALUATION ABOUT THEIR PARTICIPATION IN THE PROGRAM. DATA IS COLLECTED BY FGP STAFF, AND THE FGP MANAGER AND THE ELDER SERVICES DIRECTOR ANALYZE THE DATA. THEY COMPARE RESULTS TO ESTABLISHED BENCHMARKS AND PERFORMANCE MEASURES IN THE WORK PLAN WITH INPUT FROM PROGRAM STAFF. THE VICE PRESIDENT FOR INSTITUTIONAL ADVANCEMENT AND THE EXECUTIVE VICE PRESIDENT ALSO REVIEW RESULTS OF PERFORMANCE. ANY CHANGES, CHALLENGES, STRENGTHS, AND DISCUSSIONS WITH PARTNERS, OR OTHER SIGNIFICANT DATA ARE ANALYZED AND IMPROVEMENT PLANS, IF NEEDED, ARE FORMULATED. THE PRESIDENT/CEO AND THE ELDER SERVICES COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS REVIEW THE RESULTS AND IF NEEDED, IMPROVEMENT PLAN.

AN ESTIMATED 59 FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THE GREATER NEW HAVEN AREA IN CT. THE VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE INDIVIDUALIZED SERVICES IN THE AREA OF SCHOOL READINESS THROUGH CLASSROOM ASSISTANCE AT 12 VOLUNTEER STATIONS SUCH AS HEAD START/SCHOOL READINESS PROGRAMS AND CHILD DEVELOPMENT CENTERS THAT ARE LOCATED  IN LOW-INCOME NEIGHBORHOODS AS IDENTIFIED BY THE CITY OF NEW HAVEN, AND WHO SERVE CHILDREN FROM THESE AREAS OR WHO HAVE BEEN  IDENTIFIED WITH SPECIAL NEEDS AND/OR WHO QUALIFY FOR THE FREE LUNCH PROGRAM. SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE VOLUNTEERS  WORKING WITH SELECTED CHILDREN TO HELP THEM DEVELOP  APPROPRIATE SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL BEHAVIORS SUCH AS COOPERATION, RECOGNITION OF FEELINGS AND SHARING WITH OTHERS. A SPECIAL  CORPS OF BILINGUAL VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO ASSIST CHILDREN WHO HAVE A LANGUAGE BARRIER TO DEVELOP APPROPRIATE SOCIAL BEHAVIORS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THE FGP IS EDUCATION IN THE AREA OF SCHOOL READINESS. THE EXPECTED IMPACT OF THE PROJECT IS THAT 70%   CHILDREN ASSIGNED A FOSTER GRANDPARENT WILL HAVE A POSITIVE EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCE THAT WILL LEAD TO IMPROVEMENT IN SOCIAL BEHAVIOR, AND PROMOTION TO THE NEXT GRADE LEVEL. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $358,463 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $ 82250 OF LOCAL SUPPORT AND RESOURCES.

THE MISSION OF THE CITY OF EL PASO COMMUNITY AND HUMAN DEVELOPMENT FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IS TO PROVIDE LOW TO MODERATE-INCOME SENIORS THAT ARE AGE 55 AND OLDER WITH ENRICHED VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES.  VOLUNTEERS SERVE AT SCHOOLS, AGENCIES, OR ORGANIZATIONS THAT SERVE THE COMMUNITY.  THEY ARE ABLE TO MENTOR AND PROVIDE INDIVIDUAL ATTENTION TO CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL OR EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS.

A PEER-REVIEWED ARTICLE MENTIONS THAT, "OLDER VOLUNTEERS REPORTED A WIDE VARIETY OF BENEFITS TO THE PEOPLE THEY SERVED, THEMSELVES, THEIR FAMILIES, AND COMMUNITIES.  MORE THAN 30% REPORTED THAT THEY WERE 'A GREAT DEAL BETTER OFF' BECAUSE OF VOLUNTEERING" NANCY MARROW-HOWELL, PH.D. ET AL, MAR 17, 2009, THE GERONTOLOGIST - WHO BENEFITS FROM VOLUNTEERING? VARIATIONS IN PERCEIVED BENEFITS). VOLUNTEERS IN THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM HAVE A SUCCESSFUL HISTORY OF PROVIDING SERVICES WITH SCHOOLS, LOCAL AGENCIES, AND ORGANIZATIONS TO ASSIST CHILDREN THROUGH MEANINGFUL VOLUNTEERING. 

THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IS IN EDUCATION.  THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA SUPPORTS CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL AND EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS THROUGH MENTORING, TUTORING, AND CLASSROOM SUPPORT.  VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN SCHOOL READINESS AND GRADES K-12.  APPROXIMATELY 85 VOLUNTEERS WILL ACTIVELY ASSIST WITH STUDENTS TO IMPROVE ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT OR SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL SKILLS.   THE VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AT ABOUT 40 VOLUNTEER LOCATIONS THROUGHOUT THE CITY AND COUNTY OF EL PASO. 
 
THE FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL FOCUS ON OUTCOMES ED23A AND ED27C.   OUTCOME ED23A WILL FOCUS ON PREPARING CHILDREN FOR SCHOOL READINESS, WHICH INCLUDES BUT NOT LIMITED TO PHYSICAL WELL-BEING, HEALTH AND MOTOR DEVELOPMENT, SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT, AND AGE-APPROPRIATE ACADEMIC SKILLS AND BEHAVIOR.  OUTCOME ED27C WILL CONCENTRATE ON IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT OR SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL SKILLS.  

FUNDING FOR THE CITY OF EL PASO COMMUNITY AND HUMAN DEVELOPMENT FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM COMES FROM THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS) FOR $494,091.  THE PROGRAM ALSO RECEIVES $5,000 FROM THE DEPARTMENT OF AGING AND DISABILITY SERVICES (DADS), AND MATCH FUNDS OF $58,364.  THE MATCH FUNDS ARE OVER THE 10% THAT ARE REQUIRED FROM CNCS FOR THE GRANT.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
SENIOR LIFE MIDLAND IS A PRIVATE NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION THAT ACCEPTS AND HAS THE CAPABILITY TO ADMINISTER THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROJECT. THE FOCUS AREA IS "EDUCATION" WITH EIGHT UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS PLACED IN CLASSROOMS IN PREK SCHOOL READINESS, AND 23 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS IN K-12 IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE. VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TUTORING AND MENTORING. THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM PROVIDES SUPPORTIVE PERSON-TO-PERSON SERVICE TO AT-RISK CHILDREN IN CIRCUMSTANCES THAT LIMIT THEIR ACADEMIC, SOCIAL OR EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT. CHILDREN WHO COME FROM LOW INCOME HOMES AND ARE DEPRIVED OF THE MOST BASIC OF NECESSITIES SUCH AS HOUSING, FOOD INSECURITY, AND OFTEN COME FROM BROKEN HOMES ARE THE MOST VULNERABLE, UNDERSERVED AT RISK POPULATION (TEACHING WITH POVERTY IN MIND, NOV. 2009). EACH FOSTER GRANDPARENT WILL  HAVE AN ASSIGNMENT PLAN FOR EACH SCHOOL ASSIGNED AT RISK STUDENT IDENTIFYING END-OF-YEAR SPECIFIC OUTCOMES AND THE ACTIVITIES FOR THE VOLUNTEER WITH ASSIGNED STUDENT. VOLUNTEER TIMESHEETS WILL ALSO BE TOOLS USED AS A BASIS FOR TRACKING AND CALCULATING VOLUNTEER SERVICE HOURS. MEASURABLE START OF THE SCHOOL YEAR AND END OF  THE SCHOOL YEAR TEACHER SURVEYS, COLLECTED BY FGP COORDINATOR, AND OBSERVATION OUTCOMES WILL GIVE A BIGGER PICTURE OF THE COMPELLING DIFFERENCE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS MAKE IN A CHILD'S LIFE.
 THE STIPEND OF $2.65 AN HOUR PLUS MILEAGE REIMBURSEMENT WILL ENABLE THE FGP VOLUNTEERS TO SERVE WITHOUT COST TO THEMSELVES. THE STIPEND WILL NOT HAVE AN EFFECT ON VOLUNTEER'S ELIGIBILITY OR GOVERNMENT ASSISTED PROGRAMS. THIS GIVES THE VOLUNTEER A SENSE OF PURPOSE THAT CAN CONTRIBUTE TO HEALTH BENEFITS AND THE OPPORTUNITY TO EARN EXTRA MONEY THAT WILL HELP WITH UTILITIES, MEDICAL COSTS AND OTHER EXPENSES THAT THE VOLUNTEER MAY STRUGGLE WITH. THE VOLUNTEER MAY SERVE FOR A MINIMUM OF 15 HOURS PER WEEK, BUT NOT MORE THAN 40 HOURS PER WEEK. FOSTER GRANDPARENTS ARE PLACED IN LOCAL SCHOOLS, THE COUNTY LIBRARY AND OTHER NON-FOR-PROFIT COMMUNITY PARTNERS. SENIOR LIFE'S SUCCESS IS DUE TO THE GREAT LOCAL SUPPORT THAT IT HAS GENERATED THROUGHOUT ITS 35 YEAR EXISTENCE AND ALLOWS SENIOR LIFE THE ABILITY TO MEET THE NON-FEDERAL MATCH OF $20,001.11 THE  REQUIRED .09%  OF THE GRANTEE SHARE.
THE SENIOR LIFE MIDLAND FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IS COMMITTED TO MEETING THE CHALLENGE BY PROPOSING TO MANAGE AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT 31 FOSTER GRANDPARENT VSYS UNDER A PROGRAM DIRECTOR AND COORDINATOR. TO HARNESS THIS INVALUABLE HUMAN CAPITAL SENIOR LIFE MIDLAND PROPOSES THE 
RENEWAL OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM'S ANNUAL GRANT AMOUNT OF $180,010.00 FOR EACH BUDGET PERIOD.

JUNE 2022.  THE CVCOG HAS SPONSORED THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IN THE FOURTEEN-COUNTY SERVICE AREA SINCE THE EARLY 1990?S AND HAS THE EXPERTISE AND ADMINISTRATIVE SUPPORT SYSTEM REQUIRED TO ADMINISTER THE PROGRAM IN COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL FINANCIAL AND PROGRAMMATIC REQUIREMENTS WHILE PROVIDING A HIGH LEVEL OF SERVICE TO THE CLIENTS SERVED BY OUR FOSTER GRANDPARENTS

AN ESTIMATED 69 FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN HARRIS COUNTY, TEXAS. THEY WILL TUTOR AND MENTOR CHILDREN AND YOUTH THROUGH A NETWORK OF 35 PLACEMENT SITES SUCH AS ELEMENTARY SCHOOL, HEAD START PROGRAMS, EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION CENTERS AND DAY CARES AT SEVERAL SHELTERS.

THEIR ACTIVITIES WOULD INCLUDE ONE-ON-ONE ASSISTANCE, DEPENDING ON THE CLIENT'S INDIVIDUAL NEEDS; COMPANIONSHIP; DRIVING AND ACCOMPANYING TO APPOINTMENTS; ASSISTANCE WITH SHOPPING; LIGHT HOUSEKEEPING AS NEEDED; LIGHT COOKING AS NEEDED; SOCIALIZING WITH THE CLIENT.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREAS OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE SERVICES TO THE SENIOR POPULATION IN QUAY COUNTY. OZARKS AREA COMMUNITY ACTION CORPORATION (OACAC), SPONSOR OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP), IS A NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION WORKING TO ALLEVIATE THE CAUSES AND CONDITIONS OF POVERTY ACROSS SOUTHWEST MISSOURI. THE MISSION OF ENRICHING THE LIVES OF FAMILIES AND INDIVIDUALS WITHIN OUR COMMUNITIES BY PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES, OFFERING ASSISTANCE AND EMPOWERING PEOPLE TO MAKE POSITIVE CHANGE IS PUT INTO ACTION THROUGH OACAC PROGRAMS AND PROJECTS, INCLUDING THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM. 

OACAC IS REQUESTING $287,753 TO SUPPORT 58 VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS (VSY), WHICH WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $94,801 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES. WITH THE FOCUS OF EDUCATION, PROGRAM OBJECTIVES INCLUDE SCHOOL READINESS AND K-12 SUCCESS. FOSTER GRANDPARENTS IN 14 COUNTIES ACROSS SOUTHWEST MISSOURI WILL ASSIST YOUTH WITH TUTORING, MENTORING, CLASSROOM TEACHING AND SUPPORT, SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL SUPPORT, AND PROBLEM SOLVING. STUDIES FROM THE AMERICAN PSYCHOLOGICAL ASSOCIATION SHOW CHRONIC STRESS, DEFINED AS A "LONG TERM FORM OF STRESS, DERIVED FROM UNENDING FEELINGS OF DESPAIR/HOPELESSNESS, AS A RESULT OF FACTORS SUCH AS POVERTY, FAMILY DYSFUNCTION, FEELINGS OF HELPLESSNESS, AND/OR TRAUMATIC EARLY CHILDHOOD EXPERIENCES," COMPROMISES AN INDIVIDUAL IN MULTIPLE WAYS. CHILDREN IN LOW-INCOME COMMUNITIES FACE A SIGNIFICANT AMOUNT OF CHRONIC STRESS, WHICH CAN CAUSE POOR HEALTH, IMPAIRED LEARNING, AND DISRUPTED COGNITIVE, EMOTIONAL, AND PHYSICAL DEVELOPMENT. 

THE OBJECTIVES ADDRESSED BY THE OACAC FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM ENSURE A HIGHER QUALITY OF LIFE. UPON COMPLETION OF THE VSY, YOUTH WILL HAVE GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS, AS WELL AS IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT AND SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL SKILLS. ADDITIONALLY, FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE SERVED AS ROLE MODELS AND LEADERS IN THEIR COMMUNITIES; HAVING HAD OPPORTUNITIES TO SHARE THEIR UNIQUE SKILL SETS AND COMPASSION WITH OTHERS.

THE LCOA FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM WILL ADDRESS SUCH COMMUNITY NEEDS AS SCHOOL READINESS AND THE ABILITY TO READ.  FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL ASSIST CHILDREN IN VARIOUS AREAS SUCH AS :  LANGUAGE-FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL HELP CHILDREN MASTER THEIR LANGUAGE SKILLS, WHICH IN TURN WILL HELP INCREASE READING ABILITY AS WELL AS IMPROVE SPEECH AND SPEAKING ABILITY; CONCENTRATION-FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL HELP CHILDREN SIT STILL AND FOCUS ON ONE TASK AT A TIME, WHICH WILL HELP STRETCH ATTENTION SPAN; WORK ATTITUDE-FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL HELP TEACH CHILDREN THE IMPORTANCE OF COMPLETING TASKS, EVEN THE LEAST ENJOYABLE ONES, AS THIS IS A VERY IMPORTANT COMPONENT OF THE "ADULT" WORLD; COORDINATION-FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL HELP CHILDREN IMPROVE AND STRENGTHEN MUSCLE TONE BY ENGAGING THEM IN SUCH ACTIVITIES AS THROWING AND CATCHING BALLS, TOSSING BEAN BAGS, AND CRUMPLING PAPER; BODY PARTS-FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL HELP CHILDREN DEVELOP POSITIVE BODY IMAGE BY HELPING THEM TO IDENTIFY THE RIGHT AND LEFT SIDE OF THEIR BODIES; THIS WILL, IN TURN, HELP THEM BETTER INTERPRET THE WORLD AROUND THEM; COUNTING-FOSTER GRANDPARENT WILL HELP CHILDREN LEARN HOW TO COUNT; THEREBY, TEACHING THEM SIMPLE MATH SKILLS; COLORS-FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL HELP CHILDREN LEARN HOW TO IDENTIFY BASIC COLORS SUCH AS WHITE, BLACK, GREEN, RED, BLUE, AND YELLOW.  ALL OF THE ABOVE-MENTIONED ACTIVITIES WILL BE DONE WITH MUCH REPETITION AND PLAY  (WWW.LEARNINGINFO.ORG/EARLY-CHILDHOOD-EDUCATION.HTM). 

FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL ALSO ASSIST IN ACTIVITIES DESIGNED TO HELP BUILD SOCIALIZATION, BEHAVIOR-MANAGEMENT, AND PROBLEM-SOLVING SKILLS, INDEPENDENCE, AND SELF-CONFIDENCE THROUGH THE USE OF EXPLORATION, EXPERIMENTATION, AND CONVERSATION.

THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES ARE THAT CHILDREN RECEIVING FGP ASSISTANCE WILL DEMONSTRATE SIGNIFICANT IMPROVEMENT IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF SOCIAL, BEHAVIORAL, AND PROBLEM-SOLVING SKILLS, EXUDE CONFIDENCE, AND DEMONSTRATE INDEPENDENCE.  IN ADDITION, THE CHILDREN WILL BE PREPARED TO ENROLL IN KINDERGARTEN OR BE PROMOTED TO THE NEXT GRADE LEVEL, HAVING MASTERED PRE-READING SKILLS, GROWN RICHER IN VOCABULARY AND DEMONSTRATED STRONG BASIC MATH SKILLS.

IN THE K-12 TUTORING, THE VOLUNTEER WILL PROVIDE INSTRUCTION AND ASSISTANCE WITH ACTIVITIES, ONE-ON-ONE OR IN SMALL GROUPS, PER THE CHILD CARE PLAN IN ANY OF THE FOLLOWING AREAS: READING, LANGUAGE, LITERACY, WRITING, MATH, SPELLING, ATTENTION DEVELOPMENT, PROMOTING POSITIVE BEHAVIOR, ENCOURAGING ATTENDANCE AND PARTICIPATION, AND ACTIVITIES OF DAILY LIVING.  IN SCHOOL READINESS, THE VOLUNTEER WILL BE ASSIGNED TO PRE-ELEMENTARY CHILDREN THAT ARE NOT READY FOR SCHOOL.  PER THE CHILD CARE PLAN, THE VOLUNTEER WILL WORK TO ENGAGE THE CHILDREN IN SCHOOL READINESS ACTIVITIES: COGNITIVE/LITERACY READINESS, SOCIALIZATION, LANGUAGE, PRE-READING SKILLS, LETTER AND NUMBER IDENTIFICATION, FINE MOTOR SKILLS AND POSITIVE CLASSROOM BEHAVIOR THROUGH ACTIVITIES AND PLAY.  IN OPIOID/DRUG INTERVENTION THE FGP VOLUNTEER WILL TEACH OPIOID/DRUG INTERVENTION PROGRAMS IN PUBLIC SCHOOLS, AFTER SCHOOL PROGRAMS, LIBRARIES AND OTHER COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS. FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL RECEIVE DRUG ABUSE INTERVENTION AND PREVENTION TRAINING TO HELP STUDENTS DEVELOP THE SKILLS NEEDED FOR SELF-CONTROL, EMOTIONAL AWARENESS, COMMUNICATION, SOCIAL PROBLEM-SOLVING, ACADEMIC SUPPORT AND IDENTIFYING TRUSTED ADULTS WHEN SEEKING HELP. FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL PROVIDE GUIDANCE REDUCING RISK FACTORS FOR DRUG ABUSE.  FOLLOWING COMPLETION OF THE FGP ASSIGNMENT OR SCHOOL TERM, A POST ASSESSMENT OF THE CHILD'S OVERALL PERFORMANCE WILL BE COMPLETED TO EVALUATE THE CHILD'S PROGRESS. PROGRAM IMPACT WILL BE MEASURED THROUGH THE CHILD CARE PLAN, PRE-ASSESSMENTS AND POST ASSESSMENTS, WORKSTATION AND VOLUNTEER SURVEYS, EVALUATIONS AND DRUG INTERVENTION TRAINING RECORDS AND SURVEYS.  THE CARE AND ATTENTION OF A FOSTER GRANDPARENT WILL PROVIDE CHILDREN THE ONE-ON-ONE INTERVENTION REQUIRED TO ADDRESS THEIR NEEDS, RESULTING IN IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN MATH, LITERACY AND LANGUAGE, MORE INDEPENDENCE, EMOTIONAL GROWTH, IMPROVED SELF-ESTEEM, IMPROVED BEHAVIOR AND REDUCED RISK FACTORS FOR DRUG USE.   GIVING THE CHILDREN THE TOOLS THEY NEED TO BECOME SUCCESSFUL, CONTRIBUTING MEMBERS OF THEIR COMMUNITY.

AN ESTIMATED 27 FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE PRESCHOOL AND/OR ELEMENTARY SCHOOL CHILDREN.  OF THIS NUMBER, ALL 27 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE:  HELPING CHILDREN DEVELOP READING, MATH, AND COMMUNICATION SKILLS; PROVIDING CHILDREN WITH EMOTIONAL SUPPORT; KEEPING CHILDREN ON TASK AND FOCUSED; AND MODELING AND ENCOURAGING APPROPRIATE BEHAVIOR.  THIS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH A NETWORK OF 18 STATION SITES SUCH AS HEAD START FACILITIES AND PUBLIC SCHOOLS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 78 CHILDREN IN AREA HEAD START CLASSROOMS WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SOCIAL AND/OR EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT WHILE 162 STUDENTS IN LOCAL PUBLIC ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS WILL HAVE IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $150,038 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $33,874.

FIFTYFORWARD, A NON-PROFIT AGENCY, HAS SPONSORED THE NASHVILLE, DAVIDSON COUNTY FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) FOR 54 YEARS. THE FGPROGRAM WAS THE FIRST ESTABLISHED IN THE U.S. FIFTYFORWARD HAS BEEN A PROVIDER OF SENIOR SERVICES IN DAVIDSON COUNTY FOR MORE THAN SIXTY-ONE YEARS. THEIR MISSION IS TO SUPPORT, CHAMPION AND ENHANCE THE LIVES OF THOSE 50 AND OLDER.  THE FGPROGRAM OFFERS REWARDING VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES TO SENIORS BY PARTNERING WITH 14 VOLUNTEER SITES:  SIX PRE-ELEMENTARY CHILD LEARNING CENTERS AND EIGHT METRO NASHVILLE PUBLIC AND CHARTER SCHOOLS. DURING THIS THREE YEAR GRANT PERIOD, AN ESTIMATED 55 FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE 20 HOURS EACH WEEK, PROVIDING A TOTAL OF 57,420 HOURS OF SERVICE EACH YEAR. VOLUNTEER SITES ARE LOCATED IN SEVEN NASHVILLE DISTRICTS WITH THE HIGHEST RATES OF VIOLENT CRIME, UNEMPLOYMENT AND LOWEST ELEVENTH GRADE TEST SCORES. CHILDREN IN THESE AREAS LIVE IN A CONSTANTLY CHANGING AND UNPREDICTABLE WORLD. MANY SUFFER EMOTIONAL NEGLECT, LIVE IN DYSFUNCTIONAL HOMES, AND HAVE PARENTS THAT ARE INCARCERATED; ALL FACTORS THAT LEAD TO POOR SOCIAL, EMOTIONAL AND ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE. THE FGPROGRAM'S FOCUS IS EDUCATION. ALL VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS, WORKING IN A SUPPORTIVE ROLE WITH ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED AND SPECIAL OR EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS CHILDREN. WHILE SERVING CHILDREN, VOLUNTEERS WILL BE POSITIVE ROLE MODELS, PROVIDE FRIENDSHIP AND SHOW UNCONDITIONAL ACCEPTANCE. IN CHILD LEARNING CENTERS, VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST IN THE CLASSROOM USING POSITIVE INTERACTION AND SUPPORT; THEY WILL FOCUS ON SOCIAL/EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT AND SCHOOL READINESS AS DESCRIBED IN PERFORMANCE MEASURE ED23. AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT, IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT ASSIGNED CHILDREN SERVED WILL SHOW AN IMPROVEMENT IN ACADEMIC SKILLS AND BEHAVIOR AND ARE BETTER PREPARED TO ENTER KINDERGARTEN. IN METRO SCHOOLS, K-4TH GRADE, VOLUNTEERS WILL GIVE THEIR TIME TO STRUGGLING STUDENTS, DEVELOP A TRUSTING RELATIONSHIP AND SUPPORT ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT AND SOCIAL EMOTIONAL SKILLS AS DESCRIBED IN PERFORMANCE MEASURE ED27C. AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT, DUE TO THE RELATIONSHIP WITH A FOSTER GRANDPARENT, STUDENTS WILL SHOW AN IMPROVED INTEREST IN SCHOOL, INCREASED EDUCATIONAL GOALS AND IMPROVED SOCIAL EMOTIONAL SKILLS WHICH BENEFIT THE STUDENT'S DAILY INTERACTION WITHIN THE CLASSROOM. FGP IS SUPPORTED FINANCIALLY BY DOLLAR GENERAL LITERACY FOUNDATION $21,000, METRO NASHVILLE UNITED WAY $19,000 AND FIFTYFORWARD $73,085. CHILD CENTERS AND METRO SCHOOLS PROVIDE IN-KIND RESOURCES OF $44,000. FIFTYFORWARD'S FGPROGRAM  IS REQUESTING A CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $306,828.00

AN ESTIMATED TWENTY-SIX (26) UNDUPLICATED FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS (VSYS) WILL SERVE CHILDREN WHO HAVE SPECIAL OR EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS OR ARE ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS IN THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA. FGP PROPOSAL - JULY 1, 2019 - JUNE 30, 2020
THE KNOXVILLE-KNOX COUNTY COMMUNITY ACTION COMMITTEE (CAC) SUBMITS THIS PROPOSAL TO ADMINISTER THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) IN KNOX COUNTY AND BLOUNT COUNTY, TENNESSEE.  FGP REQUESTS $440,130 TO PROVIDE 74 VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS (VSY'S).  FGP PROPOSES TO ENROLL 74 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS TO ASSIST 148 CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL AND EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS, WITH 100% OF VOLUNTEERS PARTICIPATING IN OUTCOME-BASED WORK PLANS.  VOLUNTEERS WILL ENGAGE CHILDREN ONE-ON-ONE AND IN SMALL GROUP SETTINGS TO PROVIDE TUTORING, MENTORING, CLASSROOM SUPPORT, OUT-OF-SCHOOL TIME, SERVICE LEARNING, SUMMER LEARNING, CLASSROOM TEACHING, AND SOCIAL/EMOTIONAL SUPPORT.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA THIS PROJECT WILL ADDRESS IS EDUCATION.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 55 STUDENTS (OUT OF 68) BEING ASSISTED BY 33 FGP VOLUNTEERS AT HEAD START PROGRAMS AND OTHER PRE SCHOOLS WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SOCIAL READINESS.  ADDITIONALLY, 64 CHILDREN (OUT OF 80) BEING ASSISTED BY 40 FGP VOLUNTEERS AT PUBLIC K-12 SCHOOLS, AFTER SCHOOL PROGRAMS, AND SUMMER LEARNING PROGRAMS WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT OR SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL SKILLS.

THERE WILL BE AN ESTIMATED 43 UNDUPLICATED FOSTER GRANDPARENT (FG) VOLUNTEERS THAT WILL SERVE, AND EACH OF THESE VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS SERVING CHILDREN AND YOUTH BETWEEN THE AGES OF BIRTH AND 21 YEARS OLD.  THEY WILL ASSIST IN THE CLASSROOM BY TUTORING AND MENTORING THROUGH A NETWORK OF FIVE VOLUNTEER STATIONS INCLUDING  HEAD START CLASSROOMS, PUBLIC SCHOOL CLASSROOMS, FAITH BASED CHILDCARE CENTER, AN AFTER SCHOOL PROGRAM, AND A PUBLIC CHARTER SCHOOL.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION.  AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT, OUR ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES ARE BASED ON; NUMBER OF STUDENTS WITH IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT OR SOCIAL-EMOTIONIAL SKILLS AND NUMBER OF CHILDREN DEMONSTRATING GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $224,262 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $35,000 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

SENIOR RESOURCES OF GUILFORD IS A 501(3)(C) ORGANIZATION APPLYING FOR FUNDING TO CONTINUE OUR 30 YEAR SPONSORSHIP OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IN GUILFORD COUNTY, NORTH CAROLINA. SENIOR RESOURCES OF GUILFORD IS A STRATEGIC PARTNER OF BOTH THE UNITED WAY OF GREATER GREENSBORO AND THE UNITED WAY OF GREATER HIGH POINT. THE AGENCY'S MISSION IS TO SERVE OUR DIVERSE COMMUNITY OF SENIORS AND THEIR FAMILIES BY ADVOCATING AND PROVIDING SUPPORTIVE SERVICES THAT ENHANCE THE INDEPENDENCE, HEALTH AND QUALITY OF LIFE FOR SENIORS. THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IN GUILFORD COUNTY IS REQUESTING A CNCS GRANT IN THE AMOUNT OF $253,970 FOR THE FISCAL YEAR 2019-2020 (YEAR 1 OF 3) WHICH WILL FUND 55 UNDUPLICATED FEDERAL VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS (VSYS).  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $253,970 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $42,627 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.  THE REQUIRED NON-FEDERAL PORTION WILL BE PROVIDED BY THE UNITED WAYS OF GREATER GREENSBORO AND GREATER HIGH POINT AS WELL AS OTHER LOCAL SOURCES AND WILL FUND SEVEN (7) ADDITIONAL VSYS.  SENIOR RESOURCES WILL UTILIZE A MINIMUM OF 62 (50 FGP VOLUNTEERS IN GUILFORD COUNTY SCHOOLS AND 12 FGP VOLUNTEERS IN HEAD START CENTERS) UNDUPLICATED FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS TO EXPEND THE 62 VSYS REQUIRED FOR THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THIS PROJECT. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE EDUCATION (READING) FOR THE PROJECT PERIOD 7/1/2019-6/30/2022. THE CHILDREN'S READING FOUNDATION (SERVING YOUNG READERS SINCE 1996) RESEARCH REPORTS THAT THE RETURNS ON INVESTMENTS IN EDUCATION ARE HIGHEST FROM THE EARLY YEARS OF SCHOOLING WHEN CHILDREN ARE FIRST LEARNING TO READ. THE EARLY YEARS SET THE STAGE FOR LATER LEARNING AND WITHOUT THE ABILITY TO READ, EXCELLENCE IN HIGH SCHOOL AND BEYOND IS UNATTAINABLE. 100% OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS AND PROVIDE ONE-ON-ONE TUTORING ASSISTANCE FOR A TOTAL OF 416 UNDUPLICATED STUDENTS WHO HAVE BEEN IDENTIFIED BY THEIR TEACHER/SCHOOL ADMINISTRATOR AS HAVING EXCEPTIONAL AND/OR SPECIAL NEEDS IN READING AND READING COMPREHENSION OVER THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD. EACH FOSTER GRANDPARENT WILL BE ASSIGNED A MINIMUM OF 3 STUDENTS TO TUTOR EACH ACADEMIC SCHOOL YEAR AND COMMIT TO VOLUNTEERING A MINIMUM OF 20 HOURS PER WEEK WHILE SCHOOL IS IN SESSION. THE EXPECTED OUTCOME IS THAT A MINIMUM OF 80% OF THE GUILFORD COUNTY SCHOOL STUDENTS TUTORED BY FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS IN WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE AND THAT 75% OF THE HEAD START AND PRE-K STUDENTS TUTORED BY FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS BY THE END OF THE 2019-2022 PROJECT PERIOD.
