THE CNCS ANNUAL FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $330,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED WITH OTHER SUPPORTIVE FUNDING.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
NAME OF APPLICANT:   EAST END NEIGHBORHOOD HOUSE
DESCRIPTION APPLICANT AGENCY:     A SETTLEMENT HOUSE THAT PROVIDES DIRECT SERVICES TO INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES INTEGRATED WITH NEIGHBORHOOD ORGANIZING, NETWORKING, SUPPORTIVE SERVICES AND OUTREACH EFFORTS TO FACILITATE A PROCESS OF COOPERATION AND SELF-HELP. 
MISSION OF APPLICANT:    EAST END NEIGHBORHOOD HOUSE PARTNERS WITH DONORS, VOLUNTEERS AND OTHER ORGANIZATIONS TO FOSTER COMMUNITY PRIDE TO ASSIST FAMILIES IN BECOMING SELF-SUFFICIENT AND TO SUPPORT INDIVIDUALS THROUGH LIFE'S PASSAGES FROM BIRTH TO ELDERSHIP.
VSY'S REQUESTED:  82  DOLLAR AMOUNT REQUESTED:   $405,540 THE SERVICE CATEGORIES OUR PROJECT WILL ADDRESS ARE:   1) SCHOOL READINESS INCLUDING HEAD START AND EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION, 2) PRE-ELEMENTARY DAY CARE, 3) ELEMENTARY EDUCATION, 4) PHYSICAL DISABILITIES PROGRAMMING, AND 5) CHILD ABUSE AND NEGLECT.
COMMUNITY NEEDS ADDRESSED:
CLEVELAND CONTINUES TO RANK HIGH AMONG AMERICAN CITIES WITH THE HIGHEST RATE OF POVERTY.  CHILDREN ENROLLED IN THE CLEVELAND MUNICIPAL SCHOOL DISTRICT SUBSTANTIATE DATA ON THE CORRELATION BETWEEN POVERTY AND POOR ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE.  POOR CHILDREN BEGIN SCHOOL AT A DISADVANTAGE AND THE DISPARITIES IN THEIR READINESS AND SUCCESS RATES CAN GROW WORSE IF SCHOOLS ARE NOT PREPARED TO ADDRESS THEM EARLY.  BUT SCHOOLS ALONE CANNOT PREVENT  OR ADDRESS EVERY FACTOR THAT CONTRIBUTES TO OHIO'S HIGH CHILD POVERTY RATES.  SCHOOL AND COMMUNITY LEADERS CAN LEAD THE WAY IN PROMOTING AND IMPLEMENTING PROVEN METHODS TO BETTER SERVE THE NEEDS OF CHILDREN WHO GROW UP IN LOW-INCOME FAMILIES.  THESE EFFORTS BENEFIT ALL CHILDREN BECAUSE SCHOOLS THAT SERVE POOR STUDENTS WILL PERFORM BETTER AND DEVELOP HEALTHIER AND MORE RESPECTFUL CLIMATES THAT ALLOW ALL CHILDREN TO DEVELOP THEIR SKILLS TO THE BEST OF THEIR ABILITY.
ACCORDING TO THE 2014 - 2015 SCHOOL REPORT CARD FOR THE CLEVELAND SCHOOL DISTRICT, CLEVELAND SCHOOLS CONTINUE TO RECEIVE A FAILING GRADE IN THE PERFORMANCE INDEX AND HAVE NOT MET ANY INDICATORS.  HIGH CONCENTRATIONS OF POVERTY MANIFEST CRITICAL COMMUNITY NEEDS FOR EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMMING AND SOCIAL SERVICES THAT ADDRESS THE EMOTIONAL WELL-BEING OF CLEVELAND'S CHILDREN AND SENIOR CITIZENS.  AS A RESULT EAST END NEIGHBORHOOD HOUSE WILL IMPLEMENT THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM TO ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF SOCIETY'S MOST VULNERABLE POPULATIONS, CHILDREN AND SENIORS.
FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AS MENTORS, TUTORS  AND SOCIAL GUIDES TO CHILDREN TO BE "AT-RISK".  THEY WILL SPEND A MINIMUM OF 15 HOURS PER WEEK WORKING ONE-ON-ONE WITH THESE CHILDREN THAT HAVE BEEN PRE-SELECTED BY THEIR CLASSROOM TEACHER AS NEEDING EXTRA ASSISTANCE IN THE CLASSROOM.  THE PROGRAM HAS 22 ESTABLISHED SITES IN THE CITY OF CLEVELAND AND SURROUNDING NEIGHBORHOODS, INCLUDING11 ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS.  
ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES FOR THE CHILDREN INCLUDE IMPROVEMENT IN READING AND MATH, A REDUCTION IN BEHAVIORAL PROBLEMS AND AN INCREASE IN SELF-ESTEEM.
VOLUNTEER ASSIGNMENT PLANS WILL SERVE AS INDICATORS FOR THESE OUTCOMES AND ARE COMPLETED BY THE CLASSROOM TEACHER FOR EACH CHILD SERVICED BY A FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEER.

CATHOLIC SOCIAL SERVICES (CSS) IS AN ANTI-POVERTY SOCIAL SERVICE AGENCY FOCUSED ON IMPROVING THE QUALITY OF LIFE OF PEOPLE OF ALL FAITHS AND BACKGROUNDS DURING THEIR MOST VULNERABLE TIMES. OUR EFFORTS ARE FOCUSED ON TWO SPECIFIC POPULATIONS THAT ALLOW US TO HAVE THE MOST SIGNIFICANT IMPACT IN OUR COMMUNITY: SENIORS AND FAMILIES. CSS RECOGNIZES THE NEEDS OF AT-RISK CHILDREN, AND THROUGH THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) HAVE PAIRED THEM WITH SENIORS WHO ARE WILLING TO SHARE THEIR TIME AND HAVE A DESIRE TO HELP MAKE A DIFFERENCE IN THE LIFE OF A CHILD. CATHOLIC SOCIAL SERVICES CONTINUES ITS 70+ YEAR LEGACY ADDRESSING THE COMMUNITY'S PRESSING NEEDS WITH COMPASSION AND RESPECT. THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM HELPS SENIORS GET CONNECTED AND ENGAGED IN VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES THAT HELP CHILDREN BE READY FOR AND TO DO BETTER IN SCHOOL.
AN ESTIMATED 80 FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE, AND 100% OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE ASSISTING CHILDREN IN DEVELOPING FINE MOTOR SKILLS, HELPING CHILDREN LEARN AND PRACTICE APPROPRIATE CLASSROOM BEHAVIOR, AND HELPING CHILDREN REACH ACADEMIC GOALS IDENTIFIED BY THE TEACHER. THE PRIMARY CNCS FOCUS AREA IS EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, WE WILL SHOW THAT 90% OF STUDENTS WILL HAVE DEMONSTRATED GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS IN PRE-K AND HEAD START, AND 50% OF STUDENTS WILL HAVE IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY AND MATH IN GRADES K-5. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $444,680 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $61,930 IN NON-FEDERAL CONTRIBUTIONS.

THIS RENEWAL PROPOSAL TO OPERATE FGP (229 VSY'S) IS SUBMITTED BY COAD, THE CORPORATION FOR OHIO APPALACHIAN DEVELOPMENT. COAD'S MISSION IS TO PROVIDE A UNIFIED VOICE AND REPRESENTATION FOR ITS MEMBER AGENCIES AND THE CONSTITUENTS THAT THEY SERVE - PRIMARILY LOW-INCOME FAMILIES, CHILDREN, AND THE ELDERLY. SINCE 1971, COAD HAS WORKED TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR ALL RESIDENTS OF APPALACHIAN OHIO. THIS PROPOSAL WILL ADDRESS THE CATEGORY OF EDUCATION AND SPECIFICALLY SCHOOL READINESS AND ACADEMIC IMPROVEMENT. OUR FOCUS WILL BE ON ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS AND HEAD START PROGRAMS AND THE CHILDREN THAT ATTEND THESE SITES, PARTICULARLY THOSE THAT ARE FALLING BEHIND IN ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE. THE ACTIVITIES ENGAGED IN BY VOLUNTEERS WILL INCLUDE ONE-ON-ONE TUTORING IN SUPPORT OF LITERACY, LANGUAGE SKILLS, PROPER ACADEMIC DEVELOPMENT, AND INCREASED ENGAGEMENT IN LEARNING. THE REQUEST IS FOR $1,052,905 OF FEDERAL SUPPORT $116,989 FROM STATE AND OTHER SOURCES. THIS SUPPORT WILL ADDRESS EXISTING COMMUNITY NEEDS WHICH INCLUDE THE NEED FOR CLASSROOM SUPPORT AND EARLY CHILDHOOD INTERVENTIONS. OUR CHILDREN ARE GENERALLY AT A DISADVANTAGE THAN CHILDREN IN OTHER AREAS OF THE STATE AND THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM ADDRESSES THESE NEEDS.  IN ADDITION TO EARLY CHILDHOOD ISSUES, IN APPALACHIAN OHIO HIGH SCHOOL GRADUATION RATES FALL BELOW GRADUATION RATES IN THE REST OF OHIO, AND THE RATE OF ADULTS WHO HAVE ANY POST-SECONDARY EDUCATION RUNS WELL BELOW THE STATE AVERAGE. IN ORDER TO MEASURE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF OUR PROGRAM, WE EVALUATE OUR SERVICES BY SURVEYS. THESE SURVEYS WILL BE CONDUCTED WITH TEACHERS, VOLUNTEER STATIONS, COAD STAFF AND VOLUNTEERS. THE COMBINED DATA WILL PROVIDE AN ANALYSIS OF THE VALUE OF SERVICES AND PERFORMANCE OF VOLUNTEERS. THE OUTCOMES GENERATED BY THE PROGRAM WILL BE THAT STUDENTS WILL BE READING AT GRADE LEVEL BY THE END OF THE ACADEMIC YEAR OR WILL SHOW READINESS TO ENTER A REGULAR SCHOOL PROGRAM AT THE APPROPRIATE LEVEL OF FUNCTIONING.

CATHOLIC CHARITIES SOUTHWESTERN OHIO SEEKS RENEWAL FUNDING FOR A LONG-STANDING AND HIGHLY SUCCESSFUL FGP IN GREATER CINCINNATI. CATHOLIC CHARITIES IS SOCIAL SERVICE ORGANIZATION WHOSE MISSION IS TO ADVANCE THE HUMAN DIGNITY AND WELFARE OF THOSE PEOPLE IN NEED, BY PROVIDING COMPREHENSIVE SOCIAL SERVICES, IN RESPONSE TO THE TEACHINGS OF CHRIST AND THE CATHOLIC CHURCH. WE ARE COMMITTED TO EXTENDING GOD'S LOVE FOR THE HUMAN FAMILY, BY ASSISTING PEOPLE TO LIVE MORE FULLY AND FREELY, TO ACCEPT THAT LOVE FOR THEMSELVES AND TO SHARE IT WITH OTHERS. 
OUR REQUEST IS FOR 75 VSYS.  FEDERAL FUNDING REQUESTED IS $ 362,440, WITH A LOCAL MATCH OF $ 45,625 TO BE PROVIDED BY CATHOLIC CHARITIES. 

THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA TO BE ADDRESSED BY THE PROJECT WILL BE K - 12 SUCCESS AND/OR SCHOOL READINESS, FOCUSING ON ACADEMIC IMPROVEMENTS AND GAINS IN LITERACY AND MATH.  VOLUNTEERS WILL MENTOR AND TUTOR SPECIAL NEEDS AND DISADVANTAGED CHILDREN. THE LOCATION OF THESE ACTIVITIES WILL BE PRE-SCHOOL SETTINGS AND K- 12 SCHOOLS. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF THE SERVICE WILL BE INCREASED EMERGENT LITERACY SERVICES TO PRE-SCHOOL AGE CHILDREN AND THE IMPROVED LITERACY AND MATH SKILLS AMONG SCHOOL AGE CHILDREN, RESULTING IN LONG TERM HIGHER EDUCATIONAL OUTCOMES. THESE SERVICES WILL TAKE PLACE IN 29 STATIONS THROUGHOUT THE CINCINNATI AND HAMILTON COUNTY AREAS.

THE MISSION OF AKRON SUMMIT COMMUNITY ACTION, INC. (ASCA) IS TO REDUCE POVERTY AND PROMOTE SELF-SUFFICIENCY IN SUMMIT COUNTY. ASCA IS A PRIVATE, NON-PROFIT, TAX EXEMPT 501 (C) 3 CORPORATION.  ASCA IS AN ANTI- POVERTY SOCIAL SERVICE AGENCY THAT REPRESENTS SUMMIT COUNTY.  ASCA OFFERS VARIOUS RESOURCES TO ASSIST INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES. ASCA HAS A COMPREHENSIVE SYSTEM OF EDUCATION, TRAINING AND OTHER MEANS THAT ARE CENTRAL TO THE SERVICES OFFERED.  ASCA HAS AN OPERATING BUDGET OF OVER $15 MILLION DOLLARS AND OVER 230 EMPLOYEES.  ASCA CONTINUES TO MAKE GREAT EFFORTS TO DELIVER INNOVATIVE AND IMPACTFUL PROGRAMMING TO MEET THE COMMUNITY'S NEEDS. ONE OF THE WELL- ESTABLISHED PROGRAMS THAT ASCA OFFERS IS THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP). THE FGP IS PART OF THE NATIONAL SENIOR CORPS, A NETWORK OF PROGRAMS ADMINISTERED BY THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS).  THE FGP RECEIVES OPERATING FUNDS FROM CNCS.  THE ASCA FGP PROGRAM PROVIDES VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES FOR LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS AGE 55 AND OLDER WHO ARE CAPABLE OF ASSISTING CHILDREN/YOUTH WITH SPECIAL OR EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS.  THE FGP HELPS VOLUNTEERS REMAIN MENTALLY AND PHYSICALLY ACTIVE BY PARTICIPATING IN COMMUNITY SERVICE. THE DUAL PURPOSE OF THE FGP IS TO IMPROVE THE LIVES OF ELIGIBLE VOLUNTEERS AS WELL AS THE CHILDREN THEY ARE ASSIGNED TO BY BRINGING THEM TOGETHER IN AN APPROPRIATE SETTING (EDUCATION, SOCIAL SERVICE, MEDICAL OR SIMILAR SETTING). AN ESTIMATED 76 FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THE ASSIGNED CHILDREN. OUT OF THE 76 FGP VOLUNTEERS, 73 WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WORK ONE ON ONE WITH TWO OR MORE CHILDREN WHO HAVE SPECIAL AND OR EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS. DEPENDING ON THE CHILD'S AGE THE ACTIVITIES CAN INCLUDE RECOGNITION OF LETTERS AND NUMBERS. THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS ALSO HELP CHILDREN LEARN HOW TO READ, ASSIST WITH ACADEMIC WORK, TUTOR CHILDREN AND SERVE AS A MENTOR. THE FGP VOLUNTEERS HELP CHILDREN LEARN VARIOUS SKILLS, INCREASE POSITIVE SELF-ESTEEM/SOCIAL EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT AND IMPROVE IN LITERACY/NUMERACY ACHIEVEMENT. THE GOAL IS TO CONTRIBUTE TO SCHOOL READINESS, AND PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR ACADEMIC IMPROVEMENT. THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS PERFORM SERVICE ACTIVITIES THROUGH A NETWORK OF 23 VOLUNTEER STATIONS (A PUBLIC AGENCY, SECULAR OR FAITH BASED PRIVATE NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION, OR PROPRIETARY HEALTH CARE ORGANIZATION). THE VOLUNTEER STATIONS INCLUDE THE HEAD START/EARLY HEAD START PROGRAM, AKRON PUBLIC SCHOOLS, AKRON CHILDREN'S HOSPITAL, YMCA'S, SALVATION ARMY AND PHOENIX SCHOOL FOR ADJUDICATED YOUTH. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THE FGP IS EDUCATION.   AT THE END OF THE 12-MONTH PERFORMANCE PERIOD THE ASSIGNED STUDENTS WILL IMPROVE IN ACADEMICS (LITERACY AND OR NUMERACY SKILLS) AND OR DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN EMOTIONAL/SOCIAL DEVELOPMENT, DEPENDING ON THE AGE. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $355,568 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $70,896.00 WHICH INCLUDES PROGRAM INCOME, LOCAL/STATE, IN-KIND SUPPORT, PRIVATE DONATIONS AND OTHER SOURCES.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
SENIOR CENTERS, INC. IS A MULTI-PURPOSE SENIOR CENTER OFFERING A VARIETY OF PROGRAMS AND SERVICES TO MEET THE NEEDS OF THE SENIORS IN THE COMMUNITY.  SENIOR CENTERS, INC. IS AN INTEGRAL PART OF THE AGING NETWORK ENSURING DELIVERY OF THE HIGHEST QUALITY PROGRAMS AND ACTIVITIES.  

THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM HAS BEEN SPONSORED BY SENIOR CENTERS, INC. FOR OVER 40 YEARS. THE LENGTH OF TIME THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS PROGRAM HAS BEEN IN PLACE IN TOLEDO IS TESTAMENT TO THE FACT THAT THERE IS A REAL COMMUNITY NEED FOR THIS PROGRAM, BOTH FOR SENIORS WHO WISH TO REMAIN ACTIVE AND SUPPLEMENT THEIR INCOME AS WELL AS FOR STUDENTS IN OUR SCHOOLS WHO HAVE EXCEPTIONAL/SPECIAL NEEDS.  WE ARE FILLING THIS NEED. THE PLACEMENT OF FOSTER GRANDPARENTS IN OUR LOCAL SCHOOLS, AS WELL AS PRE-SCHOOL AND DAY CARE SETTINGS, BENEFITS THE ENTIRE COMMUNITY BY ENHANCING THE QUALITY OF LIFE OF THE VOLUNTEERS, PROVIDING EXTRA SUPPORT TO CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL/EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS AND HELPING ADDRESS COMMUNITY NEEDS.

AN ESTIMATED 72 FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AS FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WITHIN THE COMING THREE YEARS. OF THIS NUMBER, APPROXIMATELY 70 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE ONE-ON-ONE TUTORING, FOCUSING ON AREAS THAT COOPERATING TEACHERS HAVE PINPOINTED AS AREAS OF NEED FOR THE CHILDREN ASSIGNED THEM. OTHER ACTIVITIES WILL BE PROVIDING MENTORING AS WELL AS SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL SUPPORT TO THE STUDENTS WITH WHOM VOLUNTEERS WILL WORK. THESE AREAS ARE NOTED ON THE TEACHER-WRITTEN ASSIGNMENT PLANS, WHICH ARE FOLLOWED BY THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THIS THREE YEAR GRANT, CHILDREN WILL HAVE SHOWN IMPROVEMENT IN CURRICULAR AREAS IN WHICH THEY HAVE WORKED WITH THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $277,059 (YEAR ONE TOTAL OF A NEW THREE YEAR GRANT) WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY STATE AND LOCAL FUNDING, AS WELL AS WITH IN-KIND DONATIONS.

THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM OF NW MINNESOTA (FGP OF NW MN) SPONSORED BY TRI-VALLEY OPPORTUNITY COUNCIL, INC. (AKA TRI-VALLEY)  IS DEDICATED TO OPERATING A PROGRAM THAT HELPS MEET THE NEEDS OF CHILDREN BIRTH TO 21, WHILE ALSO PROVIDING MEANINGFUL VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES FOR ADULTS 55 AND OLDER.

THE FGP OF NW MN HAS SUCCESSFULLY OPERATED SINCE 1997, WITH A SERVICE AREA OF 11 COUNTIES (POLK, NORMAN, RED LAKE, LAKE OF THE WOODS, ROSEAU, PENNINGTON, MARSHALL, KITTSON, MAHNOMEN, BECKER AND CLAY). THIS LONGEVITY IS A RESULT OF NURTURING COMMUNITY PARTNERS AND FUNCTIONAL WORKING RELATIONSHIP TO ASSESS THE NEEDS OF OUR EDUCATIONAL COMMUNITIES AND POPULATIONS SERVED. THE FGP OF NW MN COMPLIES WITH THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICES (CNCS) STRATEGIC INITIATIVE, REGULATIONS AND GUIDELINES.

THE PROPOSAL FOCUSES ON TWO COMMUNITY NEEDS IN THE COMMUNITIES WE SERVE: K-12 SUCCESS AND SCHOOL READINESS. THE WORK PLANS ADDRESS EDUCATIONAL SUCCESS FOR K-12 THROUGH CONSISTENT ASSISTANCE WITH ACADEMIC MENTORING AND TUTORING IN CLASSROOMS. THESE WORK PLANS WILL ADDRESS SUCCESS IN DEMONSTRATING GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS AND IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN 3 HEAD START CENTERS AND EDUCATIONAL SUCCESS IN 6 PRIVATE AND 19 PUBLIC SCHOOLS THROUGHOUT THE SERVICE AREA. THE VOLUNTEERS WILL BE ASSIGNED A SITE AND VOLUNTEER WITH STUDENTS IN SMALL GROUPS AND 1:1; BUILDING A CONSISTENT, NURTURING, NON-JUDGMENTAL, INTER-GENERATIONAL, CARING RELATIONSHIP WITH THE STUDENTS.

THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM OF NW MN IS REQUESTING $269,652.00 TO RECRUIT, SUSTAIN AND RETAIN 45 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS (VSYS) VOLUNTEERS. THE 45 VSYS VOLUNTEERS WILL 1) WILL PROVIDE STUDENTS ASSISTANCE/ CLASSROOM SUPPORT AND TUTORING TO 350 CHILDREN IN PUBLIC AND PRIVATE SCHOOLS WITH EXCEPTIONAL OR SPECIAL NEEDS IN A SMALL GROUP OR 1 ON 1 SETTING, 2) WILL HELP 41 CHILDREN ENROLLED IN HEAD START PROGRAMS GAIN SCHOOL READINESS THROUGH DEMONSTRATION AND SUPPORT.

LUTHERAN SOCIAL SERVICE OF MINNESOTA IS HONORED TO SERVE AS ONE OF FOUR PROVIDERS OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IN MINNESOTA. WE REMAIN COMMITTED TO OUR LONG STANDING PARTNERS ACROSS MINNESOTA AND CONTINUE TO EXPAND OUR WORK TO FOCUS ON EARLY CHILDHOOD IN SETTINGS WHERE VOLUNTEERS CAN MAKE AN INTEGRAL IMPACT BY PREPARING CHILDREN FOR SCHOOL. WE WILL ALSO RESPOND TO THE NEED FOR FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS IN SCHOOLS WITH HIGHER PERCENTAGES OF FREE AND REDUCED LUNCH STUDENTS. INVESTMENTS MADE BY CNCS AND LUTHERAN SOCIAL SERVICE OF MINNESOTA OVER THE NEXT THREE YEARS WILL GIVE US NEW OPPORTUNITIES TO TALK ABOUT THE VALUE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS CREATE IN COMMUNITIES ACROSS THE STATE. 
FOR EXAMPLE, MINNESOTA CHILDREN IN POVERTY AND AFRICAN-AMERICAN STUDENTS AT ALL GRADE LEVELS ARE MORE THAN TWO GRADE LEVELS BEHIND THEIR PEERS. 13.8% OF ALL CHILDREN IN MINNESOTA LIVE AT OR BELOW THE POVERTY LEVEL AND THAT PERCENTAGE INCREASES TO 16% FOR CHILDREN UNDER THE AGE OF SIX. 35,000 MINNESOTA CHILDREN UNDER THE AGE OF FIVE DO NOT HAVE ACCESS TO HIGH QUALITY EARLY CHILDHOOD DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMS. 
CHILDREN WHO DO NOT RECEIVE EARLY CHILDHOOD AND ELEMENTARY EDUCATION INTERVENTION MAY NOT ACHIEVE THEIR FULL POTENTIAL WHICH COULD RESULT IN COMMUNITIES WITH A LESS SKILLED WORKFORCE, INCREASED CRIME RATES, AND MORE CITIZENS ON PUBLIC ASSISTANCE. AS TEACHERS SEE MORE CHILDREN WITH HIGH NEEDS IN THEIR CLASSROOMS, A GREATER AMOUNT OF STAFF TIME IS REQUIRED TO MEET THE NEEDS OF THESE STUDENTS. FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WHO SPEND ONE TO ONE TIME TUTORING AND MENTORING STUDENTS WILL INCREASE STUDENT ENGAGEMENT AND SUCCESS. WITH A STRATEGIC FOCUS ON HIGH IMPACT SITES AND POPULATIONS, OUR VOLUNTEERS CAN IMPROVE THESE OUTCOMES AND CREATE A SUCCESSFUL ENVIRONMENT FOR THESE YOUTH.
AS WE CONTINUE TO INCREASE OUR RECRUITMENT EFFORTS, AN ESTIMATED 300 FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE 2019-2020 BUDGET YEAR.  ALL OF THESE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TUTORING, MENTORING, AND SUPPORT OF SOCIAL EMOTIONAL GROWTH IN THE CHILDREN THEY SERVE. IN PARTICULAR, WE WILL FOCUS ON EARLY K-12 SUCCESS AND SCHOOL READINESS. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, WE WILL DEMONSTRATE GROWTH IN ACADEMIC PROGRESS AND SOCIAL/EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT IN THE CHILDREN WE SERVE. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $997,055 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $562,384.

AN ESTIMATED NUMBER OF 50 FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  OF THIS NUMBER 44 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE ASSISTING IN READING/WRITING SKILLS, LETTER/NUMBER RECOGNITION, AND ASSISTING IN MATH SKILLS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS SCHOOL READINESS AND K-12 SUCCESS. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOME IS 125.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $0 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $325,919 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES

AN ESTIMATED 71 FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE CHILDREN WITH IDENTIFIED SPECIAL OR EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS. SOME OF THE VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TUTORING IN SPECIFIC SUBJECT AREAS, MENTORING AND PROVIDING EMOTIONAL SUPPORT, AND ASSISTING IDENTIFIED STUDENTS BOTH ONE-ON-ONE AND IN SMALL GROUPS. THESE ACTIVITIES WILL LEAD TO INCREASED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY AND/OR MATH FOR CHILDREN IN PUBLIC SCHOOLS, AND INCREASED SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT AND SCHOOL READINESS FOR PRESCHOOL CHILDREN. THIS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH A NETWORK OF 14 VOLUNTEER STATIONS SUCH AS PUBLIC, CHARTER AND INTERMEDIATE SCHOOLS, HEAD START AND EARLY HEAD START PROGRAMS, PRESCHOOLS, CHILD CARE CENTERS, DOMESTIC VIOLENCE CHILD CARE, SUMMER EDUCATION AND RECREATION PROGRAMS. 

THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS THE CNCS FOCUS AREA OF EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT TERM, IDENTIFIED STUDENTS SERVED BY FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, AS OBSERVED, TESTED, AND REPORTED BY PROFESSIONAL STAFF. IN ADDITION, IDENTIFIED PRESCHOOL CHILDREN SERVED BY FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS IN TERMS OF SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT, AS OBSERVED, TESTED, AND REPORTED BY PROFESSIONAL STAFF. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $312,533 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $87,683 FROM AWARDED STATE FUNDS.

AN AVERAGE OF 84 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, AT LEAST 60 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME-BASED PERFORMANCE MEASURES. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE ONE-ON-ONE AND GROUP READING, INDIVIDUAL WRITING INSTRUCTION, LETTER RECOGNITION, AND SPELLING, TO PROMOTE LITERACY; AND MATH TUTORING, NUMBER IDENTIFICATION/COUNTING, COLOR IDENTIFICATION, ALONG WITH MOTOR SKILL DEVELOPMENT SUCH AS CUTTING, PASTING, TYING SHOES OR ZIPPING COATS. IN ADDITION TO ACADEMIC ACTIVITIES FGS HELP STUDENTS LEARN BASIC SOCIAL SKILLS, SUCH AS, LISTENING, SHARING, FRIENDSHIP, MANNERS, PROBLEM-SOLVING, SELF-CONTROL AND RESPECT. WHILE NURTURING THE TRUST RELATIONSHIP THROUGH PLAY: PUZZLES, STORIES, READING OR PLAYING WITH BLOCKS, THEY LEARN HOW THINGS WORK AND FIT TOGETHER IN THEIR WORLD AND THE WORLD AROUND THEM. THEY LEARN SKILLS THAT HELP TAKE THEM TO THE NEXT LEVEL IN THEIR EDUCATION, AS WELL AS SKILLS THEY TAKE HOME TO THEIR PARENTS AND FAMILIES AND SHARE, BY EXAMPLE, WITH THEIR COMMUNITIES. ACTIVITIES WITH ASSIGNED STUDENT ARE DIRECTLY RELATED TO THE AREA DETERMINED BY THE TEACHING STAFF TO BE THE GREATEST RISK AREA FOR THAT STUDENT. FGS PROVIDE ONE-ON-ONE MENTORING TO STUDENTS WHO NEED AN ACADEMIC OR EMOTIONALLY SUPPORTIVE RELATIONSHIP WITH AN ATTENTIVE, POSITIVE ADULT FIGURE. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS OBJECTIVE 1: SCHOOL READINESS. SECONDARY FOCUS IS OBJECTIVE 2: SUCCEEDING IN KINDERGARTEN THROUGH 12TH GRADE. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, WITH THE INFUSION OF TRAINED FG MENTORS, STUDENTS WILL EXPERIENCE IMPROVEMENT IN INDIVIDUALIZED GOALS. GOALS, SET BY THE CLASSROOM TEACHER, FOCUS ON ACADEMIC AND SOCIAL ADVANCEMENT. REPORTED GAINS WILL BE SEEN IN AREAS SUCH AS, READING/PRE-READING, NUMERACY SKILLS, CLASSROOM BEHAVIOR AND PARTICIPATION, SELF-CONFIDENCE/SELF-CONTROL, INTEREST IN ACADEMICS/SCHOOL AND EVEN IMPROVEMENT IN ATTENDANCE. BECAUSE OF THE DIRECT, PERSONAL ATTENTION GIVEN TO THESE AT-RISK STUDENTS BY FGS THEY WILL BE BETTER PREPARED TO ADVANCE TO THE NEXT LEVEL OF LEARNING WITH CONFIDENCE AND HAVE A BRIGHTER LOOK ON THEIR FUTURE. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $184,766 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $272,021.

AN ESTIMATED 47 FEDERAL AND TWO NON-FEDERAL FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, ALL 49 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE ONE-TO-ONE MENTORING, TUTORING, AND OTHER CLASSROOM SUPPORT TO K-12 STUDENTS NEEDING EMOTIONAL/SOCIAL SUPPORT AND/OR ASSIST WITH THE CORE CURRICULUM OF MATH AND LITERACY TO BUILD THE FOUNDATION FOR IMPROVED ACADEMIC SUCCESS TO HELP PREPARE THEM FOR SECONDARY EDUCATION. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE FGP OF NORTHEAST MICHIGAN WILL HAVE PLACED 49 FGP VOLUNTEERS IN 13 K-12 EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS SERVING 196 ELEMENTARY SCHOOL CHILDREN OF WHICH 167 WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, ENGAGEMENT, AND/OR SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL SKILLS.

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $281,983 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY A COMMITMENT FROM THE MICHIGAN AGING & ADULT SERVICE AGENCY IN THE AMOUNT OF $22,416 THROUGH THEIR FGP GRANT DOLLARS AND AN ADDITIONAL, MINIMUM AMOUNT OF $39,480 OF CASH AND IN-KIND SUPPORT WILL BE PROCURED FROM NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

THE SAGINAW COUNTY COMMISSION ON AGING, GRANTEE FOR THE SAGINAW COUNTY FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM, IS REQUESTING TWO HUNDRED AND FIFTY FOUR THOUSAND, THREE HUNDRED THIRTY FIVE DOLLARS ($254,335) IN FEDERAL FUNDS FOR THE FIRST YEAR OF A THREE YEAR GRANT.  THE FEDERAL INVESTMENT WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY EIGHTY EIGHT THOUSAND FOUR HUNDRED FIVE DOLLARS ($88,405) IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.   DETAILS CAN BE FOUND IN BUDGET SECTIONS 1 AND 2.  THE REQUESTED DOLLARS WILL PROVIDE FOR DIRECT BENEFITS TO INCOME ELIGIBLE SENIOR VOLUNTEERS AS WELL AS OPERATIONAL COSTS AND ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES. 
THIS FUNDING ALLOWS FOR AT LEAST FORTY TWO (42) FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS TO DIRECTLY ASSIST APPROXIMATELY ONE HUNDRED FOURTY SEVEN (147) CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL NEEDS ANNUALLY IN AREA SCHOOLS AND NON-PROFIT AGENCIES IN SAGINAW COUNTY, MICHIGAN DURING THE PERIOD OF JULY 1, 2019 THROUGH JUNE 30, 2022.  ADDITIONALLY, AN ESTIMATED 1,500 PRESCHOOL AND SCHOOL-AGED CHILDREN WILL BENEFIT INDIRECTLY FROM THE PRESENCE OF FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS IN THE CLASSROOM. 
THE FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION, SPECIFICALLY SCHOOL READINESS AND K-12 SUCCESS.  PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS WILL ACT AS MENTORS, PROVIDE NURTURING, TUTOR IN LITERACY, AND GIVE OTHER CLASSROOM ASSISTANCE IN ORDER TO PROVIDE SERVICES TO CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL NEEDS AS IDENTIFIED BY PARTICIPATING SITE REPRESENTATIVES.
AT THE END OF THIS GRANT PERIOD, PRE-SCHOOL CHILDREN SERVED BY THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE ATTAINED EARLY EDUCATIONAL SKILLS AND BE ABLE TO APPROPRIATELY INTERACT WITH OTHER CHILDREN IN A LEARNING ENVIRONMENT.  THOSE CHILDREN IN FIRST GRADE AND BEYOND WILL EXPERIENCE REDUCED ABSENTEEISM, IMPROVED SOCIALIZATION SKILLS, AND IMPROVED LITERACY.

THE HUMAN DEVELOPMENT COMMISSION (HDC) IS SEEKING TO CONTINUE AS THE SPONSORING AGENCY FOR THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD OF JULY 1, 2019 THROUGH JUNE 30, 2022.  HDC'S FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM SERVES THE "THUMB" AREA OF MICHIGAN'S LOWER PENINSULA WHICH INCLUDES THE FGP SERVICE AREA OF HURON, SANILAC, AND TUSCOLA COUNTIES.  INCORPORATED IN 1965, HDC IS A NONPROFIT, COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATION THAT IS COMMITTED TO HELPING PEOPLE ACHIEVE SELF-SUFFICIENCY AS CONDITIONS OF ABUSE, HOMELESSNESS, HUNGER, JOBLESSNESS, AND OTHER LIFE CRISES ARE AMELIORATED.  THE AGENCY ADMINISTERS NEARLY 70 COMMUNITY SERVICE PROGRAMS, AND SERVICE DELIVERY IS DESIGNED TO CHANGE THE LIVES OF INDIVIDUALS, FAMILIES, AND COMMUNITIES, ESPECIALLY LOW-INCOME HOUSEHOLDS AND NEIGHBORHOODS.  ADOPTED IN FEBRUARY 2011, HDC'S MISSION STATEMENT "RESTORING HOPE BY HELPING PEOPLE AND CHANGING LIVES", IS A CONSTANT REMINDER OF THE AGENCY'S COMMITMENT TO MOVE PEOPLE OUT OF POVERTY AND INTO SELF-SUFFICIENCY.

HDC WILL FULFILL AN ESTIMATED 34 VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS.  OF THIS NUMBER, 34 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE ASSISTING IN CLASSROOMS, SCHOOL BASED MENTORING, WORKING WITH STUDENTS IN POVERTY, AND ACADEMIC SKILL BUILDING.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 12 STUDENTS WILL SHOW SUCCESS IN SCHOOL READINESS AND 155 STUDENTS WILL SHOW ACADEMIC IMPROVEMENT IN K-12 SUCCESS.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $14,727 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY THE STATE OF MICHIGAN'S AGING AND ADULT SERVICES AGENCY IN THE AMOUNT TO $148,264.

AN ESTIMATED 57 FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 48 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE LITERACY AND /OR MATH SKILL PRACTICE WITH STUDENTS, COMFORTING INFANTS, MENTORING WITH YOUNG MOTHERS, MOTIVATE CHILDREN TO FOLLOW DIRECTIONS, SHARE AND TAKE RESPONSIBILITY AS WELL AS FOSTERING PROPER SOCIAL/BEHAVIOR SKILLS THROUGH ENGAGEMENT AND MODELING. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT, FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL HAVE TUTORED 345 STUDENTS IN THE PUBLIC SCHOOL WITH A TARGET OF 200 WITH IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY AND/OR MATH SKILLS. FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL ALSO WORK WITH 900 HEAD START CHILDREN OF WHICH 450 WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS IN TERMS OF SOCIAL AND/OR EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT. FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL ALSO CARE FOR AT LEAST 125 INFANTS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $265,392.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $ 29,488.

WESTERN INDIANA COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY, INC. -- FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM 

AN ESTIMATED 46 FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE WILL PROVIDE CLASSROOM ASSISTANCE IN SCHOOL READINESS ACTIVITIES THAT PROMOTE SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT TO PRE-SCHOOL AGE CHILDREN AT CHILD CARE CENTERS, ASSIST IN HEAD START CLASSROOMS BY HELPING TO ENGAGE HEAD START STUDENTS IN SCHOOL READINESS ACTIVITIES, TUTOR STUDENTS IN PUBLIC SCHOOLS IN LITERACY AND/OR MATH, MENTOR DISADVANTAGED YOUTH IN A COMMUNITY BASED SITE, AND COMFORT YOUNG CHILDREN THAT ARE SERVED BY SAFETY, WELFARE, AND HEALTH PROGRAMS.  FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE THESE SERVICES THROUGH A NETWORK OF VOLUNTEER STATIONS SUCH AS PUBLIC SCHOOLS, HEAD START CENTERS, CHILD CARE CENTERS, AND YOUTH CENTERS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS SCHOOL READINESS, K-12 SUCCESS AND MENTORING.  AT THE END OF THE 12-MONTH PERFORMANCE PERIOD 100% OF THE PRE-SCHOOL AGED CHILDREN IN CHILD CARE CENTERS ASSISTED WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS, 100% OF THE HEAD START STUDENTS ASSISTED WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS, NO LESS THAN 90% OF CHILDREN TUTORED WILL SHOW IMPROVEMENT IN ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, NO LESS THAN 60% OF THE DISADVANTAGED CHILDREN MENTORED WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVEMENT IN ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT, AND NO LESS THAN 16 AT RISK YOUNG CHILDREN WILL RECEIVE LOVING ATTENTION FROM A CARING ADULT.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $264,825 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $29,425.

PEORIA CITIZENS COMMITTEE FOR ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, INCORPORATED (PCCEO IS A COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY AND LEADERSHIP ORGANIZATION THAT PROMOTES SELF-SUFFICIENCY AND ECONOMIC SECURITY.    PCCEO MANAGES FEDERAL, STATE AND LOCAL CONTRACTS VALUED AT $17,768,000 WHICH PROVIDE COMMUNITY ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT AND HUMAN SERVICES TO ECONOMICALLY CHALLENGED INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES RESIDING IN PEORIA COUNTY.  
 A TOTAL OF 55 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN VOLUNTEER CENTERS THROUGHOUT PEORIA AND TAZEWELL COUNTIES OF IL.  OF THIS NUMBER 55 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENT PLANS THAT WILL TARGET THE INDIVIDUAL CHILD'S NEED AND TRACT THE CHILD'S PROGRESS AND ACTIVITIES THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE CONDUCTING IN THE CLASSROOMS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA IS EDUCATION, FROM BIRTH THROUGH PRE-SCHOOL TO PREPARE CHILDREN FOR SCHOOL AND PRIMARY SCHOOL TO ENSURE THAT THE CONCEPTS THAT ARE TAUGHT ARE ABLE TO BE MASTERED.  SOME VOLUNTEERS ARE UTILIZED DURING THE SUMMER MONTHS TO ASSIST CHILDREN WHO ATTEND SUMMER SCHOOL AND OTHERS ARE PLACED IN SUMMER SITES TO HELP MENTOR STUDENTS THROUGH SUMMER YOUTH PROGRAMS.  AT THE COMPLETION OF THE 3 YEAR GRANT, OVER 350 STUDENTS WILL ACHIEVE BETTER READING MASTERY, MATH, AND LITERACY SKILLS.

THIS NARRATIVE DETAILS CARROLL COUNTY FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM'S REQUEST TO THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS) FOR $55,142 WITH ADDITIONAL FUNDING OF $2757 FOR A TOTAL OF $57,899.  THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) CONNECTS SENIOR CITIZENS WITH YOUNG CHILDREN.  
THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM CURRENTLY MANAGES EIGHT VOLUNTEERS AT VARIOUS COMMUNITY SITES WITH A NINTH VOLUNTEER STARTING APRIL 10, 2019. THESE VOLUNTEERS PROVIDE SERVICES TO APPROXIMATELY NINE CHILDREN PER DAY AND SERVE NEARLY 7,000 HOURS LAST FISCAL YEAR.  THE RECEIPT OF A FEDERAL GRANT WILL ENABLE THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM TO CONTINUE PROVIDING CHILDREN WITH MUCH NEEDED ONE-ON-ONE ATTENTION. THE FEDERAL DOLLARS WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY BUT NOT LIMITED TO CARROLL COUNTY, THE CITY OF CARROLL AND UNITED WAY, WHO ALL PROVIDE THE MAJORITY OF FUNDING. MANY LOCAL SERVICE ORGANIZATIONS, COMMUNITY CHESTS, FOUNDATIONS, PRIVATE DONORS AND STAFF FUNDRAISING CONTRIBUTE THE OTHER FUNDS NEEDED TO FULFILL THE PROPOSED BUDGET. SIMULTANEOUSLY, FUNDING WILL CONTINUE TO PROVIDE SENIORS WITH EXTRA INCOME AND WITHOUT THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM CARROLL COUNTY WOULD LOSE OVER $55,000 ANNUALLY PAID IN STIPEND DOLLARS PAID WHICH IS SPENT LOCALLY ALONG WITH THE JOY OF KNOWING THEY ARE MAKING A DIFFERENCE IN CHILDREN'S LIVES.

FEDERAL HILL HOUSE (FHH) REQUESTS THE RENEWAL OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) GRANT (GRANT NUMBER: 16SFARI002), EFFECTIVE 7/1/2019-6/30/2022.  THESE FUNDS WILL SUPPORT 70 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS IN 30 CHILDREN AND YOUTH FOCUSED NONPROFIT AGENCIES LOCATED IN PROVIDENCE, RI.  
 
SINCE 1887, FEDERAL HILL HOUSE HAS BEEN AT THE HEART OF COMMUNITY LIFE BOTH IN FEDERAL HILL AND THE LARGER CITY OF PROVIDENCE. FHH PLAYS A SIGNIFICANT ROLE IN ANSWERING THE PROBLEMS FACING CHILDREN LIVING IN PROVIDENCE BY PROVIDING PROGRAMS THAT HELP SUPPORT AND STRENGTHEN FAMILIES. FHH IS A NEIGHBORHOOD INSTITUTION THAT RESPONDS TO THE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY AND IMPROVES THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR OUR CLIENTS.  

FHH'S FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM PROVIDES LOW-INCOME AGING ADULTS IN PROVIDENCE, RHODE ISLAND AN OPPORTUNITY TO REMAIN ACTIVE IN THEIR COMMUNITY. OUR FOSTER GRANDPARENTS REPRESENT A DIVERSE POPULATION: 86% ARE WOMEN, 13% ARE MALE; 53% ETHNICALLY IDENTIFY AS HISPANIC/LATINO; 45% ARE AFRICAN OR AFRICAN AMERICAN; AND 46% ARE WHITE. FOUR PERCENT OF THE VOLUNTEERS HAVE A DISABILITY; 21% LIVE BELOW THE FEDERAL POVERTY LINE. FGP ALSO HELPS AGING ADULTS REMAIN INDEPENDENT AND IN THEIR OWN HOMES BY PROVIDING A STIPEND THAT SUPPORTS BASIC LIVING EXPENSES.  

FGP OFFERS OLDER LOW-INCOME ADULTS IN THE COMMUNITY AN OPPORTUNITY TO VOLUNTEER THEIR TIME IN A MEANINGFUL, DYNAMIC WAY BY MENTORING AND ACADEMICALLY SUPPORTING CHILDREN. THE PROGRAM PROVIDES ASSISTANCE IN TRANSPORTATION SERVICES AND PROVIDES MEALS TO PARTICIPANTS. 
THE SERVICE CATEGORIES THIS PROJECT WILL ADDRESS ARE AS FOLLOWS: 
1.  K-12 SUCCESS IN PUBLIC SCHOOL SETTINGS AND AFTERSCHOOL PROGRAMMING
2.  SCHOOL READINESS, ASSISTING IN EARLY LEARNING CENTERS, CLASSROOMS AND HEAD START PROGRAMS

FGP VOLUNTEERS ALLOW ORGANIZATIONS TO PROVIDE ONE-ON-ONE INTERACTION WITH AT-RISK CHILDREN IN SAFE, NURTURING SETTINGS. STUDENTS AT THE SCHOOL AGE LEVEL BENEFIT FROM FGP MENTORS BY ADDRESSING CORE SOCIAL, EMOTIONAL AND ACADEMIC SKILLS NEEDED TO SUCCEED IN SCHOOL AND BEYOND. 

FROM JANUARY, 2016 - DECEMBER 2018, FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WERE MENTORS AND ROLE MODELS TO 313 CHILDREN ANNUALLY. THESE INCLUDE CHILDREN WITH A RANGE OF DEVELOPMENTAL/PHYSICAL DISABILITIES: 75 CHILDREN WITH LEARNING DISABILITIES; 31 CHILDREN WITH SOCIAL/BEHAVIORAL DISABILITIES AND 56 CHILDREN WITH LANGUAGE BARRIERS. BASED ON THE ANNUAL FGP EVALUATIONS CONDUCTED BY FHH, VOLUNTEER STATION SUPERVISORS REPORTED 98% OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS POSITIVELY IMPACTED THE LIVES OF CHILDREN SERVED.  

SITE SUPERVISORS FOUND OUR FGP VOLUNTEERS TO BE HIGHLY DEPENDABLE AND CONSISTENT WHEN WORKING WITH CHILDREN.  FGP VOLUNTEERS WERE ALSO RATED VERY HIGHLY FOR SUPPORTING THE RESPECTIVE VOLUNTEER SITES' MISSION AND VOLUNTEER STATIONS CONSIDER THE FGP VOLUNTEERS AN ASSET FOR CULTIVATING A HEALTHY LEARNING ENVIRONMENT.

AT THE END OF THE NEW GRANT PERIOD (2019-2022) WE ANTICIPATE SERVING 350 STUDENTS  ANNUALLY IN 35 (5 NEW STATIONS TO BE RECRUITED) VOLUNTEER STATIONS. WE  ALSO ANTICIPATE HAVING AN EQUIVALENT OF 67 VSY HOURS WITH AS MANY AS 72 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS ACTIVELY SERVING VOLUNTEERS ENROLLED IN THE PROGRAM.

THE SPONSOR FOR THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM LOCATED IN WEST WARWICK RI IS THE WEST WARWICK SENIOR CENTER. IT HAS BEEN IN OPERATION FOR 41 YEARS AND IS A PRIVATE NON-PROFIT AGENCY.THE WWSC MISSION STATEMENT READS "OUR MISSION IS TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR SENIOR CITIZENS."THEY HAVE A DEDICATED FULL TIME STAFF TO FACILITATE THE HEALTH, NUTRITIONAL, ENTERTAINMENT,AND TRANSPORTATION NEEDS OF THE SENIOR
COMMUNITY, INCLUDING VOLUNTEERS.THE INKIND SUPPORT FOR FGP INCLUDING,BUT NOT LIMITED TO, PHONES; EQUIP.;SPACE, AND POSTAGE FOR MAILINGS HAS BEEN UNFAILING,AND HAS ENABLED THE SPONSOR AND THE FGP TO HAVE A COORDINATED RELATIONSHIP.TO FACILITATE THE FGP, A DOLLAR AMOUNT OF $291,337.00 FOR 52 VOLUNTEERS ARE REQUESTED FOR PLACEMENTS IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS IN THE EDUCATIONAL FIELDS OF K-12 ,DAYCARE AND HEAD START. KIDS COUNT FIGURES REPORT 1 IN 5 CHILDREN IN RI LIVE IN POVERTY,AND THESE CHILDREN ARE AT MOST RISK OF NOT ACHIEVING THEIR FULL POTENTIAL,THUS THE NEED FOR VOLUNTEERS TO HELP SUPPORT THE EDUCATIONAL SYSTEM IS OF INCREASING VALUE.THE NEEDS OF THESE CHILDREN INCLUDE:NORMALIZATION OF RELATIONSHIPS WITH EACH OTHER AND ADULTS;STABILIZING PERSONALITY PROBLEMS TO PROPERLY LEARN NUMBERS, COLORS AND VERBAL SKILLS;ENHANCED SELF-ESTEEM TO PERFORM AND REALIZE PROGRESS;ESTABLISHING RULES FOR PROPER MANNERS IN ALL CIRCUMSTANCES, NOT JUST IN THE CLASSROOM ,AND ASSURANCES THAT THEY CAN LEARN IN SPITE OF HOME OR PHYSICAL/MENTAL INADEQUACIES. VOLUNTEERS COLLABORATE WITH TEACHERS USING AN FGP ASSIGNMENT PLAN TARGETING SPECIAL CHILDREN.EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF POSITIVE PROGRESSION AND ADVANCEMENT OF ALL CHILDREN IN EVERY CLASSROOM IS OUR GOAL.

AN ESTIMATED 42 FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  OF THIS NUMBER, 40 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  THE VOLUNTEERS WILL BE WORKING ONE-ON-ONE WITH ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED CHILDREN OR CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL AND/OR EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS.  THEY WILL PARTICIPATE IN ACTIVITIES WHICH INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO:  PRE-SCHOOL LEARNING ACTIVITIES, TEACHING LANGUAGE SKILLS, READING TO CHILDREN, ASSISTING WITH MAKE-UP WORK, ACADEMIC DRILL WORK, LISTENING TO CHILDREN READ, ASSISTING WITH REMEDIAL READING, AND PROVIDING COMFORT AND SUPPORT.  THESE ACTIVITIES WILL BE PROVIDED THROUGH A NETWORK OF APPROXIMATELY ELEVEN VOLUNTEER SITES.  THESE SITES ARE COMPRISED OF ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS, EARLY HEAD START/HEAD START CENTERS AND NON-PROFIT DAYCARE CENTERS THROUGHOUT YORK CITY AND COUNTY.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT THE CHILDREN WILL IMPROVE:  ACADEMIC SKILLS SUCH AS READING, WRITING AND SPELLING; SOCIAL AND INTERPERSONAL SKILLS; SELF-ESTEEM AND SELF-CONFIDENCE; SPEECH AND LANGUAGE SKILLS; GROUP AND CLASSROOM BEHAVIOR; PRE-ACADEMIC SKILLS AND SCHOOL READINESS.  THE CNCS INVESTMENT OF $240,854 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $26,760 IN LOCAL SUPPORT.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

GREATER ERIE COMMUNITY ACTION COMMITTEE (GECAC) HAS BEEN THE DESIGNATED COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY FOR ERIE COUNTY PENNSYLVANIA SINCE 1965. THE AGENCY HAS A LONG HISTORY OF ASSISTING FAMILIES, AND AGENCIES IN ERIE COUNTY. AN ESTIMATED 40 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE CHILDREN IN OUR FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP). THE TWO FOCUS AREAS OF GECAC'S FGP ARE K- 12 SUCCESS AND SCHOOLS READINESS.  
ALL 40 WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS THAT WILL INCLUDE MENTORING AND TUTORING THROUGH A NETWORK OF TWENTY (20) VOLUNTEER STATIONS/SITES. THESE SITES WILL INCLUDE HEAD START CENTERS, CHARTER SCHOOLS, PRE-SCHOOLS OR DAY CARE SITES, THE INTERNATIONAL INSTITUTE (A LOCAL REFUGEE RESETTLEMENT SITE) AND HARBORCREEK YOUTH SERVICES (A FACILITY FOR INCARCERATED YOUTH WITH MENTAL HEALTH DIAGNOSIS). 
FGP WILL WORK WITH APPROXIMATELY NINETY-THREE (93) PRE-SCHOOL AGE CHILDREN TO ENHANCE SCHOOL READINESS AND IMPROVE THEIR SOCIAL BEHAVIOR AND THEIR READINESS FOR KINDERGARTEN AT THE END OF EACH 12 MONTH PERFORMANCE PERIOD. 
FGP WILL WORK DIRECTLY WITH APPROXIMATELY FORTY-FIVE (45) ELEMENTARY SCHOOL AGE CHILDREN IN GRADES K THROUGH 12 TO ENHANCE ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT DUE TO THEIR INCREASED TOLERANCE OF SCHOOL BASED BEHAVIOR STANDARDS.
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $240,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $26,577 IN LOCAL FUNDING WHICH INCLUDES $12,417 IN OTHER NON-FEDERAL, IN-KIND RESOURCES.

AN ESTIMATED 85 FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE CAMBRIA COUNTY FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM. OF THIS NUMBER, 76 WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS.  THE REMAINING VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITY ASSIGNMENTS, SPECIFICALLY WORKING IN NON-PROFIT DAYCARES, COMFORTING INFANTS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THE PROJECT IS EDUCATION WITH A SMALL CONCENTRATION ON HEALTHY FUTURES.  

VOLUNTEERS THAT ARE PLACED IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS IN A SCHOOL READINESS ENVIRONMENT WILL ENGAGE IN ACTIVITIES SUCH AS TUTORING, MENTORING, AND PROVIDING SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL SUPPORT TO AID STUDENTS IN PREPARATION FOR ENTERING KINDERGARTEN. THE VOLUNTEERS WILL FOCUS ON CREATIVE APPROACHES TO LEARNING, LANGUAGE DEVELOPMENT, SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL NEEDS, AND AGE APPROPRIATE BEHAVIOR AND ACADEMIC SKILLS.  THESE VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN VARIOUS HEAD START, PRE-K COUNT, KEYSTONE STARS, AND    NON-PROFIT PRE-SCHOOL (SCHOOL READINESS) CLASSROOMS THROUGHOUT THE COMMUNITY. 

VOLUNTEERS THAT ARE PLACED IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS IN A K-12 ENVIRONMENT WILL ENGAGE IN ACTIVITIES SUCH AS TUTORING, MENTORING, AND CLASSROOM SUPPORT TO AID STUDENTS IN DEVELOPING IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT AND SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL SKILLS. THE VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN VARIOUS PUBLIC, NON-PROFIT, AND FAITH-BASED K-12 CLASSROOMS THROUGHOUT THE COMMUNITY.

ONE UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEER WILL BE PLACED IN A HEALTHY FUTURES OUTCOME 12 MONTH BASED ASSIGNMENT, WORKING WITH INDIVIDUALS WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES. ADDITIONAL VOLUNTEERS MAY BE PLACED IN A HEALTHY FUTURES OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENT AS A SECONDARY ASSIGNMENT, DURING THE SUMMER MONTHS. SOME OF THE ACTIVITIES THE VOLUNTEER(S) WILL DO ARE AS FOLLOWS: ASSIST THE INDIVIDUALS SERVED BY TAKING THEM FOR WALKS, ACCOMPANYING THEM TO OUTDOOR ACTIVITIES, READING THE NEWSPAPER, MAGAZINES AND BOOKS TO THEM, PARTICIPATING IN ACTIVITIES THAT INCREASE SENSORY AWARENESS, AND ASSISTING THEM TO ATTEND ON CAMPUS EVENTS. THE GOAL OF THE VOLUNTEER(S) IN THIS OUTCOME BASED PERFORMANCE MEASURE IS TO PROMOTE INTEGRATION, INDEPENDENCE, AND INCLUSION FOR THE INDIVIDUALS THAT THE VOLUNTEER(S) ARE ASSIGNED TO ON A DAILY BASIS.  

THE CNCS ANNUAL FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $416,280 AND NON-FEDERAL MATCH WILL IMPROVE THE EDUCATIONAL OUTCOMES FOR AT LEAST 500 DISADVANTAGED CHILDREN AND ADULTS OVER THE THREE YEAR PERIOD. FEDERATION OF ORGANIZATIONS IS THE SPONSOR ORGANIZATION FOR THE SUFFOLK COUNTY FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP). FEDERATION IS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT SOCIAL SERVICE AGENCY THAT SERVES SUFFOLK, NASSAU, QUEENS, BRONX, MANHATTAN AND BROOKLYN. FOUNDED BY FAMILY ADVOCATES IN 1972, FEDERATION OPERATES PROGRAMS THAT FOCUS ON ASSISTING PEOPLE TO HELP THEMSELVES BECOME PRODUCTIVE MEMBERS OF THEIR COMMUNITIES. AS A LEADING PROVIDER OF COST EFFECTIVE EVIDENCE BASED SERVICES, FEDERATION OF ORGANIZATIONS PARTNERS WITH INDIVIDUALS, FAMILIES AND COMMUNITIES TO PROMOTE WELLNESS AND ENRICH QUALITY OF LIFE. WE ARE AGENTS OF CHANGE IN A RAPIDLY EVOLVING HEALTH CARE ENVIRONMENT. WE COLLABORATE WITH COMMUNITY LEADERS AND PROGRESSIVE HEALTHCARE PROVIDERS TO EDUCATE AND MOTIVATE PEOPLE TO IMPROVE THEIR HEALTH.

FEDERATION OF ORGANIZATIONS IS REQUESTING 93 VSY?S, AND IT IS PROJECTED THAT AN ESTIMATED 110 FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. THROUGH A NETWORK OF APPROXIMATELY 56 STATIONS, FOSTER GRANDPARENTS (FG?S) WILL ASSIST ASSIGNED CHILDREN WITH EDUCATIONAL FOCUS AREAS, INCLUDING DEMONSTRATING GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS, OR IMPROVING ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT OR SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL SKILLS, WITH PARTICULAR FOCUS ON CHILDREN OF ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED BACKGROUNDS AND/OR CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL AND/OR EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS. SERVICE CATEGORIES WILL INCLUDE PUBLIC ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS, HEAD START FACILITIES AND PRE-ELEMENTARY DAY CARE CENTERS. RESOURCES SUCH THE NY STATE KID?S WELL-BEING INDICATORS CLEARINGHOUSE, THE ASSOCIATION FOR SUPERVISION AND CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT, THE COUNTY HEALTH RANKINGS AND ROADMAPS 2019 STATISTICS, THE US CENSUS BUREAU REPORT, AND THE NY STATE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION SCHOOL REPORT CARDS, PROVIDE EVIDENCE OF EDUCATIONAL NEEDS IN THE COMMUNITY, AND HELP IDENTIFY CHILDREN WHO WILL BENEFIT MOST FROM THE SERVICES OF FG VOLUNTEERS. PAST RESEARCH HAS INDICATED THAT ONE-ON-ONE INTERVENTION, SUCH AS THE TYPE OF ASSISTANCE THAT FG?S PROVIDE, HELPS TO IMPROVE SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT, AND ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT. AT THE END OF THE 12-MONTH PERFORMANCE PERIOD, THE CHILDREN SERVED WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS, AND WILL SHOW IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT OR SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL SKILLS, DUE IN PART TO THE SERVICES PROVIDED BY THE FG.

THESE SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL OCCUR AT STATIONS SUCH AS BUFFALO PUBLIC ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS, HEAD STARTS, CHARTER ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS, PAROCHIAL SCHOOLS, AND DAY CARE CENTERS.

THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. THESE IMPROVEMENTS WILL BE REFLECTED ON THE ANNUAL CHILD ASSIGNMENT PLANS, AS REPORTED BY CLASSROOM TEACHERS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $418,303  WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $57,000 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

THE NORTHERN NEW YORK FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM HAS BEEN AWARDED A GRANT WHICH HOLDS A STIPEND BUDGET TO FULFILL 48 VSY'S FOR EACH FISCAL YEAR, IN A THREE YEAR GRANT AWARD FROM THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE. THIS PROJECT WILL SERVE LOW-INCOME SENIOR CITIZENS AGES 55 AND ABOVE, DELIVERING ONE ON ONE ATTENTION TO CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL NEEDS.
EDUCATION WILL BE THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA THAT THIS PROJECT WILL ADDRESS DURING THIS GRANT PERIOD WITH OBJECTIVES FOCUSING ON K-12 EDUCATION AND SCHOOL READINESS.  SCHOOL READINESS WILL BE ADDRESSED IN A HEAD START SETTING. CHILDREN ENROLLED IN HEAD START FACE EMOTIONAL, PHYSICAL AND/OR LEARNING DISABILITIES.  THESE DISABILITIES CAN MAKE IT DIFFICULT FOR CHILDREN TO ACQUIRE THE COGNITIVE AND SOCIAL SKILLS NEEDED TO ENTER KINDERGARTEN.  FG'S PLACED IN HEAD STARTS WILL WORK ONE ON ONE IN SMALL GROUPS TO DEVELOP THE SKILLS NEEDED FOR THESE CHILDREN TO ENTER INTO KINDERGARTEN.  K-12 WILL BE ADDRESSED BY PLACING FG VOLUNTEERS IN GENERAL CLASSROOMS, WITH ASSIGNED STUDENTS THAT HAVE SPECIAL EDUCATIONAL NEEDS.  THESE VOLUNTEERS WILL FOCUS ON BRIDGING THE GAP BETWEEN THESE SPECIAL NEEDS CHILDREN AND THEIR FELLOW PUPILS IN THE CLASSROOM, BY ENFORCING SELF-ESTEEM, RE-ENFORCE SOCIAL SKILLS, AND KEEP CHILDREN ON TASK.  K-12 WILL ALSO BE MET BY MENTORING, FG'S WILL BE PLACED WITH HIGH SCHOOL CHILDREN ON A ONE ON ONE BASIS TO HELP REINFORCE THE TEENAGERS POSITIVE SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL GROWTH IN ORDER TO ADDRESS THE NEGATIVE IMPACTS OF POOR PARENTING SKILLS IN THEIR OWN HOMES, AND HOPEFULLY HELP BY PREVENTING THESE TEENAGERS FROM BEING SINGLED OUT, LEFT BEHIND SOCIALLY AND/OR ACADEMICALLY, AND DEVELOPING A LACK OF SELF-ESTEEM. 
THE SERVICES AND ACTIVITIES ADDRESSED ABOVE WILL BE DELIVERED IN FIVE COUNTIES OF UPSTATE NORTHERN NEW YORK INCLUDING, FRANKLIN, CLINTON, ESSEX, ST. LAWRENCE AND JEFFERSON SERVING 18 INDIVIDUAL WORK STATIONS.
OUR VOLUNTEERS WILL FOLLOW A CHILD SPECIFIC PLAN (CHILD CARE FORM) DEVELOPED BY OUR PROGRAM, THAT WILL BE IMPLEMENTED AND ESTABLISHED BY TRAINED STAFF AT EACH INDIVIDUAL WORK STATION.  THIS PLAN WILL BE DERIVED FROM EDUCATIONAL BASED METHODS PROVEN TO BE EFFECTIVE IN ENHANCING THE EDUCATIONAL DEVELOPMENT OF EACH CHILD INDIVIDUALLY. WITH THIS CHILD CARE PLAN IN PLACE AND EACH CHILD RECEIVING A MINIMUM OF 15 HOURS AND A MAXIMUM OF 40 HOURS PER WEEK, OF ONE ON ONE ATTENTION, THESE CHILDREN WILL NO DOUBT HAVE THE ADVANTAGE OF IMPROVED LEARNING THAN THOSE WITHOUT THE HELP FROM OUR VOLUNTEERS. THIS PROJECT, BASED ON ITS PREVIOUS SUCCESS, ANTICIPATES A WIN-WIN SITUATION FOR ALL.
THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE HAS GRANTED THIS PROJECT $256,078 IS SUPPLEMENTED BY $86,928 THAT THIS PROJECT HAS SECURED EITHER BY CASH OR IN-KIND DONATIONS.

THE NJ OFFICE OF VOLUNTEERISM (NJOV), WITHIN THE NJ DEPARTMENT OF STATE BECAME THE SPONSOR OF THE NJ FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (NJFGP) IN JULY 2010.  THE NJFGP PROVIDES OPPORTUNITIES FOR 130 TO 140 SENIOR CITIZENS TO ENGAGE IN MEANINGFUL VOLUNTEER SERVICE, DIRECTLY ASSISTING 300 CHILDREN AND YOUTH WITH SPECIAL NEEDS, COVERING 11 COUNTIES AND PRESENTLY 42 ACTIVE STATIONS.  THE OVERALL VOLUNTEER IMPACT REACHES OVER 1000 CHILDREN.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD 130+ VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE SERVED DIRECTLY 975+ CHILDREN, SUPPORTING BEHAVIORAL AND ACADEMIC GAINS.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $801,150 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $155,713 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.
THE PROJECT?S PRIMARY FOCUS IS SCHOOL READINESS AND ABOUT 90% OF THE VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THIS AREA.  APPROXIMATELY 10% OF THE VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE FOCUS AREA OF EDUCATION: K-12, OVER THE THREE-YEAR PERIOD.  THE K-12 EDUCATION OBJECTIVES INCLUDE PLACEMENTS AT NJ DIVISION OF CHILDREN AND FAMILIES (DFC) REGIONAL SCHOOLS AND COMMUNITY-BASED SCHOOLS THAT SERVE YOUTH WITH EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS AND/OR MULTIPLE DISABILITIES, AS WELL AS ELEMENTARY AGE STUDENTS IN PUBLIC K-12 SCHOOLS AND AFTER SCHOOL PROGRAMS. THE K-12 EDUCATION OBJECTIVES INCLUDE PLACEMENTS AT NJ DIVISION OF CHILDREN AND FAMILIES (DFC) REGIONAL SCHOOLS AND COMMUNITY-BASED SCHOOLS THAT SERVE YOUTH WITH EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS AND/OR MULTIPLE DISABILITIES, AS WELL AS ELEMENTARY AGE STUDENTS IN PUBLIC K-12 SCHOOLS AND AFTER SCHOOL PROGRAMS. 
VOLUNTEERS ARE HANDS-ON IN THE CLASSROOM AND WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS, MENTORING AND TUTORING 2-4 ASSIGNED CHILDREN AND YOUTH, NURTURING AND PROVIDING CLASSROOM ASSISTANCE THROUGH LITERACY, BASIC MATH, CONVERSATION, RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES, AND ENCOURAGING STUDENTS TO ENGAGE IN CLASSROOM LEARNING EXPERIENCES AND APPROPRIATE BEHAVIOR AND SOCIAL DEVELOPMENT AT EACH GRADE LEVEL.  VOLUNTEERS SERVING STUDENTS WITH EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS MAY ALSO ASSIST WITH MOTOR SKILLS ACTIVITIES, IN ADDITION TO SERVING AS TUTORS AND MENTORS. AS STATED BY THE VOLUNTEER STATION DIRECTOR AT MI ESCUELITA FGP, THE SPECIAL CHILD-GRANDPARENT RELATIONSHIP HELPS CHILDREN FEEL SECURE, GAIN SELF-ESTEEM AND ENJOY LEARNING, LEADING TO HEALTHY MINDS AND BODIES, WHICH FOSTERS FUTURE EDUCATIONAL SUCCESS. 
THE NJFGP WILL CONTINUE TO STRENGTHEN ADMINISTRATIVE SYSTEMS AND PROGRAMMATIC AREAS TO ENSURE PROJECT COMPLIANCE AND SUPPORT COMMUNITY STRENGTHENING INITIATIVES.   IT WILL ASSESS ONGOING COMMUNITY NEEDS, SEEK EVIDENCE-BASED PROGRAMMING OPPORTUNITIES, AND STRIVE TO ENRICH THE LIVES OF VOLUNTEERS AND STUDENTS.

FAMILY AND CHILDREN'S SERVICES OF CENTRAL MARYLAND (FCS) IS A PRIVATE, NONPROFIT, NONSECTARIAN 501(C)(3) AGENCY THAT HAS BEEN SERVING CENTRAL MARYLAND SINCE 1849. OUR HISTORY IS INTERTWINED WITH THE EVOLUTION OF BALTIMORE FROM A MAJOR PORT CITY TO A THRIVING METROPOLIS WITH POCKETS OF POVERTY AND GREAT NEED. OVER THE COURSE OF THE LAST 170 YEARS, OUR HISTORY IS RICH WITH EXAMPLES OF TIMELY RESPONSE TO CHANGING AND EMERGING NEEDS AS A KEY CONTRIBUTOR TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOCIAL SUPPORTS NECESSARY FOR A COMMUNITY TO THRIVE. OUR MISSION IS TO TRANSFORM THE LIVES OF CHILDREN AND ADULTS BY PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES TO BUILD SELF-CONFIDENCE, RESILIENCE AND HOPE.  
THE MISSION OF OUR SENIOR SERVICES DIVISION IS TO ENHANCE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR OLDER AND IMPAIRED INDIVIDUALS AND THEIR CAREGIVERS THROUGH HIGH QUALITY SUPPORTIVE SERVICES. THE DIVISION INCLUDES THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP), MEDICAL ADULT DAY CARE AND SENIOR HOUSING. OUR FGP IS AN INTEGRAL PART OF OUR SENIOR SERVICES DIVISION; AN ESTIMATED 69 FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THIS PROGRAM OVER THE COURSE OF ONE YEAR. OUT OF THE 69 VOLUNTEERS, 63 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN ASSIGNMENTS WITHIN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF EDUCATION, SPECIFICALLY EARLY-CHILDHOOD AND ELEMENTARY EDUCATION. FAMILY AND CHILDREN'S SERVICES WILL BE MEASURING OUTCOMES IN THE NUMBER OF CHILDREN WHO DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SOCIAL AND/OR EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT WITH THE ADDITION OF THE VOLUNTEER IN THE CLASSROOM. THE VOLUNTEERS WILL BE ASSISTING IN EARLY HEAD START, HEAD START AND PRESCHOOL CLASSROOMS COMPLETING A VARIETY OF TASK SUCH AS SELF-ESTEEM BUILDING, GREETINGS AND DEPARTURES, COGNITIVE-LEARNING, AND FINE MOTOR SKILLS. IN ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS, THE VOLUNTEERS WILL BE TUTORING CHILDREN IN AN EFFORT TO IMPROVE SCHOOL ATTENDANCE. ANOTHER 6 ADDITIONAL VOLUNTEERS WILL BE IN ASSIGNMENTS THAT PROMOTE CHILD SAFETY, WELFARE AND HEALTH BY SUPPORTING YOUNG MOTHERS IN 2 SITE LOCATIONS.  THE FIRST SITE IS THE HARRY AND JEANETTE WEINBERG BUILDING AT SAGE CENTER.  AT THE SAGE CENTER OUR VOLUNTEERS WILL BE HELPING YOUNG MOTHERS AS THEY ACTIVELY WORK TOWARD REUNIFICATION. THE SECOND SITE IS THE BON SECOURS FAMILY SUPPORT CENTER.  BON SECOURS FAMILY SUPPORT CENTER ALLOWS THE FGP VOLUNTEERS TO ASSIST WITH PARENTING CLASSES, LIFE SKILLS TRAINING, AND CHILD CARE.

SINCE 1913, THE URBAN LEAGUE OF SPRINGFIELD (ULS) HAS FULFILLED ITS MISSION TO ADVOCATE FOR AND PROVIDE SERVICES TO ENHANCE THE ACADEMIC, ECONOMIC, AND SOCIAL DEVELOPMENT OF YOUNG PEOPLE, FAMILIES, AND SENIORS THROUGH THE PROMOTION OF ECONOMIC SELF-SUFFICIENCY, QUALITY EDUCATION, HEALTHY HABITS AND SOCIAL JUSTICE. ULS IS REQUESTING $675,175 TO PROVIDE SERVICES IN GRADES KINDERGARTEN THROUGH 12TH IN THE FOLLOWING CATEGORIES: GED/DROPOUTS, PRE-ELEMENTARY DAY CARE, TUTORING AND CHILD (ELEMENTARY) LITERACY, ELEMENTARY EDUCATION, SPECIAL EDUCATION AND MENTORING THROUGH THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS PROGRAM. THE FGP PROGRAM WILL ASSIST WITH THE CAMPAIGN TO MAINTAIN COMMON CORE STANDARDS - K-12. THE GOAL IS FOR ALL CHILDREN TO GRADUATE AND BE ABLE TO COMPETE GLOBALLY. THE FGP PROGRAM WILL ADDRESS CRITICAL NEEDS INCLUDING IMPROVING EARLY EDUCATION, HEALTH EDUCATION AND RESOURCES, PROVIDING READING AND LITERACY ASSISTANCE TO STUDENTS AND OFFERING TRAINING, COMPANIONSHIP AND TRANSPORTATION TO HOME BOUND SENIORS. THE PROGRAM WILL UTILIZE THE SKILLS OF 45 VOLUNTEERS TO PROVIDE TUTORING TO HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS, 10 VOLUNTEERS TO PROVIDE SUPPORT TO PRE-ELEMENTARY SCHOOL AGED CHILDREN; 35 VOLUNTEERS TO TUTOR/IMPROVE LITERACY IN K-4 STUDENTS; 40 VOLUNTEERS TO TUTOR IN AFTER SCHOOL PROGRAMS; 10 VOLUNTEERS TO PROVIDE SUPPORT TO SPECIAL EDUCATION STUDENTS AND 2 VOLUNTEERS TO MENTOR CHILDREN OF INCARCERATED PARENTS. THE FGP WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD SERVICES USING RESEARCH-BASED METHODS THAT PROVIDE TRAINING WHICH EFFECTIVELY DELIVERS SERVICES AND MAINTAINS A RESILIENT VOLUNTEER FORCE. STRONG PROGRAM MANAGEMENT AND PROGRAM EVALUATIONS WILL HELP ENSURE THAT COMMUNITY NEEDS ARE MET. OUTCOMES WILL INCLUDE IMPROVEMENTS IN SOCIAL SKILLS, LITERACY, GRADUATION RATES AND LOWER THE DROPOUT RATE FOR OVER 800 ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED YOUNGSTERS, AS WELL AS DECREASED EMOTIONAL, AND DISCIPLINARY PROBLEMS. EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESS/DISASTER RECOVER TRAINING WILL BE OFFERED TO ALL FGP VOLUNTEERS. WE ARE COLLABORATING WITH THE DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICE FOR CITY OF SPRINGFIELD TO ASSIST WITH THE OPERATION OF AN EMERGENCY DISPENSING SITE. FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL BECOME MEDICAL RESERVE CORP. VOLUNTEERS TO ASSIST WITH ANY MAJOR PUBLIC HEALTH MASS CASUALTY EVENT. ADDITIONALLY, WE WILL INSTITUTE IN-SERVICE TRAINING ACTIVITIES TO PROMOTE THE ASPECT OF A HEALTHY LIFESTYLE. NUTRITIONAL WORKSHOPS WILL BE PRESENTED BY VARIOUS HEALTH AND WELLNESS PROFESSIONALS THROUGHOUT HAMDEN, HAMPSHIRE, BERKSHIRE, AND FRANKLIN COUNTIES. THE WORKSHOPS WILL PROVIDE THE LATEST NUTRITIONAL AND WELLNESS INFORMATION TO ENSURE THAT THE FGP VOLUNTEERS RECOGNIZE THE VALUE OF PROPER NUTRITION. PROPER FOOD PROVIDES THE FUEL AND ENERGY IT TAKES TO WORK WITH MENTORING AND TUTORING CHILDREN ON A DAILY BASIS. WE WANT OUR FGP VOLUNTEERS TO LOOK GREAT AND FEEL GOOD AND EVEN BECOME DISEASE FREE.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
COMMUNITY TEAMWORK, INC. IS AN $80 MILLION COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY SERVING OVER 50,000 LOW INCOME CLIENTS FROM THROUGHOUT THE GREATER LOWELL AREA WITH A WIDE RANGE OF PROGRAMS THAT INCLUDE: ALL THREE SENIOR CORPS VOLUNTEER PROGRAMS, CHILD AND FAMILY SERVICES, HOUSING AND HOMELESS SERVICES, WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT AND ENERGY AND COMMUNITY RESOURCES OUR MISSION IS TO BE A CATALYST FOR SOCIAL CHANGE, WE STRENGTHEN COMMUNITIES AND REDUCE POVERTY BY DELIVERING VITAL SERVICES AND COLLABORATING WITH KEY STAKEHOLDERS TO CREATE HOUSING, EDUCATION AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES. WE STRIVE TO ASSIST LOW INCOME PEOPLE TO BECOME SELF-SUFFICIENT, TO ALLEVIATE THE EFFECTS OF POVERTY, AND TO ASSIST LOW INCOME PEOPLE TO PARTICIPATE IN THE DECISIONS THAT AFFECT THEIR LIVES. WE ARE REQUESTING $233,334.00 TO PROVIDE HIGH QUALITY VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT AND SUPPORT TO 39 VSYS/UNDUPLICATED FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WHO WILL PROVIDE CRITICALLY IMPORTANT SUPPORT SERVICES TO CHILDREN IN A VARIETY OF SETTINGS, WHO REQUIRE THE EXTRA ATTENTION AND SERVICE THAT OUR FGP VOLUNTEERS CAN PROVIDE.  CTI WILL WORK WITH A WIDE RANGE OF EARLY EDUCATION AND CARE, TRADITIONAL PUBLIC SCHOOLS, AND PRIVATE-NONPROFIT INSTITUTIONS SERVING CHILDREN IN THE GREATER LOWELL COMMUNITY. OUR COMMUNITY IS FACING INCREASINGLY CHALLENGING SOCIO-ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES AND IS HOME TO OVER 50 DIFFERENT ETHNIC AND CULTURAL BACKGROUNDS. YET WE CAN ALSO BOAST OF A HIGHLY ENGAGED AND PARTNERSHIP DRIVEN COMMUNITY OF INSTITUTIONS. CTI'S SENIOR CORPS VOLUNTEER PROGRAMS HAVE ESTABLISHED THEMSELVES AS A VITAL CONTRIBUTOR ACROSS THE ENTIRE SPECTRUM OF EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS IN OUR COMMUNITY. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. OUR FGP VOLUNTEERS HELP CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL NEEDS, ABILITIES, LANGUAGE CHALLENGES AND WHO ARE IMPACTED BY POVERTY AND CONTINUE TO MAKE GREAT STRIDES. FGP VOLUNTEERS SUPPORT AMBITIOUS LITERACY INITIATIVES WITH STUDENTS OF ALL AGES AND THEY DEVELOP PROFOUNDLY SUPPORTIVE AND ENCOURAGING RELATIONSHIPS WITH THE STUDENTS THEY SERVE. FGP VOLUNTEERS CONTRIBUTE MIGHTILY TO THE QUALITY OF EDUCATION IN OUR REGION. OUR SUPPORTING AGENCY AND OUR COMMUNITY, AS A WHOLE ARE COMMITTED TO NURTURING AND SUPPORTING THIS VALUED PROGRAM.

THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM OF GREATER LAWRENCE, HAVERHILL AND METHUEN IS SPONSORED BY THE MERRIMACK VALLEY COMMUNITY SERVICE CORPS INC. MVCSC ALSO SPONSORS THE RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP). OUR MISSION IS TO PROMOTE MEANINGFUL VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES AND SERVICES WITHIN THE GREATER LAWRENCE REGION FOR SENIORS 55 OR OLDER. FGP IS COMMITTED TO MEETING THE NEEDS OF ALL INDIVIDUALS WITHOUT REGARD TO COLOR, RACE, RELIGION OR CREED.THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS PROGRAM WILL SUPPORT 38 VSYS, WHICH ALL WILL BE SERVING IN ACTIVITIES UNDER THE NATIONAL PERFORMANCE MEASURES AND EVIDENCE BASED PROGRAMMING. FGP CURRENTLY HAS 25 ACTIVE VOLUNTEERS ENROLLED WITH 13 ADDITIONAL VOLUNTEERS WHO HAVE BEEN CLEARED TO START, JUST PENDING WORKSTATION PLACEMENT. 

WE HAVE INITIATED RECRUITMENT EFFORTS BY HIRING AN OUTREACH AND RECRUITMENT COORDINATOR AS WELL AS OBTAINING A MAILING LIST OF SENIOR RESIDENTS IN THE AREAS WE SERVICE. WE ARE AND WILL CONTINUE TO RECRUIT VOLUNTEERS UTILIZING OUR LOCAL MASSHIRE MERRIMACK VALLEY CAREER CENTER WITH A HIGHER FOCUS ON SENIOR CENTERS AND OTHER SENIOR SERVICING ORGANIZATIONS. MCVCS IS ALSO WORKING ON SECURING NEW WORKSTATIONS TO COINCIDE WITH THE RISE IN VOLUNTEER RECRUITS.THE 10 ACTIVE WORKSTATIONS WE CURRENTLY HAVE ARE HOUSED IN LOCAL SCHOOLS, DAY CARE CENTERS AND HEAD START PROGRAMS ACROSS LAWRENCE, HAVERHILL AND METHUEN.

THE NEED FOR PROGRAMS LIKE THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IN THESE COMMUNITIES IS EVIDENCED IN THE STATE REQUIRED MCAS EXAM SCORES. IN FACT, THE LAWRENCE PUBLIC SCHOOL SYSTEM, RATED LEVEL 5 IN THE STATE OF MASSACHUSETTS, IT IS THE LOWEST PERFORMING SCHOOL SYSTEM IN THE STATE AND IS CURRENTLY IN STATE RECEIVERSHIP. WHILE WE USE TEACHERS? INPUT TO HELP IDENTIFY CHILDREN AT RISK FOR FAILING, IT IS THE STANDARDIZED MCAS EXAM GIVEN TO 3RD GRADERS STATEWIDE THAT BEST ILLUSTRATES THE ISSUE. IN LAWRENCE, 45% OF STUDENTS HAD A PERFORMANCE LEVEL OF "NEEDS IMPROVEMENT" IN ENGLISH AND 34% IN MATHEMATICS. IN HAVERHILL, 34% OF STUDENTS SCORED "NEEDS IMPROVEMENT" IN ENGLISH AND 28% IN MATHEMATICS.IN METHUEN, 39% OF STUDENTS "NEED IMPROVEMENT" IN ENGLISH AND 31% IN MATHEMATICS. 

THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM HAS FOCUSED ON TWO MAJOR AREAS OF EDUCATION: 

PRESCHOOL: THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM HAS PARTNERED WITH THE GREATER LAWRENCE COMMUNITY ACTION COUNCIL (GLCAC) HEAD START PROGRAM TO PROVIDE HIGH QUALITY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION, AS WELL AS NUTRITION, HEALTH, AND FAMILY SERVICES TO LOW-INCOME FAMILIES IN LAWRENCE.
1ST THROUGH 3RD GRADE: WHEN TEACHERS IDENTIFY STUDENTS IN THEIR CLASSROOM THAT NEED ACADEMIC ASSISTANCE, FOSTER GRANDPARENTS RECEIVED AN ASSIGNMENT PLAN AND WORK ONE ON ONE WITH THE CHILD THEY ARE ASSIGNED TO. THIS ENHANCES THE CHILDREN'S READING SKILLS, INCREASED VOCABULARY AND THE ABILITY TO RECOGNIZE SIGHT WORDS. AS A RESULT, CLASSROOM TEACHERS AND FOSTER GRANDPARENTS ANTICIPATE THAT THESE CHILDREN IN GRADES K - 3 WILL SHOW IMPROVED OVERALL ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, IMPROVED CLASSROOM BEHAVIOR, A STRENGTHENED BOND TO ACADEMICS AND INCREASED SELF-CONFIDENCE. THESE IMPROVEMENTS WILL ULTIMATELY LEAD TO IMPROVEMENT IN STANDARDIZED TEST SCORES, INCLUDING THE MCAS EXAM. 

THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM RECEIVES 10% IN-KIND DONATION FROM THE HEAD START PROGRAMS, DAY CARE CENTERS, LAWRENCE AND METHUEN PUBLIC SCHOOL SYSTEM.

THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IS REQUESTING $225,219 TO CONTINUE OFFERING SUPPORT SERVICES IN THE LAWRENCE, METHUEN AND HAVERHILL COMMUNITIES THAT HAVE DEMONSTRATED A LACK OF PROFICIENCY IN BOTH LANGUAGE ARTS AND MATHEMATICS.

AN ESTIMATED 150 FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THE DELAWARE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM. 100 OF THESE VOLUNTEERS ARE FUNDED BY THE CORPORATION OF NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE AND 50 VOLUNTEERS ARE FUNDED BY THE STATE OF DELAWARE.  OF THESE NUMBERS 150 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  THE VOLUNTEERS SERVING THESE CHILDREN WILL PERFORM SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES SUCH AS SERVING CHILDREN ONE-ON-ONE OR IN SMALL GROUPS OF 3-7 CHILDREN.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THE DELAWARE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IS EDUCATION WITH OUR OBJECTIVE BEING K-12 AND PRE-SCHOOL READINESS.   THE STRUCTURE OF ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE THE VOLUNTEER PERFORMING TASKS THAT WILL TRACK THE CHILDREN IN K-12 IN AREAS SUCH AS:

1.	MATH CONCEPTS
2.	STAYING FOCUSED ON TASK
3.	ENGLISH/LANGUAGE ART

AND PRE-SCHOOL READINESS IN AREAS SUCH AS:
1.	SOCIAL RELATIONSHIP
2.	ALPHABET KNOWLEDGE
3.	EARLY READING ABILITY
4.	NUMBER RELATIONSHIPS
5.	PHONOLOGICAL AWARENESS ETC.

AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT, THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOME OF OUR K-12 OBJECTIVE IS TO HAVE A TARGETED 300 CHILDREN TO SHOW IMPROVEMENT IN ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY AND/OR MATH. THE PROGRAM ALSO HAS AN OUTCOME TARGET OF 225 CHILDREN BEING SERVED IN OUR PRE-SCHOOL PROGRAMS THAT WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS IN THE AREA OF SOCIAL AND/OR EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT. THIS SAME OUTCOME WILL ALSO MEASURE THE SAME GAIN IN THE HEAD START/PROGRAMS. THE HEAD START PROGRAM IS STRONG IN DELAWARE. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $547546  WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY OUR SPONSOR THE STATE OF DELAWARE. THE STATE OF DELAWARE WILL SUPPLEMENT A FEDERAL MATCH AT 10% IN THE AMOUNT OF $60,874. THE GRANT BUDGET TOTALS: $ 608,420.

58 UNDUPLICATED FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) VOLUNTEERS, SPONSORED BY NEW OPPORTUNITIES, INC. (NOI), WILL SERVE IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF EDUCATION. THESE ACTIVITIES WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH PARTNERSHIPS WITH 8 ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS AND 6 SCHOOL READINESS SITES IN- WATERBURY, WOLCOTT, CHESHIRE, PROSPECT, BEACON FALLS, NAUGATUCK, WHICH ARE LOCATED IN NEW HAVEN COUNTY AND THOMASTON LOCATED IN LITCHFIELD COUNTY. THE VOLUNTEERS WILL ENGAGE IN MENTORING/TUTORING ACTIVITIES WITH STUDENTS WHO ARE ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED AND/OR WHO HAVE SPECIAL NEEDS FOR THE PURPOSE OF IMPROVING ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AND SOCIAL/EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT. 

AT THE END OF THE 12 MONTH PERFORMANCE PERIOD, 66 ELEMENTARY SCHOOL STUDENTS WILL SHOW EVIDENCE OF IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT. 108 SCHOOL READINESS CHILDREN WILL BE BETTER PREPARED FOR SUCCESS IN ELEMENTARY SCHOOL BECAUSE THEY HAVE DEMONSTRATED GAINS IN SOCIAL AND/OR EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT. THESE OUTCOMES WILL BE MEASURED BY THE TEACHING PROFESSIONALS WHO ASSIGN AND SUPERVISE THE VOLUNTEERS.  

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $279,584 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY MORE THAN $50,000 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

THE NUTMEG BIG BROTHERS BIG SISTERS FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IN THE GREATER HARTFORD AND EASTERN CT REGIONS WILL CREATE MEANINGFUL CONNECTIONS WITH PARTICIPATING EARLY CHILDHOOD CENTERS AND SCHOOLS BY PROVIDING SUPPORT TO CHILDREN AT RISK OF NEGATIVE EDUCATIONAL AND/OR LIFE OUTCOMES DUE TO CONNECTICUT'S ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT GAP.  IT WILL ALSO PROVIDE LOW-INCOME SENIORS WITH STIPEND-SUPPORTED OPPORTUNITIES FOR MEANINGFUL COMMUNITY SERVICE. 
EIGHTY-SIX LOW-INCOME SENIORS (APPROXIMATELY 50 IN THE HARTFORD AREA AND 36 IN EASTERN CT) WILL SERVE IN THE PROGRAM AND WILL BE PLACED IN CLASSROOMS PRIMARILY FOCUSED IN THE FOLLOWING CONNECTICUT COMMUNITIES: BLOOMFIELD, EAST HARTFORD, HARTFORD, MIDDLETOWN, NEW BRITAIN, NEW LONDON, NORWICH, AND WINDHAM. 
FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL PROVIDE ACADEMIC AND SOCIAL SUPPORT TO CHILDREN AGES 1-10, AND ASSIST IN CLASSROOMS OF YOUNG CHILDREN THROUGH A NETWORK OF PLACEMENT SITES.
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION.  AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR- GRANT, THE PUBLIC SCHOOL STUDENTS SERVED WILL SHOW IMPROVEMENT IN ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT, AND THE EARLY CHILDHOOD POPULATION WILL IMPROVE IN SOCIAL/EMOTIONAL SKILLS. 

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $516,140 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY A NON-FEDERAL SHARE OF $57,349.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

THE STATE OF TEXAS, COUNTY OF HIDALGO-RIO GRANDE VALLEY FOSTER GRANDPARENTS PROGRAM (FGP PROJECT) IS SPONSORED BY THE COUNTY OF HIDALGO COMMUNITY SERVICE AGENCY LOCATED IN EDINBURG, TEXAS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR RIO GRANDE VALLEY-FGP PROJECT IS EDUCATION. THE PROJECT WILL INVOLVE 40 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WHO WILL MEET INCOME ELIGIBILITY GUIDELINES AND SERVE A MINIMUM OF 15 AND A MAXIMUM OF 40 HOURS WEEKLY AT $2.65 AN HOUR. THE VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO ACCRUE 8 HOURS EVERY MONTH PAID AT $2.65 AN HOUR AND 8 HOURS A MONTH OF RECOGNITION LEAVE FOR PERFECT ATTENDANCE DURING THE MONTH.  100% OF THE 40 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME BASED MEASURES IN HEAD START PROGRAMS. IN THE SCHOOL READINESS OBJECTIVE, THE VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE SERVICE ACTIVITIES IN SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL, LANGUAGE DEVELOPMENT, LITERACY AND NUMERACY SUPPORT TO APPROXIMATELY 160 EXCEPTIONAL CHILDREN WHO WILL PARTICIPATE IN CNCS SUPPORTED EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION PROGRAMS DURING THE YEAR. FORTY UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL PARTICIPATE IN SERVICE ACTIVITIES FOR APPROXIMATELY 160 YOUTH ENGAGED IN AFTER SCHOOL ACTIVITIES IN COMMUNITY SPONSORED PROGRAMS THE GEOGRAPHIC AREA. THE VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN EARLY/HEAD START, HEAD START, HEAD START-TEXAS MIGRANT PROGRAMS, COMMUNITY CENTERS AND LIBRARIES. THEY WILL SERVE EXCEPTIONAL CHILDREN OF LOW INCOME AND MIGRANT FARM-WORKER FAMILIES. THE HIDALGO COUNTY HEAD START PROGRAMS CURRENTLY SERVES 3,690 OF THE NEEDIEST 3-5 YEAR OLDS IN 40 CENTERS. WILLACY AND CAMERON COUNTIES' HEAD START NEIGHBORS IN NEED OF SERVICES (NINOS) SERVES 2,914 CHILDREN 0-5 YEARS IN 35 CENTERS. THE TEXAS MIGRANT COUNCIL HEAD START PROGRAM CURRENTLY SERVES 3-5 YEAR OLD CHILDREN OF LOW-INCOME MIGRANT/FARM WORKERS IN 16 CENTERS. COMMUNITY CENTERS PROVIDE AFTER SCHOOL SAFE AND SECURE PRE-KINDER ENVIRONMENTS WHERE CHILDREN COMPLETE SCHOOL WORK WHILE PARENTS WORK. THE FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL HELP PREPARE CHILDREN ENTER KINDERGARTEN WITH ESSENTIAL DEVELOPMENTAL SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE NECESSARY TO SUCCEED. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $242,447 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $26,669 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES BY HIDALGO COUNTY, TEXAS.

THE TEXOMA FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) IS REQUESTING $198,993. THESE FUNDS WOULD ALLOW 41 VSYS TO SERVE AT MINIMUM 80 SPECIAL NEEDS OR EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS CHILDREN IN OUR TRI COUNTY FGP STATIONS. THE PROGRAM'S SPONSOR, THE TEXOMA COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS (TCOG) IS AN ORGANIZATION COMPRISED OF CITY AND COUNTY GOVERNMENTS, COLLEGES, SCHOOL DISTRICTS, AND CHAMBERS OF COMMERCE DETERMINED TO BUILD STRENGTH THROUGH REGIONAL COOPERATION. ITS MEMBERS ARE SERVED BY WORKING TOGETHER TO CONTINUALLY IMPROVE THE ECONOMIC, SOCIAL AND EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE CITIZENS OF COOKE, GRAYSON AND FANNIN COUNTIES.  CREATED BY THE TEXAS STATE LEGISLATURE IN 1968, THE TEXOMA COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS SERVES GOVERNMENTAL MEMBERSHIP FROM THE AFOREMENTIONED TRI-COUNTY AREA.  

TEXOMA FGP IS A PART OF THE TEXOMA AREA AGENCY ON AGING (AAA). THE GOAL OF THE AGENCY IS TO SERVE AS THE COMMUNITY CATALYST TO ENHANCE AWARENESS OF THE STRENGTHS AND NEEDS OF OUR OLDER POPULATION AND TO PROMOTE THE DEVELOPMENT OF A COORDINATED AND COMPREHENSIVE SYSTEM OF SERVICES, PROGRAMS, AND OPPORTUNITIES TO ENSURE THEIR PROLONGED WELL-BEING, INDEPENDENCE AND DIGNITY.

ACCORDING TO KIDS COUNT DATA CENTER AS OF 2015, 45,875 CHILDREN WERE LIVING IN THE TEXOMA AREA AND OF THOSE, 10,086 CHILDREN LIVED IN POVERTY. THE AMERICAN COMMUNITIES SURVEY OF 2015 INDICATED THAT 7,008 CHILDREN IN THE TEXOMA AREA (GRAYSON, FANNIN, AND COOKE COUNTIES) HAD DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES WHICH INCLUDED BUT NOT LIMITED TO ADHD, AUTISM, LEARNING DISABILITIES AND STUTTERING. AS OF 2016, THERE WERE 1820 CHILDREN ENROLLED IN HEAD START PROGRAMS WITHIN THE TRI-COUNTY AREA WHICH MORE THAN TRIPLED IN GRAYSON COUNTY ALONE SINCE 2014. CHILDHOOD EDUCATION AND ITS ASSOCIATED OUTCOMES ARE ALSO TIED TO MANY OF THE SAME STRESSORS AS OVERALL HEALTH AND WELL-BEING. THE SCIENTIFIC AMERICAN ARTICLE ?POVERTY DISTURBS CHILDREN?S BRAIN DEVELOPMENT AND ACADEMIC PERFOMANCE? STATED THAT STUDENTS WHO ARE ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED DON?T PERFORM AS WELL IN SCHOOL BOTH LOCALLY AND NATIONALLY. IT IS IMPERATIVE THAT CHILDREN BE GIVEN EVERY OPPORTUNITY AND SUPPORT TO SURPASS THEIR CIRCUMSTANCES. MENTORING PROVIDES THAT PROSPECT FOR SUCCESSFUL OUTCOMES. WE BELIEVE AND HAVE PREVIOUSLY DEMONSTRATED THE MOBIUSMENTOR.ORG STATEMENT THAT SAYS ?MENTORING IS A PROVEN STRATEGY FOR POSITIVE YOUTH DEVELOPMENT. YOUTH ARE MORE LIKELY TO SUCCEED IN LIFE WHEN THEY HAVE THE ADDITIONAL SUPPORT OF A CARING, CONSISTENT ADULT MENTOR?.

TEXOMA FGP SERVICE CATEGORIES INCLUDE:  SCHOOL READINESS/HEAD START, K - 12 SUCCESS, AND OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. TEXOMA COMMUNITY NEEDS INCLUDE UNEMPLOYMENT, POVERTY, SINGLE PARENT FAMILIES, LOW EDUCATION OF PARENTS, TRANSPORTATION ISSUES, LOW QUALITY CHILD CARE, INSUFFICIENT COGNITIVE STIMULATION AND VOCABULARY EXPOSURE, POOR SOCIAL SKILLS, POOR MOTOR FUNCTION, POOR READING FUNCTION, LOW STANDARDIZED TEST SCORES, RACIAL DIVERSITY, UNDER-FUNDED RURAL SCHOOLS AND INCARCERATED PARENT(S). FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN K - 12 SCHOOLS, HEAD START PROGRAMS AND OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITY AREAS SUCH AS DAYCARES, THERAPEUTIC, AND AFTER SCHOOL PROGRAMS.  FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE ONE ON ONE OR SMALL GROUP ATTENTION TO CHILDREN ASSIGNED TO VOLUNTEERS BY TEACHERS, DIRECTORS, SUPERVISORS, ETC. PRE-SERVICE INSTRUCTION AND MONTHLY IN-SERVICE INSTRUCTION FOR VOLUNTEERS IS PROVIDED TO HELP THEM ADDRESS THE SPECIFIC NEEDS OF ASSIGNED CHILDREN.  THE STATION TEACHERS/DIRECTORS WILL ASSESS IMPROVEMENT ACCORDING TO THE ASSIGNMENT DESIGNATIONS AND SPECIFICATIONS INITIALLY AND AT THE END OF THE SERVICE PERIOD TO ASSESS IMPACT. ANTICIPATED IMPACT ON PARTICIPATING STUDENTS IS A 75% IMPROVEMENT IN THE AREA OF SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT AND TWO-THIRDS IMPROVEMENT FOR TUTORED/MENTORED STUDENTS.

THE CHICKASAW NATION IS A FEDERALLY-RECOGNIZED TRIBE LOCATED IN SOUTH-CENTRAL OKLAHOMA. THE CHICKASAW NATION SERVES CHICKASAW CITIZENS AS WELL AS OTHER NATIVE AMERICAN TRIBES AND IS A GOOD NEIGHBOR TO THE NON-NATIVE COMMUNITY. IT IS ESTIMATED THAT 47 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE RECRUITED TO ADD TO THE EXISTING 13 VOLUNTEERS IN ORDER TO COMPLETE 60 VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PROVIDING ONE-ON-ONE ATTENTION TO CHILDREN THROUGH IMAGINARY PLAY, CHICKASAW LANGUAGE AND CULTURE DISCUSSION, LITERACY DEVELOPMENT, MATH AND SCIENCE TUTORING AND OFFERING EMOTIONAL SUPPORT AND GUIDANCE TO CHILDREN, PARENTS AND STAFF. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 30 CHILDREN WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS IN TERMS OF LITERACY SKILLS, 20 CHILDREN WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS IN TERMS OF NUMERACY (MATH) SKILLS AND 30 CHILDREN WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS IN TERMS OF SOCIAL AND/OR EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $360,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $40,000.

SANDOVAL COUNTY SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (SCSVP), LOCATED IN CENTRAL NEW MEXICO IS THE INCUMBENT PROJECT SPONSOR OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM. THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM AND RSVP PROGRAMS ARE ALSO SPONSORED BY SANDOVAL COUNTY.  SANDOVAL COUNTY IS LARGE IN SIZE WITH 3,716 SQUARE MILES OF GEOGRAPHICALLY DIVERSE GEOGRAPHY, CULTURES AND PEOPLE. THE MAJORITY OF COMMUNITIES ARE LOCATED IN RURAL AND OFTENTIMES CHALLENGING GEOGRAPHIC SETTINGS. THE SENIOR POPULATION IS A MICROCOSM OF THE LARGER DIVERSE POPULATION, WITH THE MAJORITY BEING CAUCASIAN/WHITE, FOLLOWED BY NATIVE AMERICAN AND A MUCH SMALLER AFRICAN AMERICAN RACE WITH APPROXIMATELY 35% OF CAUCASIANS SELF-REFERRING OF HISPANIC ETHNICITY.
AN ESTIMATED 10 FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE SANDOVAL COUNTY FGP PROGRAM. OF THIS NUMBER, ALL WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS DURING THE GRANT YEARS OF JULY, 2018 THROUGH JUNE, 2021. THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS' SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE:  ASSISTING IN ELEMENTARY/PRIMARY SCHOOL CLASSROOMS AS WELL AS ASSISTING IN HEAD START/PRE-SCHOOL CLASSROOMS IN THE RIO RANCHO PUBLIC SCHOOL DISTRICT, JEMEZ VALLEY, CUBA INDEPENDENT AND BERNALILLO PUBLIC SCHOOLS. WE WILL CONTINUE TO SUPPORT THE RIO RANCHO BOYS AND GIRLS CLUB AS A WORKSTATION ASSISTING WITH THEIR SUMMER TUTORING PROGRAM WHICH HELPS THE STUDENTS MAINTAIN COLLECTIVE SCHOOL KNOWLEDGE LEARNED THE PRIOR SCHOOL YEAR. IDENTIFIED INTERESTS, READING AND COMPUTER SKILLS WILL CONTINUE TO BE THE FOCUS OF THE SERVICE ACTIVITIES AT THE RR BOYS AND GIRLS CLUB. WE HAVE ALSO PARTNERED WITH THE PMS (PRESBYTERIAN MEDICAL SERVICES) HEAD START PROGRAM, THIS ORGANIZATION OFFERS EARLY CHILD HOOD EDUCATION PREPARING CHILDREN FOR SCHOOL. THEY OFFER 4 WORKSTATION SITES, 1 IN CUBA, 2 IN RIO RANCHO AND 1 IN BERNALILLO.THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES WILL BE APPROXIMATELY 6 PRE-SCHOOL CHILDREN WHO WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS IN TERMS OF SOCIAL AND/OR EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT. ADDITIONALLY, 15-18 CHILDREN IN ELEMENTARY K-12 WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT. OUTCOMES WILL BE A MEASURE OF CONDITIONS THAT CAN BE CHANGED. SO TOO THE CHILDREN WILL BENEFIT FROM THE ONE-ON-ONE ATTENTION THEY WILL RECEIVE FROM THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS, THOUGH THIS OUTCOME CANNOT BE MEASURED WITH A TOOL. THE ON-GOING AND INTENSIVE RELATIONSHIPS THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS MAINTAIN WITH THE CHILDREN IS SOMETHING THAT LASTS FOR YEARS TO COME, AS EVIDENCED BY THE GREETINGS THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS RECEIVE WHEN THEY RUN INTO THE CHILDREN YEARS LATER.
THE SANDOVAL COUNTY FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM DOES NOT RECEIVE ANY FEDERAL FUNDING. THE PROGRAM IS FUNDED THROUGH THE NEW MEXICO AGING AND LONG TERM SERVICES DEPARTMENT AND THE PROJECTED FUNDING WILL BE $48,741.00 AND IS SUPPLEMENTED BY $7,200 IN LOCAL COUNTY FUNDING.

THE FGP IN SOCORRO COUNTY IS A LONG-STANDING PROGRAM THAT FOCUSES ON PLACING VOLUNTEERS IN OUR ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS IN ORDER TO HELP STRUGGLING STUDENTS SUCCEED IN SCHOOL. IT IS OUR COMMITMENT TO ENGAGE LOCAL SENIORS AND TO ENCOURAGE THE DEVELOPMENT OF MENTORING RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN SENIORS AND OUR YOUTH.

AN ESTIMATED SEVEN FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN OUR PROGRAM, AND SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PROVIDING READING ASSISTANCE TO YOUNGSTERS ENROLLED IN THE LOCAL PUBLIC SCHOOLS. VOLUNTEERS PROVIDE EMOTIONAL SUPPORT AND A STABLE, LOVING PRESENCE FOR CHILDREN WITH LEARNING CHALLENGES; MANY OF THESE STUDENTS ARE CONSIDERED ON THE FRINGE FOR ADDICTIONS SUCH AS DRUG AND DOMESTIC ABUSE. OUR VOLUNTEERS IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE OF YOUNGSTERS AND TEENAGERS WHO REQUIRE THE LOVE, PERSONAL CARE AND ATTENTION WHICH AN ELDER CAN SO EFFECTIVELY PROVIDE.

THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS SOCORRO COUNTY. THIS IS THE FIRST YEAR OF OUR THREE-YEAR GRANT, AND THERE ARE NO FEDERAL DOLLARS SUPPLEMENTING THIS PROJECT.
