LINC ST. CHARLES COUNTY ESTABLISHED OVER 25 YEARS AGO COVERING ST. CHARLES COUNTY, MISSOURI WITH CRISIS INTERVENTION, SUPPORT SERVICES AND DIRECTION TO DISADVANTAGED CHILDREN AND FAMILIES TO CREATE A MORE FUNCTIONAL LIVING ENVIRONMENT.  LINC PROVIDES WRAP AROUND SERVICES SUCH AS EMERGENCY FOOD, HOUSING AND UTILITY ASSISTANCE, TUTORING/MENTORING, AND CHILDREN'S COUNSELING. THIS SUPPORT TAKES THE FORM OF A VARIETY OF PROGRAMS DESIGNED TO PROMOTE WHOLENESS AND WELL-BEING, HELPING PARENTS SET AND ACHIEVE GOALS THAT ARE CONDUCIVE TO PROVIDING SAFE ENVIRONMENT FOR THEIR CHILDREN.  SINCE 2010 LINC, IN CONJUNCTION WITH OTHER NON-PROFITS, AREA CHURCHES AND BUSINESSES, INSTITUTED THE SUMMER STUDENT LUNCH PROGRAM WHICH FEEDS CHILDREN WHO WOULD NORMALLY RECEIVE FREE OR REDUCED LUNCH DURING THE SCHOOL YEAR. BIKE CLUB OPERATES IN TANDEM WITH THE SUMMER LUNCH PROGRAM AND ALLOWS STUDENTS THE OPPORTUNITY TO EARN BICYCLES BY VOLUNTEERING TIME. SEEDS OF LOVE GARDEN TEACHES "COMMUNITY" BY WORKING TOGETHER.  LINC CURRENTLY HAS PROGRAMS AVAILABLE OFFERING TUTORING TO BOTH STRUGGLING SCHOOL AGED CHILDREN AND PREPARING HIGH SCHOOL DROP OUTS PREPARING FOR HISET EXAM AS WELL AS PARTNERSHIP IN PROVIDING TESTING AND COACHING FOR HIGHER EDUCATION.  LINC IF CHOSEN AS SPONSORED AGENCY WILL BE ABLE TO UTILIZE THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM AS ONE MORE WRAPAROUND SERVICE TO THE COVERED COUNTIES LINCOLN, ST. CHARLES AND WARREN. CNCS GRANT FUNDING AT $180,523.00 DOLLARS AVAILABLE TO APPLY AND HAVING AN ESTIMATED 50 TO 60 INDIVIDUAL VOLUNTEERS OF WHICH 30 WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE, EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION PROGRAMS, SCHOOL READINESS, SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT, LITERACY SKILLS, MATH SKILLS, MENTORING AND TUTORING. RT AND VOLUNTEERS THAT HAS MADE OUR JOURNEY POSSIBLE.  LINC IS HONORED TO HAVE THE WISDOM FROM THESE SENIOR ADULTS TO PROVIDE ONE-ON-ONE SERVICES TO CHILDREN WITH EXCEPTIONAL OR OTHER SPECIAL NEEDS. LINC'S MISSION AND VISION IS EXACTLY THE FIT NEEDED IN OUR OVERALL MASTER PLAN.

DOUGLASS COMMUNITY SERVICES (DCS) IS LOCATED IN NORTHEAST MISSOURI AND SERVES THE COUNTIES OF LEWIS, MACON, MARION, MONROE, PIKE, RALLS, RANDOLPH, AND SHELBY. THE TOTAL GEOGRAPHIC AREA COVERED BY DCS IS 4,520 SQUARE MILES, WITH A TOTAL POPULATION OF 122,974. THE DCS SERVICE AREA IS PRIMARILY RURAL WITH THE LARGEST CITY BEING HANNIBAL, IN MARION/RALLS COUNTY WITH A POPULATION OF 28,858. THIS GRANT WOULD INCLUDE CLARK COUNTY, MO INTO THE DCS SERVICE AREA (POPULATION: 6,860)

THE AVERAGE FAMILY INCOME LEVEL FOR THE SERVICE AREA OF THIS GRANT IS $63,212, ABOUT $17,000 LESS THAN THE STATE AVERAGE. EDUCATION, SOCIAL SERVICES, AND HEALTH CARE EMPLOY THE GREATEST PERCENTAGE OF WORKING PEOPLE WHO ARE 16 YEARS AND OLDER. THESE OCCUPATIONS ARE FOLLOWED CLOSELY BY MANUFACTURING AND RETAIL TRADE INDUSTRIES. ALTHOUGH THE AREA HAS HISTORICALLY BEEN ACCEPTED AS HAVING AN AGRICULTURAL ECONOMIC BASE, SHELBY COUNTY IS NOW THE ONLY COUNTY WITH A SIGNIFICANT PERCENTAGE OF EMPLOYMENT IN AGRICULTURE. 

DOUGLASS COMMUNITY SERVICES IS GOVERNED BY A 15-MEMBER BOARD OF DIRECTORS WITH REPRESENTATION FROM THE FINANCIAL, EDUCATION, HEALTH, AND BUSINESS SECTORS, AS WELL AS REPRESENTATIVES FROM THE FIVE MAJOR DCS PROGRAMS.  THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS MEETS REGULARLY IN HANNIBAL, MO AND REPRESENTS THE GEOGRAPHIC AREA SERVED.  DOUGLASS HAS A NEGOTIATED INDIRECT COST RATE OF 11.6%.

 A PRIVATE, NON-PROFIT, DOUGLASS COMMUNITY SERVICES HAS BEEN PROVIDING SOCIAL SERVICES SINCE 1969.  THE ORGANIZATION SPONSORS HEAD START/EARLY HEAD START, RSVP, A THRIFT STORE, A FOOD PANTRY, COURT APPOINTED SPECIAL ADVOCATES, AND TWO PRE-EMPLOYMENT PROGRAMS FOR AT-RISK TEENS.  DOUGLASS COMMUNITY SERVICES EMPLOYS APPROXIMATELY 175 PERSONS THROUGHOUT NORTHEAST MISSOURI.

AN ESTIMATED 50 VSY WILL BE COMPLETED BY DOUGLASS COMMUNITY SERVICES? FOSTER GRANDPARENTS.  OF THIS NUMBER, APPROXIMATELY 19 VYS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS WITH HEAD START CENTERS.  THEIR ACTIVITIES INCLUDE WORKING WITH LOW-INCOME CHILDREN WHO ARE BEHIND THEIR CONTEMPORARIES IN READING (LANGUAGE SKILLS) AND MATH (NUMBER RECOGNITION).  OF THE  REMAINING VSY, 10 WILL INCLUDE MENTORING IN PUBLIC SCHOOLS OR WORKING WITH THE DISABLED POPULATION. THEIR TASKS INCLUDE ASSISTING THE CLIENT IN DAILY INTERACTIONS. THE REMAINING 21 VSY WILL BE PLACED IN EARLY HEAD START CENTERS WORKING WITH INFANTS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA WILL BE EDUCATION.  THE CNCS GRANT AMOUNT OF $241,249 WITH AN ADDITION $24,125 PROVIDED BY DOUGLASS COMMUNITY SERVICES AS AN IN-KIND MATCH.

BI-COUNTY SERVICE, INC. WAS FORMED UNDER THE STATUTES OF THE STATE OF MISSOURI IN 1984 AS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION TO SPONSOR THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROJECT THAT NOW SERVES THE COUNTIES OF JOHNSON, LAFAYETTE, PETTIS, RAY AND SALINE IN WEST CENTRAL MISSOURI. BI-COUNTY SERVICE, INC.  FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROJECT RECOGNIZES THAT THE INTRINSIC BOND BETWEEN SENIOR ADULT VOLUNTEERS AND CHILDREN YIELDS IMPRESSIVE RESULTS IN VOLUNTEER STATIONS FROM PRESCHOOL TO HIGH SCHOOL, AND EVEN INTO COLLEGE THROUGH OUR PARTNERSHIP WITH MISSOURI VALLEY COLLEGE?S EARLY CHILDHOOD LAB SCHOOL, AND THE UNIVERSITY OF CENTRAL MISSOURI?S CHILD CARE CENTER. AN ESTIMATED SIXTY FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN FORTY-ONE VOLUNTEER STATIONS ACROSS THE FIVE-COUNTY SERVICE AREA. OF THAT NUMBER FIFTY-TWO FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE ASSISTING CHILDREN WITH READING PROFICIENCY, WORKING ON LITERACY AND NUMERACY SKILLS FOR HEAD START AND PRE-SCHOOL CHILDREN, HELPING CHILDREN WITH BASIC KNOWLEDGE I.E. SIMPLE SHAPES, COLORS AND SIGHT WORDS, SUPPORTING CHILDREN WITH SELF-HELP SKILLS SUCH AS PROPER TABLE ETIQUETTE, PERSONAL HYGIENE AND TOILETING, AND PERHAPS MOST IMPORTANTLY, BEING A TRUSTED AND CARING ADULT ROLE MODEL.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR THE BI-COUNTY SERVICE, INC. FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IS EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE POSITIVELY IMPACTED THE LIVES OF OVER 400 CHILDREN THROUGH THEIR SERVICE. ADDITIONALLY, THE VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE BENEFITED FROM THE ACTIVITY AND CAMARADERIE RESULTING FROM THEIR VOLUNTEER SERVICE.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $274,547.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $67,049.00 OF LOCALLY GENERATED FUNDS AND IN-KIND MATCH. THE NEED FOR MATURE, NURTURING ADULT VOLUNTEERS TO ASSIST CHILDREN IN REALIZING THEIR ACADEMIC POTENTIAL HAS NEVER BEEN GREATER. STANDARDIZED ACADEMIC TEST SCORES ACROSS THE PROJECT'S SERVICE AREA REVEAL SIGNIFICANT DEFICITS IN SOME DISTRICTS AND ARE PROBLEMATIC AT BEST IN OTHER DISTRICTS.  THE NEED IS CLEAR AND THE LARGER BODY OF DATA PROMPTS OUR PROJECT TO ADDRESS THIS UBIQUITOUS COMMUNITY NEED THROUGH A CONCENTRATION OF VOLUNTEER EFFORTS IN THE AREAS OF ELEMENTARY EDUCATION AND SCHOOL PREPAREDNESS. THE PROJECT'S RESEARCH AND CONVENTIONAL WISDOM DEMONSTRATES THAT THE CRITICAL TIME TO ADDRESS INTELLECTUAL CHALLENGES IS THE EARLY, FORMATIVE YEARS. CHILDREN PAIRED WITH A FOSTER GRANDPARENT, ALMOST WITHOUT EXCEPTION, PROMOTE TO THE NEXT GRADE LEVEL, BUILD AND SUPPORT STRONGER INTERPERSONAL RELATIONSHIPS, AND PERFORM BETTER IN THE CLASSROOM, AND IT IS CLEAR THAT IT IS THE PRESENCE OF THAT CARING ADULT VOLUNTEER THAT MAKES A DIFFERENCE.

UNIVERSITY OF LOUISIANA AT MONROE (ULM) GERONTOLOGY DEPARTMENT, UNDER THE PROGRAM DIRECTOR, MS. RITA MASSEY, WILL OVERSEE THE PLACEMENT OF 40 FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS SERVING THE PARISH OF DESOTO.  FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL TUTOR CHILDREN TO STRENGTHEN EDUCATIONAL ACADEMICS AND SOCIAL SKILLS THROUGH A NETWORK OF 7 NON-PROFIT VOLUNTEER STATIONS SUCH AS HEAD START CENTERS, PUBLIC SCHOOLS, GED CENTERS AND CENTERS FOR DEVELOPMENTAL DISABLED CLIENTS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THE PROJECT IS TO IMPROVE EDUCATIONAL OUTCOMES FOR ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED CHILDREN IN HEAD START WITH ACTIVITIES TO PREPARE THEM FOR SCHOOL READINESS AND TUTORING ELEMENTARY STUDENTS TO IMPROVE ACADEMIC SKILLS FOR EDUCATIONAL SUCCESS.  

AT THE END OF THE 12-MONTH PERFORMANCE PERIOD, ELEMENTARY STUDENTS WHO HAVE WORKED WITH FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $229,961 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $127,954 NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES WHICH INCLUDE DAILY LUNCHES FOR VOLUNTEERS, ANNUAL PHYSICAL EXAMS, CRIMINAL BACKGROUND HISTORY CHECKS AND VOLUNTEER TRAINING.
LA DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION (LDE) (LOUISIANA BELIEVES) FOR 2017 INDICATES 49.1% OF     KINDERGARTEN STUDENTS PERFORMED 49.1 % BELOW LEVEL ON THE DIBELS.  STUDENTS WHO BEGIN KINDERGARTEN UNPREPARED ARE LIKELY TO EXPERIENCE DIFFICULTY IN THEIR ACADEMIC ENDEAVORS.  LDE HAD DEVELOPED THE SCHOOL READINESS REPORT TO ENGAGE STAKEHOLDERS TO RECOGNIZE THAT CHILDREN COME TO SCHOOL WITH MANY EXPERIENCES IN MULTIPLE SETTINGS AND RESOURCES FOR SCHOOL READINESS.  SCHOOL READINESS DESCRIBES THE CAPABILITIES OF CHILDREN, THEIR FAMILIES, SCHOOL AND COMMUNITIES TO BEST PROMOTE STUDENT SUCCESS IN KINDERGARTEN AND BEYOND.  EACH COMPONENT PLAYS AN ESSENTIAL ROLE IN DEVELOPMENT OF SCHOOL READINESS.  A READY CHILD IS PREPARED SOCIALLY, PERSONALLY, PHYSICALLY, AND INTELLECTUALLY WITHIN THE COGNITIVE DOMAINS OF LITERACY, MATH, MOTOR DEVELOPMENT AND SOCIAL/EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENTS.  A STUDY PUBLISHED IN THE JOURNAL OF GERIATRICS AND GERONTOLOGICAL EDUCATION, REPORTS THAT 3-4 YEAR OLDS WHO PARTICIPATE IN A 9-MONTH INTERGENERATIONAL PROGRAM WERE MORE WILLING TO SHARE, HELP AND COOPERATE WITH AN OLDER PERSON THAN THOSE WITHOUT EXPERIENCE WITH THE ELDERLY.

CENLA AREA AGENCY ON AGING, INC. (CENLA AAA) WAS INCORPORATED IN 1992 AS A 501 (C) (3) ORGANIZATION WHOSE MISSION IS TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR SENIORS AGE 60 AND OLDER BY PROCURING AND PROVIDING SERVICES TO ALLOW THEM TO REMAIN IN THEIR COMMUNITIES FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE OLDER AMERICANS ACT OF 1965 AND THE STATE OF LOUISIANA OFFICE OF ELDERLY AFFAIRS REGULATIONS. OUR GOVERNING BODY IS A 14 MEMBER BOARD OF DIRECTORS, TWO MEMBERS FROM EACH OF THE CENTRAL LA PARISHES WE SERVE. A 14+ MEMBER ADVISORY COUNCIL ENHANCES OUR ABILITY TO SERVE THE ELDERLY BY FURTHERING OUR MISSION OF DEVELOPING AND COORDINATING COMMUNITY-BASED SYSTEMS OF ELDERLY SERVICES IN THE PARISHES WE SERVE.

OUR CURRENT PLANNING AND SERVICE AREA AS THE AGING AND DISABILITY RESOURCE CENTER COVERS 19 PARISHES IN LOUISIANA'S CENTRAL AND NORTHEAST REGIONS. IN ADDITION TO SERVING AS A RESOURCE CENTER, WE CONTRACT TITLE III SERVICES AND PROVIDE OMBUDSMAN, SENIORX, SENIOR HEALTH INSURANCE INFORMATION, EVIDENCE-BASED III-D WELLNESS WORKSHOPS, AND ADMINISTER THE CNCS FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IN AVOYELLES, CATAHOULA, CONCORDIA, GRANT, LASALLE, RAPIDES AND WINN PARISHES.

CENLA AAA HAS ADMINISTERED THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) IN THE CENTRAL LOUISIANA REGION SINCE JULY 1, 2012. WE HEREBY PROPOSE TO CONTINUE THE FGP SERVICES IN THIS AREA BY ENGAGING AN ESTIMATED 75 FGP VOLUNTEERS TO EQUAL A TOTAL OF 64 VSYS. SIXTY-FOUR (64) VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: TUTORING CHILDREN IN SCHOOLS, PROVIDING CHILDREN WITH EMOTIONAL SUPPORT IN DEVELOPING BASIC LEARNING SKILLS, ASSISTING CHILDREN IN K-12 AND HEAD START CLASSROOMS, AND MENTORING CHILDREN IN THE SPECIAL EDUCATION CENTER. THE PRIMARY CNCS FOCUS AREA OF THE GRANT IS EDUCATION, EMPHASIZING SCHOOL READINESS AND K-12 SUCCESS OBJECTIVES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT WE ANTICIPATE AT LEAST A 75-80 PERCENT SUCCESS RATE OF STUDENTS DEMONSTRATING GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS AND K-12 SUCCESS IN TERMS OF SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT, LITERACY SKILLS, AND MATH SKILLS. THE CNCS FEDERAL GRANT AMOUNT OF $288,219 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $32,026 FROM NON-FEDERAL SOURCES.

THE PAOLA ASSOCIATION FOR CHURCH ACTION, INC. (PACA) SPONSORS THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM OF MIAMI, LINN, FRANKLIN AND JOHNSON COUNTIES IN THE STATE OF KANSAS.  IT IS OUR MISSION TO PROVIDE ELIGIBLE, LOW-INCOME, OLDER AMERICANS (55 YEARS AND UP) THE OPPORTUNITY TO VOLUNTEER WITH "AT RISK" CHILDREN/YOUTH AND "SPECIAL NEEDS" CHILDREN/YOUTH.  IT IS THE TARGET OF THIS PROGRAM TO FOCUS PRIMARILY IN THE AREA OF ACADEMICS, I.E., LITERACY AND MATH, WHILE AT THE SAME TIME TAKE THE OPPORTUNITY TO BUILD A MEANINGFUL RELATIONSHIP WITH THOSE WITH WHOM THEY VOLUNTEER.  THE TOOLS THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS USE ARE PRAISE, MOTIVATION AND ENCOURAGEMENT.  THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS USE THIS TO ASSIST CHILDREN AND YOUTH TO STRIVE AND ACHIEVE THE GOALS THEY HAVE AND TO REACH THEIR FULL POTENTIAL AT AN AGE APPROPRIATE LEVEL.
PACA IS REQUESTING $270,645 TO SUPPORT 48 VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS.  WITH THE 48 VSY THE SERVICE CATEGORIES OF INTELLECTUAL DISABILITY (FORMERLY MENTAL RETARDATION), ELEMENTARY EDUCATION, HEAD START SCHOOL PREPAREDNESS, HEALTHY LIFESTYLES AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES WILL BE ADDRESSED.  THE NEED IS GREAT FOR THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS TO WORK WITH THE MENTALLY CHALLENGED TO KEEP THEM FOCUSED ALONG WITH HELPING THEM MAKE STRIDES IN THEIR EVERYDAY LIVES.  THE NEED IS ALSO GREAT FOR THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS TO PREPARE THE CHILDREN BEFORE BEGINNING KINDERGARTEN, CONTINUE WITH THEM THROUGH THEIR ELEMENTARY EDUCATION TO MAKE SURE THEY RECEIVE A HIGH SCHOOL DIPLOMA AND/OR GED.  A NEWLY DEVELOPED CHILD TREATMENT PLAN WILL HELP US IDENTIFY THOSE THAT ARE BEING SERVED AND THE PROGRESS THEY HAVE MADE BY HAVING A FOSTER GRANDPARENT ASSIST WITH THEIR NEEDS.  PROGRAM EVALUATIONS DONE BY SITE STAFF, ADVISORY COUNCIL MEMBERS AND MEMBERS OF PACA ALONG WITH CONTINUED EDUCATION AND RESEARCH WILL HELP US DETERMINE THE CONTINUED NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY AND ANY AREAS THAT WE NEED TO IMPROVE OR CHANGE SO THAT WE CAN CONTINUE TO REACH THE OUTCOMES THAT WE HAVE SET WORTH IN OUR WORK PLANS.  AT THE SAME TIME, ALL OF THE COMMUNITY IS INCLUDED IN THE OUTCOMES OF THE PROGRAM IN THE SUCCESS OF THE CHILDREN AND THE USE OF THE MOST PROLIFIC EXPERIENCE IN OLDER PEOPLE.

FORT HAYS STATE UNIVERSITY (FHSU), ESTABLISHED IN 1902, IS A LIBERAL ARTS UNIVERSITY IN THE KANSAS REGENTS SYSTEM.  AMONG THE UNIVERSITY'S ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS IS PUBLIC SERVICE.  IN 1974, FHSU WAS THE FIRST INSTITUTION OF HIGHER EDUCATION TO BE AWARDED A SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP), CURRENTLY ADMINISTERED BY THE COLLEGE OF HEALTH & BEHAVIORAL SCIENCES.  IN 1997 THE UNIVERSITY WAS AWARDED THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) TO ENGAGE SENIORS IN SERVICE TO CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL NEEDS IN WESTERN KANSAS.  FGP'S SERVICE AREA ENCOMPASSES NINE COUNTIES OF THE SCP SERVICE AREA IN THIS REGION.  

FHSU REQUESTS $179,473 IN FEDERAL RESOURCES MATCHED WITH NON-FEDERAL AND IN-KIND RESOURCES TO SUPPORT 33 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS. GRANDPARENTS WILL ADDRESS THE CNCS FOCUS AREA:   EDUCATION - OBJECTIVE: SCHOOL READINESS, ED21 - ASSISTING IN CLASSROOM - HEAD START & ASSISTING IN CLASSROOM: & ED23 - HAVING PLANNED OUTCOMES OF CHILDREN DEMONSTRATING GAINS IN SOCIAL AND/OR EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT TO ASSURE SUCCESS IN SCHOOL.

CHILDREN FROM ECONOMIC AND SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED FAMILIES WILL BE MATCHED WITH FOSTER GRANDPARENTS TO PROMOTE GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS BY PROVIDING CONSISTENT, POSITIVE SUPPORT TO IMPROVE SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT AND BEHAVIORS, AND LITERACY SKILLS. THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL ASSIST CHILDREN IN HEAD START SETTINGS, PRE-SCHOOL AND PRIMARY GRADES IN SCHOOL READINESS AND SOCIAL AND/OR EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT BY DEVELOPING SUPPORTIVE RELATIONSHIPS TO FOSTER SIGNIFICANT LEARNING EXPERIENCES DURING THE CHILD'S MOST FORMATIVE YEARS.  THEY WILL PROVIDE ONE-ON-ONE CONTACT AND SUPPORT, ENCOURAGE AND ENGAGE IN CONVERSATION, READ TO CHILDREN AND ROLE-MODEL APPROPRIATE SOCIAL BEHAVIORS.  

SEMI-ANNUAL TEACHER SURVEYS WILL BE CONDUCTED TO DEMONSTRATE THE IMPACT OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT/CHILD RELATIONSHIP ON THE SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL GROWTH OF THE CHILD SERVED.   THE CHILDREN WILL EXHIBIT GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS BY DEMONSTRATING IMPROVEMENT IN SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT AND BEHAVIORS AND IN LITERACY.

BUTLER COUNTY DEPARTMENT ON AGING (BCDOA) IS A COUNTY GOVERNMENT DEPARTMENT CHARGED WITH SERVING SENIOR CITIZENS AGE 60+.  ITS MISSION IS TO LINK OLDER ADULTS WITH THE SERVICES THEY NEED TO ENSURE A CONTINUUM OF CARE.  STUDIES HAVE SHOWN THAT WHEN SENIORS VOLUNTEER IT IMPROVES THEIR HEALTH.  THE DEPT. ON AGING (DOA) SPONSORS THE BUTLER COUNTY RSVP AND FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROJECTS AS ANOTHER EXTENSION OF SERVING SENIORS BY PROVIDING THE OPPORTUNITY FOR THEM TO VOLUNTEER.  FURTHER, THE VOLUNTEERS SERVE IN THE COMMUNITY PROVIDING YET ANOTHER LINK BETWEEN THE DEPARTMENT ON AGING AND BUTLER COUNTY.

STUDIES SHOW THAT CHILDREN BETWEEN THE AGES OF THREE AND FIVE WHO EXHIBIT DEVELOPMENTAL DELAYS OR SPECIAL NEEDS ARE LESS LIKELY TO BE READY TO ENTER KINDERGARTEN. KANSAS NEUROLOGICAL INSTITUTE (KNI), SPONSOR OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM OF NORTHEAST KANSAS, IS A STATE-SUPPORTED RESIDENTIAL AND RESOURCE CENTER SERVING PERSONS WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES. KNI OPERATES ON A PERSON-CENTERED PHILOSOPHY. THE MISSION IS TO SUPPORT EACH PERSON TO HAVE A MEANINGFUL LIFE. 

KNI IS REQUESTING $397,195 TO SUPPORT 67 VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS, AND THIS INVESTMENT IS TO BE SUPPLEMENTED BY AT LEAST $87,680 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

IN THE TWELVE-COUNTY SERVICE AREA, THE NATIONAL PERFORMANCE MEASURES OF SCHOOL READINESS (ED21) WILL BE ADDRESSED AT HEAD STARTS AND PRESCHOOLS.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD, 90% OF STUDENTS SERVED BY FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL MEET THE OUTCOME OF ED23, HAVING INCREASED THEIR SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT TO MOVE ON TO THE NEXT LEVEL--FOR EXAMPLE, FOR FIVE-YEAR-OLDS, THAT WOULD BE TO ENTER KINDERGARTEN. FOR THOSE IN ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS, THE K-12 SUCCESS OUTPUT OF ED4A WILL DEMONSTRATE THAT 70% OF THE NUMBER OF STUDENTS SERVED BY FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL HAVE AN OUTCOME (ED27) THAT WILL SHOW IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT AS REPORTED ON THE PRE AND POST "TIME ON TASK INVENTORY" TESTS.

A WAIVER WAS GRANTED TO ALLOW FOSTER GRANDPARENTS TO CONTINUE TO SERVE PERSONS WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES WHO LIVE AT KNI AND HAVE HAD THE BENEFIT OF FOSTER GRANDPARENT RELATIONSHIPS FOR 51 YEARS.  PROGRAM OUTCOMES INCLUDE PERSONS WHO LIVE AT KNI AND HAVE A FOSTER GRANDPARENT RELATIONSHIP AND REPORT A BETTER QUALITY OF LIFE.  FOR 2017 A NEW INCLUSION PERFORMANCE MEASURE ALLOWS FOR REPORTING HOURS IN E-GRANTS

AN ESTIMATED 106 CATHOLIC CHARITIES, INC. FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE TUTORING AND MENTORING IN SCHOOLS, IN PRESCHOOLS AND IN SHELTERS FOR HOMELESS CHILDREN AND FAMILIES FOR THIS GRANT PERIOD. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 570 CHILDREN PER YEAR WILL IMPROVE THEIR ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE OR READINESS FOR SCHOOL SUCCESS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $492,899 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $82,600 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES FROM CATHOLIC CHARITIES, INC.

CATHOLIC CHARITIES OF NORTHEAST KANSAS (CCNEK), SPONSOR OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM OF WYANDOTTE COUNTY/KCK (FGP), IS A HUMAN SERVICE NON-PROFIT PROVIDING A WIDE RANGE OF PROGRAMS AND SERVICES TO THE 21 COUNTIES OF NORTHEAST KANSAS.  CCNEK'S VISION IS "OUR NEIGHBORS WHO ARE CHALLENGED BY POVERTY OF MIND, BODY AND SPIRIT, FIND THE OPEN DOOR OF CATHOLIC CHARITIES AND ARE MET WITH HELP, HOSPITALITY AND HOPE" AND THE ORGANIZATIONAL MISSION IS "AS A FAITH-BASED ORGANIZATION, WE ARE INSPIRED BY GOD'S LOVE AND COMPASSION TO PROVIDE UNCONDITIONAL LOVE AND NECESSARY HELP TO PEOPLE OF ALL FAITHS BY STABILIZING AND STRENGTHENING INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES IN NEED ACROSS THE 21 COUNTIES OF NORTHEAST KANSAS."   FGP IS INSTRUMENTAL IN THIS VISION AND MISSION BY  PROVIDING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AND CASE MANAGEMENT TO THE ELDERLY MEMBERS OF THE COMMUNITY AND BY ENGAGING THEM IN THE COMMUNITY WHERE THEY CAN BE A VITAL MENTOR TO THOSE MOST IN NEED.

CCNEK ON BEHALF OF THE FGP RESPECTFULLY REQUESTS $405,740 TO SUPPORT 89 VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS (VSY). THE VSY WILL PROVIDE CLASSROOM SUPPORT AND VOLUNTEER HOURS TO ASSIST WITH ADDRESSING SCHOOL PREPAREDNESS FOR HEAD START, PRE-ELEMENTARY DAYCARE AND SPECIAL EDUCATION PROGRAMS. 

FGP WILL UTILIZE THE VOLUNTEER ASSIGNMENT PLAN REPORTING TOOL.  THE TOOL ALLOWS THE PROGRAM TO COLLECT DATA NEEDED FOR BIANNUAL REPORTING.  THE VAP REPORT FORM IS SENT AT THE BEGINNING OF THE SCHOOL YEAR TO HELP TEACHERS MAP OUT A PLAN WITH THEIR FOSTER GRANDPARENT FOR THE SCHOOL YEAR/SEMESTERS.  THE VAP ALLOWS THE TEACHER TO IDENTIFY STUDENTS THE FGP WILL BE WORKING WITH DURING THE YEAR AND THE GOALS TO BE ACCOMPLISHED.  THE TEACHER WILL USE THE VAP TO IDENTIFY FOCUS AREAS THAT THE STUDENTS MAY NEED IMPROVEMENT IN, SUCH AS: VOCABULARY, READING, ABILITY TO RETELL A STORY, ETC.  THE FORMS ARE SENT BACK TO THE TEACHERS AT THE END OF THE SEMESTER TO SEE IF THE STUDENTS MET THE GOAL.    

IN 2018, THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM OF WYANDOTTE COUNTY ANTICIPATES BEING ABLE TO DIRECTLY SERVE 500 CHILDREN, 250 WILL BE STUDENTS IN GRADES K-12 AND 250 CHILDREN IN EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION PROGRAMS, FROM BIRTH TO 18 YEARS OF AGE AT 38 STATIONS AND WILL BE SPECIFICALLY ADDRESS IN A ONE-ON-ONE CAPACITY THE ISSUES OF COGNITIVE LANGUAGE SKILLS, REMEDIAL READING PROFICIENCY, SOCIAL SKILLS, SELF-HELP AND FINE/GROSS MOTOR SKILLS ON A DAILY BASIS WITHIN THEIR ASSIGNED CLASSROOM.  THE COMPLETED VAP'S WILL DEMONSTRATE THAT AT LEAST 70% OF THE IDENTIFIED STUDENTS WILL SHOW IMPROVEMENT IN THREE OF THE PRIORITY AREAS BY THE END OF THE SCHOOL YEAR.  FGP VOLUNTEERS ARE PROVIDED MONTHLY IN-SERVICE TRAININGS FOCUSED ON CHILD OUTCOMES AND SERVICE STRATEGIES.

VOLUNTEERS OF AMERICA (VOA) IS A NATIONAL, NONPROFIT, FAITH-BASED ORGANIZATION DEDICATED TO SERVING THE BASIC NEEDS OF THE MOST VULNERABLE INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES IN THE COMMUNITY. VOA COLORADO BRANCH HAS SPONSORED THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM FOR 44 YEARS. THE VOA DENVER AREA FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) SERVES SEVEN FRONT RANGE COUNTIES IN COLORADO. AN ESTIMATED 90 DENVER AREA FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 81 FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS (FGVS) WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. ALL VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF EDUCATION. THEIR NATIONAL PERFORMANCE MEASURES FOCUS AREA OBJECTIVES WILL INCLUDE SCHOOL READINESS, K-12 SUCCESS, AND OTHER EDUCATION. IN THE SCHOOL READINESS AREA SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL BE DETERMINED BY EACH CHILD'S TEACHER, SUCH AS GAMES, MUSIC AND VARIOUS SOCIAL SKILLS, AND K-12 SUCCESS SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE LISTENING TO CHILDREN READ, HELPING WITH PRONUNCIATION AND PHONEMIC AWARENESS. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT OUR ANTICIPATED OUTCOME FOR SCHOOL READINESS OF THE 124 CHILDREN SERVED ONE-ON-ON BY 31 VOLUNTEERS, 60% OR 74 OF CHILDREN 3-4 YEARS OLD WILL DEMONSTRATE AGE APPROPRIATE SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL SKILLS TO BE READY AND PREPARED TO ENTER THE NEXT LEVEL OF  PRESCHOOL OR KINDERGARTEN. FIFTY FGVS SERVING IN THE K-12 SUCCESS OBJECTIVE WILL PROVIDE 200 STUDENTS ONE-ON-ONE TUTORING TO PROMOTE STUDENTS' IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY BY 80%, OR 160, OF THE STUDENTS TUTORED. VOA COLORADO BRANCH RESPECTFULLY REQUESTS THE CNCS INVESTMENT OF $488,111.00 TO FUND 92 VSYS, FOR THE GRANT CYCLE BEGINNING 
JULY 1, 2018. THIS FEDERAL INVESTMENT WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $145,728.00 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

AN ESTIMATED 80 FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  OF THIS NUMBER 67 VSY FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: 1) ASSISTING IN CLASSROOM, 2) ASSISTING IN CLASSROOM-HEAD START, 3) SCHOOL-BASED MENTORING, 4) COMFORTING CHILDREN, 5) TUTORING-OTHER AND 6) OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 80% OF THE CHILDREN SERVED BY THE FGPY IN DAY CARE, HEAD START AND PRE-K PROGRAMS WILL BE SCHOOL READY.  IT IS FURTHER ANTICIPATED THAT 80% OF THE CHILDREN WHO RECEIVED TUTORING SERVICES WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT.  IN ADDITION, 80% OF YOUTH MENTORED BY A FGPV SHALL SHOW IMPROVEMENT IN AT LEAST ONE SUBJECT AREA AND ATTITUDE IN SCHOOL ATTENDANCE. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $402,380 WILL FUND 67 FGP VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS (VSY?S) AND WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $44,709 OTHER NONFEDERAL FUNDS.

ACTIVITIES THEY WILL PARTICIPATE IN WILL BE BASED ON STUDENT NEEDS AS DETERMINED BY COMMUNITY NEEDS IDENTIFIED AND CHILD'S NEED AS DETERMINED BY THE FGP CARE PLAN ASSESSMENT TOOL. AT THE END OF THE 3 YEAR GRANT, IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT 80% OF CHILDREN SERVED WILL BE ON APPROPRIATE GRADE LEVEL AND/OR DEVELOPMENTALLY ON TARGET FOR THEIR CHRONOLOGICAL AGE.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $427,440.00(2018-19) WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $131,248.00 OF NONFEDERAL RESOURCES TO MEET THESE OBJECTIVES.

WESTERN ARKANSAS FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IS SPONSORED BY DEQUEEN-MENA EDUCATIONAL COOPERATIVE AND IN PARTNERSHIP WITH GUY FENTER EDUCATIONAL COOPERATIVE.  DEQUEEN-MENA EDUCATIONAL COOPERATIVE PROVIDES SERVICES TO TWELVE SCHOOL DISTRICTS IN FIVE COUNTIES AND GUY FENTER EDUCATIONAL COOPERATIVE PROVIDES SERVICES TO TWENTY-TWO SCHOOL DISTRICTS IN SIX COUNTIES.  WESTERN ARKANSAS FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM PLACES MEN AND WOMEN, 55 YEARS AND OLDER, IN SCHOOLS, HEAD STARTS, DEVELOPMENTAL FACILITIES, AND PRE-SCHOOLS IN THESE ELEVEN COUNTIES IN WESTERN ARKANSAS. THESE MEN AND WOMEN WORK 15 TO 35 HOURS PER WEEK, TUTORING AND MENTORING CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL NEEDS.

THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IN EASTERN ARKANSAS IS A LONG STANDING TRADITION ROOTED IN STRENGTHENING OUR COMMUNITIES AND FOSTERING CIVIC ENGAGEMENT THROUGH A COMMITMENT TO COMMUNITY SERVICE.  ITS MISSION IS TWO FOLD:  FIRST, TO PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR OLDER PERSONS TO SERVE SCHOOLS AND HEAD START PROGRAMS IN THEIR LOCAL COMMUNITIES WHILE ADDRESSING CRITICAL NEEDS IN THE AREAS OF EDUCATION, MENTORING AND HEALTH. SECONDLY, THE PROGRAM AIMS TO PROVIDE ONE-ON-ONE ASSISTANCE TO SPECIAL AND EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS CHILDREN HELPING THEM TO IMPROVE IN THEIR SPECIFIC NEEDED AREAS OF DEVELOPMENT. WITH THIS NEW GRANT CYCLE, THE PROGRAM HOPES TO CENTRALIZE THIS DYNAMIC COMMITMENT IN A WAY THAT WILL HAVE AN EVEN GREATER IMPACT ON THE COMMUNITIES WHERE WE LIVE, WORK AND PLAY.  THE SPONSORING ORGANIZATION, EAST ARKANSAS AREA AGENCY ON AGING (EAAAA) IS IN FULL COMMITMENT TO IMPROVING ITS FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM FOR MAXIMUM IMPACT ON ITS COMMUNITY.  THE AGENCY WAS FOUNDED IN 1978 WITH A MISSION TO PROVIDE LEADERSHIP RELATIVE TO AGING ISSUES ON BEHALF OF OLDER PERSONS IN EAST ARKANSAS, AND TO CARRY OUT A WIDE RANGE OF FUNCTIONS IN PLANNING, COORDINATION, AND SERVICE DELIVERY SUCH THAT OLDER PERSONS ARE ASSISTED IN LEADING INDEPENDENT, MEANINGFUL AND DIGNIFIED LIVES IN THEIR OWN HOMES AND COMMUNITIES AS LONG AS POSSIBLE.  THE EAAAA IS A PRIVATE, NON-PROFIT CORPORATION.  AS SUCH, IT IS GOVERNED BY A 13-MEMBER BOARD OF DIRECTORS, IN CONJUNCTION WITH AN ADVISORY COUNCIL.  THE ADVISORY COUNCIL IS MADE UP OF A MAJORITY OF ELDERLY EAST ARKANSANS. 
THE EAAAA'S FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM STAFF IS CONSCIOUS OF THE ADAPTATIONS THAT COULD BE MADE TO OUR PROGRAM TO STRENGTHEN ITS COMMUNITY OWNERSHIP AND PARTICIPATION.  VALUABLE RELATIONSHIPS WITH APPROPRIATE STAKEHOLDERS HAVE BEGUN TO PROSPER IN RECENT MONTHS UNDER NEW LEADERSHIP AND A SUCCESSFUL FUTURE FOR THE PROGRAM IS ON THE HORIZON.  THE EAAAA FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IS ONE OF SEVEN PROGRAMS IN THE STATE OF ARKANSAS.  OUR FORTY ONE VOLUNTEERS HOLD VALUED POSITIONS IN COLLABORATION WITH TWELVE COMMUNITY PARTNERS WHO OPERATE AND OVERSEE VOLUNTEER WORK AT NINETEEN VOLUNTEER STATIONS.
OUR PROGRAM CURRENTLY HAS 30 ACTIVE VOLUNTEERS, WITH OUR FSY QUOTA OF THIRTY-FOUR.  THESE VOLUNTEERS SERVE AT NINETEEN VOLUNTEER STATIONS IN EIGHT ARKANSAS COUNTIES.  ONE HUNDRED AND SIXTY ONE STUDENTS BENEFIT DIRECTLY EACH ACADEMIC YEAR FROM ONE-ON-ONE INDIVIDUALIZED ATTENTION FROM A FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEER.  FURTHERMORE, COUNTLESS OTHERS BENEFIT FROM A SMILE OR AN ENCOURAGING WORD SPOKEN FROM A GRANDPARENT IN THEIR SCHOOL.  THESE VALUED VOLUNTEERS COMPLETED 34,882 SERVICE HOURS IN 2012 MEETING THE CRITICAL NEEDS OF THE ORGANIZATIONS THEY SERVE, SAVING NON-PROFITS UPWARDS OF $1 MILLION DOLLARS IN RESOURCES.  UNDER CURRENT LEADERSHIP, THE PROGRAM IS NOW FULLY STAFFED, WITH A WAITING LIST FOR SENIORS TO BECOME PART OF THE PROGRAM IN CERTAIN REGIONS OF OUR SERVICE AREA.  THE PROGRAM NOW HAS THE PRIVILEGE OF SELECTING THE BEST CANDIDATES FOR THE VOLUNTEER STATIONS AND THE FLEXIBILITY TO FIND THE BEST POSSIBLE NICHE FOR OUR VOLUNTEERS.  THROUGH THE RECENTLY ADMINISTERED NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF FOSTER GRANDPARENT DIRECTOR'S SURVEY, IT WAS DETERMINED THAT 75% OF OUR VOLUNTEERS FEEL THAT THEIR PARTICIPATION IN THE PROGRAM PREVENTS ISOLATION WHILE 100% REPORTED INCREASED SELF-ESTEEM AND IMPROVED SENSE OF WELL-BEING AS WELL AS THE BENEFITS OF INCREASED HEALTH, SOCIALIZATION, PURPOSE AND FULFILLMENT.

THE STATE OF WEST VIRGINIA CREATED THE REGION 8 PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT COUNCIL IN 1972 UNDER THE REGIONAL PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT ACT TO SERVE GRANT, HAMPSHIRE, HARDY, MINERAL, AND PENDLETON COUNTIES.  LATER, THE COUNTIES OF BERKELEY, JEFFERSON AND MORGAN WERE ADDED TO THE REGIONAL COUNCIL.  THE REGIONAL COUNCIL IS RESPONSIBLE FOR PLANNING AND FOSTERING COMMUNITY AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT THROUGHOUT THE DISTRICT.  THE REGIONAL PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT ACT EMPOWERS THE COUNCIL TO RECEIVE AND EXPEND FUNDS; ENGAGE IN COMPREHENSIVE DEVELOPMENT PLANNING; PUBLISH SPECIALIZED STUDIES; PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO LOCAL GOVERNMENTS; PERFORM REGIONAL DEVELOPMENT; AND EXERCISE POWERS JOINTLY OR IN COOPERATION WITH AGENCIES AND POLITICAL SUBDIVISIONS OF THE STATE.  THE REGIONAL COUNCIL RECEIVES FUNDS FROM FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTAL ORGANIZATIONS TO PROVIDE THESE SERVICES.  THE REGION 8 PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT COUNCIL HAS ALSO RECEIVED STATE AND FEDERAL FUNDS TO CREATE LOAN POOLS THAT ASSIST NEW AND EXPANDING BUSINESSES.  THE REGIONAL COUNCIL POSSESSES A TRAINED AND EXPERIENCED STAFF AND HAS COMMITTED LOCAL ELECTED OFFICIALS AND COMMUNITY LEADERS.  IN ADDITION TO ITS PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT SERVICES, THE COUNCIL ALSO PROVIDES A VARIETY OF COMMUNITY SERVICE PROGRAMS. 

IT IS THE MISSION OF THE REGION 8 PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT COUNCIL TO OBTAIN THE MAXIMUM LEVEL OF ECONOMIC AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT IN THE POTOMAC HIGHLANDS OF WEST VIRGINIA THROUGH DEVELOPMENT, PLANNING AND BY ASSISTING LOCAL GOVERNMENTS AND BUSINESSES IMPLEMENT PROJECTS AND PROGRAMS.

OUR MISSION STATEMENT AT AIKEN BARNWELL COUNTIES COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY, INC., IS "TO MOBILIZE RESOURCES AND TO PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES, SERVICES, AND ADVOCACY THAT WILL EMPOWER PEOPLE TO REALIZE AND SUSTAIN SELF-SUFFICIENCY AND SELF-DIGNITY".  EACH DAY WE CONTINUE TO OFFER THE BEST SERVICE AND PROGRAMMATIC ACTIVITIES TO THE LOW-INCOME AND OLDER POPULATIONS IN OUR COMMUNITY.   WE STRIVE TO PROVIDE QUALITY SERVICES TO PEOPLE WITH SPECIAL NEEDS BY PRODUCING THE ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL SUPPORT THAT SO MANY ARE MISSING.
     THE MISSION OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) IS TO DEVELOP AND BUILD BRIDGES BETWEEN TWO GENERATIONS WITH THE PURPOSE OF PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES FOR CHILDREN AND SENIORS TO INTERACT AND LEARN FROM EACH OTHER, AS WELL AS TO ENJOY MEANINGFUL EXPERIENCES AND RELATIONSHIPS.  EDUCATION, FRIENDSHIPS, AND CARING ARE MAIN COMPONENTS OF OUR PROGRAM.  FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL SERVE AS MENTORS, TUTORS, AND CAREGIVERS FOR AT-RISK CHILDREN AND YOUTH WITH SPECIAL NEEDS THROUGH A VARIETY OF COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS INCLUDING PUBLIC SCHOOLS, HEAD START CENTERS, AFTER-SCHOOL PROGRAMS, NON-PROFIT DAY-CARE CENTERS, AND FAITH-BASED STATIONS. THE PROGRAM ALLOWS CHILDREN WITH EXCEPTIONAL OR SPECIAL NEEDS OR CHILDREN WHO SEEM TO BE FALLING BEHIND TO ACHIEVE IMPROVED ACADEMIC, PHYSICAL, MENTAL, EMOTIONAL, AND SOCIAL DEVELOPMENT WHILE ASSISTING THEM TO LEARN AND GROW WITH A POSITIVE SELF-IMAGE.  PUT SIMPLY, THE ONE-ON-ONE ATTENTION IS IMPORTANT IN HELPING SET A CHILD ON THE PATH TOWARDS A SUCCESSFUL FUTURE.  IN RETURN, FOSTER GRANDPARENTS RECEIVE THE JOY OF BEING NEEDED WITHIN THEIR COMMUNITIES.
     THE FGP OF AIKEN, ALLENDALE, BARNWELL, AND EDGEFIELD COUNTIES WILL CAREFULLY AND STRATEGICALLY PLACE AN ESTIMATED 107 VOLUNTEERS, SERVING BETWEEN 15 AND 40 HOURS A WEEK AT THEIR ASSIGNED STATIONS.  OF THIS NUMBER, AT LEAST 90 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. THEY WILL PROVIDE INDIVIDUALIZED ATTENTION, UNHURRIED HELP, CONSISTENT SUPPORT AND THE OPPORTUNITY FOR INTER-GENERATIONAL CONNECTION. SOME OF THEIR SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TUTORING AND/OR MENTORING WHILE ASSISTING IN CLASSROOM WITH ACADEMICS, SUCH AS, (READING, WRITING AND MATH), SOCIAL SKILLS, LIBRARY SERVICES, PRE-ELEMENTARY DAY CARE, AND AFTER-SCHOOL PROGRAMS WITH HOMEWORK AND RETENTION ACTIVITIES.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THIS THREE YEAR GRANT, ONE OF OUR GOALS IS THE CHILDREN THAT RECEIVED SUPPORT FROM A FOSTER GRANDPARENT IN PRE-ELEMENTARY OR EARLY CHILDHOOD PROGRAMS WILL SHOW A POSITIVE IMPACT IN SCHOOL READINESS, WHICH IS DETERMINED BY THE SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE CHILDREN SHOULD HAVE WHEN THEY ENTER KINDERGARTEN.  ANOTHER IMPORTANT GOAL IS THAT A POSITIVE NUMBER OF STUDENTS IN KINDERGARTEN THROUGH 12TH GRADE, THAT RECEIVED ASSISTANCE FROM A FOSTER GRANDPARENT, WILL SHOW IMPROVEMENT AND SUCCEED IN ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE. TO ENSURE THAT THE CHILDREN AND SENIORS WHO PARTICIPATE WILL HAVE THE SUPPORT THEY NEED THROUGH QUALITY PROGRAMMING AND PARTNERSHIPS TO SUCCEED. THESE RESOURCES WILL HELP ENHANCE AND STRENGTHEN THE PROGRAM WHILE ALLOWING US TO ACHIEVE OUR SET GOALS.

THE PARTNERSHIPS WE HAVE FORMED CREATE A FIRM FOUNDATION FOR OUR FOCUS AREA OF EDUCATION AND ALL ASPECTS ASSOCIATED WITH IT. OF THE CHILDREN FROM BIRTH TO FIVE YEARS OLD THAT ESNG SERVES, 98% LIVE AT OR BELOW THE POVERTY LINE, 41% HAVE A DIAGNOSED DISABILITY AND 37% ARE ENGLISH LANGUAGE LEARNERS. THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) OF DUVAL COUNTY IN JACKSONVILLE, FLORIDA IS AN ORGANIZATION WHICH OFFERS AN OPPORTUNITY FOR SENIORS 55 AND OVER TO GIVE OF THEIR TIME AND TALENTS IN TUTORING, MENTORING, AND NURTURING SPECIAL AND EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS AND AT-RISK CHILDREN. THE SPONSOR FOR THE FGP OF DUVAL COUNTY IS THE CITY OF JACKSONVILLE, A GOVERNMENT AGENCY. THIS PROGRAM IS WITHIN THE SENIOR SERVICES DIVISION OF THE PARKS, RECREATION AND COMMUNITY SERVICES DEPARTMENT WITH THE CITY OF JACKSONVILLE'S GOVERNMENT. AN ESTIMATED 78 FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES FOR VOLUNTARY PRE-KINDERGARTEN (VPK) CHILDREN (AGES 3 - 4), AND PRE-KINDERGARTEN (PK) CHILDREN (AGES 4 - 5) WILL INCLUDE: 1) ASSIST WITH SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL BEHAVIORAL CONCEPTS, AND 2) COMFORT AND COMMUNICATE (VOCABULARY AND SPEECH). ADDITIONAL ACTIVITIES FOR KINDERGARTEN THRU 12 GRADE STUDENTS (AGES 5 -- 21) WILL INCLUDE: 3) ASSIST WITH EARLY WRITING AND PRINT CONCEPTS; 4) ASSIST WITH READING CONCEPTS; 5) ASSIST WITH MATH CONCEPTS; AND 6) MODEL PROPER SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL BEHAVIORAL CONCEPTS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS "EDUCATION," AND "HEALTHY FUTURES." BY THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, OUR FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE ASSISTED VPK AND PK AGED CHILDREN EXPERIENCING EARLY CHILDHOOD SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL BEHAVIORAL PROBLEMS; AND WOULD HAVE ASSISTED FAILING STUDENTS IN GRADES K THRU 12 WITH FAVORABLE OUTCOMES AND IMPACT. OUTCOMES THAT ENABLED THE VPK AND PK AGED CHILDREN TO IMPROVE IN THEIR EARLY CHILDHOOD DEVELOPMENT OF SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL BEHAVIORS; AND THE K THRU 12 GRADE STUDENTS TO ADVANCE TO THE NEXT LEVEL, BASED UPON THE IMPROVEMENT IN READING AND READING READINESS (INCLUDING PHONICS AND COMPREHENSION), MATH AND MATH READINESS, AND LIFE MANAGEMENT SKILLS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $372,856.00 TO FUND THE FGP OF DUVAL COUNTY AT 78 VSYS WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $124,286.00 PROVIDED BY THE CITY OF JACKSONVILLE.

     ARI IS A NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION INCORPORATED IN 1991 AND GRANTED FEDERAL 501(C)(3) TAX EXEMPT STATUS IN 1995, WITH THE OVERARCHING MISSION TO ERADICATE AND PREVENT CHILD SEXUAL ABUSE.  IN CARRYING OUT THIS MISSION, THE ORGANIZATION SPONSORS AND CONDUCTS PROGRAMS TO HELP ACHIEVE OVERALL HEALTH, SAFETY AND SECURITY IN FAMILIES AND COMMUNITIES THROUGH VARIOUS COOPERATIVE AND COLLABORATIVE EFFORTS THAT ARE ACTION ORIENTED, COMMUNITY BASED AND DRIVEN BY INDIVIDUALS WHOSE EXPERTISE IS PRIMARILY INFORMED BY PERSONAL EXPERIENCE WITH THE PROBLEMS BEING ADDRESSED, BACKED BY AN UNDERSTANDING OF THE SOCIAL CONTEXT IN WHICH THAT EXPERIENCE WAS CREATED.
     ARI ORIGINATED AS THE INTERNATIONAL NGO "LOOKING UP," WHICH WAS BASED IN MAINE FROM 1983 -- 1991, PROVIDING EDUCATION AND INDIVIDUAL VICTIM AND SURVIVOR SERVICES TO OVER 10,000 INDIVIDUALS AND SERVICE PROVIDING ORGANIZATIONS A YEAR THROUGHOUT THE UNITED STATES, CANADA AND IN NINE ADDITIONAL COUNTRIES.  ARI EVOLVED FROM THAT WORK, DEVELOPING A BROADER VISION THAT INCLUDES SOCIAL CHANGE EFFORTS ADDRESSING THE PROBLEM OF CHILD SEXUAL ABUSE AND OTHER FORMS OF SEXUAL VIOLENCE THROUGH A LONG TERM, MULTI-FACETED DEDICATION TO COMMUNITY STRENGTHENING FOR SECURITY, HEALTH, SAFETY AND PREVENTION OF VIOLENCE IN DIVERSE COMMUNITY SETTINGS.

AMONG 300 STUDENTS WHO ARE ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED, ENGLISH LANGUAGE LEARNERS, OR HAVE SPECIAL OR EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS, WE WILL ACHIEVE THE FOLLOWING OUTCOMES: 90% WILL IMPROVE ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT (N=270); AND 85% (N=255) WILL IMPROVE ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN READING AND/OR MATH AS REPORTED BY STATION SUPERVISORS.
EIGHT (8) FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL SERVE IN EARLY CHILDHOOD STATIONS REACHING 63 CHILDREN  AND REALIZING OUTCOMES OF INCREASED SCHOOL READINESS WITH AT LEAST 95% (N=60) SHOWING GAINS IN SOCIAL/EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT. SOME OF THESE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL ALSO IMPROVE CHILDREN'S SAFETY, WELFARE AND HEALTH BY PROVIDING INFANT CARE, COMFORT AND SUPPORT TO INFANTS, CHILDREN AND YOUNG MOTHERS MAKING 1,000 (CONTACTS) OVER THE THREE YEAR GRANT PERIOD.

THE ROUND VALLEY INDIAN TRIBES (RVIT) WILL HAVE 18 FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) VOLUNTEERS WHO WILL BE MATCHED WITH YOUTH MENTEES IN GRADES HEADSTART TO 12TH. ALTHOUGH OUR FGP DID NOT GET THE NUMBERS WE NEEDED; WE HAVE MADE CONTACTS, MAKING COLLABORATED EFFORTS, AND MARKETING OUR FGP. BEING SO RURAL 30 MILES OFF THE NEAREST HWY, WE RE-PURPOSED OUR FUNDING TO PROVIDE OUTREACH TO SURROUNDING TRIBES AND  TOWNS. WE HAVE MET WITH A LOT OF TRIBE AND STILL IN PROCESS OF WORKING THROUGH EACH STEP WE NEED TO GET OTHER TRIBES WORK WITH OUR FGP. THE FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL MEET DAILY DURING THE ACADEMIC YEAR WITH THEIR MENTEES. ALL FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL MEET WITH THEIR MENTEES AT THE DESIGNATED ROSTER STATIONS INCLUDING: BUILDING HORIZONS CENTER (A YOUTH AFTER SCHOOL PROGRAM SITE), THE ROUND VALLEY HEAD START, THE FAMILY RESOURCE CENTER, AND THE ROUND VALLEY UNIFIED SCHOOL DISTRICT AND ROUND VALLEY CHARTER SCHOOL LOCATED ON THE ROUND VALLEY INDIAN RESERVATION ADJACENT TO COVELO, CALIFORNIA. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THE RVIT FGP IS EDUCATION. THE COMMUNITY NEEDS TO BE ADDRESSED WITH THE FGP ARE 1) THE NEED FOR OUR TRIBAL YOUTH TO RECONNECT WITH OUR TRIBAL ELDERS, 2) THE NEED FOR OUR TRIBAL YOUTH TO RECOGNIZE, UNDERSTAND, AND ADDRESS THE HISTORICAL TRAUMA OF OUR PEOPLE, AND 3) THE NEED TO RE-ENGAGE OUR YOUTH WITH THE EDUCATIONAL PROCESS TO IMPROVE ACADEMIC SUCCESS. THE SERVICE ACTIVITIES TO BE CARRIED OUT BY FGP VOLUNTEERS, WHO WILL MEET WITH THEIR MATCHED-YOUTH MENTEES AT LEAST TWICE A WEEK, WILL INCLUDE TUTORING, MENTORING, COACHING, HOMEWORK HELP, PROVIDING EDUCATION ABOUT THE CULTURE AND HISTORY OF THE RVIT, AND OFFERING SUPPORT TO THEIR MENTEES IN AN EFFORT TO IMPROVE OVERALL ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT. FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL TEACH YOUTH MENTEES TO RECOGNIZE AND UNDERSTAND THE HISTORICAL TRAUMA EXPERIENCE BY THE TRIBES OF THE RVIT.

THE  OUTCOME MEASURE FOR THE FGP WILL BE THE NUMBER OF STUDENTS WITH IMPROVED OVERALL ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, WITH ATTENTION TO IMPROVED PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY AND MATH. THIS OUTCOME WILL BE MEASURED USING THE DATA COLLECTION INSTRUMENT OF A TEACHER SURVEY. TEACHERS WILL BE SURVEYED EACH YEAR WHEN THE FGP BEGINS FOR THAT YEAR AND AGAIN IN JANUARY AND MAY (JUST BEFORE THE COMPLETION OF THE ACADEMIC YEAR). TEACHERS WILL COMPLETE SURVEYS THAT COLLECT DATA ON PERFORMANCE AND ENGAGEMENT OF THE SEVENTY-TWO STUDENTS IN THE PROGRAM FOR THAT YEAR. YOUTH ATTENDANCE FOR WEEKLY FGP MEETINGS WITH THEIR MENTORING ELDER AS WELL AS THEIR PARTICIPATION IN RELATED ACTIVITIES (E.G., CULTURAL EVENTS AT THE RVIT, SUCH AS THE ANNUAL GONA WILL BE TRACKED BY THE FGP VOLUNTEERS IN AN ACTIVITY LOG. THE OUTPUT MEASURE FOR THE FGP WILL BE THE LEVEL OF PARTICIPATION IN PROGRAM-RELATED ACTIVITIES (INCLUDING MEETINGS WITH THEIR FGP MENTOR) AS MEASURED ON THE ACTIVITY LOGS. THE FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL USE THIS SAME INSTRUMENT (ACTIVITY LOG) TO WRITE UP AN EVALUATION OF EACH ACTIVITY.

THE CNCS INVESTMENT OF $108,000 WILL BE MATCHED WITH $13,463 FOR A TOTAL OF $121,463. THE PRIMARY GOAL OF THE PROPOSED RVIT FGP IS TO IMPROVE ACADEMIC SUCCESS FOR TRIBAL YOUTH IN GRADES PRE-SCHOOL TO 12.

THE CITY OF OAKLAND?S HUMAN SERVICES DEPARTMENT (HSD) DEVELOPS AND IMPLEMENT SUPPORTIVE INITIATIVES TO PROMOTE A HEALTHY AND CARING ENVIRONMENT FOR ALL MEMBERS OF THE COMMUNITY- CHILDREN, YOUTH, SENIORS AND ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES AND THEIR FAMILIES.  
THE AGING & ADULTS SERVICES DIVISION MANAGES THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IN WHICH VOLUNTEERS, AGE 55 AND ABOVE, ARE AFFORDED THE OPPORTUNITY TO VOLUNTEER AND BE PLACED IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS. ACCESS TO ADDITIONAL EDUCATIONAL RESOURCES AND OPPORTUNITIES FOR THEIR FAMILY MEMBERS).

EDUCATION IS THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROGRAM.  THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST CHILDREN/YOUTH IN SERVICE ACTIVITIES FOR THE AGE GROUPS COVERING PRE-K AND K-12.

THE FGP'S FOUR WORK PLANS INCLUDE SERVICE ACTIVITIES IN SCHOOL READINESS: ASSISTING IN CLASSROOMS AND COMMUNITY CENTERS, ROLE MODELING, READING, SHARING GAMES, PROVIDING SAFE ENVIRONMENTS TO LEARN/SPACE FOR CHILDREN/YOUTH TO DEVELOP SOCIALLY-EMOTIONALLY, SUPPORTIVE EXERCISES, LANGUAGE/LETTER RECOGNITION. STATION SITE SUPERVISORS, FG VOLUNTEERS AND TEACHER/CENTER OBSERVATION ASSESSMENTS).

AT THE END OF THIS THREE YEAR GRANT PERIOD, AN ESTIMATED 8 FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS AND SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE ASSIST WITH SPECIAL CLASSROOM LEARNING PROJECTS, ENGAGING YOUTH IN BASIC SKILL DEVELOPMENT, READING AND CONVERSATION. WILL HAVE DEMONSTRATED SOME GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS: SOCIAL/ AND OR EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT; AND, OR AREAS OF IMPROVEMENT IN READING.

SINCE 1972, PEPPERDINE UNIVERSITY HAS SUCCESSFULLY SPONSORED THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP). FGP IS AN INNOVATIVE, MULTIGENERATIONAL VOLUNTEER PROGRAM THAT PAIRS ELDERLY CITIZENS WITH AT-RISK YOUTH FROM IMPOVERISHED, UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES WITHIN THE GREATER LOS ANGELES (LA) AREA. THROUGH A SYMBIOTIC MODEL, FGP SIMULTANEOUSLY PROVIDES COMPANIONSHIP FOR ELDERLY VOLUNTEERS AND MENTORSHIP TO YOUTH WITH SPECIAL NEEDS AND DIFFICULT CIRCUMSTANCES. FGP PRIMARILY FOCUSES ON EDUCATIONAL IMPROVEMENT, WORKING TO PROMOTE SCHOOL READINESS AND SUCCESS IN YOUTH (K-12). FGP PURPOSEFULLY TARGETS POPULATIONS IN HIGHLY IMPOVERISHED NEIGHBORHOODS OF SOUTH CENTRAL LA. MORE THAN 38% OF RESIDENTS OF  LA COUNTY LIVE IN ECONOMIC HARDSHIP, WHILE 18% LIVE BELOW THE FEDERAL POVERTY LINE ($28,290 ANNUALLY FOR A FAMILY OF FOUR). COMPARATIVELY, WITHIN FGP'S PRIMARY SERVICE AREA, A STARTLING 52% OF FAMILIES LIVE BELOW THE FEDERAL POVERTY LEVEL. UNDER CONDITIONS OF SIGNIFICANT POVERTY, CHILDREN EXPERIENCE ENHANCED RISK OF DEVELOPMENTAL DELAYS, ESPECIALLY IN THE CRITICAL AREAS OF LANGUAGE, LITERACY, AND EMOTIONAL REGULATION. THROUGH ITS INNOVATIVE STRUCTURE, FGP WORKS TO MITIGATE EDUCATIONAL CHALLENGES AND RISKS FOR VULNERABLE YOUTH BY PROVIDING A SOURCE OF MENTORSHIP AND SUPPORT FROM ITS FOSTER GRANDPARENTS. IN ORDER TO CONTINUE ITS IMPORTANT WORK THROUGH FOSTER GRANDPARENTS PROGRAM, PEPPERDINE IS REQUESTING SUPPORT FROM THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE.

IN ORDER TO IMPROVE EDUCATIONAL OUTCOMES FOR HIGH-RISK YOUTH, PEPPERDINE'S FGP WILL PAIR 104 SENIOR CITIZENS (FGP VOLUNTEERS) WITH YOUTH FROM THE FOLLOWING TARGETED GROUPS: 1) HEAD START PROGRAMS FOR YOUNG CHILDREN AGES 3-5; 2) SPECIALIZED EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS FOR DISADVANTAGED AND/OR DISABLED YOUTH; 3) K-12 STUDENTS NEEDING ADDITIONAL ASSISTANCE IN LANGUAGE DEVELOPMENT AND LITERACY; AND 4) VULNERABLE YOUTH NEEDING ADULT SUPPORT WHILE PARENTS ARE BEING TREATED FOR SUBSTANCE ABUSE OR MENTAL HEALTH ISSUES. THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL FACILITATE A WIDE ARRAY OF EDUCATIONAL AND DEVELOPMENTAL ACTIVITIES WITH THEIR YOUTH PARTNERS INCLUDING: ASSISTING IN HEAD START AND K-12 CLASSROOMS,  READING,  TUTORING, MENTORING, SOCIALIZING (PLAYING EDUCATIONAL GAMES, READING, TALKING, WALKING, LISTENING, AND SHARING MEALS), AND SUPPORTING YOUTH WHOSE PARENTS ARE RECEIVING  REHABILITATIVE TREATMENT. ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT INCLUDE INCREASED SCHOOL READINESS, ENHANCED LANGUAGE AND LITERACY SKILLS, IMPROVED CLASSROOM PARTICIPATION, HEIGHTENED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT, AND GREATER SOCIAL AND BEHAVIORAL SKILLS FOR PARTICIPATING YOUTH.

CATHOLIC CHARITIES, DIOCESE OF SAN DIEGO IS A RESPECTED LEADER IN THE ADMINISTRATION OF SOCIAL SERVICE PROGRAMS IN SAN DIEGO AND IMPERIAL COUNTIES.  WITH A COMMITMENT TO ADVOCACY, JUSTICE AND ENHANCING THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR THE POOR, PROGRAMS ARE DESIGNED TO PROMOTE SELF-DETERMINATION, A KEY QUALITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING AND STRONGER COMMUNITIES.  FOR THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM THE GRANT RENEWAL PERIOD IS 2018-21 AND CATHOLIC CHARITIES IS REQUESTING $465,618 TO FUND 97 VSYS.   AGENCY WIDE PRIORITY OUTCOMES WILL BE THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREAS FOR THE PROJECT INCLUDING EDUCATION K-12 SUCCESS: ED5 - LITERACY, ED4A- MENTORING(25% OUTPUTS ONLY) AND SCHOOL READINESS: ED23 - SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL GAINS.  ED4A  WILL ADDRESS ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT GAINS AMONG AT RISK YOUTH ENROLLED IN COMMUNITY SCHOOLS THROUGH MENTORING IN AREAS THAT WILL SUPPORT POSITIVE BEHAVIORAL CHANGE AND THE TEENS' TRANSITION BACK TO TRADITIONAL SCHOOLS AND/OR SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF JOB TRAINING AND HIGH SCHOOL DIPLOMA ATTAINMENT. 
SERVICES WILL PRIMARILY TARGET PRESCHOOL AND ELEMENTARY SCHOOL AGED CHILDREN WHO ARE LIVING IN POVERTY AND TO CONTINUE ADDRESSING THE ONGOING COMMUNITY PROBLEM OF LOW READING SCORES IN GRADES K-12 AND UNDER ACHIEVEMENT IN SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT AMONG PRESCHOOLERS.   
DEPENDING ON THE PERFORMANCE MEASURE, SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: SKILL BUILDING AND TUTORING IN READING, COMPREHENSION AND LANGUAGE SKILLS, MENTORING TO SUPPORT ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, PROBLEM SOLVING, ENHANCING SELF-AWARENESS AND CONFIDENCE, DEVELOPING POSITIVE RELATIONSHIPS, SOCIAL SKILL DEVELOPMENT AND BEHAVIOR MANAGEMENT.  MENTORING ACTIVITIES FOR AT-RISK YOUTH WHO HAVE HISTORIES WITH THE JUVENILE JUSTICE SYSTEM WILL HELP TO ENSURE THEIR CONTINUED PARTICIPATION IN COMMUNITY SCHOOLS, STRENGTHEN AREAS OF ACADEMICS AND REDUCE THE RISK OF RECIDIVISM.     
TO ENSURE POSITIVE OUTCOMES AND OUTPUTS, CATHOLIC CHARITIES WILL ALIGN WITH THE CNCS  INITIATIVES AND THE STANDARDIZED PERFORMANCE MEASURES, SURVEYS AND DATA COLLECTION PROCESSES.   
AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD, THE PREDICTION IS THE CATHOLIC CHARITIES FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM WITH 97 FEDERALLY FUNDED VSYS WILL HAVE SERVED APPROXIMATELY 1,065 CHILDREN AND YOUTH IN THE RESPECTIVE PERFORMANCE AREAS. IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT 65% OF THE CHILDREN SERVED IN GRADES K-12  WILL MAKE PROGRESS TOWARD GRADE LEVEL PROFICIENCY IN READING; MENTORED YOUTH WILL SHOW IMPROVEMENT IN BEHAVIOR, SOCIAL SKILLS AND ATTITUDES TOWARD SCHOOL AND 85% OF PRESCHOOL CHILDREN WILL HAVE MET OR EXCEEDED THEIR TARGET GOALS IN SOCIAL/EMOTIONAL DOMAINS.  IT IS ESTIMATED THAT THE ANNUAL FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $465,618 WILL BE AUGMENTED WITH APPROXIMATELY $35,322 IN NON-FEDERAL CASH AND $98,805 IN-KIND TO SUPPORT THE COST OF MANAGING A SUCCESSFUL PROGRAM WITH PROVEN OUTCOMES.

SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE DEVELOPING POSITIVE RELATIONSHIPS WITH THE YOUTH, TUTORING THE YOUTH AT SCHOOL, ASSISTING THE YOUTH IN MAKING BETTER DECISIONS REGARDING BEHAVIOR WHEN ANGRY OR APATHETIC, AND OFFERING A PERSPECTIVE INFLUENCED BY THE WISDOM OF YEARS IN TEACHABLE MOMENTS. SAN FRANCISCO'S FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP), SPONSORED BY THE FELTON INSTITUTE/FAMILY SERVICE AGENCY (FSA), IS COMMITTED TO MEETING THE CRITICAL NEEDS OF OUR COMMUNITY.FGP VOLUNTEERS ARE ACTIVE, VITAL, AND COMMUNITY-MINDED ADULTS AGE 55 AND OVER WHO ARE PLACED IN MEANINGFUL VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES THAT INCREASE THE CAPACITY OF SCHOOL AND COMMUNITY BASED PROGRAMS FOR CHILDREN. OUR FGP VOLUNTEERS FOSTER TRUSTING AND SUPPORTIVE RELATIONSHIPS WITH THE CHILDREN THEY SERVE, HELPING TO NURTURE THE SOCIAL, COGNITIVE, AND EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT OF EACH CHILD. THE PROGRAM BEGAN IN 1965 AS PART OF THE ORIGINAL PILOTS IN THE COUNTRY AND CONTINUES TO BEAN ESSENTIAL PART OF THE EDUCATION AND SUPPORT OF SAN FRANCISCO CHILDREN, AS WELL AS AN IMPORTANT WAY TO BRING MEANINGFUL AND STIPENDED, VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES TO LOW-INCOME SENIORS IN OUR COMMUNITY.
PROGRAM PARTNERS INCLUDE 28 VOLUNTEER STATIONS CONSISTING OF: 21 INFANT AND PRESCHOOL PROGRAMS, 6 ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS, AND 1 COUNSELING CENTER. OUR FGP VOLUNTEERS PROVIDE SIGNIFICANT SERVICES AND EDUCATIONAL SUPPORT TO CHILDREN AND THEIR FAMILIES STRUGGLING WITH POVERTY AND OTHER SOCIAL ISSUES. THE MAJORITY OF OUR PRE-SCHOOLS IN OUR PORTFOLIO ARE HEAD START PROGRAMS, AND THUS BY THEIR OWN ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA, SERVE PRIMARILY LOW INCOME, HIGH NEED FAMILIES. THE MAJORITY OF OUR ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS SERVED BY FGP VOLUNTEERS ARE SUPPORTING CHILDREN FROM ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED BACKGROUNDS. THE MAJORITY OF OUR VOLUNTEER SITES OFFER SERVICES IN MULTIPLE LANGUAGES INCLUDING CANTONESE, MANDARIN, VIETNAMESE, SPANISH, TAGALOG, AND RUSSIAN. IN RESPONSE TO REQUESTS FROM VOLUNTEER STATIONS, WE HAVE RECRUITED A MULTIETHNIC, MULTILINGUAL VOLUNTEER CORPS WHERE 86% SPEAK LANGUAGES OTHER THAN ENGLISH.  
FSA IS REQUESTING A GRANT OF $263,379 TO RECRUIT, TRAIN, AND PLACE 68 VOLUNTEERS TO REFLECT 55 VSY (VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS) WITH A GRANTEE SHARE OF $79,016 OR AN AMOUNT OF $342,395. THE SPECIFIC SERVICE ACTIVITIES AND FOCUS ARE INCORPORATED IN FOUR WORK PLANS AND COMPLY WITH THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS) REGULATIONS AND STRATEGIC INITIATIVES.
WE DESIGNED THE WORK PLANS TO SUPPORT CHILDREN AND YOUTH IN IMPROVING AND INCREASING THEIR LITERACY SKILLS, SCHOOL READINESS, AND POSITIVE SOCIALIZATION, IN SCHOOL, COMMUNITY, AND CLINIC BASED VOLUNTEER SITES. IN WORK PLAN #1, 8 VOLUNTEERS PROVIDE SERVICE IN 6 EXPERIENCE CORPS BAY AREA ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS THROUGH BOTH INDIVIDUAL AND GROUP LITERACY SESSIONS, AND WE PROJECT THAT 56 CHILDREN AGE 5 TO 11 WILL BE SERVED ANNUALLY. WORK PLAN #2 ENCOMPASSES OUR LARGEST GROUP OF VOLUNTEERS WITH 56 VOLUNTEERS ASSISTING IN GENERAL CLASSROOM ACTIVITIES, INCLUDING READING, ART, AND MUSIC AND ENCOURAGING POSITIVE BEHAVIOR AND SOCIALIZATION WITH CHILDREN AGE 0 TO 5. WE PROJECT THAT FGP VOLUNTEERS IN THIS PLAN WILL SERVE 392 CHILDREN AT 21 PRESCHOOL SITES. WORK PLAN #3 PROVIDES SUPPORT IN A CLINIC BASED SETTING AND IS OUR SMALLEST WORK PLAN WITH 2 VOLUNTEERS SERVING IN 1 VOLUNTEER SITE, PROVIDING REGULAR SOCIALIZATION AND COMFORT TO CHILDREN OF PARENTS RECEIVING CLINIC SERVICES. WE PROJECT VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE 20 CHILDREN IN THIS PLAN. IN WORK PLAN #4, 2 VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE SERVICE IN SCHOOL-BASED AND COMMUNITY-BASED SETTINGS IN BOTH INDIVIDUAL AND GROUP LITERACY SESSIONS, PROJECTING TO SERVE 14 CHILDREN AGE 5 TO 11.

FRESNO EOC FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM ESTIMATES 68 FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVED. OF THIS NUMBER 67 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE ASSISTING IN CLASSROOM, ASSISTING IN CLASSROOM HEAD START, TUTORING-PUBLIC SCHOOLS, TUTORING-OTHER AND COMFORTING CHILDREN. OGLALA LAKOTA COUNTY FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

"THEY ALWAYS SAY KNOWLEDGE IS WONDERFUL, BUT WITHOUT EXPERIENCE, IT HAS NO MEANING OR FEELING TO IT.  SO CHILDREN SEE OUR PRACTICES FROM THE TIME THEY'RE LITTLE.  THEY WATCH, AND OFTEN THEY EXPERIENCE WHAT THEY SEE IN ORDER TO DEVELOP UNDERSTANDING." --ALBERT WHITE HAT, "ZUYA:  LIFE'S JOURNEY" (2102)

     OGLALA LAKOTA COUNTY IN SOUTHWESTERN SOUTH DAKOTA INCLUDES MOST OF THE PINE RIDGE INDIAN RESERVATION.  OUR COUNTY HAS THE THIRD LOWEST LIFE EXPECTANCY OF ANY COUNTY IN THE UNITED STATES.  OUR PER CAPITA INCOME IS USUALLY IN THE BOTTOM TEN COUNTIES IN THE UNITED STATES.  CONVENTIONAL PUBLIC HEALTH WISDOM TELLS US THAT ONLY THROUGH AN INCREASE IN PER CAPITA INCOME WILL OUR LONGEVITY IMPROVE.  AS THERE APPEARS LITTLE LIKELIHOOD OF OUR ECONOMIC SITUATION IMPROVING IN THE NEAR FUTURE OUR CHALLENGE IS TO FIND OTHER MEANS OF STRENGTHENING OUR COMMUNITIES SO THAT WE LIVE LONGER AND HEALTHIER LIVES. 
     THE IDEA OF THE WELL LIVED LIFE IS COMMON TO ALL CULTURES.  IN TRADITIONAL LAKOTA LIFE, THE IDEAL OF THE IKCE WICASA, THE COMMON MAN, WAS THE FOUNDATION OF LAKOTA LIFE.  PEOPLE WERE EXPECTED TO LIVE IN A HUMBLE, SELF EFFACING AND GENEROUS HEARTED MANNER, ALWAYS LOOKING OUT FOR THE WELFARE OF THE MOST DISADVANTAGED PEOPLE IN THE BAND--ORPHANS AND THE ELDERLY.  BECAUSE OF THE DENSE, SUPPORTIVE AND HIGHLY DEVELOPED KINSHIP SYSTEM, MID NINETEENTH CENTURY LAKOTA PEOPLE WERE FELT BY SOME TO BE THE HEALTHIEST PEOPLE ON EARTH, AND NOT JUST BECAUSE OF HAVING HORSES TO HUNT AMPLE HERDS OF BUFFALO.  AN OGLALA LAKOTA PERSON WAS CONFIDENT THAT DESPITE REVERSES IN HER FORTUNES, SHE STILL WOULD BE TAKEN CARE OF BY LOVING, CONCERNED RELATIVES.
     OUR OGLALA LAKOTA COUNTY FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM WILL BE AN IMPORTANT PIECE IN STRENGTHENING OUR COMMUNITIES.  OUR GRANDPARENTS ARE THE BEST INDIVIDUALS TO PASS ON THE WISDOM AND STRENGTHS OF LAKOTA CULTURE TO CHILDREN WHO SOMETIMES GROW UP WITH LITTLE OR NO EXPOSURE TO ELDERS BECAUSE OF OUR SHORT LIFE EXPECTANCY.  UNTIL ABOUT A YEAR AND A HALF AGO, THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM WAS SUCCESSFUL AND WELL RECEIVED.  OUR PROJECT WILL ONCE AGAIN PLACE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS IN OUR DAY CARES, HEAD STARTS AND SCHOOLS.  
     THE SPONSORING NON PROFIT CORPORATION WACANTE KIYAPI (HELPING WITH A GOOD HEART) IS BASED IN OGLALA LAKOTA COUNTY AND HAS AN EIGHTEEN YEAR TRACK RECORD OF SUCCESSFUL PROJECTS WHICH PROMOTE HEALTH AND WELLNESS IN OUR LAKOTA COMMUNITIES.

THE SENIOR ACTION, INC. FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM COVERS 44 VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS (VSYS) AT 1044 HOURS PER YEAR.  AN ESTIMATED 45 FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  OF THIS NUMBER, 37 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: READING WITH CHILDREN, ASSISTING WITH ASSIGNMENT CORRECTIONS, REVIEWING VOCABULARY WORDS, ACTING AS A MENTOR AND POSITIVE ROLE MODEL AND HELPING TO BUILD POSITIVE RELATIONSHIPS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION.  AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT, IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT AT LEAST 50% OF THE CHILDREN WORKING ONE-ON-ONE WITH FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS IN EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION PROGRAMS WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT AND 50% OF CHILDREN WORKING ONE-ON-ONE WITH FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS IN THE K-12 SETTING WILL SHOW ACADEMIC IMPROVEMENT. THE LENAWEE COUNTY DEPARTMENT ON AGING STARTED THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IN 1938, PROVIDING A WONDERFUL OPPURTUNITY FOR LOW INCOME SENIORS TO INTERACT AND ENCOURAGE AT RISK CHILDREN. THE PROGRAM EXPANDED INTO MONROE COUNTY IN 1984, THEN HILLSDALE COUNTY IN 2000, WITH THE PRIMARY FUNDING SOURCE APPROVAL OF OSA. THE MONROE COUNTY AND LENAWEE COUNTY ISD'S ALSO PROVIDE FUNDING. 
THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS ARE GIVEN 40 HOURS OF PRE-SERVICE TRAINING, THEN PLACED WITHIN SITES INCLUDING; SPECIAL NEEDS CLASSROOMS, HEADSTARTS, AND OTHER LOCATIONS WHERE THE MOST NEED HAS BEEN IDENTIFIED. THERE IS ALSO OPPURTUNITIES FOR SUMMER PLACEMENTS, INCLUDING BOYS AND GIRLS CLUB, LIBRARIES, DAY CAMPS, YMCA, AND THE 1:1 SIX WEEK SUMMER READING PROGRAM, THAT IS A STRUCTURED MENTORING CONCEPT STARTED IN 1983. INSERVICE TRAINING MEETINGS ARE DONE ON A MONTHLY BASIS IN EACH COUNTY, TO PROVIDE ONGOING INFORMATION AND SUPPORT FOR THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS. 
EVALUATIONS, AND INFORMATION DATA ON THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WANTS AND NEEDS AS WELL AS THE IMPACT ON THE CHILDREN THEY SERVE IS COLLECTED AND REVIEWED TO ENSURE THAT THE CORRECT AND ONGOING NEEDS ARE MET.
AN ESTIMATED 35 FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER 35 WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE READING, MATH, SOCIAL INTERACTION, AND WRITING. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS TO SUPPORT AND ASSIST IN THESE AREAS. AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT, THE CHILDREN ASSIGNED TO THE FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SHOW IMPROVEMENT IN THE AREAS OF DEFINITION. THE CURRENT STATE ALLOCATION IS $200,554; WITH THE LOCAL MATCH AMOUNT OF $46,386.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IN SOUTH CENTRAL INDIANA WAS ESTABLISHED IN 1976 AT THE
MUSCATATUCK CENTER FOR THE DISABLED. FGP MOVED TO A CLASSROOM TUTORING/MENTORING PROGRAM IN
ABOUT 1975. THE FGP RECENTLY HIRED ITS 4TH DIRECTOR APRIL 17, 2017. THE SERVICE AREA COVERS 2,000 SQ.
MILES OVER 5-COUNTIES. THE PROGRAM SERVES ABOUT HALF THE SCHOOL SITES AND HEAD START CENTERS WITH 60
FG VOLUNTEERS.  FOR 32 YEARS FGP HAS SERVED 5 INDIANA COUNTIES, A 2,000 SQ. MILE AREA INCLUDING BARTHOLOMEW, BROWN, DECATUR, JACKSON AND JENNINGS.  WE ARE CURRENTLY ACTIVE IN 18 SCHOOL SITES AND 4 HAD START CENTERS.  PERFORMANCE SURVEYS CONSISTENTLY RATE THE QUALITY OF FGP OUTCOMES AND VOLUNTEERS AS MOST VALUABLE BY TEACHERS, PRINCIPALS AND THE COMMUNITIES WE SERVE.  HOWEVER, WE CANNOT CURRENTLY FILL THE NEED FOR VOLUNTEERS IN EVERY CLASSROOM THAT ASKS.
GRANT FUNDING FOR THE NEXT 3-YEAR RENEWAL PERIOD JULY 1, 2018-JUNE 30, 2021 WILL FUEL A RE-BUILDING
AND EXPANSION OF OUR FGP. BASED ON COMMUNITY NEEDS SURVEYS CONDUCTED RECENTLY IN OUR FIVE-COUNTY AREA (BARTHOLOMEW, BROWN, DECATUR, JACKSON AND JENNINGS COUNTIES) WE WILL STRENGTHEN AND ALIGN FGP PERFORMANCE MEASURES AND ACTIVITIES TO BETTER SUPPORT THE NEEDS ARTICULATED BY OUR RURAL INDIANA COUNTIES. ALL COUNTIES AGREED ON SIMILAR PRIORITIES. THEY RECOGNIZED INCREASING POVERTY AND A SPECIFIC NEED FOR FOCUSED EDUCATION IN ACADEMICS AND THE LIFE SKILLS NEEDED FOR LIFE LONG SUCCESS.  THEY SHARED CONCERNS ABOUT THE GROWING POVERTY IN THEIR COMMUNITIES AND AN ALARMING GROWTH IN THE NUMBER OF WORKING POOR. THEY EMPHASIZED THAT EFFECTIVE LIFE SKILLS EDUCATION AND EMPHASIS ON STUDENT PROFICIENCY AT OR ABOVE EVERY GRADE LEVEL ARE TWO KEY DETERMINANTS FOR THE ECONOMIC VITALITY OF THEIR COMMUNITIES. EDUCATION PREPARES WORKERS WHO ATTRACT JOBS AND FUND SERVICES WITH A HEALTHY AND SUSTAINABLE TAX BASE. ACROSS THE SERVICE AREA, COMMON CONCERNS AMONG ELDERLY RESIDENTS INCLUDED FINDING MEANINGFUL OPPORTUNITIES TO VOLUNTEER, TO LEARN NEW SKILLS, AND HAVE ACCESS TO PRODUCTIVE ACTIVITIES.  COMMUNITIES RECOGNIZED THE VALUE IN LEVERAGING AND ACKNOWLEDGING THE VALUABLE EXPERIENCE AND TALENTS OF THEIR ELDERLY WHO ARE BEST SERVED BY "AGING WELL AND IN-PLACE" FOR AS LONG AS THEY WANT. COMMUNITY PRIORITIES WILL DRIVE OUR CNCS PERFORMANCE MEASURES THAT ENSURE EVERY CHILD WILL BE PROFICIENT IN MATH, ENGLISH AND LANGUAGE ARTS AT OR ABOVE GRADE LEVEL.  WE WILL AGGRESSIVELY RECRUIT VOLUNTEERS TO EXPAND FROM 60 TO 74 VOLUNTEERS.  WITH THE INCREASED CAPACITY, WE CAN IMPACT 1150 SCHOOL CHILDREN, ALLOCATE 66 VOLUNTEERS TO 28 SCHOOL SITES TO IMPACT 228 TEACHER-IDENTIFIED AT-RISK STUDENTS. IN OUR AREA, 1/3 OF STUDENTS HAVE IEPS.  WE WILL THEN BE ABLE TO SERVE IN HALF OF OUR 44 PUBLIC SCHOOLS, 6 FAITH-BASED SCHOOLS AND ALL 5 HEAD START CENTERS.  WE WILL ALSO BE ABLE TO EXPAND THE FGP TO INCLUDE TWO COMMUNITY SUPPORTED HOMELESS SHELTERS. AT SHELTERS WE WILL INITIATE AFTER-SCHOOL TUTORING AND A MENTORING PROGRAM FOR STUDENTS WHO ARE AT A MOST CRITICAL POINT IN THEIR YOUNG LIVES AND NEED MENTORS TO HELP THEM NAVIGATE THE SOCIAL, EMOTIONAL AND BEHAVIORAL CHALLENGES THAT HINDER THEIR LEARNING AND THEIR FUTURES. 
THE FGP WILL, BY ITS VERY PERFORMANCE, EFFECTIVELY ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF OUR LOW-INCOME ELDERLY WITH MEANINGFUL OPPORTUNITIES TO VOLUNTEER, LEARN NEW SKILLS AND "AGE WELL AND IN PLACE" FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM HAS BEEN SPONSORED BY THE COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM OF EVANSVILLE (CAPE) FOR 42 YEARS. CAPE IS A PRIVATE NON-FOR-PROFIT, SOCIAL SERVICE AGENCY SERVING SEVERAL COUNTIES IN SOUTHWESTERN INDIANA. AS A MULTI-PROGRAM AGENCY, THE COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM OF EVANSVILLE ACTIVELY ADDRESSES THE NEEDS OF THE VULNERABLE, ECONOMICALLY-CHALLENGED IN THE COUNTIES OF POSEY, GIBSON, AND VANDERBURGH. ADDITIONALLY, THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IS FUNDED TO INCLUDE THE COUNTY OF WARRICK, AND IS EXPANDED AS THE NEED HAS INCREASED.  TO FACILITATE THE PROVISION OF SERVICES FOR PHYSICAL, SOCIAL, AND EMOTIONAL NEEDS IN THESE COUNTIES, THE COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM OF EVANSVILLE IS SEEKING STEWARDSHIP OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM FOR THE PERIOD OF JULY 1, 2018 THROUGH JUNE 30, 2019. THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL SERVICE FEDERAL GRANT INVESTMENT OF $167,874.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $21,383 NON-FEDERAL DOLLARS FROM CAPE. 
IT IS ESTIMATED THAT FORTY FIVE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL SERVE IN THE PROGRAM, SERVING CHILDREN IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF AGENCY WIDE PRIORITY MEASURE OUTCOME FOR K-12 SUCCESS AND SCHOOL READINESS.
AT LEAST 80% OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL SERVE IN THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA, K-12 SUCCESS. THESE VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE TUTORING-PUBLIC SCHOOLS TO TEACHER SPECIFIED STUDENTS IN IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT. THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL ALSO SERVE IN SCHOOL READINESS, ASSISTING IN CLASSROOM AND/OR HEAD START CLASSROOMS. THESE FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE GAINS IN SOCIAL/EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT AS WELL AS LITERACY SKILLS. NO MORE THAN 20% OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL SERVE IN THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA OF SCHOOL READINESS, SERVING CHILDREN IN SAFETY, WELFARE, AND HEALTH PROGRAMS.

THE COMMUNITY ACTION FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM WILL HAVE AN ESTIMATE OF 48 VOLUNTEERS TO SERVE YOUTH IN MARION COUNTY. THE ACTIVITIES THE GRANDPARENTS PERFORM WILL HELP THE CHILDREN THEY SERVE BECOME PRODUCTIVE ADULTS.  GRANDPARENTS WILL FOCUS ON SERVING CHILDREN FROM DAY CARE, (6 WEEKS) TO 12TH GRADE, (18 YEARS).  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 85% OF THE CHILDREN BEING SERVED WILL BE AT OR ABOVE HIS OR HER GRADE OR AGE LEVEL. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $214,903 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $23,000 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.
EACH WEEK 4- 5 DAYS A WEEK, 4-5 HOURS A DAY, SENIORS 55 YEARS OF AGE OR OLDER WILL TRAVEL TO DESIGNATED SITES ASSIGNED BY THE DIRECTOR OF THE PROGRAM TO WORK WITH CHILDREN WHO HAVE SOME SPECIAL OR EXCEPTIONAL NEED. THESE SENIORS WILL HELP CHILDREN WHO NEED HELP IN AREAS OF LANGUAGE/COMMUNICATION, HOMELESSNESS, VISUALLY IMPAIRED, EMOTIONAL OR SOCIAL NEED, LITERACY, ABUSED/NEGLECTED, SPEECH IMPAIRED, EMOTIONAL AND OR SOCIAL BARRIERS.  
THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IS SPONSORED BY COMMUNITY ACTION OF GREATER INDIANAPOLIS WHOSE MISSION IS TO EMPOWER THOSE WE SERVE TO BECOME SELF-RELIANT AND SELF-SUFFICIENT. COMMUNITY ACTION IS AN AGENCY THAT WAS ESTABLISHED IN 1965 TO CARRY OUT THE MISSION OF SERVING THOSE WHO FELL BELOW A CERTAIN INCOME GUIDELINE.  IT WAS CREATED AS THE RESULT OF THE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY ACT OF 1964. THIS WAS THE POVERTY LEVEL WHICH WOULD ALLOW THOSE INDIVIDUALS TO QUALIFY FOR GOVERNMENT SERVICES.  THOSE SERVICES INCLUDED ASSISTANCE ON ELECTRIC AND HEATING BILLS, HELP WITH EMPLOYMENT, SUMMER YOUTH PROGRAMS, HEAD START, ADULT BASIC EDUCATION, NEIGHBORHOOD YOUTH PROGRAMS AND THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM TO NAME A FEW.  COMMUNITY ACTION OF GREATER INDIANAPOLIS IS A NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION DEDICATED TO THE REDUCTION AND ULTIMATE ELIMINATION OF POVERTY AMONG ITS CLIENTS IN CENTRAL INDIANA.  EACH YEAR WE SERVE APPROXIMATELY 5,000 (FAMILIES) HOUSEHOLDS AND 1,200 OF THEM UNDUPLICATED CHILDREN SERVED BY THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IN MARION COUNTY.   CAGI'S MISSION IS CRAFTED TO NOT ONLY GIVE INDIVIDUALS A "HAND OUT" BUT A "HAND UP" IN TERMS OF INCREASING THEIR CAPACITY TO BECOME MORE SELF-RELIANT AND SELF-SUFFICIENT. CAGI STARTED IN 1965 AS CAAP (COMMUNITY ACTION AGAINST POVERTY) BUT LATER CHANGED ITS NAME TO COMMUNITY ACTION OF GREATER INDIANAPOLIS. COMMUNITY ACTION WILL SERVE IN FOUR COUNTIES IN INDIANA, (BOONE, HAMILTON, HENDRICKS, AND MARION), SERVING CLIENTS WHO FALL AT OR BELOW THE 150% POVERTY GUIDELINE FOR SOME AND THE 200% GUIDELINE FOR FOSTER GRANDPARENTS.

CATHOLIC CHARITIES DIOCESE OF GARY HAS BEEN THE SPONSORING AGENCY FOR THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM FOR EIGHTEEN YEARS.  CATHOLIC CHARITIES IS A MULTI-PROGRAM, PRIVATE, NOT-FOR-PROFIT SOCIAL SERVICE AGENCY SERVING THE COMMUNITY IN NORTHWEST INDIANA.  THE MISSION OF CATHOLIC CHARITIES IS TO PROVIDE AND ADVOCATE FOR THE PHYSICAL, EMOTIONAL, AND SOCIAL NEEDS OF THE POOR AND VULNERABLE IN THE FOUR COUNTIES OF THE DIOCESE OF GARY.  ONCE AGAIN CATHOLIC CHARITIES IS REQUESTING STEWARDSHIP OF THIS PROGRAM FOR THE PERIOD OF 1/1/2018 THROUGH 12/31/2021.
FORTY-NINE VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST CHILDREN IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA EDUCATION-PERFORMANCE MEASURE OUTCOME K-12 SUCCESS AND SCHOOL READINESS.  VOLUNTEERS WILL TUTOR/MENTOR TEACHER IDENTIFIED STUDENTS IN LITERACY OR MATH.  ACTIVITIES WILL CONSIST OF BUT NOT LIMITED TO READING COMPREHENSION, WRITING, AND COMMUNICATION, IDENTIFICATION OF THE ALPHABET AND NUMBERS, MOTOR SKILLS AND RECOGNIZING COLORS.  FORTY-FIVE VOLUNTEERS IN THE EDUCATION (K-12 SUCCESS, OUTPUT ED2, OUTCOME ED 27) WILL ASSIST 225 CHILDREN THROUGH MENTORING AND TUTORING TO HELP THEM IMPROVE THEIR ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT.  FOUR VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST 20 CHILDREN, (SCHOOL READINESS, OUTPUT ED2-OUTCOME ED 24) TO INCREASE THEIR LITERACY SKILLS. 
THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $214,155 ANNUALLY WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $29,474 FROM CATHOLIC CHARITIES.

THE CITY OF CHICAGO, DEPARTMENT OF FAMILY AND SUPPORT SERVICES (DFSS) WORKS WITH COMMUNITY PARTNERS TO CONNECT CHICAGO RESIDENTS AND FAMILIES TO RESOURCES THAT BUILD STABILITY, SUPPORT THEIR WELL-BEING, AND EMPOWER THEM TO THRIVE. DFSS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING SEVEN DIVISIONS: CHILDREN SERVICES, YOUTH SERVICES, HUMAN SERVICES, HOMELESS SERVICES, SENIOR SERVICES (AREA AGENCY ON AGING), DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, AND WORKFORCE SERVICES.

THE DFSS SENIOR SERVICES DIVISION (SSD) HAS BEEN A SPONSOR OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) SINCE THE EARLY 1980S. EACH YEAR FGP VOLUNTEERS PROVIDE SERVICES TO MORE THAN 500 CHILDREN, YOUTH AND YOUNG ADULTS ENROLLED IN CHICAGO PUBLIC SCHOOLS (CPS), HEAD START PROGRAMS, CHARTER SCHOOLS, THERAPEUTIC FACILITIES AND AFTER-SCHOOL PROGRAMS. PARTICIPANTS RECEIVING SERVICES ARE IDENTIFIED AS AT-RISK AND REQUIRE ONE-ON-ONE SUPPORT IN THE AREAS OF READING, MATH, LITERACY AND SOCIALIZATION. 
DFSS WILL MAINTAIN ITS CURRENT NUMBER OF FEDERAL VOLUNTEERS OF 117 AND NON-FEDERAL VOLUNTEERS AT 31.  THE AMOUNT OF FEDERAL FUNDING REQUESTED FOR FY 2018 IS $540,988 AND THE TOTAL DOLLAR AMOUNT OF NON-FEDERAL FUNDING IS $219,992. CHICAGO'S FGP PROJECT WILL ADDRESS TWO SERVICE CATEGORIES: 1) SCHOOL READINESS - HEAD START AND EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION AND 2) K-12 SUCCESS.

DFSS WILL CONTINUE TO ADDRESS SEVERAL COMMUNITY NEEDS BY PROVIDING TUTORING AND MENTORING TO CHILDREN ENROLLED AT SCHOOLS IN LOW INCOME COMMUNITIES NEEDING PROVISIONAL SUPPORT TO INTENSIVE SUPPORT AND TUTORING TO CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL NEEDS IN GRADES K-12. IN ADDITION, DFSS WILL PROVIDE MENTORING, GUIDANCE AND LEADERSHIP, TO CHILDREN AND YOUTH, AND YOUNG ADULTS AND ESTABLISH INTERGENERATIONAL RELATIONSHIPS THROUGH EXCHANGES OF STORIES AND IDEALS THAT HELP BOTH THE CHILDREN AND THE FGP VOLUNTEERS GAIN A BROADER PERCEPTION OF THE WORLD. FGP VOLUNTEERS SERVE 32 OF THE 77 COMMUNITY AREAS IN CHICAGO. RESIDENTS IN THESE COMMUNITIES HAVE A HIGHER LIKELIHOOD OF LIVING BELOW THE FEDERAL POVERTY LEVEL, EXPERIENCING HIGH RATES OF CRIME, HIGH DROP-OUT RATES AND LOWER LITERACY SKILLS. HISTORICALLY, THE OUTCOMES ACHIEVED HAVE IMPROVED LITERACY AND MATH SKILLS, PERSONAL DEVELOPMENT AND LIVING SKILLS, SCHOOL READINESS AND PROMOTION TO THE NEXT GRADE LEVEL.

AN ESTIMATED 95 FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE BETWEEN 15 TO 40 HOURS PER YEAR SERVING AT RISK CHILDREN.  OF THIS NUMBER AT LEAST 82 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE WORKING ONE ON ONE READING, DEVELOPING MATH SKILLS, DEVELOPMENTAL SKILLS, AND OVERALL MENTORING TO ENCOURAGE POSITIVE CLASSROOM BEHAVIOR. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS K-12 SUCCESS AND SCHOOL READINESS.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, OUR ANTICIPATED OUTCOME IS TO MAKE SIGNIFICANT STRIDES IN K-12 EDUCATION AND SCHOOL READINESS BY PLACING A MINIMUM OF 75 PERCENT OF UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEER IN THE WORK PLANS WHICH ADDRESS THESE TWO AREAS. EVERY YEAR, OVER 80% OF THE SITES WILL REPORT THAT THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEER MADE A SIGNIFICANT POSITIVE IMPACT IN THE YOUTH THAT THEY SERVED.

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $494,295 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY AT LEAST $49,429 AS THE ANTICIPATED AMOUNT OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

CATHOLIC CHARITIES, DIOCESE OF JOLIET, A NOT FOR PROFIT SOCIAL SERVICE AGENCY, IS SEEKING FUNDING FOR THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM SERVING WILL COUNTY ILLINOIS.  CATHOLIC CHARITIES MISSION IS: "WE ARE A FAITH-BASED ORGANIZATION PROVIDING SERVICES TO PEOPLE IN NEED AND CALLING OTHERS OF GOOD WILL TO DO THE SAME."  THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM WILL SUPPORT 43 VOLUNTEER SERVICES YEARS WITH $255,130 OF FUNDING FROM THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE.  FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL PROVIDE ONE-ON-ONE TUTORING/MENTORING TO OVER 250 CHILDREN AND WILL PROVIDE 44,892 HOURS OF SERVICE ANNUALLY.  FOSTER GRANDPARENT SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL CONCENTRATE THEIR EFFORT IN THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA AND THE SCHOOL READINESS AND K-12 SUCCESS OBJECTIVES.  THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM WILL UTILIZE CNCS PERFORMANCE MEASURES: ED21: NUMBER OF CHILDREN THAT COMPLETED PARTICIPATION IN CNCS-SUPPORTED EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION PROGRAMS; ED23: NUMBER OF CHILDREN DEMONSTRATING GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS IN TERMS OF SOCIAL AND /OR EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT; ED2: NUMBER OF STUDENTS THAT COMPLETED PARTICIPATION IN THE CNCS-SUPPORTED K-12 EDUCATION PROGRAMS; ED5: NUMBER OF STUDENTS WITH IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY AND/OR MATH; ED4A: NUMBER OF DISADVANTAGED YOUTH/MENTOR MATCHES WITH SPECIAL OR EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS/MENTOR MATCHES THAT WERE SUSTAINED BY THE CNCS-SUPPORTED PROGRAM FOR AT LEAST THE REQUIRED TIME PERIOD.  THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM WILL UTILIZE A STANDARD TEACHER SURVEY TO MEASURE THE PERFORMANCE OF THE PROGRAM. THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES OF THE PROGRAM WILL BE: 80% OF CHILDREN IN EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION PROGRAMS ASSIGNED TO A FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SOCIAL AND/OR EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT; 80% OF CHILDREN IN ELEMENTARY EDUCATION PROGRAMS ASSIGNED TO A FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE.

THE MISSION OF SOUTHWESTERN ILLINOIS COLLEGE (SWIC), THE GRANT APPLICANT, IS TO UPHOLD THE DIGNITY AND WORTH OF ALL PEOPLE AND HOLDS THE BELIEF THAT LEARNING IS A LIFE-LONG PROCESS WHICH ENHANCES THE QUALITY OF LIFE. SWIC SEEKS TO CONTINUE SUPPORTING THE COMMUNITY IT SERVES BY APPLYING FOR FISCAL YEAR 2018 RENEWAL (YEAR 1 OF 3) OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) GRANT PROVIDED BY THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS). IF GIVEN THE OPPORTUNITY TO BE AWARDED THIS RENEWAL GRANT, SWIC FGP WILL PLACE THE REQUESTED 52 VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS (VSY) IN SERVICE ACTIVITIES THAT WILL ASSIST CHILDREN WITH EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS IN ST. CLAIR, MONROE AND RANDOLPH COUNTIES IN SCHOOLS, HEAD STARTS, NOT-FOR-PROFIT DAYCARES, AND COMMUNITY CENTERS TO ASSIST THEM IN MAKING PROGRESS TOWARD THEIR INDIVIDUAL GOALS.  IN ALIGNMENT WITH THE CNCS STRATEGIC PLAN, SWIC FGP HAS PRIORITIZED EDUCATION AS THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA. THROUGH A SUPPORTIVE PARTNERSHIP OF 21 VOLUNTEER STATIONS, FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE LOVING AND EXPERIENCED TUTORS AND MENTORS TO YOUTH WITH EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS WHO WILL CARRY OUT SERVICE ACTIVITIES SUCH AS TUTORING, SUPPORTING SCHOOL READINESS, AND IMPROVING SCHOOL ATTENDANCE FOR IDENTIFIED CHILDREN IN NEED. OVER THE NEXT 3 YEARS THE TARGET OUTCOME IS TO SUPPORT 156 OR MORE EXCEPTIONAL CHILDREN EACH YEAR FROM BIRTH THROUGH MIDDLE SCHOOL. EXECUTIVE SUMMARY 
TRI-COUNTY OPPORTUNITIES COUNCIL (TCOC) IS THE COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY WHICH SPONSORS THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM OF WESTERN ILLINOIS (FGP). TRI-COUNTY OPPORTUNITIES COUNCIL (TCOC) WAS ORGANIZED AND INCORPORATED IN 1965 BY A GROUP OF INTERESTED CITIZENS FROM LEE, OGLE, AND WHITESIDE COUNTIES FOR THE PURPOSES OF INVESTIGATING THE FREQUENCY, LOCATION, CHARACTER AND CAUSE OF POVERTY; AND COORDINATING EFFORTS TO PREVENT, ALLEVIATE AND ELIMINATE POVERTY THROUGH THE COOPERATION OF PUBLIC AGENCIES, PRIVATE ORGANIZATIONS, BUSINESS, INDUSTRY AND INTERESTED INDIVIDUALS. TO STRENGTHEN AND ENABLE LOW-INCOME PEOPLE TO BECOME SELF-SUFFICIENT THROUGH THE ATTAINING OF NECESSARY SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE, MOTIVATIONS AND OPPORTUNITIES.
TO BETTER ORGANIZE A WIDE RANGE OF SERVICES RELATED TO THE NEEDS OF LOW-INCOME PEOPLE IN BUREAU, CARROLL, LASALLE, LEE, MARSHALL, OGLE, PUTNAM, STARK AND WHITESIDE COUNTIES BY UTILIZATION OF INNOVATIVE APPROACHES AND NEW TYPES OF SERVICES IN ATTACKING THE CAUSES OF POVERTY INCLUDING THE SUPPORT OF SELF-HELP GROUPS AND COOPERATIVE EFFORTS OF LOW-INCOME PEOPLE.
TO ENCOURAGE PARTICIPATION OF LOW-INCOME PEOPLE IN THE PLANNING, DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF PROGRAMS AND PROJECTS AND IN THE DECISION MAKING PROCESSES OF GOVERNMENTAL ENTITIES AFFECTING THEIR LIVES. TO STRENGTHEN THE CAPABILITIES OF THE CAA'S COMMUNITY FOR PLANNING AND COORDINATING FEDERAL, STATE, LOCAL AND PRIVATE ASSISTANCE RELATED TO THE ELIMINATION OF POVERTY BY BROADENING THE RESOURCE BASE OF PROGRAMS TO INCLUDE PUBLIC OFFICIALS, PRIVATE ORGANIZATIONS, INDIVIDUALS, BUSINESS AND INDUSTRY.

THE AGENCY CURRENTLY EMPLOYS 217 INDIVIDUALS AND IS MADE UP OF SEVEN MAIN FEDERAL AND STATE GRANT FUNDED PROGRAMS INCLUDING THE COMMUNITY SERVICES BLOCK GRANT PROGRAM (CSBG), THE LOW INCOME HOME ENERGY ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (LIHEAP), THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP), THE WEATHERIZATION PROGRAM, THE HOUSING PROGRAM, AND THE HEAD START PROGRAM. THE AGENCY SERVES BUREAU, CARROLL, LASALLE, LEE, MARSHALL, OGLE, PUTNAM, STARK, AND WHITESIDE COUNTIES. THESE NINE COUNTIES COVER AN EXPANSE OF 5,454 SQUARE MILES. THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM BEGAN 52 YEARS AGO IN 1966 AT TRI-COUNTY AND IS ONE OF THE OLDEST PROGRAMS AT THE AGENCY AND WAS AMONG THE FIRST FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAMS IN THE STATE OF ILLINOIS.
WE WILL BE REQUESTING $316,120 OF FEDERAL FUNDS AND NON FEDERAL FUNDS(MATCH) $41,647. AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT, APPROXIMATELY 72 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL PROVIDE OVER 225,000 HOURS OF SERVICE TO OVER 720 AT-RISK CHILDREN IN THE 9 COUNTY SERVICE AREA OF TRI COUNTY OPPORTUNITIES COUNCIL, IN WESTERN ILLINOIS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA WILL BE EDUCATION; SCHOOL READINESS AND K-12 SUCCESS.  FOSTER GRANDPARENT WILL SERVE IN 25 PUBLIC SCHOOL SITES AND 11 PRESCHOOLS WORKING ONE ON ONE WITH AT RISK CHILDREN.  AT THE END OF EACH GRANT/ ACADEMIC YEAR, THE OUTCOMES PROJECTED WILL SHOW NO LESS THAN IMPROVEMENT OF 80% IN EACH OF THE AREAS LISTED.

THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM OFFERS 70 SENIORS AGED 55 AND OVER OPPORTUNITIES TO SERVE AS MENTORS, TUTORS, AND CAREGIVERS FOR CHILDREN WITH EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS. THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM'S MISSION IS TO BRING TOGETHER THE MATURE PERSON AND A YOUNG CHILD IN WAYS THAT HELP EACH INDIVIDUAL GROW. BOTH THE SENIOR AND THE CHILD LEARN WHAT IT MEANS TO GIVE, ACCEPT, MENTOR, AND GAIN UNDERSTANDING.  THE PROGRAM'S PRIMARY FOCUS IS EDUCATION; HELPING EACH CHILD WITH READING, SPELLING, MATH, WRITING.  IN DOING SO, INFANTS AND TODDLERS, AND STUDENTS K-12 DEVELOP TRUSTING RELATIONSHIPS WITH ADULTS SO THEY GROW TO BELIEVE IN THEMSELVES AND BECOME A CONFIDENT LEARNER.

THE UNITED STATES VIRGIN ISLANDS (USVI) IS REQUESTING CONTINUING FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $218, 798 FOR THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM TO SUPPORT 58 VSYS.  THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IS PART OF SENIOR CORPS, ADMINISTERED BY THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE, THE FEDERAL AGENCY THAT SUPPORTS SERVICE AND VOLUNTEERING. THE FGP PROGRAM CONSISTS OF VOLUNTEERS AGE 55 AND OLDER WHO PROVIDES ONE-ON-ONE ASSISTANCE, TO MANY CHILDREN IN VARIOUS PUBLIC AND PRIVATE EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS. THESE CHILDREN RANGE FROM VARIOUS AGE GROUPS IN THE COMMUNITY, AT THE PRE- SCHOOL, EARLY HEAD START AND ELEMENTARY SCHOOL.  
THE TERRITORY'S ANNUAL YEARLY PROGRESS (AYP) SCORES DEMONSTRATES THAT MANY OF THE PUBLIC SCHOOLS ARE BELOW THE NATIONAL STANDARDS OF 50%. TO HELP INCREASE THE AYP SCORES, FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE ONE-ON-ONE ASSISTANCE TO MANY STUDENTS IN THE CLASSROOM BY HELPING THEM TO STAY ON TASK. ADDITIONALLY, TEAMING UP WITH FGP WILL HELP TO IMPROVE THEIR PROFICIENCY IN READING AND MATH AND SOCIAL MANAGEMENT.  
A FUTURE GOAL OF THE PROGRAM IS TO GET MALES FGP ENROLLED IN THE PROGRAM. HAVING MALES INVOLVED IN THE PROGRAM WILL HELP TO MENTOR AND GUIDE YOUNG MEN TO BECOME WELL ROUNDED RESPONSIBLE CITIZENS IN THE COMMUNITY. 
THE PROGRAM WITH THE ASSISTANCE OF OTHER COMMUNITY MEMBERS AND ORGANIZATIONS, AND THE ADVISORY COUNCIL, WILL TARGET AFTER SCHOOL PROGRAMS, YOUTH REHABILITATION CENTERS ETC, TO ASSIST THE YOUNGER MALE POPULATION.
 THE UNITED STATES VIRGIN ISLANDS (USVI) COMPRISES OF FOUR NON-CONTIGUOUS ISLANDS SEPARATED BY THE CARIBBEAN AND ATLANTIC OCEAN.  ST. CROIX, ST. THOMAS, ST. JOHN AND WATER ISLAND.  THE TOTAL AREA OF THE USVI IS 133 SQUARE MILES. 
THE FGP PROGRAM IS ONE OF 13 UNITS UNDER THE DEPARTMENT OF HUMAN SERVICES, DIVISION OF SENIOR CITIZENS AFFAIRS, WHOSE MISSION IS TO SEEK, TO ENSURE A COORDINATED AND COMPREHENSIVE SYSTEM OF QUALITY SERVICES, TO PREVENT ISOLATION AMONG SENIORS AND TO ADVOCATE COMMUNITY RESPONSIVENESS OF THOSE SERVICES. THE DEPARTMENTS MISSION STATEMENT IS TO PROVIDE SOCIAL SERVICES THAT WILL ENHANCE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES WITH DIVERSE NEEDS.  WORKING TOGETHER TO CARRY OUT THE MISSION OF THE DEPARTMENT, FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AS ROLE MODELS, MENTORS, AND A FRIEND IN THE CHILDREN LIVES THAT THEY MAKE CONTACT WITH.

HSOR PLANS ON PLACING 100% OF FOSTER GRANDPARENT'S IN WORK PLANS THAT RESULT IN AGENCY-WIDE OUTCOMES WITH APPROXIMATELY 43% OF FOSTER GRANDPARENTS SERVING IN THE K-12 SUCCESS AGENCY-WIDE PRIORITY MEASURE AND 57% OF FOSTER GRANDPARENTS SERVING IN THE SCHOOL READINESS AGENCY-WIDE PRIORITY MEASURE.
