APPLICANT LEGAL NAME: COASTAL COMMUNITY ACTION, INC. (CCA) 
BEING THAT THE SPONSOR AGENCY, CCA, IS A COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY, WE ADHERE TO THE NATIONAL COMMUNITY ACTION PROMISE: COMMUNITY ACTION CHANGES PEOPLE'S LIVES, EMBODIES THE SPIRIT OF HOPE, IMPROVES COMMUNITIES AND MAKES AMERICA A BETTER PLACE TO LIVE. WE CARE ABOUT THE ENTIRE COMMUNITY AND ARE DEDICATED TO HELPING PEOPLE HELP THEMSELVES AND EACH OTHER. 
THE CCA MISSION STATEMENT: TO RESPECTFULLY AND RESPONSIBLY HELP PEOPLE HELP THEMSELVES. 
OUR VISION: TO BE A LEADING FORCE IN IMPROVING THE LIVES OF THOSE WE SERVE. 
THE ANNUAL ALLOCATION OF $295,880 WILL BE UTILIZED TO SUPPORT FROM 50 - 55 VOLUNTEERS IN THE ALLOTTED 50 VSYS. THE PROJECT WILL ADDRESS THE IDENTIFIED NEEDS OF CHILDREN IN THE PUBLIC SCHOOLS,  THE HEAD START PROGRAM AND AFTERSCHOOL & SUMMER ENRICHMENT PROGRAMS.  VOLUNTEERS WILL BE ASSIGNED INDIVIDUAL CHILDREN AND WORK ONE-ON-ONE TO ASSIST THEM TO ACHIEVE THEIR INDIVIDUAL GOALS AS OUTLINED ON THE CHILD ASSIGNMENT FORM AND DEVELOPED BY THE TEACHERS PRIOR TO PLACEMENT WITH FG.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
A TOTAL OF 80 FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST APPROXIMATELY 100 CHILDREN ONE-ON-ONE. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL CONTINUE TO INCLUDE:  1) SUPPORTING LITERACY AND MATHEMATICAL DEVELOPMENT; 2) HELPING WITH CLASS ASSIGNMENTS AND HOMEWORK; 3) PROVIDING EDUCATIONAL ASSISTANCE TO CHILDREN IN SUMMER PROGRAMS; 4) WORKING WITH DEVELOPMENTALLY DISABLED CHILDREN ON MANIPULATIVES, SPEECH, AND MOTOR SKILLS; AND 5) HELPING PRE-ELEMENTARY CHILDREN IN AREAS OF PHONOLOGICAL & PRINT AWARENESS, ALPHABET KNOWLEDGE, AND SOCIAL RELATIONSHIPS. THIS PROJECT ADDRESSES EDUCATIONAL NEEDS WITHIN THE COMMUNITY, FOCUSING PRIMARILY ON ACADEMIC AND BEHAVIORAL GROWTH FOR CHILDREN WHO ARE AT RISK.  THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES FOR CHILDREN IN EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION CENTERS AND CHILDREN WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES OR DELAYS [THOSE WITH OTHER HUMAN NEEDS] WHO ENROLLED IN THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS PROGRAM WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS BASED ON THEIR SOCIAL AND/OR EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES FOR YOUTH IN ELEMENTARY EDUCATION  AND THOSE IN SUMMER PROGRAMS WHO COMPLETE PARTICIPATION IN THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS PROGRAM WILL SHOW ACADEMIC SUCCESS DEMONSTRATED BY AN IMPROVED PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY AND/OR MATH. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $250,538 IS SUPPLEMENTED BY $112,226 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES AS OF THIS WRITING. ADDITIONALLY, OUR FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS ARE CURRENTLY PLACED AT 30 STATIONS THROUGHOUT WAKE COUNTY AS FOLLOWS: 3 EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION CENTERS; 1 DEVELOPMENTAL EDUCATION CENTER; 22 PUBLIC ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS; 1 PUBLIC CHARTER SCHOOL; AND 3 SUMMER CAMP CENTERS.  FURTHERMORE, BY THE END OF FY 2018 PERFORMANCE PERIOD, FIFTY PERCENT OF THE INDIVIDUALS SERVED FOR AT LEAST 10 MONTHS WILL HAVE ACHIEVED THE APPROPRIATE MILESTONES IN LITERACY, MATH,  SOCIAL AND/OR EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT, AS OUTLINED IN THEIR EDUCATION ASSIGNMENT PLANS.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
WAYNE ACTION GROUP FOR ECONOMIC SOLVENCY (WAGES) IS THE SPONSOR ORGANIZATION FOR THE WAGES FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM. WAGES IS A LOCAL NON-PROFIT COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY WHICH PLANS, DEVELOPS, AND ADMINISTERS HUMAN SERVICE PROGRAMS DESIGNED TO MEET THE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY. WAGES WAS CHARTED BY A RESOLUTION OF THE WAYNE COUNTY COMMISSIONERS ON NOVEMBER 15, 1965.
WAGES IS DEDICATED TO HELPING PEOPLE IMPROVE THEIR QUALITY OF LIFE AND HEALTH AND GAIN INDEPENDENCE. WAGES ADVOCATES FOR THE DISADVANTAGED, ENCOURAGES PEOPLE TO RAISE THEIR SELF-ESTEEM THROUGH EDUCATION; PROVIDES SERVICES AND OPPORTUNITIES FOR VOLUNTEERISM; AND MOBILIZES COMMUNITY, PUBLIC AND PRIVATE RESOURCES.
THE WAGES FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IS REQUESTING 95 VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS (VSYS) AND $441,541  FEDERAL FUNDING FOR THE MULTI-YEAR PROJECT PERIOD OF 7/1/2017 - 6/30/2020. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THE WAGES FGP WILL BE EDUCATION. WAGES FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL PROVIDE SERVICES WHICH IMPROVE SCHOOL READINESS FOR ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED PRE-K CHILDREN AND ENHANCE THE EDUCATIONAL SUCCESS OF CHILDREN IN GRADES K-3.
THE GOAL OF THE STATE OF NORTH CAROLINA, ACCORDING TO GS115C-83, IS TO ENSURE THAT EVERY STUDENT READ AT OR ABOVE GRADE LEVEL BY THE END OF THIRD GRADE AND CONTINUE TO PROGRESS IN READING PROFICIENCY SO THAT HE OR SHE CAN READ, COMPREHEND, INTEGRATE, AND APPLY COMPLEX TEXTS NEEDED FOR SECONDARY EDUCATION AND CAREER SUCCESS.
IN WAYNE COUNTY ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS DURING THE 2015-2016 SCHOOL YEAR, ONLY 46.0% OF THE LOW-INCOME OR ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED ELEMENTARY SCHOOL STUDENTS READ AT OR ABOVE GRADE LEVEL WHICH IS LOWER THAN THE STATE AVERAGE OF 57.7% ACCORDING TO THE NC SCHOOL REPORT CARDS. PRINCIPALS FROM SIX ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS AND ONE CHARTER SCHOOL HAVE ACCEPTED FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS TO WORK ONE-ON-ONE WITH IDENTIFIED SPECIAL NEEDS STUDENTS. FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL FOCUS ON IMPROVING STUDENTS READING SKILLS THROUGH ONE-ON-ONE ASSISTANCE. FOSTER GRANDPARENTS PLACED AT THOSE ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS HAVE ONE MAJOR GOAL; TO INCREASE READING PROFICIENCY OF THE COUNTY'S LOW-INCOME OR ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED ELEMENTARY STUDENTS. 
WAGES HEAD START SERVES 640 ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED AND AT-RISK CHILDREN TO PREPARE THEM FOR SUCCESS IN KINDERGARTEN AND IN LIFE (WAGES 2016 COMMUNITY ASSESSMENT). FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE BY ENGAGING THEM ONE- ON-ONE, MODELING AND REINFORCING APPROPRIATE BEHAVIOR AND ENCOURAGING SELF-HELP SKILLS. FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS SERVING AT SIX HEAD START CENTERS WILL MENTOR AND PROVIDE SUPPORT TO PREPARE IDENTIFIED SPECIAL NEEDS CHILDREN FOR SUCCESS IN KINDERGARTEN.
CURRENT STATISTICS SHOW THAT THERE ARE 2,660 CHILDREN AGES 0-5 IN REGULATED CHILDCARE IN WAYNE COUNTY. AS OF MARCH 2016, THERE WERE 25 FIVE STAR CENTERS IN WAYNE COUNTY; FIVE OF
THOSE WERE OPERATED BY WAGES. MOREOVER, 59% (1,569) OF CHILDREN 0-5 ATTEND A 4 OR 5 STAR FACILITY. (WAGES 2016 COMMUNITY ASSESSMENT).
FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AS POSITIVE ROLE MODELS AND WILL FACILITATE THE DEVELOPMENT OF CHILDREN IN AT LEAST TWO OF THE COUNTY'S REGULATED CHILDCARE CENTERS. FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL ENGAGE IN ACTIVITIES WHICH ENCOURAGE SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT. FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL EMBRACE PRE-SCHOOL CHILDREN WHO HAVE BEGUN TO GAIN A SENSE OF SELF, AND HAVE STRONG EMOTIONS DURING THESE DEVELOPMENTAL YEARS. FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL PROVIDE GUIDANCE AND NURTURING SUPPORT DURING ONE-ON-ONE INTERACTIONS. THE GOAL OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS IS TO ENRICH THE PROGRESS AND GROWTH OF IDENTIFIED CHILDREN.
THE OVERALL ANTICIPATED OUTCOME OF THE WAGES FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IS TO POSITIVELY INFLUENCE THE DEVELOPMENT OF BOTH PRE-ELEMENTARY AGED AND ELEMENTARY AGED ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED YOUTH BY INCREASING THEIR READING PROFICIENCY AND IMPROVING THEIR POTENTIAL OF SUCCESS IN SCHOOL AND IN LIFE.

LAND OF SKY REGIONAL COUNCIL (LOSRC) IS A MULTI-COUNTY, LOCAL GOVERNMENT PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT ORGANIZATION IN NORTH CAROLINA. IT IS ONE OF 16 SUCH ORGANIZATIONS IN THE STATE AND SERVES REGION B, WHICH INCLUDES BUNCOMBE, HENDERSON, MADISON AND TRANSYLVANIA COUNTIES. THE PROFESSIONAL STAFF CARRIES OUT APPROVED PROGRAMS AND PROVIDES LOCAL GOVERNMENTS WITH GRANT AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE THROUGH THE DEPARTMENTS OF AREA AGENCY ON AGING, MOUNTAIN MOBILITY, ECONOMIC & COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT, AND MOUNTAIN WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT.
LOSRC'S MISSION IS TO PROVIDE CREATIVE REGIONAL SOLUTIONS TO RELEVANT AND EMERGING ISSUES IN BUNCOMBE, HENDERSON, MADISON AND TRANSYLVANIA COUNTIES WHILE PROVIDING A STANDARD OF EXCELLENCE IN THE DELIVERY OF FEDERAL, STATE, AND REGIONAL SERVICES FOR OUR MEMBER COMMUNITIES. 
EDUCATION CUTS, LARGER CLASSROOM SIZES, INCREASING DEMANDS AND EXPECTATIONS ON BOTH TEACHERS AND STUDENTS ARE JUST A FEW EXAMPLES OF CHALLENGES TEACHERS FACE DAILY.  AS PUBLIC SCHOOLS AND SMALL NON-PROFIT CHILDCARE CENTERS STRUGGLE TO MEET THESE CHALLENGES, THE NEED FOR VOLUNTEERS IS EVER INCREASING.  THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM CAN HELP MEET THIS NEED BY PROVIDING VOLUNTEERS TO SERVE ONE-ON-ONE WITH OVER 140 SPECIAL NEEDS AND AT-RISK CHILDREN IN OUR COMMUNITY.  
THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IS REQUESTING $335,654, OR 65 VSYS, TO PROVIDE ONE-ON-ONE ASSISTANCE TO AT-RISK CHILDREN TO HELP THEM ACHIEVE SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS IN TERMS OF SOCIAL AND/OR EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT AND IMPROVED ACADEMIC SUCCESS.  OF THIS NUMBER, 56 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS TO MEET OBJECTIVES IN SCHOOL READINESS, 36 FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST IN CLASSROOMS OF EARLY EDUCATION PROGRAMS AND HEAD START CENTERS SPECIALIZING IN SPECIAL AND EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS.  TO MEET OBJECTIVES IN K-12 SUCCESS, 20 FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL TUTOR IN PUBLIC SCHOOLS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE ASSISTING IN CLASSROOMS, ASSISTING IN CLASSROOM- HEAD START, AND TUTORING- PUBLIC SCHOOLS.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 75 CHILDREN IN SCHOOL READINESS AND K-12 SUCCESS PROGRAMS, 45 AND 30 CHILDREN RESPECTIVELY, WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SOCIAL AND/OR EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT AND IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE AS A RESULT OF THEIR RELATIONSHIP WITH A FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEER.  NINE FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST IN CLASSROOMS CARING FOR INFANTS.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $335,654 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $44,100 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

THE SOUTHERN MISSISSIPPI PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT DISTRICT (SMPDD), ONE OF TEN PLANNING DISTRICTS IN THE STATE, HAS A BRANCH OFFICE LOCATED IN HATTIESBURG, MISSISSIPPI. THIS BRANCH OFFICE HOUSES THE WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT DEPARTMENT, A MEDICARE WAIVER PROGRAM, AND A WORKFORCE INVESTMENT ACT YOUTH PROGRAM. THESE DEPARTMENTS ARE TIED DIRECTLY TO OUR EFFORTS TO IMPROVE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT AND THE LIVES OF OUR CITIZENS THROUGHOUT THE FIFTEEN COUNTY SERVICE AREA. THE MAIN OFFICE, LOCATED IN GULFPORT, MS, HOUSES THE AREA AGENCY ON AGING, THE SENIOR AIDES PROGRAM, AND VARIOUS OTHERS DEPARTMENTS NECESSARY TO ACHIEVE THE MISSION ENVISIONED BY OUR BOARDS AND EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. IT IS THROUGH THE AREA AGENCY ON AGING THAT THE HATTIESBURG FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (HFGP) IS MOST SUCCESSFUL. THE HFGP PROPOSES A SENIOR CORPS FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM PROJECT WITH 30 VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS (VSYS) FOR A TOTAL OF $179,544.  
ACCORDING TO THE FEDERAL NO CHILD LEFT BEHIND ACT, SCHOOLS MUST MEET ADEQUATE YEARLY PROGRESS (AYP), MEANING THAT A CERTAIN PERCENTAGE OF STUDENTS MUST ACHIEVE AT THE PROFICIENT LEVEL OR ABOVE. ABOUT 50% OF MISSISSIPPI SCHOOLS DID NOT MEET ALL THREE COMPONENTS OF AYP (READING/LANGUAGE ARTS, MATHEMATICS AND OTHER INDICATORS). WHEN LOOKING AT EACH COMPONENT, 86% OF SCHOOLS MET AYP IN READING/LANGUAGE ARTS; 84% MET AYP IN MATHEMATICS; AND 54% MET AYP IN THE AREA OF OTHER INDICATORS. IN ADDITION, MISSISSIPPI HAS THE HIGHEST DROPOUT RATE IN THE NATION. MANY OF THESE YOUTH FIND THEIR WAY TO OUT-OF-SCHOOL PROGRAMS FOR OCCUPATIONAL TRAINING AND GEDS. EMPLOYMENT FOR THESE INDIVIDUALS IS ONLY A GLIMMER IN THE FUTURE, NOT A CERTAINTY IN LIGHT OF THE UNEMPLOYMENT RATE, THE LACK OF SUPPORT, SKILLS, AND TRAINING. THIS PROJECT CAN AIDE, IF ONLY BY EXAMPLE, THE CHARACTERISTICS NECESSARY TO ALLOW THESE CHILDREN THE PROMISE OF A SELF-SUFFICIENT TOMORROW. 
THE HFGP PROJECT WILL ADDRESS THE FOLLOWING FOCUS AREA: EDUCATION (AFTERSCHOOL PROGRAMS, ELEMENTARY EDUCATION, HEAD START, PRE-ELEMENTARY DAY CARE, SPECIAL EDUCATION, AND OUT-OF-SCHOOL YOUTH.)  COLLECTION METHODS TO BE USED INCLUDE: ASSIGNMENT PLANS, TEACHER ASSESSMENT (PRE-/PRE- TEST), EVALUATION OF VOLUNTEER, SITE MONITORING TOOL, AND AGENCY IMPACT SURVEY. BY THE END OF THIS GRANT, HFGP ANTICIPATES HIGHER ATTENDANCE, MILDER BEHAVIOR, IMPROVED HOMEWORK AND BETTER GRADES.

THE YAZOO COUNTY BOARD OF SUPERVISORS VOWS ITSELF AND COUNTY GOVERNMENT AS BEING A SERVICE ORGANIZATION FULLY COMMITTED TO IMPROVING THE OVERALL QUALITY OF LIFE FOR ALL THE CITIZENS OF YAZOO COUNTY. ALL SERVICES, PROGRAMS AND FUNCTIONS OF OUR GOVERNMENT MUST SEEK TO EMPOWER THE CITIZENS OF YAZOO COUNTY TO LIVE INDEPENDENT, HEALTHY, PROSPEROUS AND ENJOYABLE LIVES. THE YAZOO COUNTY BOARD OF SUPERVISORS REALIZES THE GROWTH AND DEVELOPMENT OF YAZOO COUNTY IS INTEGRAL AND A NECESSARY COMPONENT OF MISSISSIPPI'S OVERALL GROWTH AND DEVELOPMENT. THE YAZOO COUNTY BOARD OF SUPERVISORS BECAME THE SPONSOR OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IN 2005.  THERE ARE CURRENTLY 32 VOLUNTEERS IN THE PROGRAM SERVING A TOTAL OF 1044 ANNUALLY.  THE YAZOO COUNTY BOARD OF SUPERVISOR REQUEST THE AMOUNT OF $145,088.00 FROM CNCS TO CONTINUE THE DAY TO DAY OPERATION OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM. THE YAZOO COUNTY FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROJECT WILL ADDRESS PRIMARILY THREE SERVICE CATEGORIES: EDUCATION, MENTORING AND TUTORING.  THE COMMUNITY NEEDS THAT THE FGP WILL ADDRESS WILL BE EDUCATION.  IN DOING A WEB BASED RESEARCH OF THE STATISTICS OF EDUCATION IN THE YAZOO COUNTY AREA, YAZOO COUNTY DROPOUT RATE OF GRADES 9-12 IN BOTH THE CITY (7%) AND COUNTY SCHOOL (6%) DISTRICTS WERE HIGHER THAN THE NATIONAL GRADES 9-12 DROPOUT RATE OF 4.4%.  THE YCFGP WILL PLACE 32 INDIVIDUALS IN THE ELEMENTARY SCHOOL SYSTEM.  THESE INDIVIDUAL WILL WORK ONE ON ONE OR IN A GROUP SETTING WITH THE YOUTHS.  BY CONSTANTLY WORKING WITH THE YOUTHS DAILY, MOTIVATING AND INSTILLING A "YES I CAN" ATTITUDE WILL INSPIRE THE YOUTHS TO EXCEL AND DO BETTER ACADEMICALLY.

THE MISSION OF COMMUNITIES IN SCHOOLS (CIS), THE NATION'S LEADING DROPOUT-PREVENTION ORGANIZATION, IS TO SURROUND STUDENTS WITH A COMMUNITY OF SUPPORT, EMPOWERING THEM TO STAY IN SCHOOL AND ACHIEVE IN LIFE.  CIS HAS A RESEARCH-BASED AND PROVEN-EFFECTIVE MODEL TO FACILITATE AND SUPPORT EDUCATION PROGRAMMING INSIDE A SCHOOL OR COMMUNITY CENTER THAT HELPS ASSESS NEEDS AND COORDINATE RESOURCES THAT REMOVE BARRIERS TO A STUDENT'S SUCCESS. 
THE GOAL OF THE CISFL FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROJECT IS TO INCREASE TUTORING AND SCHOOL READINESS FOR AT-RISK STUDENTS IN THE FORM OF FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS.   FOSTER GRANDPARENTS SERVING UNDER THE TUTORING ?PUBLIC SCHOOL WORK PLAN IN PUTNAM COUNTY WILL ASSIST AT-RISK CHILDREN WHO ARE STRUGGLING WITH PRE-LITERACY AND GRADE LEVEL LITERACY CHALLENGES.
COMMUNITIES IN SCHOOLS OF FLORIDA IS REQUESTING FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $172,200 TO SUPPORT 35 VSY?S WITH 42 VOLUNTEERS.  FOSTER GRANDPARENTS IN PUTNAM COUNTY WILL BE SERVING AT NINE (9) SCHOOLS AND (1) CHILD DEVELOPMENT CENTER INCLUDING:  MOSELEY ELEMENTARY SCHOOL, JAMES A. LONG ELEMENTARY, MELLON ELEMENTARY, BROWNING-PEARCE ELEMENTARY, MIDDLETON-BURNEY ELEMENTARY, EH MILLER SCHOOL (ALL GRADES- ALL ESE SCHOOL), INTERLACHEN ELEMENTARY, C. H. PRICE MIDDLE SCHOOL, RCMA WALKER CHILD DEVELOPMENT CENTER, AND OCHWILLA ELEMENTARY SCHOOL.
UNDER THE SCHOOL READINESS WORK PLAN ASSIGNMENTS WILL BE WORKING WITH CHILDREN WHO MAY HAVE EMOTIONAL BONDING ISSUES OR COGNITIVE, AFFECTIVE, OR PSYCHO-MOTOR DELAYS. THE ROLE OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE TO BUILD THE SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL SKILLS OF THE CHILDREN THEY ARE SERVING.  
THE PROJECT'S ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES ARE AS FOLLOWS: 1. CHILDREN RECEIVING LITERACY TUTORING WILL MAKE THE NECESSARY GAINS IN SKILLS AS MEASURED THROUGH I-READY AND/OR THE FSA TO BE PROMOTED TO THE NEXT GRADE. 2. CHILDREN SERVED IN SCHOOL READINESS WORK PLANS WILL MAKE ADEQUATE GAINS IN THE AREAS OF SOCIAL/EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT TO BE PROMOTED TO THE NEXT LEVEL OR BE KINDERGARTEN READY. 
THE ROLE OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE TO BUILD THE SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL SKILLS OF THE CHILDREN THEY ARE SERVING.  ACTIVITIES  UNDER THESE WORK PLANS MAY INCLUDE HOLDING/ROCKING TO PROVIDE COMFORT TO A CRYING CHILD, READING TO CHILDREN, HELPING CHILDREN CUT AND PASTE, PROVIDING  PRAISE AND ENCOURAGEMENT AS CHILDREN LEARN THEIR SHAPES, COLORS AND LETTERS, SING SONGS, AND PRACTICE WRITING THEIR NAMES. OTHER ACTIVITIES MAY INCLUDE PARTICIPATING IN A CHILD?S DRAMATIC PLAY, OR ENGAGING THEM IN BUILDING BLOCK OR PUZZLES. VOLUNTEERS WILL REINFORCE APPROPRIATE SOCIAL SKILLS SUCH AS SHARING AND TAKING TURNS. THEY WILL ALSO HELP CHILDREN TALK ABOUT THEIR FEELINGS, RESOLVE CONFLICT, AND FOLLOW CLASSROOM RULES. 
IN THE 2017/2018 GRANT CYCLE, COMMUNITIES IN SCHOOLS OF FLORIDA PROPOSES TO COORDINATE THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM SERVICES PREVIOUSLY PROVIDED BY THE DISSOLVED COMMUNITIES IN SCHOOLS OF NORTHEAST FLORIDA PROGRAM. CISFL IS ALSO WORKING TO REESTABLISH THE ORIGINAL CIS OF PUTNAM COUNTY PROGRAM, AND IS WORKING WITH VETERAN FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM COORDINATOR, LISA VALUKEVICH, WHO WILL CONTINUE TO COORDINATE THE PROGRAM IN PUTNAM COUNTY.

HISTORICALLY, THE ACTUAL NUMBER OF UNDUPLICATED FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL CHANGE DURING THE YEAR DUE TO UNFORESEEN ILLNESSES, DECLINING HEALTH AND/OR DEATH.  WE MONITOR PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS? ATTENDANCE TO PREVENT THIS FROM ADVERSELY AFFECTING OUR ATTAINMENT OF THE REQUIRED 28 VSYS FOR THE GRANT CYCLE.
AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT CYCLE, THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOME IS TO HAVE 28 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS, WORKING 20 TO 30 HOURS PER WEEK WITH 90% OF THE STUDENTS ACHIEVING SUCCESS IN LITERACY WHICH WILL ENSURE THEIR PROMOTION TO THE NEXT GRADE LEVEL AND OR EXCEED CURRENT EDUCATIONAL STANDARDS.  THE CURRENT CNCS TWELVE MONTH FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $145,387.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY A MINIMUM OF 20% NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.
OUR VOLUNTEERS RECEIVE PRE AND ONGOING MONTHLY TRAINING FROM RETIRED SCHOOL ADMINISTRATORS, EDUCATORS AND OTHER PROFESSIONALS IN CHILD CARE SERVICE AREAS FROM BOTH PRIVATE AND PUBLIC SECTORS.  MOST OF OUR FOSTER GRANDPARENTS SERVE AS VOLUNTEERS IN THEIR NEIGHBORHOOD SCHOOLS WHICH LENDS ITSELF TO A STRONGER COMMITMENT TO THE STUDENTS THEY SERVE IN THE CAPACITY OF MENTORS, TUTORS.  THEY ARE REFERRED TO BY THE SCHOOL ADMINISTRATORS AND EDUCATORS AS AN EXTRA PAIR OF EARS, EYES AND HANDS IN THE CLASSROOMS. 
THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM OF TUSCALOOSA COUNTY IS AN INTEGRAL PART OF THIS COMMUNITY.  OUR LOCAL GOVERNING OFFICIALS RECOGNIZES THE SIGNIFICANT ROLE THIS PROGRAM PLAYS IN THE EDUCATION OF THE CHILDREN IN TUSCALOOSA COUNTY AND HAVE INCLUDED US IN NATIONAL PUBLICATIONS.  WE ARE PROUD THAT THE CONTRIBUTIONS OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM HAVE BEEN INCLUDED IN TUSCALOOSA COUNTY'S SUBMISSIONS TO AMERICA PROMISE ALLIANCE FOR 100 BEST COMMUNITIES FOR YOUNG PEOPLE.  OUR COMMUNITY HAS BEEN IDENTIFIED SEVERAL YEARS AS ONE OF THE 100 BEST CITIES FOR CHILDREN IN AMERICA.

WYOMING SENIOR CITIZENS, INC.(WSCI), WAS FOUNDED IN 1975 AND IS A NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION WHOSE PURPOSE IS TO MEET THE NEEDS WYOMING'S OLDER RESIDENTS AND HELP THEM MAINTAIN THEIR INDEPENDENCE.  THE POPULATION OF WYOMING IS ONLY 582,658 WITH 13.1% OF THE POPULATION OVER 65.  WSCI SERVES THE ENTIRE STATE OF WYOMING THROUGH THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM, LONG-TERM CARE OMBUDSMAN AND ELDER ABUSE PROGRAMS, WYOMING HEALTH INSURANCE INFORMATION PROGRAM, SENIOR MEDICARE PATROL PROGRAM, NATIONAL FAMILY CAREGIVER SUPPORT PROGRAM,  NAVIGATOR MARKETPLACE PROGRAM,  AND THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM.
WSCI IS REQUESTING $309,803 FOR THIS PROJECT PERIOD IN ORDER TO SUPPORT 52 FEDERAL VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS OR VSYS.  THE PROGRAM STAFF AND VOLUNTEERS WILL MENTOR TROUBLED TEENAGERS AND YOUNG MOTHERS, CARE FOR PREMATURE INFANTS OR CHILDREN WITH DISABILITIES, AND HELP CHILDREN WHO HAVE BEEN ABUSED OR NEGLECTED.  THE PROGRAM STAFF AND VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO WORK TO SERVE THOSE CHILDREN WITH EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS, AND TEACH OTHER CHILDREN TO READ THROUGH ONE-ON-ONE TUTORING.  WSCI ANTICIPATES RECEIVING $24,152 IN STATE FUNDING AND AN ESTIMATED $11,000 FROM OTHER SOURCES TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE SUCCESS OF THIS PROGRAM.
THE FOCUS OF THIS APPLICATION WILL BE HEALTHY FUTURES OF WYOMING'S YOUTH THROUGH THE INVOLVEMENT OF GRANDPARENT MENTORS OVER AGE 55.  THE GOAL IS TO NOT ONLY HELP THE CHILDREN SUCCEED, BUT BUILD THE CONFIDENCE AND SELF WORTH OF THE SENIOR VOLUNTEERS AS WELL.  ONE OF THE TRULY FORGOTTEN RESOURCES IN OUR COMMUNITIES IS THE KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE HELD BY OUR ELDERS.  USING THEM AS A RESOURCE TO HELP AND SUPPORT OUR YOUTH IS A WIN-WIN FOR EVERYONE.  
THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS PROGRAM WILL SERVE 6 OF 23 COUNTIES IN WYOMING AND UTILIZE VOLUNTEER STATIONS TO ASSIST IN TRAINING AND MANAGEMENT OF THE VOLUNTEERS.  AN ESTIMATED 69 UN-DUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE OVER 200 CHILDREN THROUGHOUT THE AFFECTED COUNTIES.  FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL VOLUNTEER BETWEEN 15-40 HOURS PER WEEK MENTORING THE CHILDREN AS WELL AS TUTORING WITH READING AND MATH.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, WSCI ANTICIPATE 200 CHILDREN WILL INCREASE IN MATH AND OR READING SKILLS DUE TO THE MENTORING OF FOSTER GRANDPARENTS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $309,803 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY AN ESTIMATED $35,000 FROM STATE AND LOCAL FUNDS.

AN ESTIMATED 65 FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS COMPLETING 50 VSYS.  ACTIVITIES INCLUDE HOMEWORK ASSISTANCE AT SCHOOLS, LEARNING EXPERIENCES AND TEAM-BUILDING EXERCISES AT AFTER-SCHOOL PROGRAMS, AND MENTORING FOR CHILDREN IN HOSPITALS.  THE PRIMARY CNS FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION, WITH THE ADDED BENEFIT OF CREATING QUALITY VOLUNTEER EXPERIENCES FOR OLDER ADULTS THROUGH POSITIVE SOCIAL INTERACTION.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT (2 YEARS AND 5 MONTHS FOR THIS CYCLE), 234 YOUTH K-12 WILL SHOW IMPROVED ACADEMIC INVOLVEMENT FROM SCHOOL AND COMMUNITY-BASED MENTORING, AND 58 PRE-K CHILDREN WILL SHOW DEVELOPMENT IN SOCIAL/EMOTIONAL GROWTH. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $298,911 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $33,981 (NON-FEDERAL SOURCES).

THE UINTAH BASIN ASSOCIATION OF GOVERNMENTS, ORIGINALLY CALLED THE ASSOCIATION, WAS ESTABLISHED IN 1972 TO FACILITATE INTERGOVERNMENTAL COOPERATION AND TO ENSURE THE ORDERLY AND HARMONIOUS COORDINATION OF FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL PROGRAMS FOR THE SOLUTION OF MUTUAL PROBLEMS OF THE REGION.  THE UINTAH BASIN ASSOCIATION OF GOVERNMENTS (UBAOG) FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) IS ESTIMATING 42 FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN DAGGETT, UINTAH, AND DUCHESNE COUNTIES.  OF THIS NUMBER, 42 FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE, TUTORING STUDENTS ONE-ON-ONE IN FIRST AND SECONDARY SCHOOLS 2 TO 5 DAYS A WEEK FOR ONE HALF TO ONE HOUR PER STUDENT, HELPING THEM ACHIEVE THEIR GRADE LEVEL IN READING OR MATH, OR MENTOR AT-RISK CHILDREN.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS K - 12 SUCCESSES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE UBAOG FGP PROGRAM WILL HAVE HELPED APPROXIMATELY 200 STUDENTS IMPROVE ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY AND/OR MATH.   THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL & COMMUNITY SERVICES FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $205,841 FOR 12 MONTHS.  THIS WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY APPROXIMATELY $28,000 FROM STATE AND LOCAL RESOURCES.

AN ESTIMATED 15 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL SERVE OF THIS NUMBER 15 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE ASSISTING CHILDREN WHO ARE BEHIND IN CLASS WORK, ONE-ON-ONE READING SESSIONS, HELP WITH BASIC READING AND MATH SKILLS, LANGUAGE SKILLS, AND MENTORING TO INCREASE ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT, ATTENDANCE, CLASS PARTICIPATION, ETC. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION- K-12 SUCCESS: ED2 NUMBER OF STUDENT THAT COMPLETED PARTICIPATION IN CNCS-SUPPORTS K-12 EDUCATION PROGRAMS.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT 75 STUDENTS WILL HAVE IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY AND/OR MATH (ED5).  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $86,776 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $29,813.

THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM OF NORTHERN UTAH AND ITS SPONSORING ORGANIZATION, WEBER HUMAN SERVICES, WILL RETAIN AN ESTIMATED 70 FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS TO FULFILL THE REQUESTED 57 FEDERAL AND 7 NON-FEDERAL VSY?S.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION K-12 SUCCESS- NUMBER OF STUDENTS WITH IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY AND/OR MATH.
THE ACTIVITIES VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE INCLUDE, ONE-ON-ONE INTENSIVE TUTORING TO CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL AND/OR EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS WHO FALL BELOW BENCHMARK ON THE DYNAMIC INDICATORS OF BASIC EARLY LITERACY SKILLS (DIBELS) TEST IN ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS AND AFTER-SCHOOL SETTINGS. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT THE PROGRAM WILL FULFILL THE FOLLOWING OUTCOMES;

* 30 YOUTH WILL RECEIVE HELP WITH THEIR SCHOOL BASED ASSIGNMENTS IN AFTER-SCHOOL AND WILL RECEIVE SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL SKILLS THROUGH MENTORSHIP EACH YEAR.
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $814,605, ($271,535 PER YEAR) WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $106,377LOCAL MATCH ($35,459 PER YEAR), $16,500 STATE TRANSPORTATION DOLLARS, $10,000 IN SCHOOL DISTRICT FUNDS AND AN AVERAGE OF $30,600 IN IN-KIND DONATIONS TO THE PROGRAM.

THE GOAL OF THE SENIORS COUNCIL FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IS TO RECRUIT, TRAIN AND PLACE FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS INTO PRESCHOOL AND ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS IN AN EFFORT TO ENHANCE SCHOOL READINESS AMONG PRE SCHOOL CHILDREN AND EDUCATIONAL SUCCESS OF STUDENTS IN GRADES K-12. SERVING IN THE EDUCATION FOCUS AREA, FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL SERVE CHILDREN WHO ARE ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED AND/OR HAVE SPECIAL OR EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS BY ASSISTING IN THE CLASSROOM OF PRE SCHOOL CHILDREN AND TUTORING ELEMENTARY SCHOOL CHILDREN IN PUBLIC SCHOOLS.  CHILDREN WILL BE MENTORED AND TUTORED IN ACTIVITIES THAT WILL PROVIDE GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS AND IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE. SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE, BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO, COMMUNICATION EXERCISES, COGNITIVE ACTIVITIES, MODELING PROPER SOCIAL SKILLS, POSITIVE ENCOURAGEMENT AND REDIRECTION, AND HELP WITH SCHOOLWORK. BY THE END OF THE 3-YEAR GRANT WE ESTIMATE THAT A TOTAL OF 176 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL SERVE OF WHICH 172 WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. THESE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL VOLUNTEER AT APPROXIMATELY 29 STATIONS AND SERVE AN ESTIMATED 359 CHILDREN. 
     THE CNCS INVESTMENT OF $844,681 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY NOT LESS THAN $95,000 NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) HAS VOLUNTEERS WHO WILL SERVE IN LOCAL SCHOOLS TO ASSIST LOW-ACHIEVING, AT-RISK YOUTH.  RISK FACTORS, BASED ON LOCAL POVERTY LEVELS, INCLUDE PARENTAL ABSENCE, SUBSTANCE, AND OTHER FORMS OF ABUSE.  PROTECTIVE FACTORS INCLUDE CARING RELATIONSHIPS, POSITIVE ACCEPTANCE, HIGH EXPECTATIONS, AND INTERACTIVE OPPORTUNITIES.  SCHOOLS BENEFIT BY HAVING A NURTURING SENIOR AVAILABLE TO ENHANCE AND ENRICH THE CLASSROOM EXPERIENCE.  YOUTH BENEFIT WITH AN IMPROVED SCHOOL PERFORMANCE.

THEY WILL READ WITH THEIR YOUTH AND TUTOR IN LOW ACHIEVING SUBJECTS SUCH AS MATH, LANGUAGE ARTS, AND SOCIAL SKILLS.  FGPS WILL HELP YOUTH THROUGH PRAISE, ONE-ON-ONE NURTURING, AND ENSURING EACH CHILD'S OPPORTUNITY TO INTERACT AND LEARN.  AT THE TEACHER'S DIRECTION, FGPS WILL WORK BETWEEN 15 AND 40 HOURS EACH WEEK IN THEIR CLASSROOM.  FGPS WILL WORK WITH ANY GRADE AT THE DISCRETION OF THE PRINCIPAL.

CURRENTLY, 12 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS VOLUNTEER WITH THE WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS' (DOC) DIVISION OF JUVENILE CORRECTIONS (DJC) AT WISCONSIN'S JUVENILE CORRECTIONAL FACILITIES, LINCOLN HILLS SCHOOL (LHS) AND COPPER LAKE SCHOOL (CLS), AND COMMIT 28-30 HOURS OF SERVICE PER WEEK. THOUGH HOUSED ON THE SAME CAMPUS, LHS AND CLS ARE CONSIDERED TWO DISTINCT FACILITIES AND FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) SITES. WITH CONTINUED SUPPORT FROM CNCS, DJC HOPES TO EXPAND ITS PROGRAM TO INCLUDE AN ESTIMATED 18 LOW-INCOME OLDER ADULTS WHO WILL SERVE AS FGP VOLUNTEERS AT LHS AND CLS. THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL BUILD UPON THE EFFORTS OF EXISTING VOLUNTEERS AND INCLUDE BOTH SCHOOL-BASED AND COMMUNITY-BASED MENTORING FOR BOTH THE DISADVANTAGED YOUTH AND YOUTH WITH SPECIAL NEEDS IN THE INSTITUTIONS, WITH A PRIMARY FOCUS ON EDUCATION FOR K-12 SUCCESS. AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT PERIOD, NEARLY 200 YOUTH WILL HAVE IMPROVED THEIR ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT THROUGH INCREASED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT. THE CNCS INVESTMENT OF $138,460 IN ANNUAL FEDERAL FUNDING WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $34,015 IN STATE-FUNDED DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS IN-KIND SUPPORT.	 
DJC'S FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM HAS SERVED WISCONSIN'S YOUTH AT LHS SINCE 1973 AND YOUTH AT CLS SINCE IT OPENED IN 2011. THE FGP HELPS TO ENGAGE LOW-INCOME OLDER ADULTS IN THEIR COMMUNITY WHILE ALSO CREATING LASTING BONDS WITH AND PROMOTING POSITIVE CHANGE AMONG WISCONSIN'S DISADVANTAGED AND AT-RISK YOUTH. THE FGP ALSO PROMOTES TOLERANCE, RESPECT, AND HEALTHY LIVING ACTIVITIES BY ENABLING MULTI-GENERATIONAL INTERACTIONS.

GOODWILL INDUSTRIES OF SOUTHEASTERN WISCONSIN IS RESPONDING TO THE NOTICE OF FUNDING OPPORTUNITY (NOFO) FOR THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM FOR OPERATIONS IN RACINE AND KENOSHA COUNTIES.  OUR ORGANIZATION HAS HAD THE PLEASURE OF ADMINISTERING THIS PROGRAM IN THESE COUNTIES SINCE 1993, IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES. WE RUN A SUCCESSFUL PROGRAM FOR OLDER ADULTS, WORKING WITH STAFF AND STUDENTS AT 11 SCHOOLS IN RACINE COUNTY AND 6 SCHOOLS IN KENOSHA COUNTY. THESE VOLUNTEERS ARE WILLING TO SHARE THEIR EXPERIENCE, ABILITIES AND SKILLS FOR THE BETTERMENT OF THEIR COMMUNITY TO ENRICH THE LIVES OF CHILDREN WHOM THEY SERVE. THE ONE-ON-ONE ATTENTION A VOLUNTEER GIVES THESE STUDENTS MAKES A MEASURABLE DIFFERENCE IN THE STUDENTS' GRADES, READING AND MATH ABILITIES, THEIR ATTITUDE TOWARDS LEARNING, AND IS A POSITIVE EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCE. THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM ALSO PROVIDES MANY BENEFITS TO THE VOLUNTEERS, OFFERING THEM THE OPPORTUNITY TO MENTOR AND PUT THEIR LIFE EXPERIENCES TO WORK IN THEIR OWN COMMUNITIES. QUALITY OF LIFE FOR VOLUNTEERS IS GREATLY ENHANCED THROUGH PARTICIPATION IN THIS PROGRAM, AS ONE VOLUNTEER RECENTLY STATED, "HELPING THESE CHILDREN GIVES ME A REASON TO GET OUT OF BED IN THE MORNING. THEY DEPEND ON ME."  
GOODWILL HAS CONSISTENTLY MET THE SCHOOL-BASED NATIONAL PERFORMANCE MEASURE REQUIREMENTS AND OTHER CRITERIA OF THE PROGRAM. MOVING FORWARD, IT IS THE DESIRE OF GOODWILL TO CONTINUE THIS LEGACY PROGRAM THROUGH PARTNERSHIP WITH THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS).  AN ESTIMATED 40 FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AND BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE SCHOOL BASED MENTORING AND TUTORING, AND ASSISTING IN THE CLASSROOM. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THERE WILL BE AN INCREASE IN THE NUMBER OF CHILDREN DEMONSTRATING GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS IN TERMS OF SOCIAL AND/OR EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT, AND LITERACY AND MATH SKILLS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT REQUESTED OF $179,528 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $20,807 IN NON-FEDERAL MATCH SUPPORT. 
WITH CHANGES IN 2016 TO REQUEST FUNDING DIRECTLY THROUGH CNCS, GOODWILL IS SUBMITTING A BUDGET THAT DOES NOT COMPLY WITH THE REQUIRED 80/20 RULE, HOWEVER, IT REFLECTS THE PROGRAM AT FULLY OPERATIONAL WITH OUR FOSTER GRANDPARENT SUPERVISOR AT 40 HRS PER WEEK. THIS WILL ALLOW US TO ACHIEVE 30 VSY'S. WE RESPECTFULLY REQUEST A WAIVER TO THE 80/20 RULE.

COMMUNITY RELATIONS-SOCIAL DEVELOPMENT COMMISSION (SDC) REQUESTS SUPPORT FROM THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE TO OPERATE THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) IN MILWAUKEE COUNTY.  BY YEAR THREE OF THE GRANTING PERIOD 40-50 UNDUPLICATED, LOW-INCOME ADULTS, AGES 55 AND ABOVE WILL SERVE AS VOLUNTEERS AT 24 VOLUNTEER STATIONS. WITH CONTRIBUTIONS FROM COMMITTED VOLUNTEERS, THE FGP WILL SERVE 285 STUDENTS IN ONE-ON-ONE TUTORING AND BETWEEN 500-750 LOW-INCOME CHILDREN IN CLASSROOMS ANNUALLY. AN ANNUAL BUDGET OF $258,703 (INCLUDING STATE AND NATIONAL FUNDING) WILL SUPPORT PROGRAM STAFF, VOLUNTEERS, AND CHILDREN WHO ARE ENROLLED IN LOCAL SCHOOLS AND NON-PROFIT PRESCHOOLS IN MILWAUKEE, WI. 
BECAUSE SDC HAS SIGNIFICANT EXPERIENCE AS AN ADMINISTRATOR AND PROVIDER OF THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP), WE BELIEVE WE ARE WELL-POSITIONED TO OPERATE THIS PROGRAM. OUR CURRENT SCP PROGRAM AND ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF ARE FAMILIAR WITH THE PROGRAM REQUIREMENTS, VSYS, AND WILL BE ABLE TO QUICKLY DEVELOP AN EFFECTIVE TRANSITION. THIS ENSURES THAT EXISTING VOLUNTEERS AND PARTICIPATING SCHOOLS CONTINUE TO DEVOTE THEIR EFFORTS  SUPPORTING CHILDREN WHO GROW-UP IN OUR COMMUNITY.   TO ACCOMPLISH THIS, SDC WILL COORDINATE THE DEVELOPMENT OF OUR WORK PLAN AND PROGRAM PROCEDURES WITH ASSISTANCE FROM INTERFAITH OLDER ADULT PROGRAMS, INC., WHO CURRENTLY FACILITATES FGP IN MILWAUKEE COUNTY.  PRELIMINARY MEETINGS WITH STAFF AT INTERFAITH AND THE MILWAUKEE PUBLIC SCHOOLS DISTRICT HAS PROVIDED US WITH RESOURCES AND TOOLS TO DUPLICATE SUCCESSES IN THE PROGRAM.

SOUTHWESTERN WISCONSIN COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM (SOUTHWEST CAP) HAS SERVED AS A SPONSOR OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM FOR NEARLY 40 YEARS IN SIX RURAL COUNTIES. SOUTHWEST CAP IS SEEKING TO EXPAND FGP TO TWO CONTIGUOUS COUNTIES WITH 6 VSYS.  AN ESTIMATED SIX TO  TWELVE LOW  INCOME ADULTS WILL SERVE  AS FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS  IN 3-12 SCHOOLS  IN TWO   RURAL COUNTIES IN SOUTHWEST WISCONSIN.  FIVE OF THE SIX VSYS WILL SERVE IN OUTCOME POSITIONS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE:  TUTORING, SERVING AS A ROLE MODEL, READING/LITERACY, AND MATH LITERACY/OPERATIONS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION / K-12 SUCCESS.  AT THE END OF THE 3 YEAR GRANT IT IS ANTICIPATED ALMOST 100 STUDENTS WILL BE SERVED.  THE ANNUAL CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $30,053 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $3,336 NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES AND $250 IN LOCAL RESOURCES.  
THE FGP  ENGAGES LOW INCOME OLDER ADULTS IN A PURPOSEFUL ACTIVITY THAT PROMOTES  HEALTHY LIVING BY INTERGENERATIONAL VOLUNTEERING.  THE CONNECTION TO SOUTHWESTERN WISCONSIN COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM PROVIDES RESOURCES TO ASSIST THE LOW INCOME ADULTS

WORKFORCE CONNECTIONS, INC. (WCI) IS A NON-PROFIT COMMUNITY PARTNER DEDICATED TO
PROVIDING SERVICES AND TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES TO JOB SEEKERS AND BUSINESSES THROUGHOUT WESTERN WISCONSIN FOR 33 YEARS.  WCI IS COMMITTED TO CONNECTING PEOPLE, WORK, AND TRAINING TO PROMOTE SELF-SUFFICIENCY.    
NEARLY 20% OF KIDS IN WISCONSIN LIVE IN POVERTY (UNIVERSITY OF WISCONSIN).  THE EFFECTS OF POVERTY ON CHILDREN SHOW IN THE FORM OF INABILITY TO LEARN IN THE CLASSROOM AT THE SAME LEVEL AS THEIR PEERS, LONG-TERM HEALTH ISSUES, AND THE INABILITY TO BE SELF-SUFFICIENT LATER IN LIFE.  ADULTS, 55 AND OLDER ALSO FACE CHALLENGES SUCH AS THE RISING COST OF LIVING, HEALTHCARE COSTS, AND LONELINESS.  THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM WILL HELP TO ADDRESS THESE COMMUNITY CONCERNS BY ENLISTING THE VOLUNTEER SERVICES OF SENIORS TO TUTOR CHILDREN TO HELP THEM IMPROVE MATH AND LITERACY SKILLS, IMPROVE CLASSROOM ENGAGEMENT, AND SCHOOL ATTENDANCE.  IN RETURN, FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL RECEIVE PROGRAM BENEFITS, A SENSE OF PURPOSE, AND HEALTH BENEFITS.
AN ESTIMATED 114 FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE 7 COUNTIES OF WESTERN WISCONSIN; LA CROSSE, MONROE, PEPIN, BUFFALO, TREMPEALEAU, JACKSON, AND JUNEAU THROUGHOUT THE 3-YEAR PROGRAM.  OF THIS NUMBER 114 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS THROUGHOUT SCHOOLS IN THE 7 COUNTY AREA.  VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TUTORING IN MATH AND LITERACY WHICH WILL RESULT IN 75% OF CHILDREN SERVED EXPERIENCING UPGRADED MATH AND LITERACY SCORES BY AT LEAST ONE GRADE, A DEMONSTRATED ADVANCEMENT IN CLASSROOM ENGAGEMENT, AND IMPROVED SCHOOL ATTENDANCE.  
UPON COMPLETION OF THE 3-YEAR PROGRAM, APPROXIMATELY 450 CHILDREN WILL HAVE BEEN TUTORED WITH AT LEAST A 75% SUCCESS RATE.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $450,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $50,000 OF NON-FEDERAL SOURCES.

SINCE 1919 ENCOMPASS EARLY EDUCATION AND CARE, INC. HAS PROVIDED HIGH QUALITY CARE AND EDUCATION FOR THE CHILDREN AND FAMILIES OF BROWN COUNTY, AND SINCE 1978 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS HAVE PLAYED A SIGNIFICANT ROLE IN THE ABILITY TO DO SO. TODAY ENCOMPASS SERVES APPROXIMATELY 750 CHILDREN PER DAY WITHIN ITS SEVEN NATIONALLY ACCREDITED, UNITED WAY SUPPORTED PROGRAMS, ENSURING ALL CHILDREN HAVE ACCESS TO HIGH QUALITY EARLY CARE AND EDUCATION. AN ESTIMATED 30 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS ANNUALLY WILL SERVE CHILDREN AT ENCOMPASS EARLY EDUCATION AND CARE, INC. IN GREEN BAY AND DE PERE, WISCONSIN.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA WILL BE EDUCATION IN THE AREA OF 4K/SCHOOL READINESS FOR CHILDREN ATTENDING ONE OF THE SPONSORING ORGANIZATION?S SEVEN CHILDCARE CENTERS.  FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE DEDICATED TO WORK WITH CHILDREN, 6 WEEKS TO 12-YEARS OF AGE, WHO ARE ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED OR THOSE WHO HAVE SPECIAL OR EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS SUCH AS DEVELOPMENTAL DELAYS, SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL CONCERNS OR THOSE WHO ARE SIMPLY NOT ON TRACK FOR SUCCESS. 
ENCOMPASS IS WELL RESPECTED WITHIN THE COMMUNITY AND STATE OF WISCONSIN. THE AGENCY HAS NUMEROUS PARTNERSHIPS WITH LOCAL NON-PROFITS, BUSINESSES, GOVERNMENT AGENCIES AND LOCAL SCHOOL DISTRICTS.  ENCOMPASS USES THE HIGH SCOPE CURRICULUM, A RESEARCHED BASED, INTERNATIONALLY RENOWNED PRESCHOOL CURRICULUM.  THE AGENCY?S HIGH QUALITY CURRICULUM IS SO WELL RESPECTED THAT ALL SEVEN ENCOMPASS CENTERS HAVE DISTRICT SPONSORED COMMUNITY BASED 4K CLASSROOMS WITHIN THEM.  WORKING WITHIN THE FRAMEWORK OF THE HIGH SCOPE CURRICULUM, A MINIMUM OF 28 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS FOCUSING ON ACTIVITIES INCLUDING SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT; LANGUAGE, LITERACY, AND COMMUNICATION; AND MATH CONCEPTS.  FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL PARTICIPATE IN REACHING A 95% SUCCESS RATE OF ESTABLISHED GOALS AND GAINS THROUGH READING; ENCOURAGING LANGUAGE DEVELOPMENT;  ENGAGING CHILDREN WITH COLOR AND LETTER RECOGNITION; ACTIVITIES INVOLVING MATH SKILL DEVELOPMENT AND CONCEPTS; ENCOURAGING ACCEPTABLE SOCIAL INTERACTION; PARTICIPATING IN FAMILY-STYLE MEAL SERVICE; ASSISTING CHILDREN WITH LARGE AND FINE MOTOR SKILLS; AND SPATIAL AWARENESS WITH INFANTS.  THE DOSAGE FOR OUTCOMES WILL BE BASED ON WORKING WITH EACH ASSIGNED CHILD AT LEAST 15 MINUTES PER DAY, 3 DAYS PER WEEK, FOR A PERIOD OF AT LEAST 60 DAYS.  CHILDREN SERVED WILL BE ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED OR THOSE WITH SPECIAL OR EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS IN PRE-K CLASSROOMS.  AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT PERIOD, APPROXIMATELY 300 CHILDREN WILL HAVE 1:1 LEARNING EXPERIENCES WITH AN ASSIGNED (UNDUPLICATED) FOSTER GRANDPARENT AND APPROXIMATELY 500 ADDITIONAL CHILDREN WILL HAVE THE BENEFIT OF A FOSTER GRANDPARENT ROLE MODEL IN THE CLASSROOM. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $146,038 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $16,290 (10%) IN STATE FUNDING AND $16,243 FROM STATE, LOCAL AND IN-KIND COMMUNITY SUPPORT.

AN ESTIMATED THIRTY TO THIRTY FIVE (25 VSYS) LOW INCOME OLDER ADULTS WILL SERVE AS FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) VOLUNTEERS AT PRE-K-12 PAROCHIAL AND/OR PUBLIC SCHOOLS AND PRESCHOOL PROGRAMS IN PORTAGE COUNTY, WISCONSIN.  THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TUTORING, SERVING AS ROLE MODELS, AND MENTORING CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL AND/OR EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF EDUCATION/ K-12 SUCCESS AND SCHOOL READINESS FOR PRE-K.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD, MORE THAN 100 CHILDREN WILL HAVE IMPROVED ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AND/OR ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $135,212 IN YEAR THREE WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $16,021 IN MATCH FUNDING. 
THE VOLUNTEER SUPPORT EXPENSES ARE IN LINE WITH THE PORTAGE COUNTY WAGE AND BENEFIT PACKAGE; HOWEVER, VOLUNTEER EXPENSES EXCEED THE 80/20 BELOW THE LINE SPENDING AT 70.8%. THE FGP SUPERVISOR IS SCHEDULED FOR 27 HOURS (PART-TIME) PER WEEK. IT IS THEREFORE REQUESTED THAT A WAIVER BE GRANTED FOR BOTH THE 80/20 AND THE FULL-TIME STATUS REQUIREMENTS. 
THE FGP ENGAGES LOW INCOME OLDER ADULTS IN A PURPOSEFUL ACTIVITY THAT PROMOTES HEALTHFUL LIVING BY INTERGENERATIONAL VOLUNTEERING.

THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION:K-12 SUCCESS AND SCHOOL READINESS. AN ESTIMATED 22 FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER 20 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME-BASED ASSIGNMENTS.  THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TUTORING (READING, MATH, AND LITERACY) CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL NEEDS AND/OR THOSE WHO HAVE ACADEMIC, SOCIAL, EMOTIONAL, OR ECONOMIC CHALLENGES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, AT LEAST 350 CHILDREN WILL BENEFIT ONE TO ONE AND IN SMALL GROUPS. NINE CHILDREN WILL SHOW INCREASED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY AND MATH, AND 27 CHILDREN WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS IN TERMS OF SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT. IN ADDITION TWO VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE INFANT AND TODDLER ROOM WHERE THEY WILL READ TO, PLAY WITH AND COMFORT CHILDREN.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT IS $90,000, AND WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $32,524 NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

AN ESTIMATED 40 LOW INCOME OLDER ADULTS WILL SERVE AS ADVOCAP FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS AT SCHOOLS AND DAY CARES IN FOND DU LAC, GREEN LAKE AND WINNEBAGO COUNTIES. ALL VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE PRIMARY PLACEMENT IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TUTORING IN PUBLIC SCHOOLS AND PROVIDING ASSISTANCE IN HEAD START AND PRE-SCHOOL CLASS ROOMS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 132 ELEMENTARY SCHOOL CHILDREN WILL DEMONSTRATE INCREASED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT AND 81 HEAD START AND PRE-SCHOOL CHILDREN WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT.   THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS) INVESTMENT OF  $210,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $23,333 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES FOR A TOTAL BUDGET OF $233,333.

IN 1965, THE WISCONSIN LEGISLATURE RECOGNIZED THE NEED FOR A SERVICE UNIT BETWEEN SCHOOL DISTRICTS AND THE STATE SUPERINTENDENT. COOPERATIVE EDUCATIONAL SERVICE AGENCY 10 (CESA 10), IS ONE OF 12 IN WISCONSIN AND PROVIDES SERVICES TO MEMBER SCHOOL DISTRICTS AND LOCAL GOVERNMENT THROUGHOUT THE STATE. THE MISSION OF CESA 10 IS TO ASSIST DISTRICTS WITH SERVICES THEY WOULD OTHERWISE HAVE DIFFICULTY PROVIDING, OR SERVICES THAT ARE MANDATED BY STATE OR FEDERAL GOVERNMENT. SINCE 1965, CESA 10 HAS TRADITIONALLY OFFERED SERVICES IN SPECIAL EDUCATION, INSTRUCTIONAL SERVICES, AND EDUCATIONAL TECHNOLOGY. IN THE LATE 90?S, THE FACILITIES MANAGEMENT DEPARTMENT WAS CREATED BASED ON SCHOOL IDENTIFIED NEEDS, AND IS NOW PROVIDING SERVICES TO SCHOOL DISTRICTS STATEWIDE.
CESA 10 HAS BEEN PROVIDING THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) TO SCHOOLS SINCE 1987. THE PURPOSE OF CESA 10?S FGP IS TO MATCH CHILDREN WITH DISABILITIES AND THOSE FALLING SIGNIFICANTLY BEHIND THEIR PEERS WITH FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS TO PROVIDE POSITIVE EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCES IN A COST EFFECTIVE MANNER. DURING THE 2015-16 SCHOOL YEAR, THE PROJECT PAIRED 40 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WITH MORE THAN 120 CHILDREN IN 16 SCHOOL DISTRICTS IN WEST CENTRAL WISCONSIN. THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS LOGGED MORE THAN 33,000 HOURS IN THE CLASSROOM.  
FOR THE PAST 29 YEARS, CESA 10 HAS BEEN A RECIPIENT OF THE DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH SERVICE?S (DHS) FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM GRANT. CESA 10?S FGP SERVES SCHOOL DISTRICTS IN THE WISCONSIN COUNTIES OF CHIPPEWA, CLARK, EAU CLAIRE, MONROE, RUSK, TAYLOR, AND TREMPEALEAU.  
CESA 10 IS COMMITTED TO ENSURING THAT AN ESTIMATED 45 FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS CONTINUE TO SERVE IN MEANINGFUL AND IMPACT-BASED ASSIGNMENTS THAT DEMONSTRATE A QUANTIFIABLE IMPACT ON CHILDREN AND COMMUNITIES IN OUR SERVICE AREA.  THEIR ACTIVITIES INCLUDE TUTORING AND MENTORING CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL NEEDS IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF EDUCATION FOR K-12 SCHOOLS AND PRE-K/SCHOOL READINESS PROGRAMS (HEAD START).  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD, MORE THAN 500 CHILDREN WILL HAVE IMPROVED ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AND/OR ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT AS A RESULT OF CESA 10?S FGP.  CESA 10 IS ASKING CNCS FOR A FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $179,947, WHICH WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED WITH $29,447 IN STATE FUNDING AND $25,900 IN LOCAL AND IN-KIND COMMUNITY SUPPORT ANNUALLY.
ENGAGES PERSONS 55 AND OLDER IN VOLUNTEER SERVICE IN THEIR COMMUNITIES
ENGAGES PERSONS 55 AND OLDER IN VOLUNTEER SERVICE IN THEIR COMMUNITIES

FAMILY & COMMUNITY SERVICES, INC. (F&CS) IS A PRIVATE NON-PROFIT SOCIAL SERVICE AGENCY HEADQUARTERED IN RAVENNA, OHIO IN PORTAGE COUNTY. WITH 71 PROGRAMS IN 21 COUNTIES IN OHIO AND 2 COUNTIES IN MICHIGAN AND THE WORK OF OVER 500 EMPLOYEES, MORE THAN 100,000 CHILDREN AND ADULTS WERE ASSISTED IN 2016. SINCE ITS INCEPTION IN 1941, FAMILY & COMMUNITY SERVICES, INC. HAS SOUGHT TO STRENGTHEN, EMPOWER, AND ENRICH INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES THROUGH A BROAD CONTINUUM OF SERVICES. THE AGENCY IS GUIDED BY A COMMITMENT TO INDIVIDUAL DIGNITY, SERVICE EXCELLENCE, ACCOUNTABILITY, VOLUNTEERISM AND BELIEF IN THE SOLIDARITY OF THE HUMAN FAMILY.  
   FOR THIS GRANT YEAR, F&CS IS REQUESTING 100 VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS FOR AN EIGHT COUNTY AREA: CLARK, GEAUGA, GREENE, MAHONING, MONTGOMERY, PORTAGE, STARK AND TRUMBULL.  F&CS IS REQUESTING $503,792 IN FEDERAL FUNDING. WITH THESE FUNDS, FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL DELIVER IN THE EDUCATION ISSUE AREA, SPECIFICALLY WITH FOCUS ON THE FOLLOWING PERFORMANCE MEASURES: ED23 & ED23: SCHOOL READINESS AND  ED27 & ED4A: K-12 SUCCESS. USING RESEARCH-BASED METHODS, THE PROJECT'S ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES WILL BE TO HAVE STUDENTS DEMONSTRATE IMPROVEMENT IN TEACHER-IDENTIFIED PRIORITY AREAS AND TO BE DEVELOPMENTALLY PREPARED TO ADVANCE TO THE NEXT LEVEL WITHIN THE STATION OR SCHOOL PROGRAM.

AN ESTIMATED 30 FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 30 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE ASSISTING IN THE CLASSROOM AT HEAD STARTS IN MACY AND WALTHILL, TUTORING OF STUDENTS IN OMAHA AND WALTHILL PUBIC SCHOOL AND TUTORING OF STUDENTS AT THE AFTER SCHOOL PROGRAM AT OMAHA NATION COMMUNITY RESPONSE TEAM. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT,75% OF THE CHILDREN WHO RECEIVE FGP SERVICES WILL SHOW IMPROVEMENTS IN SCHOOL "READINESS AND ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $ 180,000.00  WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $18,000.00

AN ESTIMATED 10 FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE WITHIN COMMUNITY ACTION'S EARLY HEAD START AND HEAD START CENTERS. OF THIS NUMBER, 10 (100%) FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL ASSIST IN CLASSROOMS, INCLUDING LEADING SMALL GROUP ACTIVITIES, PROVIDING EMOTIONAL SUPPORT TO CHILDREN, TEACHING AND REINFORCING SOCIAL SKILLS IN THE MOMENT, AND FACILITATING MEALTIME DISCUSSIONS WITH CHILDREN. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS SCHOOL READINESS - SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 85% OF CHILDREN IMPACTED BY SERVICE WILL HAVE DEMONSTRATED GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS IN TERMS OF SOCIAL AND/OR EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $60,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $6,660 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

THE PIONEER FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IS SPONSORED BY BLUE VALLEY COMMUNITY ACTION PARTNERSHIP (BVCA).  THE PIONEER FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM WAS THE FIRST FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IN THE STATE OF NEBRASKA STARTING IN 1972 WITH BVCA SPONSORING SINCE 1991.  BLUE VALLEY COMMUNITY ACTION PARTNERSHIP (BVCA) WAS OFFICIALLY INCORPORATED ON JANUARY 19, 1966. BVCA IS A PRIVATE, NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION. BVCA PARTNERSHIP OPERATES 30 PROGRAMS THAT INTERACT AND COMPLEMENT EACH OTHER. THEIR PROGRAMS ARE AS DIVERSE AS THE COMMUNITIES AND FAMILIES THEY SERVE. THE SERVICE AREA INCLUDES BUTLER, FILLMORE, GAGE, JEFFERSON, POLK, SALINE, SEWARD, THAYER AND YORK COUNTIES IN NEBRASKA. LIMITED SERVICES ARE ALSO PROVIDED IN PAWNEE, NEMAHA, JOHNSON AND RICHARDSON COUNTIES IN NEBRASKA.  BVCA'S PIONEER FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IS REQUESTING 56 VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS (VSY'S) AND A TOTAL DOLLAR AMOUNT OF $284,417 WITH NON-FEDERAL SHARE AMOUNT OF $63,335.

THE EASTERN NEBRASKA OFFICE ON AGING (ENOA) IS COMMITTED TO HELP OLDER NEBRASKANS LIVE INDEPENDENTLY AND PROVIDES VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES FOR INDIVIDUALS OF ALL AGES.  AN ESTIMATED 70 FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  OF THIS NUMBER, 49 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE LISTENING TO CHILDREN READ, HELPING WITH A DAILY ROUTINE, HELPING CHILDREN TO STAY ON TASK, GOAL-SETTING, ENCOURAGING POSITIVE SOCIAL SKILLS, AND PROVIDING SUPPORT AND ENCOURAGEMENT. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION.  
AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, BY MEASURING THE PROGRESS ON THE VOLUNTEER ASSIGNMENT PLANS AT THE CLOSING OF EACH ACADEMIC YEAR, IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT AT LEAST 65% OF THE CHILDREN WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVEMENT IN ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT OR SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT FOR SCHOOL READINESS.
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $293,896 FROM THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY LOCAL SUPPORT OF $ 63,436 AND AN EXCESS AMOUNT OF $24,254.

THE SENIOR VOLUNTEERS OF THE CENTRAL MN FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM PROVIDE MEANINGFUL SUPPORTIVE RELATIONSHIPS FOR CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL NEEDS THAT ENRICH THE LIVES OF ALL INVOLVED. AN ESTIMATED 200 FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS SERVE. THEY TUTOR AND MENTOR CHILDREN THROUGH A NETWORK OF 100 VOLUNTEER STATIONS SUCH AS HEAD STARTS, PRE-SCHOOLS, AND K-12 CLASSROOMS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. ANNUALLY, THE THREE-YEAR GRANT WILL SUPPORT 112 PRE-SCHOOL AGE CHILDREN IN DEMONSTRATING GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS IN TERMS OF LITERACY AND NUMERACY SKILLS, 819 SCHOOL AGE CHILDREN IN DEMONSTRATING IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY AND/OR MATH, 147 SCHOOL AGE CHILDREN IN DEMONSTRATING IMPROVED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT, AND AN ADDITIONAL 168 CHILDREN WILL RECEIVE SERVICES IN COMPLEMENTARY MEASURES. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $663,097 TO FUND 125 VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS (VSYS) WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $167,262 NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.
ENGAGES PERSONS 55 AND OLDER IN VOLUNTEER SERVICE IN THEIR COMMUNITIES

THE COUNCIL ON AGING INC., SERVING ST. CLAIR COUNTY IS A NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION THAT COORDINATES PROGRAMS TO PROMOTE AND SAFEGUARD THE INDEPENDENCE AND WELL-BEING OF SENIORS. THE GOAL OF THE NATIONAL SENIOR CORPS IS TO EMPOWER PEOPLE 55 YEARS OF AGE OR OLDER TO CONTRIBUTE TO THEIR COMMUNITIES THROUGH SERVICE, ENHANCE THE LIVES OF THOSE WHO SERVE AND THOSE WHOM THEY SERVE, AND PROVIDE COMMUNITIES WITH VALUABLE SERVICES (DOMESTIC VOLUNTEER SERVICE ACT, CHAPTER 66, SUBCHAPTER II). THE LOCAL FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM WILL PROVIDE ACCESS TO SERVICES, RESOURCES, AND STRUCTURED VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES THAT WILL IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR LOW-INCOME SENIORS AND ENABLE THEM TO BE ACTIVELY ENGAGED IN THEIR COMMUNITIES. IN TURN, THEY WILL CONTRIBUTE TO IMPROVED EDUCATIONAL OUTCOMES FOR AT-RISK CHILDREN AND YOUTH. THE LOCAL 57 FOSTER GRANDPARENT VSY POSITIONS WILL BE FULFILLED BY 65 TO 70 SENIORS ANNUALLY. THEY WILL  FOCUS ON SCHOOL READINESS SKILLS FOR ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED YOUNG CHILDREN AND ON EDUCATIONAL AND BEHAVIORAL OUTCOMES OF K-12 YOUTH WITH SPECIAL OR EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS. 100% OF VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS IN NON-PROFIT CHILD-SERVING ORGANIZATIONS. VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST PRESCHOOL CHILDREN AGES 0 TO 5 WITH EMOTIONAL/SOCIAL/ACADEMIC AND MOTOR SKILL DEVELOPMENT FOR SCHOOL READINESS SKILLS, WITH A STRONG FOCUS ON PHONEMIC AND PHONOLOGICAL AWARENESS AND BEGINNING READING ACTIVITIES. VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST AT-RISK K-12 STUDENTS THROUGH ACTIVITIES THAT WILL ENCOURAGE SELF-ESTEEM, GOOD ATTENDANCE, COMPLETING ASSIGNMENTS AND IMPROVING ACADEMIC SKILLS WITH A STRONG FOCUS ON READING AND READING COMPREHENSION. AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT, OVER 1,000 YOUTH (BASED ON 350 OR MORE  PER YEAR) WILL HAVE BEEN ASSISTED BY A FOSTER GRANDPARENT, AND 75% OR MORE WILL DEMONSTRATE PROGRESS OR IMPROVEMENT IN THE TARGET AREAS FOCUSED UPON. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $202,565 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $191,075 NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES THAT HAVE BEEN LEVERAGED FROM THE STATE OF MICHIGAN AND THE SUPPORT OF THE LOCAL COMMUNITY WHERE THE PROJECT SERVES.

AN ESTIMATED 95 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM MANAGED BY CATHOLIC CHARITIES WEST MICHIGAN WHICH SERVICES MUSKEGON, LAKE AND NEWAYGO COUNTIES. THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS WILL BE MOBILIZED THROUGHOUT THESE COUNTIES TO ENSURE THE HIGHEST IMPACT ON LOCAL NEEDS.
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. VOLUNTEERS WILL MENTOR OVER 500 CHILDREN A YEAR WITH EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS WITHIN THE PROGRAM'S THREE COUNTY SERVICE AREA. BY THE CONCLUSION OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT CYCLE OVER 1,500 STUDENTS WILL DEMONSTRATE INCREASED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE AND STUDENT ENGAGEMENT IN LEARNING, AIDED BY FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS' INVOLVEMENT AND MENTORING.  
VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN 26 STATION LOCATIONS WHICH INCLUDE CHILDCARE CENTERS, HEAD START PROGRAMS, PRESCHOOL PROGRAMS AND K-12 SCHOOL DISTRICTS LOCATED THROUGHOUT THE THREE COUNTY SERVICE AREAS TO PROVIDE APPROXIMATELY 100,000 HOURS OF SERVICE ANNUALLY TO ENSURE IMPACT ON TARGET OUTCOME AREAS. 
THE THREE YEAR COMMITMENT FROM THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL COMMUNITY SERVICE TO INVEST $342,162 ANNUALLY WILL BE AUGMENTED BY OVER $117,055 IN STATE MONIES AND $100,000 IN LOCAL GRANTEE MATCH.

WASHTENAW COUNTY WOULD LIKE TO TAKE THIS OPPORTUNITY TO RIGHT SIZE OUR PROGRAM BY ADJUSTING THE VSY TO 52. AN ESTIMATED NUMBER OF 63 FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 52 WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE ASSISTING IN PRESCHOOL CLASSROOMS, ASSISTING IN HEAD START CLASSROOMS, COMFORTING CHILDREN, AND TUTORING IN K-12 SCHOOLS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THERE WILL BE AN 80% IMPROVEMENT IN THE FOLLOWING OUTCOMES:
PRESCHOOL/HEAD START:
*	NUMBER OF CHILDREN DEMONSTRATING GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS IN TERMS OF SOCIAL AND/OR EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT. 
K-12 PUBLIC SCHOOLS:
*	NUMBER OF STUDENTS WHO DEMONSTRATED IMPROVED ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT.
WE WILL ALSO ADDRESS THE COMMUNITY NEED FOR QUALITY CHILD CARE AND SUPPORT TO CHILDREN SHELTERED IN TEMPORARY HOUSING. 
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $287, 828.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $111,387 OF APPLICANT FUNDING.

THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) OF WAYNE COUNTY IS SPONSORED BY COMMUNITY SOCIAL SERVICES OF WAYNE COUNTY (CSSWC) IN DETROIT, MICHIGAN.  OUR FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM SERVES THE ENTIRETY OF WAYNE COUNTY AND THE CITIES OF WARREN AND ST. CLAIR SHORES IN SOUTHERN MACOMB COUNTY.
THIS YEAR, WE WILL CELEBRATE OUR 52ND YEAR AS A CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL & COMMUNITY SERVICE AND AGING & ADULT SERVICES AGENCY FUNDED PROGRAM.  OUR DETROIT FGP IS PROUD TO BE ONE OF THE 21 ORIGINAL SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROJECTS DEVELOPED ACROSS THE COUNTRY IN 1965.
OUR PROGRAM IS FUNDED FOR 178 FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS WHO  SERVE OUR COMMUNITY AT NEARLY FIFTY VOLUNTEER STATIONS.  OUR MAIN FOCUS AREAS ARE EDUCATION AND HEALTHY FUTURES.  SOME OF THE MENTORING ACTIVITIES OUR SENIOR VOLUNTEERS PROVIDE ARE:
*  READING TO CHILDREN AND HELPING THE CHILDREN TO READ, ENCOURAGING THEM TO READ TO THE VOLUNTEER AND ALOUD IN CLASS
*  ASSISTING CHILDREN WITH THEIR MATH, SOCIAL STUDIES, SPELLING AND OTHER ACADEMIC STUDIES AS IDENTIFIED BY THE STATION SUPERVISOR
*  ASSISTING CHILDREN WITH DEVELOPING PROPER BEHAVIORAL AND SOCIAL SKILLS, INCLUDING SHARING, BEING COURTEOUS, WAITING THEIR TURN, ETC.
*  ASSISTING CHILDREN IN HEAD START AND OTHER EARLY-LEARNING CLASSES WITH LEARNING THEIR NUMBERS, ALPHABET AND COLORS AS WELL AS THEIR SOCIAL SKILLS
*  GUIDING, COMFORTING AND PLAYING WITH INFANTS AND TODDLERS AT SELECT STATIONS--USUALLY OUR DOMESTIC SHELTER STATIONS WHERE THE POPULATION MAY BE TRANSIENT.
DURING THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD 2017-20, OUR FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AT LEAST 20 HOURS PER WEEK WITH SPECIAL-NEEDS AND EXCEPTIONAL-NEEDS CHILDREN. OCCASIONALLY ONE OR TWO VOLUNTEERS, DUE TO MEDICAL LIMITATIONS, MAY BE REQUIRED BY THEIR PHYSICIAN TO WORK LESS THAN 20 HOURS WEEKLY.  
AT THE END OF THE GRANT PERIOD, BASED ON THE FINAL EVALUATIONS OF THE STATION SUPERVISORS, WE EXPECT MANY OF THE CHILDREN WILL HAVE SHOWN POSITIVE CHANGES IN THE FOLLOWING AREAS:  
*  IMPROVED ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT (WRITING, SPELLING, READING, MATH, ETC.)
*  IMPROVED SOCIAL SKILLS AND BEHAVIORAL SKILLS
*  INCREASED CONFIDENCE AND SELF-ESTEEM.
THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL & COMMUNITY SERVICE'S FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $627,353 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES FROM THE STATE WHICH WE ANTICIPATE TO BE APPROXIMATELY $331,457, AND THE IN-KIND/MATCH CONTRIBUTIONS (CASH, MEALS AND/OR TRANSPORTATION) FROM OUR VOLUNTEER STATIONS.

AN ESTIMATED 50 FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  OF THIS NUMBER, 50 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TUTORING IN READING AND MATH, SOCIAL, EMOTIONAL AND COGNITIVE DEVELOPMENT.
THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR  GRANT 198 HEAD START CHILDREN WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVED GROWTH IN SOCIAL, EMOTIONAL AND COGNITIVE DEVELOPMENT.  252 K-12 WILL EXHIBIT IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN READING AND/OR MATH.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT ON $246,393 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $72,797.

FAMILY SERVICE AGENCY OF MID MICHIGAN IS A WELL-ESTABLISHED AND RECOGNIZED FAMILY AND CHILDREN'S AGENCY OPERATING IN THE COMMUNITY SINCE 1945.  THE MISSION OF FAMILY SERVICE AGENCY OF MID MICHIGAN IS "BUILDING TOMORROW BY STRENGTHENING FAMILIES AND COMMUNITIES TODAY".
THE PROFESSIONAL AND ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF IS DEEPLY COMMITTED TO THE ENHANCEMENT OF SERVICE DELIVERY AND COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT.  SERVICES OFFERED THROUGH THE AGENCY INCLUDE FAMILY COUNSELING, IN-HOME ELDER CARE, GUARDIANSHIP, REPRESENTATIVE PAYEE PROGRAM, VISUALLY IMPAIRED CENTER, SUPPORTIVE HOUSING AND THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT AND SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAMS.
THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM OF GENESEE, LAPEER AND SHIAWASSEE COUNTIES HAS BEEN IN OPERATION SINCE 1978, WITH FAMILY SERVICE AGENCY OF MID MICHIGAN BEING THE SPONSORING AGENCY SINCE 1991.

THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM OF NORTHWEST MICHIGAN HAS BEEN SPONSORED BY CATHOLIC HUMAN SERVICES (CHS) FOR OVER 20 YEARS AND IN THAT TIME THE PROGRAM HAS GROWN TO REPRESENTATION IN ALL TEN COUNTIES. THE MISSION STATEMENT OF CHS IS TO ENHANCE THE LIVES OF THOSE WE SERVE BY PROVIDING HOPE-FILLED SOCIAL, EMOTIONAL AND SPIRITUAL SUPPORT TO ALL PEOPLE. CHS PROVIDES SERVICES TO ALL FAITHS, ALL INCOMES AND ALL FAMILIES. CHS PROVIDES THE FOLLOWING SERVICES TO THE 21 COUNTIES OF NORTHERN MICHIGAN; ALCOHOL & DRUG COUNSELING, FAMILY COUNSELING, PREVENTION SERVICES, PREGNANCY COUNSELING & OPEN ADOPTION, EMPLOYEE ASSISTANCE PROGRAM, SENIOR COMPANION & FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAMS, NURSING HOME SERVICES AND COMMUNITY SERVICES. THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT & SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM'S MISSION IS TO ENRICH THE LIVES OF THE OLDER ADULT VOLUNTEERS AS WELL AS THOSE OF THE CLIENTS AND CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL NEEDS. THE PROGRAM IS DESIGNED TO TAP THE TALENTS, SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND TRADITIONS OF THE VOLUNTEERS, ENABLE THEM TO PROVIDE SERVICE TO OTHERS, AND TO ENHANCE THEIR LATER YEARS BY BRINGING A SENSE OF VITALITY AND RENEWAL TO THEIR LIVES. WE STRIVE TO PROVIDE A VALUABLE SERVICE TO THE COMMUNITY BY PAIRING OUR FG VOLUNTEERS WITH IDENTIFIED CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL NEEDS IN A VARIETY OF SETTINGS, AS WELL AS SERVING OUR LOW INCOME VOLUNTEER WITH THE RESOURCES AND TRAINING NEEDED TO ENSURE THEIR QUALITY OF LIFE. WE ARE FUNDED FOR 6 VSYS THROUGH CNCS AND MAINTAIN THEIR PLACEMENT AND SERVICE HOURS. WE REQUEST CNCS FUNDING OF $33,141 TO PROVIDE FG SERVICES FOR 6 VSYS. WE RECEIVE $171,241 FUNDING FROM THE STATE OFFICE FOR THE FGP. THE FGP WILL ADDRESS THE SERVICE CATERGORY OF EDUCATION FOR PRE-ELEMENTARY DAY CARE CHILDREN WITH 6 FG VOLUNTEERS IN DAY CARE/HEAD START SETTINGS IN GRAND TRAVERSE & WEXFORD COUNTIES. THE FG VOLUNTEERS WILL WORK WITH THE CHILDREN ON INCREASING THEIR SOCIAL SKILLS &  INTERACTION PREPARING THE CHILDREN FOR SCHOOL READINESS. WE WILL RECORD DATA USING A PRE/POST TEST THAT THE TEACHERS WILL COMPLETE ON THE CHILDREN. THE FG VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO WORK WITH THE CHILDREN TO INCREASE THEIR ABILITY TO FOLLOW DIRECTIONS AND ACCOMPLISH TASKS, AS WELL AS INCREASING SOCIAL SKILLS THROUGH MANNERS, BEHAVIOR AND FOCUS LEVEL. THESE WILL BE MEASURED WITH TEACHER OBSERVATION FORMS & LOGS THAT THE TEACHERS WILL COMPLETE ON THE CHILDREN. IDENTIFIED CHILDREN WILL INCREASE THEIR ABILITY TO FOLLOW DIRECTIONS AND OR ACCOMPLISHED TASKS, ACCORDING TO OBSERVATIONS OF DAY CARE STAFF. IDENTIFIED CHILDREN WILL IMPROVE THEIR SOCIAL SKILLS THROUGH MANNERS, BEHAVIOR AND FOCUS LEVEL, BY THE END OF EACH FISCAL YEAR. ACCORDING TO THE KIDS COUNT IN MICHIGAN BOOK PUBLISHED IN 2013, 87% OF CHILDREN UNDER AGE 6 HAVE BOTH PARENTS WORKING AND 80% OF CHILDREN UNDER AGE 6 IN GRAND TRAVERSE COUNTY HAVE BOTH PARENTS WORKING & 78% IN WEXFORD COUNTY. DUE TO THE HIGH NUMBER OF PARENTS BEING IN THE WORKFORCE, THERE IS A NEED FOR SAFE, SUPERVISED CHILD CARE FOCUSING ON SOCIAL SKILL DEVELOPMENT, PROVIDED BY POSITIVE ADULT ROLE MODELS. FOSTER GRANDPARENTS CAN ACT AS POSITIVE ROLE MODELS AND ADD DIVERSITY TO DAY CARE SETTINGS BY PROVIDING AN INTERGENERATIONAL ASPECT TO PROGRAMS. SEVERAL OF THE CHILDREN THAT THE FGS ARE WORKING WITH HAVE SPECIAL AND EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS AS REPORTED BY THE TEACHER/SUPERVISOR/DIRECTOR AND ARE RESIDING IN LOW INCOME HOUSEHOLDS. THE DAY CARE PROVIDES SERVICES AND CARE TO CHILDREN AGES 0-5 AND HEAD START IS 4-5 YEARS OLD. AN ESTIMATED 33 FG VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE MENTORING STUDENTS TO PERFORM AT GRADE LEVEL, ROLE MODEL SOCIAL SKILLS, SERVE AS A POSITIVE ROLE MODEL, TAKE PART IN MENTORING A STUDENT TO MOVE TO THE NEXT GRADE LEVEL, BY INCREASING READING, MATH & OTHER SKILLS, IN WHICH THE VOLUNTEERS WILL WORK WITH THE CHILDREN WITH FLASH CARDS, ASSIGNED READING BOOKS BY READING & BEING READ TO. THE PROGRESS WILL BE MEASURED & REPORTED FROM DATA COLLECTION ON THESE ACTIVITIES THROUGH PRE & POST TESTS COMPLETED BY THE ASSIGNED TEACHER

AN ESTIMATED 49 FOSTER GRANDPARENT (FG) VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE CHILDREN WHO COULD BENEFIT FROM MENTORING IN PRE-SCHOOL THROUGH EIGHTH GRADE IN INGHAM, EATON AND CLINTON COUNTIES. OVER 90% OF FGS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE HELPING CHILDREN IN PRE-SCHOOL AND HEAD START SETTINGS WITH PRE-READING,  PRE-MATH, AND SCHOOL BEHAVIORAL NORMS; HELPING ELEMENTARY STUDENTS WITH ENGLISH LANGUAGE ARTS, MATH, AND BEHAVIORAL SKILLS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION WITH AN EMPHASIS ON MENTORING. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, APPROXIMATELY 1000 CHILDREN WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVEMENT THEIR ACADEMIC AND SOCIAL SKILLS AND BE ABLE TO PROGRESS IN SCHOOL.  THE FGP PROGRAM WILL WORK WITH STATION PARTNERS TO TRACK PROGRESS AND COLLECT, ANALYZE AND REPORT OUTCOMES TO CNCS AND OTHER FUNDERS. OF THE 59 VSYS, 57 ARE SUPPORTED BY THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $298,666, AND TWO ADDITIONAL VSYS WILL BE SUPPORTED BY $91,515.00 FROM THE STATE OF MICHIGAN AND OTHER NON-FEDERAL SOURCES.

THE PRIMARY FOCUS FOR THE SUBURBAN COOK, LAKE/MCHENRY COUNTY FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM WILL BE ELEMENTARY EDUCATION FOCUSING ON LITERACY. TO MEET OUR OBJECTIVE OF 145 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS OUR PROGRAM WILL VOLUNTEER IN 31 ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS, EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS CENTERS AND HEAD-START CENTERS THROUGHOUT SUBURBAN COOK, LAKE & MCHENRY COUNTIES.
OUR PROGRAM WORK PLANS WILL FOCUS ON SUPPORTING GROWTH IN READING AND MATH IN THE ELEMENTARY EDUCATION AREA. FOR SPECIAL NEEDS WE WILL FOCUS ON WHATEVER NEEDS THEY HAVE THAT WE CAN HELP MEET (I.E LIFE SKILLS, SCHOOL WORK) AND FOR HEAD-START WE WILL FOCUS ON SCHOOL PREPAREDNESS WHICH INCLUDES LETTER RECOGNITION, SHAPES, COLORS & NUMBERS.
THESE COUNTIES COMBINED WILL HAVE 121 ACTIVE VOLUNTEERS WORKING ONE ON ONE WITH IDENTIFIED CHILDREN ON READING & MATH SKILLS TO IMPROVE COMPREHENSION, GRADES AND STANDARDIZED TEST SCORES. THE AFTER SCHOOL MATTERS INITIATIVE PROVIDED THE EXTRA SUPPORT & TRAINING THAT OUR VOLUNTEERS NEEDED TO BE PREPARED TO INTERACT WITH ASSIGNED STUDENTS AS NEW TECHNOLOGY AND TECHNIQUES WERE BEING INTRODUCED IN THE CLASSROOMS. THIS SUPPORT HAS BEEN VITAL TO OUR PROGRAM AS IT KEEPS OUR VOLUNTEERS IN TOUCH WITH CURRENT APPROACHES AND TRAINING WITHOUT CREATING ADDITIONAL EXPENSES TO OUR ALREADY STRETCHED BUDGET.  
IN THE CENTERS WHERE WE ARE PRESENT WE WILL CONTINUE TO BE IMPACTFUL, NECESSARY AND VERY SUPPORTIVE OF THE ROUGHLY 135 CHILDREN IN THE STATE FUNDED AND PRIVATE HEAD-START PROGRAMS IN OUR SERVICE AREA. A TOTAL OF 24 UNDUPLICATED FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL SERVE IN HEAD-START PROGRAMS THROUGHOUT OUR SERVICE AREAS HELPING PREPARE KIDS AGE 0-5 YEARS AGE FOR THE NEXT LEVEL OF PROGRESSION BY HELPING THEM WITH THEIR SOCIAL & DEVELOPMENTAL SKILLS. THESE NEEDS ARE PARAMOUNT AND ON-GOING IN THE COMMUNITIES WHERE OUR PROGRAM SERVES. WE WILL USE SURVEYS, SCHOOL DISTRICT TEST SCORES TO MONITOR THE IMPACT THE VOLUNTEER HAS ON EACH CHILD THEY SERVICE. 
THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOME FOR OUR TUTORING/LITERACY PERFORMANCE MEASURE WILL BE:
AN INCREASED NUMBER OF STUDENTS MATCHED WITH A FOSTER GRANDPARENT WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVED READING SKILLS AND TEST SCORES. 
THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOME FOR THE HEAD-START PERFORMANCE MEASURE WILL BE: CHILDREN WHO WORKED ONE-ON-ONE WITH A FOSTER GRANDPARENT WILL BE DEVELOPMENTALLY PREPARED PREPARED TO ENTER KINDERGARTEN OR THE NEXT LEVEL OF THE HEAD-START PROGRAM.
THE FEDERAL FUNDING LEVEL FOR THIS EFFORT WILL BE $649,293 AND THE NON-FEDERAL LEVEL ROUGHLY $166,640.

COMMUNITY ACTION PARTNERSHIP OF CENTRAL ILLINOIS (CAPCIL) IS A NON-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATION. IT IS THE MISSION OF CAPCIL, IN PARTNERSHIP WITH COMMUNITIES IN OUR SERVICE AREA, TO EMPOWER PERSONS WITH LOW INCOME AND THE AGED BY CREATING AND IMPLEMENTING POVERTY-FIGHTING INITIATIVES FOR THOSE IN CRISIS AND THOSE THAT ENDEAVOR A LIFE OF LASTING INDEPENDENCE. WE PURSUE A PROMISE TO CHANGE PEOPLE?S LIVES, EMBODY THE SPIRIT OF HOPE, IMPROVE COMMUNITIES AND MAKE AMERICA A BETTER PLACE TO LIVE. WE CARE ABOUT THE ENTIRE COMMUNITY AND WE ARE DEDICATED TO HELPING PEOPLE HELP THEMSELVES AND EACH OTHER. 
THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM IS JUST ONE OF MANY SERVICES CAPCIL PROVIDES TO HELP ACCOMPLISH OUR PROMISE. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR OUR PROJECT IS EDUCATION. OUR PROJECT IS DESIGNED TO ENGAGE OUR FGP VOLUNTEERS IN SERVICE ACTIVITIES THAT WILL PROMOTE GENUINE IMPROVEMENTS IN THE LOVES OF THE CHILDREN WE WORK WITH, WHICH IN TURN ENRICHES THE LIVES OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS. AN ESTIMATED 60 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN HEAD START, EARLY LEARNING CENTERS, SCHOOLS, AND COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS IN OUR SEVEN-COUNTY SERVICE AREA. WE ARE REQUESTING $304,896.00 FROM CNCS TO PROVIDE SERVICES, WITH $51,730.00 TO BE SUPPLEMENTED THROUGH OTHER RESOURCES. OUR PROJECT WILL ADDRESS CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL OR EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS INCLUDING LITERACY, SOCIAL/EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT, CHILDREN IN FOSTER CARE AND AT RISK TEENS. SERVICE ACTIVITIES MAY INCLUDE READING AND/OR LISTING TO CHILDREN READ, HELPING IDENTIFY COLORS/NUMBERS/LETTERS/OBJECTS, HELPING WITH SCHOOLWORK, ASSISTING WITH SELF-CONTROL, SELF-CONCEPT, COOPERATION AND SOCIAL RELATIONSHIPS. THE PROJECT ANTICIPATES POSITIVE OUTCOMES FOR IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE AND ATTENDANCE FOR AS MANY OF 240 CHILDREN AS WELL AS HELPING OUR VOLUNTEERS TO REMAIN INDEPENDENT THROUGH THE TAX-FREE STIPEND, EDUCATIONAL TRAININGS AND REFERRAL RESOURCES.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
THE LEGAL NAME OF THE SPONSORING ORGANIZATION IS THE KANKAKEE SCHOOL DISTRICT NO. 111 LOCATED IN KANKAKEE IL WHICH IS THE COUNTY SEAT OF KANKAKEE COUNTY.  THE KANKAKEE SCHOOL DISTRICT #111 MISSION STATEMENT STATES "THE KANKAKEE SCHOOL DISTRICT IS TOTALLY COMMITTED TO PROVIDING QUALITY EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES DESIGNED TO MEET THE DIVERSE ACADEMIC PHYSICAL AND VOCATIONAL NEEDS OF ALL OF OUR STUDENTS.  WE STRIVE TO ESTABLISH A SUPPORTIVE LEARNING ENVIRONMENT IN WHICH STUDENTS ACQUIRE THE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS NECESSARY FOR A PRODUCTIVE LIFE IN THE 21ST CENTURY.  WE ARE ALSO COMMITTED TO HELPING STUDENTS DEVELOP A HEALTHY SELF-IMAGE AND EXHIBIT POSITIVE SOCIAL BEHAVIORS AS WELL AS LEARN TO APPRECIATE ETHNIC AND CULTURAL DIFFERENCES.  TO ACHIEVE THIS PURPOSE, TEACHERS AND ADMINISTRATORS, THE BOARD OF EDUCATION, PARENTS AND STUDENTS MUST WORK TOGETHER TO BUILD AN EDUCATIONAL PROGRAM WHICH MATCHES COMMUNITY EXPECTATIONS AND AVAILABLE RESOURCES WITH THE RESPONSIBILITY FOR DEVELOPING ENTHUSIASTIC LIFE-LONG LEARNERS CAPABLE OF MEETING AND SOLVING SOCIETY'S PROBLEMS".
THE NUMBER OF VSY'S REQUESTED FOR FY2017 IS 47 (FOURTY-SEVEN).  THE DOLLAR AMOUNT REQUESTED IS $283,960.00.  THE SERVICE CATEGORIES THIS PROJECT WILL ADDRESS ARE IMPROVING ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AND INCREASING READING READINESS AMONG STUDENTS AGED 3-12.  THE VOLUNTEERS TO BE PLACED IN AREAS WHERE THERE IS A GREAT NEED FOR IMPROVEMENT IN THE AREAS OF READING READINESS AND LITERACY. THEIR ONE-ON-ONE ASSISTANCE IN THE CLASSROOM WILL PROVIDE A STRONG BASE FOR IMPROVEMENT IN THESE AREAS. FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO SERVE AS MENTORS IN OTHER ACADEMIC AND BEHAVIORAL RELATED AREAS INCLUDING MODELING CONFLICT RESOLUTION SKILLS, DEVELOPING A HEALTHY SELF-IMAGE, EXHIBITING APPROPRIATE CLASSROOM BEHAVIORS ETC.  THE GOAL OF THE PROGRAM IS TO HELP STUDENTS IMPROVE SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT, GAIN LITERACY AND MATH SKILLS, IMPROVE STUDENT ATTENDANCE PATTERNS, AND IMPROVE THE ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT OF ALL STUDENTS. THE PROJECT WILL ADDRESS COMMUNITY NEEDS SUCH AS INCREASED TEACHER-PARENT COOPERATION, PROMOTING POSITIVE INTERACTION BETWEEN DIFFERENT ETHNIC GROUPS, ENHANCING COMMUNITY AWARENESS OF VOLUNTARISM AND SHARING KNOWLEDGE AND BENEFITS OF PARTICIPATION IN SENIOR CORPS PROGRAMS.
RESEARCH BASED METHODS USED WILL INCLUDE (BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO) SELF-ASSESSMENT SURVEYS, COMMUNITY PARTNER SURVEYS, STUDENT GRADE REPORTS, TEACHER LOGS, ADVISORY COUNCIL INPUT ETC.

THIS NARRATIVE DESCRIBES AMERICAN HOME FINDING ASSOCIATION (AHFA), THE CURRENT SPONSOR FOR THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) IN WAPELLO COUNTY, IOWA. AHFA IS A LICENSED, PRIVATE, NOT-FOR-PROFIT SOCIAL SERVICE AGENCY THAT BEGAN AS AN ADOPTION AGENCY IN 1899. ALTHOUGH ADOPTION REMAINS ONE OF THE SERVICES, AHFA HAS EXPANDED TO INCLUDE: BIRTH PARENT SERVICES, MATERNAL CHILD AND ADOLESCENT HEALTH & WIC, CHILD CARE CENTER, CHILD WELFARE EMERGENCY SERVICES, AFTERCARE PROGRAM, ACHIEVING MAXIMUM POTENTIAL (AMP), TEEN HEALTH CENTER, AND THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM. THE MISSION OF AHFA IS TO PROVIDE QUALITY SERVICES THAT NURTURE AND IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR CHILDREN AND FAMILIES. WE BELIEVE: *EACH PERSON IS AN INDIVIDUAL WITH A UNIQUE SET OF EXPERIENCES. *EACH PERSON HAS DIGNITY AND WORTH. *EACH PERSON HAS A RIGHT TO ACCESS THE POWER STRUCTURE. *EACH PERSON IS FREE TO MAKE HIS/HER OWN DECISIONS. *EACH PERSON HAS POTENTIAL. *EACH PERSON HAS A NEED TO BE WANTED AND APPRECIATED. *EACH PERSON IS TO BE RESPECTED, AND *WE CAN ALL LEARN FROM ONE ANOTHER BY WORKING TOGETHER. THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM ALIGNS WELL WITH AHFA'S MISSION, AS THE PROGRAM SERVES LIMITED INCOME SENIORS, AT RISK CHILDREN, THE AREA SCHOOLS, AND THE COMMUNITY AS A WHOLE. APPROXIMATELY 33 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL TUTOR CHILDREN IN 12 VOLUNTEER SITES. THESE SITES INCLUDE CHILDCARE CENTERS, FAITH-BASED AGENCIES, ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS, A RESIDENTIAL FACILITY SCHOOL, A WIC CLINIC, AND HEAD START CLASSROOMS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS READING READINESS AND KINDERGARTEN THROUGH 12TH GRADE SUCCESS. THE ANTICIPATED PROJECT OUTCOMES INCLUDE: IMPROVEMENT OF STUDENT READING AND PRE-READING SKILLS, IMPROVEMENT OF GRADUATION RATES, INCREASED QUALITY OF LIFE (PHYSICAL AND MENTAL) IN THE LIMITED INCOME SENIORS WHO PARTICIPATE, AND OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE VOLUNTEERS TO REMAIN FINANCIALLY INDEPENDENT. AN ADDED BONUS TO THE SENIORS INCLUDES BENEFITING FROM A CIRCLE OF PEERS WHO HAVE SIMILAR INTERESTS AND LIFESTYLES, AND PREVENTING ISOLATION IN THEIR GOLDEN YEARS. BY ATTENDING MONTHLY IN-SERVICES, SENIORS WILL ALSO INCREASE THEIR AWARENESS OF LOCAL SERVICES THAT BENEFIT THE AGED, AND EXPAND THEIR KNOWLEDGE OF CHILDHOOD DEVELOPMENT AND CURRENT TEACHING CURRICULUMS. AMERICAN HOME FINDING IS REQUESTING $152,023.00 FROM CNCS TO OPERATE THE PROGRAM FROM 7/1/2017 TO 6/30/2018, BASED ON 33 VSYS. THE SPONSOR WILL FUND $37,588.

THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM OF GREATER SIOUXLAND, SPONSORED BY THE ROTARY CLUB OF ROCK VALLEY FOUNDATION, INC. (RVRFGP), REQUESTS $326,631 FUNDING FOR THE EIGHT-COUNTY SERVICE AREA INCLUDING LYON, SIOUX, O'BRIEN, OSCEOLA, CHEROKEE, DICKINSON, PLYMOUTH, AND WOODBURY COUNTIES IN IOWA.  
FEDERAL FUNDS FROM THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL & COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS) PROVIDE DOLLARS FOR PERSONNEL EXPENSES, OPERATING COSTS, AND DIRECT BENEFITS TO LOW-INCOME SENIOR VOLUNTEERS AS DESCRIBED IN PART II-BUDGET DETAIL.  AN AMOUNT IN EXCESS OF 80% OF FEDERAL FUNDING IS USED FOR DIRECT VOLUNTEER EXPENSES.  FUNDING ALLOWS AN ESTIMATED 80 FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS TO PROVIDE 73,080 HOURS TO ASSIST APPROXIMATELY 1800 CHILDREN IN 35+ NON-PROFIT AGENCIES, INCLUDING SCHOOLS, HEAD STARTS, DAY CARES THROUGHOUT THE RVRFGP SERVICE AREA.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $326,631 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $134,764 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.  
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR LOW-INCOME FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS TO SERVE CHILDREN IN NEED THROUGH EDUCATION.  FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS FOCUS ON ASSISTING CHILDREN WITH SCHOOL READINESS AND K-12 SUCCESS BY PROVIDING ONE-ON-ONE AND SMALL GROUP ACTIVITIES TO HELP STRUGGLING CHILDREN.  EXAMPLES OF ACTIVITIES INCLUDE READING TO CHILDREN; LISTENING TO CHILDREN READ; CHECKING THEIR READING COMPREHENSION; ASSISTING WITH MATH COMPREHENSION; AND ASSISTING WITH GAMES AND ACTIVITIES TO ENHANCE PRE-READING SKILLS, VOCABULARY, SPEECH DEVELOPMENT AND SOCIAL SKILLS.  FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS ALSO ACT AS POSITIVE ROLE MODELS, PROVIDE SUPPORT AND ENCOURAGEMENT TO THE CHILDREN, AND ADD DIVERSITY BY PROVIDING AN INTER-GENERATIONAL ASPECT TO THE PROGRAMS OFTEN BY SHARING THEIR LIFE EXPERIENCES RELATING TO THE STUDIES. 
AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE CHILDREN SERVED WILL SHOW INCREASED SCHOOL READINESS IN TERMS OF SOCIAL AND/OR EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT, GAINS IN LITERACY SKILLS FOR SCHOOL READINESS, AND IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY AND/OR MATH.

THE NORTHWEST VERMONT FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP; FORMERLY CALLED TRI-COUNTY FGP) HAS BEEN SERVING CHITTENDEN, FRANKLIN, AND GRAND ISLE COUNTIES OF NORTHWEST VERMONT FOR NEARLY 40 YEARS. A SPONSORED PROGRAM OF UNITED WAY OF NORTHWEST VERMONT (UWNWVT), FGP IS PART OF UWNWVT'S COMMUNITY IMPACT & VOLUNTEER MOBILIZATION DEPARTMENT WHICH ALSO INCLUDES RSVP OF NORTHWEST VERMONT AND VOLUNTEER CONNECTION. UWNWVT STRIVES TO UNITE OUR COMMUNITY IN ORDER TO SOLVE COMPLEX PROBLEMS AND CREATE A STRONGER NORTHWEST VERMONT. 
UWNWVT ACCOMPLISHES THIS MISSION THROUGH STRATEGIC INVESTMENT OF FINANCIAL RESOURCES AS WELL AS VOLUNTEER INVESTMENTS THROUGH UWNWVT SENIOR CORPS PROGRAMS RSVP AND FGP, AND THEIR BROADER MOBILIZATION OF VOLUNTEERS THROUGH COMMUNITY-WIDE RECRUITMENT AND REFERRAL EFFORTS. THIS VOLUNTEER MOBILIZATION EFFORT AIMS TO ACHIEVE UWNWVT'S GOAL OF ENSURING, AMONG OTHER PRIORITIES, THAT CHILDREN, YOUTH AND YOUNG ADULTS ACHIEVE THEIR FULL POTENTIAL.
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF NORTHWESTERN VERMONT FGP IS EDUCATION: SCHOOL READINESS AND K-12 SUCCESS. AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT PERIOD AT LEAST 26 FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL BE SERVING CHILDREN IN PRE-SCHOOL, ELEMENTARY AND MIDDLE SCHOOL CLASSROOMS; 100% OF THESE VOLUNTEERS WILL PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: ONE-TO-ONE NURTURING, AGE APPROPRIATE INSTRUCTION AND DEVELOPMENTAL PLAY FOR YOUNG CHILDREN; TUTORING AND LEARNING SUPPORT FOR STUDENTS WHO ARE IDENTIFIED BY SUPERVISING TEACHERS AS NEEDING ADDITIONAL SUPPORT TO ACHIEVE LITERACY AND/OR MATH GOALS; AND ONE-TO-ONE OR SMALL GROUP ACTIVITIES PROVIDING TUTORING, MENTORING, ROLE MODELING, NURTURING AND SUPPORT.
AT THE END OF EACH YEAR OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD:
- YOUNG CHILDREN SERVED BY FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL HAVE ACHIEVED ESSENTIAL SOCIO-EMOTIONAL AND DEVELOPMENTAL SKILLS THAT WILL PREPARE THEM FOR SUCCESS WHEN THEY ENTER SCHOOL, AND 
- K-12 STUDENTS WILL HAVE IMPROVED AND ACHIEVED INDIVIDUALIZED GOALS IN LITERACY AND/OR MATH. 
CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $154,971 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $117,807 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

GREEN MOUNTAIN FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM WILL DEPLOY ALL OF OUR 57 VSY'S IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF EDUCATION. ALL VOLUNEERS WILL BE IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  THE ACTIVITIES FOR THE PRE-K GROUP WILL ADDRESS THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF SCHOOL READINESS CENTERING ON THE SERVICE FOCUS OF SOCIAL/EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT. THEIR SERVICE WILL ADDRESS A CHILD'S DEVELOPMENT IN ONE OR MORE OF THE FOLLOWING AREAS: SELF-CONCEPT, SELF-CONTROL, SELF-HELP, COOPERATION, SOCIAL RELATIONSHIPS AND APPROACHES TO LEARNING. VOLUNTEER GRANDPARENTS WILL TUTOR/MENTOR CHILDREN TO ACHIEVE GAINS IN BEHAVIORS SUCH AS ATTENDING TO TASKS, LISTENING, FOLLOWING DIRECTIONS, COOPERATIVE PLAY, SHARING, DRESSING, APPROPRIATE MANNERS, PERSONAL HYGIENE, CLEANING UP THEIR SPACE, ZIPPING COATS, TYING SHOES, FINE MOTOR SKILLS SUCH AS CUTTING, PASTING AND COLORING. 15 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE 45 CHILDREN AT 8 SITES WITH AN OUTCOME TARGET OF ACHIEVING GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS, SOCIAL/EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT WITH AT LEAST 50% OR 23 OF THE STUDENTS. THE ACTIVITIES FOR THE ELEMENTARY GROUP WILL CENTER AROUND THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT WHICH CENTERS AROUND STUDENT ATTITUDES AND BEHAVIORS AS THEY RELATE TO THEIR DAY TO DAY INVOLVEMENT IN THEIR CLASSROOMS AND REFLECTED IN TASKS SUCH AS HOMEWORK COMPLETION, CLASS PARTICIPATION, INTEREST IN CLASSROOM ACTIVITIES AND CLASSROOM CONDUCT.  VOLUNTEER GRANDPARENTS WILL TUTOR/MENTOR CHILDREN TO ACHIEVE GAINS IN AREAS SUCH AS STAYING ON TASK, LISTENING, FOLLOWING DIRECTIONS, ESTABLISHING AND HONORING CLASSROOM ROUTINE, SHARING, COOPERATION WITH PEERS, RESPECT, TIME MANAGEMENT, HOMEWORK/ASSIGNMENT/PROJECT COMPLETION AND POSITIVE WORK AND LEARNING HABITS. 42 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE 126 CHILDREN AT 20 SITES WITH AN OUTCOME TARGET OF ACHIEVING GAINS IN ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT WITH AT LEAST 50% OR 63 OF THE STUDENTS. AT THE END OF EACH GRANT YEAR A MINIMUM OF 57 OUTCOME VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AN ESTIMATED 171 STUDENTS AT 28 VOLUNTEER STATIONS WITH 50% OF THE STUDENTS OR A TOTAL OF 86 STUDENTS DEMONSTRATING GAINS IN THE FOCUS AREAS DEFINED ABOVE. THE CNCS INVESTMENT OF $340,184 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $69,952 IN NON- FEDERAL RESOURCES.

HOPE FOR THE AGED, INC HAS BEEN A SPONSOR OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM SINCE 1966. THE MISSION OF HOPE FOR THE AGED, INC, A PRIVATE, NON -PROFIT ORGANIZATION, IS TO PROMOTE AND ESTABLISH PROGRAMS DIRECTED TO ENHANCING THE QUALITY OF LIFE OF THE ISLAND'S URBAN AND RURAL LOW INCOME ELDERLY POPULATION THROUGH THE DEVELOPMENT OF SPECIAL PROJECTS AND THE PROVISION OF DIRECT SERVICES. 
THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM OFFERS THE OPPORTUNITY FOR PERSONS 55 YEARS FEELING USEFUL AND PRODUCTIVE. THROUGH THE PROGRAM THE ELDERLY CAN OFFER SERVICES TO CHILDREN AND YOUTH TO THEIR EDUCATION SUCCEED, WHICH IS THE PRIORITY SERVICE AREA OF THIS PROGRAM. 
THE INCREASING POPULATION OF OLDER ADULTS AND RETIRED PERSONS WITH THE TIME AND DESIRES TO SHARE THEIR LIVE EXPERIENCES AND KNOWLEDGE, THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM OFFERS AN INTER GENERATIONAL APPROACH IN A RELATIONSHIP WHERE BOTH PARTIES WIN. ON ONE HAND, THE NEW OLDER ADULTS, BABY BOOMERS FIND THE OPPORTUNITY TO SHARE THEIR LIFE EXPERIENCES AND KNOWLEDGE BY HELPING STUDENTS AND IN THE OTHER HAND STUDENTS RECEIVED THE INDIVIDUALIZED HELP TO ACHIEVE SUCCESS IN THEIR ACADEMIC NEEDS. ALSO FGP'S VOLUNTEERS OFFER TO STUDENTS THE SUPPORT AND MOTIVATION TO REACH THE SUCCESS IN ITS ACADEMIC DEVELOPMENT AND ENLIGHTEN HER LIFE.
