WESLEY FAMILY SERVICES FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) 2017 [SOUTHWESTERN PA INTERGENERATIONAL PARTNERSHIP]
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
WESLEY FAMILY SERVICES (WFS) HAS A WELL-ESTABLISHED ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY AND A LEGACY TO DELIVER HIGH PERFORMING QUALITY PROGRAMMING TO DIVERSE POPULATIONS ACROSS SOUTHWESTERN PA TO ENSURE THE SUCCESSFUL IMPLEMENTATION OF THE PROPOSED FGP PROJECT.  AS THE SPONSOR AGENCY, WE PROPOSES TO IMPLEMENT THE FGP PROJECT TO MEET THE EDUCATIONAL, TUTORING, MENTORING AND SOCIAL EMOTIONAL NEEDS OF K-12 SCHOOL AGE CHILDREN AND YOUTH, ESPECIALLY OF THOSE IDENTIFIED AT RISK AND/OR WITH EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS, ACROSS THE FGP SPECIFIED GEOGRAPHICAL AREA.  THE FGP VOLUNTEERS CAN PROVIDE AN OPTIMAL RESPONSE TO THE MANY CONCERNING TRENDS AND NEEDS WITHIN THE IDENTIFIED COMMUNITIES. IN ADDITION, OLDER ADULTS' INVOLVEMENT, WHILE HELPING STRENGTHENING THE PROTECTIVE FACTORS OF CHILDREN AND YOUTH IN THESE COMMUNITIES, IT ALSO CONTRIBUTES TO SUPPORT THEIR OWN SOCIAL, COGNITIVE, AND EMOTIONAL WELL-BEING.  THE FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE COMPRISE OF ELIGIBLE ADULTS 55 YEARS OF AGE AND OLDER AND SERVE BETWEEN 15 AND 20 HOURS PER WEEK OR AN AVERAGE OF 30 HOURS PER GRANT-PERIOD TO FULFILL MEASURABLE ASSIGNMENT PLANS IN IDENTIFIED CORE-PARTNERS FACILITIES (I.E., STATIONS)  WITHIN THE TARGETED FGP AREA.  WFS PROPOSES TO RECRUIT UP TO 129 FGP VOLUNTEERS AND TO DEVELOP AND SUSTAIN AN ADEQUATE CORE-PARTNERSHIP NETWORK OF VOLUNTEER STATIONS ACROSS THE FGP GEOGRAPHICAL AREA. IN TOTAL, WFS IS REQUESTING $774,031 AND CONTRIBUTING $154,806 OF NON-FEDERAL SUPPORT FOR THIS PURPOSE, FOR EACH BUDGETED YEAR OR 12 MONTH PERIOD. THESE FGP OUTPUTS WILL BE INVESTED AND AIM AT AUGMENTING OUR CORE-PARTNERS' CAPACITY TO IMPROVE THE SCHOOL READINESS AND K-12 SUCCESS, BY FOCUSING FGP VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES (E.G., TUTORING, REINFORCING SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL SKILLS, ASSISTING WITH HOMEWORK, DEVELOPING POSITIVE AND SUPPORTIVE RELATIONSHIPS, ETC.) ON IMPROVING THE EDUCATIONAL AND BEHAVIORAL OUTCOMES OF DISADVANTAGED CHILDREN AND YOUTH AND THEREBY EXPAND THEIR CHANCES AND PROSPECTS OF SUCCESS IN POST-SECONDARY EDUCATION SETTINGS.  OUTCOMES WILL BE REPORTED AND MEASURED ON ALL CHILDREN WHO RECEIVE 30 HOURS OR MORE OF 1:1 ACTIVITIES WITH AN ASSIGNED GFP VOLUNTEERS.

AN ESTIMATED 120 FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER AT LEAST 77 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME-BASED ASSIGNMENTS ENGAGING IN 103 VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION. FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL INCLUSIVELY ASSIST LOW-INCOME, AT-RISK PRE-SCHOOL AND ELEMENTARY SCHOOL-AGED CHILDREN WITH AGE-APPROPRIATE, ACADEMIC SKILL-BUILDING ACTIVITIES. SOME OF THE ACTIVITIES FOR CHILD READINESS WILL INCLUDE ROLE MODELING, ENCOURAGING SOCIALLY APPROPRIATE BEHAVIORS AND INCREASING STUDENT ATTENTION SPAN. ACTIVITIES IN PRE-KINDERGARTEN THROUGH GRADE 12 WILL FOCUS ON KEEPING STUDENTS ON TASK, REVIEWING CLASS WORK AND HOMEWORK ASSIGNMENTS, INSTILLING PROBLEM SOLVING AND CRITICAL THINKING SKILLS. THE STUDENTS SERVED BY FOSTER GRANDPARENTS, AT THE END OF THE PROJECT PERIOD, WILL DEMONSTRATE INCREASED ATTENDANCE, POSITIVE SOCIAL INTERACTIONS WITH PEERS AND OVERALL, AN ACADEMIC GAIN IN DESIGNATED TARGET AREAS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $463,166 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY AT LEAST $116,081 NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

THESE EFFORTS INTEND TO ALIGN WITH THE FOLLOWING PLANS:

*CITY OF PHILADELPHIA'S UNIVERSAL PRE-KINDERGARTEN PROGRAM WHOSE GOALS ALIGN WITH THE UN IMPACT 2030 GLOBAL GOALS FOR SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT TO ENSURE INCLUSIVE AND EQUITABLE QUALITY EDUCATION AND PROMOTE LIFELONG LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES FOR ALL

THE UNION-SNYDER AGENCY ON AGING, INC. IS REQUESTING FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $495,836 FOR THE 2017-2018 GRANT YEAR. NON FEDERAL FUNDING WILL BE AT A LEVEL OF NO LESS THAN $145,129.  THE REQUEST IS FOR 83 VSYS, HOWEVER, AN ESTIMATED 92 FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. EIGHTY-THREE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME-BASED ASSIGNMENTS. 
THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM OF CENTRAL PENNSYLVANIA WILL SERVE SITES IN THE FOLLOWING SIX COUNTIES: JUNIATA, LYCOMING, MIFFLIN, NORTHUMBERLAND, SNYDER, AND UNION. FORTY-ONE VOLUNTEER STATIONS WILL BE SERVED. CHILDREN FROM INFANCY THROUGH 21 YEARS OF AGE WITH DOCUMENTED AND SPECIFIC SPECIAL NEEDS WILL BE SERVED. 
THE COMMUNITY NEEDS THAT WILL BE ADDRESSED ARE PRIMARILY IN THE AREAS OF EDUCATION AND MENTORING AT ALL AGE LEVELS. PRIMARY FOCUS WILL BE ON MATH AND READING SKILLS AND DEFICIENCIES IN REGARDS TO K-12 SUCCESS. EACH YEAR THE PENNSYLVANIA SYSTEM OF SCHOOL ASSESSMENT SCORES WILL BE REVIEWED IN ORDER TO SEE THE AREAS OF DEFICIENCY THAT NEED TO BE ADDRESSED IN THE PUBLIC SCHOOLS. PRE-K COUNTS AND HEAD START CURRICULUM AND GOALS WILL BE ACQUIRED FROM THEIR SITES IN ORDER TO MEET THE NEEDS OF THE CHILDREN. ACTIVITIES DONE BY THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL INCLUDE EDUCATIONAL TUTORING IN ALL AREAS (WITH A FOCUS ON MATH AND READING), DEMONSTRATING AND PROMOTING PROPER SOCIAL SKILLS, ASSISTING WITH SELF-HELP, FINE, AND GROSS MOTOR SKILLS.
THE PROGRAM WILL SERVE A MINIMUM OF FOUR PRE-K COUNTS CLASSROOMS. EIGHT PRESCHOOLS AND CHILD CARE CENTERS WILL BENEFIT FROM THE PARTICIPATION OF FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS. 
THERE ARE NINE SCHOOL DISTRICTS AND ONE FAITH BASED SCHOOL WITHIN THESE SIX COUNTIES. HEAD START PROGRAMS THAT WILL BE ASSISTED ARE LOCATED IN JUNIATA, MIFFLIN, NORTHUMBERLAND, SNYDER, AND UNION COUNTIES. . IN ADDITION, ONE CSIU (CENTRAL SUSQUEHANNA INTERMEDIATE UNIT) ALTERNATIVE EDUCATION PROGRAM AND ONE CSIU JOB PREPAREDNESS WORKSHOP WILL BE SERVED BY FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS. 
AT THE END OF THE 12-MONTH PERFORMANCE PERIOD, IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT 75% OF THE CHILDREN SERVED WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVEMENT IN ONE OR MORE OF THE DESIGNATED PERFORMANCE MEASURES

AN ESTIMATED 229 FOSTER GRANDPARENT (FGP) VOLUNTEERS (229 VSYS) WILL SERVE IN HEAD START CENTERS, DAY CARE, AND PUBLIC SCHOOLS IN THE HUDSON VALLEY (NY) COUNTIES OF WESTCHESTER, PUTNAM, DUTCHESS, ULSTER, ORANGE, AND SULLIVAN. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PROVIDING TUTORING AND MENTORING IN READING AS WELL AS MATH, ASSISTING TEACHERS IN THE CLASSROOM, AND COMFORTING AND CARING FOR CHILDREN WHO ARE ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED AND / OR HAVE SPECIAL OR EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS THE CNCS FOCUS AREA OF EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 169 (75%) OF 226 K-12 AND FAITH BASED SITE STUDENTS WORKING WITH THE APPROXIMATELY 113 FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL IMPROVE READING, PROBLEM SOLVING, AND COMMUNICATION SKILLS. 120 (75%) OF 160 CHILDREN IN UNIVERSAL PRE-K AND HEAD START SITES WORKING WITH THE APPROXIMATELY 80 FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS IN TERMS OF SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT, LITERACY, AND MATH SKILLS. ANOTHER 36 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN PRE-ELEMENTARY/DAYCARE SETTINGS AND COURT-BASED CHILD CARE WHERE THEY WILL COMFORT CHILDREN AND CARE FOR APPROXIMATELY 190 INFANTS/TODDLERS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $1,024,147 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $28,313 IN STATE AND LOCAL FUNDS FROM THE NEW YORK STATE OFFICE FOR AGING AND WESTCHESTER COUNTY, AS WELL AS $176,500 FROM IN-KIND DONATIONS.

AN ESTIMATED 50 FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  OF THIS NUMBER, 47 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: READING TOGETHER, SOUNDING OUT WORDS AND LETTERS, WRITING LETTERS AND NUMBERS, ASKING QUESTIONS TO PROMOTE CRITICAL THINKING, AND DEMONSTRATING PROBLEM SOLVING SKILLS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, AN ANTICIPATED 315 CHILDREN WILL HAVE IMPROVED THEIR PERFORMANCE IN MATH AND LITERACY AND WILL BE MORE ENGAGED IN SCHOOL.   APPROXIMATELY 90 EARLY EDUCATION CHILDREN WILL HAVE DEVELOPED THE SCHOOL READINESS SKILLS THEY NEED TO ENTER AND SUCCEED IN KINDERGARTEN.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $252,553 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $44,377 FROM THE STATE, COUNTY AND IN-KIND SUPPORT.

SECTION A.  EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
GATEWAY COMMUNITY ACTION PARTNERSHIP IS ACTIVELY INVOLVED IN THE LIVES AND WELFARE OF THE COMMUNITIES IN SOUTHERN NEW JERSEY.  IN ATLANTIC COUNTY, GATEWAY PROVIDES SERVICES TO CHILDREN AND FAMILIES IN ITS EARLY HEAD START AND HEAD START PROGRAMS AS WELL AS THE WOMEN, INFANTS, AND CHILDREN'S (WIC) NUTRITION PROGRAM.  GATEWAY HAS BEEN ACTIVELY SUPPORTING THE WORK OF THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM THROUGHOUT ITS HEAD START CENTERS IN SOUTHERN NEW JERSEY, INCLUDING CELEBRATING THEIR WORK AT THE ANNUAL HEAD START VOLUNTEER LUNCHEON. GATEWAY RECOGNIZES THE IMPORTANT ROLE THAT SENIOR ADULTS CAN PLAY IN THE LIVES OF YOUNG CHILDREN. GATEWAY IS COMMITTED TO ENSURING THAT CHILDREN BENEFIT FROM THE LOVE AND ATTENTION OF A FOSTER GRANDPARENT, AND THAT FOSTER GRANDPARENTS BENEFIT FROM THE OPPORTUNITY TO SHARE THEIR TIME AND TALENTS WITH THE CHILDREN.  
GATEWAY COMMUNITY ACTION PARTNERSHIP WILL WORK WITH AN ESTIMATED 93 FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS TO SERVE IN THE COMMUNITY. FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS, IN CHILD CARE AND HEAD START, HELPING CHILDREN WITH SCHOOL READINESS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE SUPPORTING SCHOOL READINESS IN THE CLASSROOM: HEAD START, CHILD CARE, AND SCHOOL DISTRICT PRESCHOOL PROGRAMS. OTHER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE COMFORTING CHILDREN IN THE CLASSROOM AND ASSISTING WITH CARING FOR INFANTS IN THE EARLY HEAD START CLASSROOMS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION, SPECIFICALLY EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, IT IS EXPECTED THAT CHILDREN WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS, SOCIAL AND/OR EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT, LITERACY SKILLS, AND NUMERACY. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $519,974 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $57,775.

THE FRIENDS PROGRAM, INC. IS A NON-PROFIT HUMAN SERVICES AGENCY OPERATING SINCE 1975 WITH FOUR PROGRAMS: A YOUTH MENTORING PROGRAM, EMERGENCY HOUSING FOR FAMILIES, FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM AND RSVP - RETIRED AND SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM.  
106 OR MORE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE EACH YEAR.  THESE VOLUNTEERS WILL SUPPORT CHILDREN'S DEVELOPMENT IN A VARIETY OF WAYS. SOME FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL PROVIDE ONE-TO-ONE AND SMALL GROUP TUTORING TO IMPROVE STUDENT ENGAGEMENT, ATTENDANCE, AND ATTITUDES TOWARD EDUCATION. SUPPORTED STUDENTS WILL SEE IMPROVED OUTCOMES IN LITERACY AS WELL AS MATHEMATICS AS A RESULT OF THEIR INCREASED ENGAGEMENT. SOME FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL PROVIDE SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL SUPPORT TO IMPROVE STUDENTS' UNDERSTANDING OF TASK ORGANIZATION AND TO INCREASE TASK COMPLETION. FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL PROVIDE HELP TO STUDENTS WITH ASSIGNMENT PLANNING, PROBLEM-SOLVING, AND PROVIDE BEHAVIORAL REINFORCEMENT AT THE DIRECTION OF THE TEACHER. THOSE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS ASSIGNED TO CHILD CARE AND HEAD START PROGRAMS WILL SUPPORT PRE-LITERACY ACTIVITIES AND EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT THROUGH READING ALOUD, SUPPORTING TASK COMPLETION, ENCOURAGING COOPERATION, AND PROVIDING ONE-TO-ONE ATTENTION. ALL FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL SERVE AS POSITIVE ROLE MODELS AND PROMOTE EACH CHILD'S DEVELOPMENT. 
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA IS EDUCATION.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 1,371 DISADVANTAGED CHILDREN AND YOUTH WILL SHOW EVIDENCE OF INCREASED ACADEMIC ENGAGEMENT AS EVALUATED BY THEIR TEACHERS. THESE STUDENTS WILL DEMONSTRATE EFFECTS SUCH AS IMPROVED ATTENDANCE, IMPROVED ATTITUDES TOWARDS EDUCATION, IMPROVED BEHAVIOR, AND IMPROVED ORGANIZATION AND TASK COMPLETION. THESE IMPROVEMENTS WILL SUPPORT STRONGER RESULTS IN LITERACY AND MATHEMATICS.  297 YOUNG CHILDREN (UNDER 6) WHO ARE AT-RISK OR IN POVERTY WILL IMPROVE THEIR SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT. THESE MOST VULNERABLE CHILDREN WILL DEMONSTRATE IMPROVED SELF-CONTROL, INCREASED COOPERATION AND IMPROVED SOCIAL RELATIONSHIPS. THE GAINS FOR MANY WILL BE ACCOMPANIED BY STRONGER PRE-MATH AND PRE-LITERACY SKILLS. IN ADDITION, A TOTAL OF MORE THAN 3,000 CHILDREN AND YOUTH WILL BE POSITIVE IMPACTED BY THE SERVICE AND SUPPORT OF A FOSTER GRANDPARENT IN THEIR CLASSROOM. 
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $546,790 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED WITH $140,147 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES REPRESENTING THE SUPPORT OF THE NEW HAMPSHIRE COMMUNITIES.

THE APPLICANT, PENQUIS C.A.P., INC. (PENQUIS), IS A NONPROFIT COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY WHOSE MISSION IS TO ASSIST INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES IN PREVENTING, REDUCING OR ELIMINATING POVERTY IN THEIR LIVES, AND, THROUGH PARTNERSHIPS, TO ENGAGE THE COMMUNITY IN ADDRESSING ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL NEEDS. PENQUIS HAS ADMINISTERED THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) SINCE 1992 AND SERVES 14 OF MAINE'S 16 COUNTIES (ALL BUT YORK AND CUMBERLAND). AN ESTIMATED 85 FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 77 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE ASSISTING IN CLASSROOMS AND TUTORING IN PUBLIC SCHOOLS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 90% OF CHILDREN SERVED WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS IN TERMS OF SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT AND 90% OF K-12 STUDENTS WILL IMPROVE ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY AND/OR MATH. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $346,674 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $49,913.
ENGAGES PERSONS 55 AND OLDER IN VOLUNTEER SERVICE IN THEIR COMMUNITIES

SHORE UP! INC. (SELF-HELP ON RURAL ECONOMICS & URBAN PROBLEMS) IS A PRIVATE, NON-PROFIT COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY THAT HAS BEEN IN EXISTENCE SINCE 1965.  SHORE UP! INC. WOULD LIKE TO SUBMIT A GRANT APPLICATION FOR FY 2017 FGP QUARTER 4 (YEAR 3 OF A MULTI-YEAR GRANT). AN ESTIMATED 63 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  OF THIS NUMBER 63 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TUTORING, MENTORING, READING, AND COMFORTING CHILDREN WHILE ASSISTING IN ASSIGNED CLASSROOMS.   THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS "EDUCATION".  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE ASSISTED OVER 1,000 CHILDREN TO REACH THE FOLLOWING TWO OUTCOMES: STUDENTS WILL IMPROVE ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY AND/OR MATH, AND CHILDREN WILL DEMONSTRATE GAINS IN SOCIAL AND/OR EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $287,028.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $31,914.00.

FIFTY-FOUR FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE UNDER THE GRANT YEAR 2017-2018.  THIRTY-ONE VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED AT TWELVE SITES FOR A MINIMUM OF FIFTEEN HOURS PER WEEK DURING THE SCHOOL YEAR & ASSIGNED TO FOUR AT RISK STUDENTS EACH, WHO HAS BEEN IDENTIFIED BY THEIR TEACHER.  THESE VOLUNTEERS WILL CONDUCT DAILY TEACHER APPROVED ACTIVITIES THAT FOCUS ON HELPING KINDERGARTEN THROUGH GRADE TWELVE STUDENTS REACH THEIR INDIVIDUALIZED, TEACHER-IDENTIFIED READING GOALS.  SEVENTEEN VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN EIGHT PRESCHOOL LOCATIONS & WILL VOLUNTEER A MINIMUM OF FIFTEEN HOURS PER WEEK OVER TWELVE MONTHS. THESE VOLUNTEERS WILL EACH BE ASSIGNED FOUR AT RISK STUDENTS. THEIR GOAL WILL BE TO IMPROVE PRE-LITERACY SKILLS WORKING TOWARDS SCHOOL READINESS. SIX VOLUNTEERS WILL BE ASSIGNED TO NON-IMPACT SITES FOR A MINIMUM OF FIFTEEN HOURS PER WEEK OVER TWELVE MONTHS WITH AT RISK STUDENTS FOCUSING ON THEIR INDIVIDUAL LITERACY SKILLS.  THESE NON-IMPACT SITES WILL BE TWO AFTER SCHOOL PROGRAMS, THREE SPECIAL NEED PROGRAMS AND ONE MENTAL HEALTH SITE. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION FOR PRESCHOOL THROUGH TO GRADE TWELVE.  AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM UNDER THE NATIONAL PERFORMANCE MEASURES EDUCATION SCHOOL READINESS FOR PRESCHOOLERS & IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY FOR KINDERGARTEN TO GRADE TWELVE, VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE A) EXPOSED THE STUDENTS TO LITERACY ACTIVITIES B) ENCOURAGED THE YOUTH TO REMAIN IN SCHOOL TO GRADUATE & C) HELPED STUDENTS ACHIEVE IMPROVEMENT IN SCHOOL READINESS, READING AND MATH SKILLS, BEHAVIOR AND ATTITUDE. THESE GOALS WILL GIVE THE STUDENTS A LITERACY FOUNDATION TO GRADUATE TO THE NEXT GRADE LEVEL EACH YEAR. COASTLINE ELDERLY SERVICES, INC. OF NEW BEDFORD, MA IS THE SPONSORING AGENCY APPLYING FOR A GRANT RENEWAL (YEAR 1 OF 3) OF THE SENIOR CORPS GRANT FOR THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $291,223 FOR FIFTY-FOUR VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $52,888 NON-FEDERAL FUNDING. VOLUNTEERS WILL BE ASSIGNED TO TWENTY-SIX STATIONS IN THE DARTMOUTH, FAIRHAVEN, NEW BEDFORD, WAREHAM, AND PLYMOUTH TOWNS.

AN ESTIMATED 51 FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS ALL 51 WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TUTORING IN PUBLIC SCHOOL, ASSISTING IN HEAD START CLASSROOMS AND ASSISTING IN EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION CLASSROOMS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA IS OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT 112 STUDENTS IN K-12 WILL HAVE IMPROVED ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN LITERACY AND/OR MATH AND 24 CHILDREN WILL HAVE ACHIEVED GAINS IN SCHOOL READINESS IN TERMS OF SOCIAL AND/OR EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT, LITERACY SKILLS AND MATH SKILLS.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $311,119.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $31,112.00.

IN THIS APPLICATION, ACTION FOR BOSTON COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT (ABCD) IS SEEKING RENEWAL OF ITS FOSTER GRANDPARENTS PROGRAM (FGP) SERVING BOSTON AND QUINCY, MA.  ABCD EMPOWERS DISADVANTAGED PEOPLE BY PROVIDING THEM WITH THE TOOLS TO OVERCOME POVERTY, LIVE WITH DIGNITY, AND ACHIEVE THEIR FULL POTENTIAL, AND THE FOSTER GRANDPARENTS PROGRAM IS AN INTEGRAL PART OF THIS MISSION.

ABCD WILL PLACE LOW-INCOME VOLUNTEERS, AGES 55 AND OLDER, IN CHILDCARE CENTERS, HEAD START CLASSROOMS, AND SCHOOLS IN BOSTON AND QUINCY, WHERE THEY WILL PROVIDE ONE-ON-ONE AND SMALL GROUP SERVICES TO CHILDREN. AN ESTIMATED 136 FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN EDUCATION-BASED ASSIGNMENTS. SERVICE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE ASSISTING IN HEAD START AND PRESCHOOL CLASSROOMS, SPECIFICALLY IN THE AREA OF SCHOOL READINESS (SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL AND LITERACY); PROVIDING TUTORING IN K-12 PUBLIC SCHOOLS TO SUPPORT LITERACY OUTCOMES, AND PROVIDING MENTORING IN A SCHOOL-BASED PROGRAM. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS EDUCATION, ADDRESSING BOTH SCHOOL READINESS AND SUCCEEDING IN KINDERGARTEN THROUGH 12TH GRADE OBJECTIVES. 

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $610,072 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY A MATCH OF $197,935 IN NON-FEDERAL FUNDS, AND WILL ADDITIONALLY LEVERAGE MANY OTHER RESOURCES AT ABCD, SUCH AS A FULLY OPERATIONAL FGP INFRASTRUCTURE AND SUBSTANTIAL MANAGEMENT, PROGRAM DESIGN, AND PROGRAM EVALUATION EXPERTISE. 

ALL VOLUNTEER INFORMATION AND SERVICES ARE TRACKED AND MONITORED USING ABCD'S INTERNAL DATA MANAGEMENT AND PAYROLL SYSTEMS. THIS SYSTEM ENSURES THAT PROGRAM OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES ARE COLLECTED, MEASURED, AND MANAGED IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE MEASURES OUTLINED IN THE PERFORMANCE MEASUREMENT SECTION OF THIS PROPOSAL, AND IN COMPLIANCE WITH ALL FGP FEDERAL REGULATIONS. EVERY FALL, ABCD WILL HAVE ITS FGP PARTNERS COMPLETE ASSIGNMENT PLANS INDICATING FREQUENCY AND DURATION OF SERVICES TO BE PROVIDED TO ASSIGNED CHILDREN, AND THE SPECIFIC SERVICES TO BE ADDRESSED BY THE FGP WORKING WITH ASSIGNED CHILDREN. THE PARTNER WILL ALSO DOCUMENT CHILDREN?S SPECIAL NEEDS AS DETERMINED BY THE NECESSARY PROFESSIONAL. AT THE END OF THE SCHOOL YEAR, ABCD WILL HAVE PARTNERS COMPLETE AND SHARE INFORMATION IN A CONFIDENTIAL AND TIMELY MANNER USING OUTCOME MEASUREMENT TOOLS REFERENCED IN THE PERFORMANCE MEASURE SECTION OF THIS PROPOSAL. DATA WILL BE COLLECTED AND ENTERED EACH YEAR ACCORDINGLY INTO ABCD'S DATABASE TO REPORT OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES. FOSTER GRANDPARENTS ALSO COMPLETE A SELF-EVALUATION ABOUT THEIR PARTICIPATION IN THE PROGRAM. DATA IS COLLECTED BY FGP STAFF AND THE FGP MANAGER AND THE FGP DIRECTOR ANALYZE THE DATA. THEY REVIEW RESULTS AS COMPARED TO ESTABLISHED BENCHMARKS AND PERFORMANCE MEASURES IN THE WORK PLAN WITH INPUT FROM PROGRAM STAFF. THE DIRECTOR OF PLANNING AND THE EXECUTIVE VICE PRESIDENT ALSO REVIEW RESULTS. ANY CHANGES, AREAS FOR IMPROVEMENT, OR OTHER SIGNIFICANT RESULTS ARE ANALYZED AND IMPROVEMENT PLANS, IF NEEDED, ARE FORMULATED. THE PRESIDENT/CEO AND THE ELDER SERVICES COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS REVIEW THE RESULTS AND IF NEEDED, IMPROVEMENT PLAN.

AN ESTIMATED 69 FGP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THE GREATER NEW HAVEN AREA. THE VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE INDIVIDUALIZED SERVICES IN THE AREA OF SCHOOL READINESS THROUGH CLASSROOM ASSISTANCE AT 12 VOLUNTEER STATIONS SUCH AS HEADSTART/SCHOOL READINESS PROGRAMS AND CHILD DEVELOPMENT CENTERS.  SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE VOLUNTEERS  WORKING WITH CHILDREN TO HELP THEM DEVELOP  APPROPRIATE SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL BEHAVIORS SUCH AS COOPERATION, RECOGNITION OF FEELINGS AND SHARING WITH OTHERS. A SPECIAL  CORPS OF BILINGUAL VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO ASSIST CHILDREN WHO HAVE A LANGUAGE BARRIER TO DEVELOP APPROPRIATE SOCIAL BEHAVIORS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THE FGP IS EDUCATION IN THE AREA OF SCHOOL READINESS. THE EXPECTED IMPACT OF THE PROJECT IS THAT 70%   CHILDREN ASSIGNED A FOSTER GRANDPARENT WILL HAVE A POSITIVE EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCE THAT WILL LEAD TO IMPROVEMENT IN SOCIAL BEHAVIOR, AND PROMOTION TO THE NEXT GRADE LEVEL. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $317,400 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $ 129,560 OF LOCAL SUPPORT AND RESOURCES.
